1	1	1	1	 IN THE beginning God created the heaven and the earth.
2	1	1	2	 Now the earth was unformed and void, and darkness was upon the face of the deep; and the spirit of God hovered over the face of the waters.
3	1	1	3	 And God said: 'Let there be light.' And there was light.
4	1	1	4	 And God saw the light, that it was good; and God divided the light from the darkness.
5	1	1	5	 And God called the light Day, and the darkness He called Night. And there was evening and there was morning, one day.
6	1	1	6	 And God said: 'Let there be a firmament in the midst of the waters, and let it divide the waters from the waters.'
7	1	1	7	 And God made the firmament, and divided the waters which were under the firmament from the waters which were above the firmament; and it was so.
8	1	1	8	 And God called the firmament Heaven. And there was evening and there was morning, a second day.
9	1	1	9	 And God said: 'Let the waters under the heaven be gathered together unto one place, and let the dry land appear.' And it was so.
10	1	1	10	 And God called the dry land Earth, and the gathering together of the waters called He Seas; and God saw that it was good.
11	1	1	11	 And God said: 'Let the earth put forth grass, herb yielding seed, and fruit-tree bearing fruit after its kind, wherein is the seed thereof, upon the earth.' And it was so.
12	1	1	12	 And the earth brought forth grass, herb yielding seed after its kind, and tree bearing fruit, wherein is the seed thereof, after its kind; and God saw that it was good.
13	1	1	13	 And there was evening and there was morning, a third day.
14	1	1	14	 And God said: 'Let there be lights in the firmament of the heaven to divide the day from the night; and let them be for signs, and for seasons, and for days and years;
15	1	1	15	 and let them be for lights in the firmament of the heaven to give light upon the earth.' And it was so.
16	1	1	16	 And God made the two great lights: the greater light to rule the day, and the lesser light to rule the night; and the stars.
17	1	1	17	 And God set them in the firmament of the heaven to give light upon the earth,
18	1	1	18	 and to rule over the day and over the night, and to divide the light from the darkness; and God saw that it was good.
19	1	1	19	 And there was evening and there was morning, a fourth day.
20	1	1	20	 And God said: 'Let the waters swarm with swarms of living creatures, and let fowl fly above the earth in the open firmament of heaven.'
21	1	1	21	 And God created the great sea-monsters, and every living creature that creepeth, wherewith the waters swarmed, after its kind, and every winged fowl after its kind; and God saw that it was good.
22	1	1	22	 And God blessed them, saying: 'Be fruitful, and multiply, and fill the waters in the seas, and let fowl multiply in the earth.'
23	1	1	23	 And there was evening and there was morning, a fifth day.
24	1	1	24	 And God said: 'Let the earth bring forth the living creature after its kind, cattle, and creeping thing, and beast of the earth after its kind.' And it was so.
25	1	1	25	 And God made the beast of the earth after its kind, and the cattle after their kind, and every thing that creepeth upon the ground after its kind; and God saw that it was good.
26	1	1	26	 And God said: 'Let us make man in our image, after our likeness; and let them have dominion over the fish of the sea, and over the fowl of the air, and over the cattle, and over all the earth, and over every creeping thing that creepeth upon the earth.'
27	1	1	27	 And God created man in His own image, in the image of God created He him; male and female created He them.
28	1	1	28	 And God blessed them; and God said unto them: 'Be fruitful, and multiply, and replenish the earth, and subdue it; and have dominion over the fish of the sea, and over the fowl of the air, and over every living thing that creepeth upon the earth.'
29	1	1	29	 And God said: 'Behold, I have given you every herb yielding seed, which is upon the face of all the earth, and every tree, in which is the fruit of a tree yielding seed--to you it shall be for food;
30	1	1	30	 and to every beast of the earth, and to every fowl of the air, and to every thing that creepeth upon the earth, wherein there is a living soul, I have given every green herb for food.' And it was so.
31	1	1	31	 And God saw every thing that He had made, and, behold, it was very good. And there was evening and there was morning, the sixth day.
32	1	2	1	 And the heaven and the earth were finished, and all the host of them.
33	1	2	2	 And on the seventh day God finished His work which He had made; and He rested on the seventh day from all His work which He had made.
34	1	2	3	 And God blessed the seventh day, and hallowed it; because that in it He rested from all His work which God in creating had made.
35	1	2	4	 These are the generations of the heaven and of the earth when they were created, in the day that the LORD God made earth and heaven.
36	1	2	5	 No shrub of the field was yet in the earth, and no herb of the field had yet sprung up; for the LORD God had not caused it to rain upon the earth, and there was not a man to till the ground;
37	1	2	6	 but there went up a mist from the earth, and watered the whole face of the ground.
38	1	2	7	 Then the LORD God formed man of the dust of the ground, and breathed into his nostrils the breath of life; and man became a living soul.
39	1	2	8	 And the LORD God planted a garden eastward, in Eden; and there He put the man whom He had formed.
40	1	2	9	 And out of the ground made the LORD God to grow every tree that is pleasant to the sight, and good for food; the tree of life also in the midst of the garden, and the tree of the knowledge of good and evil.
41	1	2	10	 And a river went out of Eden to water the garden; and from thence it was parted, and became four heads.
42	1	2	11	 The name of the first is Pishon; that is it which compasseth the whole land of Havilah, where there is gold;
43	1	2	12	 and the gold of that land is good; there is bdellium and the onyx stone.
44	1	2	13	 And the name of the second river is Gihon; the same is it that compasseth the whole land of Cush.
45	1	2	14	 And the name of the third river is Tigris; that is it which goeth toward the east of Asshur. And the fourth river is the Euphrates.
46	1	2	15	 And the LORD God took the man, and put him into the garden of Eden to dress it and to keep it.
47	1	2	16	 And the LORD God commanded the man, saying: 'Of every tree of the garden thou mayest freely eat;
48	1	2	17	 but of the tree of the knowledge of good and evil, thou shalt not eat of it; for in the day that thou eatest thereof thou shalt surely die.'
49	1	2	18	 And the LORD God said: 'It is not good that the man should be alone; I will make him a help meet for him.'
50	1	2	19	 And out of the ground the LORD God formed every beast of the field, and every fowl of the air; and brought them unto the man to see what he would call them; and whatsoever the man would call every living creature, that was to be the name thereof.
51	1	2	20	 And the man gave names to all cattle, and to the fowl of the air, and to every beast of the field; but for Adam there was not found a help meet for him.
52	1	2	21	 And the LORD God caused a deep sleep to fall upon the man, and he slept; and He took one of his ribs, and closed up the place with flesh instead thereof.
53	1	2	22	 And the rib, which the LORD God had taken from the man, made He a woman, and brought her unto the man.
54	1	2	23	 And the man said: 'This is now bone of my bones, and flesh of my flesh; she shall be called Woman, because she was taken out of Man.'
55	1	2	24	 Therefore shall a man leave his father and his mother, and shall cleave unto his wife, and they shall be one flesh.
56	1	2	25	 And they were both naked, the man and his wife, and were not ashamed.
57	1	3	1	 Now the serpent was more subtle than any beast of the field which the LORD God had made. And he said unto the woman: 'Yea, hath God said: Ye shall not eat of any tree of the garden?'
58	1	3	2	 And the woman said unto the serpent: 'Of the fruit of the trees of the garden we may eat;
59	1	3	3	 but of the fruit of the tree which is in the midst of the garden, God hath said: Ye shall not eat of it, neither shall ye touch it, lest ye die.'
60	1	3	4	 And the serpent said unto the woman: 'Ye shall not surely die;
61	1	3	5	 for God doth know that in the day ye eat thereof, then your eyes shall be opened, and ye shall be as God, knowing good and evil.'
62	1	3	6	 And when the woman saw that the tree was good for food, and that it was a delight to the eyes, and that the tree was to be desired to make one wise, she took of the fruit thereof, and did eat; and she gave also unto her husband with her, and he did eat.
63	1	3	7	 And the eyes of them both were opened, and they knew that they were naked; and they sewed fig-leaves together, and made themselves girdles.
64	1	3	8	 And they heard the voice of the LORD God walking in the garden toward the cool of the day; and the man and his wife hid themselves from the presence of the LORD God amongst the trees of the garden.
65	1	3	9	 And the LORD God called unto the man, and said unto him: 'Where art thou?'
66	1	3	10	 And he said: 'I heard Thy voice in the garden, and I was afraid, because I was naked; and I hid myself.'
67	1	3	11	 And He said: 'Who told thee that thou wast naked? Hast thou eaten of the tree, whereof I commanded thee that thou shouldest not eat?'
68	1	3	12	 And the man said: 'The woman whom Thou gavest to be with me, she gave me of the tree, and I did eat.'
69	1	3	13	 And the LORD God said unto the woman: 'What is this thou hast done?' And the woman said: 'The serpent beguiled me, and I did eat.'
70	1	3	14	 And the LORD God said unto the serpent: 'Because thou hast done this, cursed art thou from among all cattle, and from among all beasts of the field; upon thy belly shalt thou go, and dust shalt thou eat all the days of thy life.
71	1	3	15	 And I will put enmity between thee and the woman, and between thy seed and her seed; they shall bruise thy head, and thou shalt bruise their heel.'
72	1	3	16	 Unto the woman He said: 'I will greatly multiply thy pain and thy travail; in pain thou shalt bring forth children; and thy desire shall be to thy husband, and he shall rule over thee.'
73	1	3	17	 And unto Adam He said: 'Because thou hast hearkened unto the voice of thy wife, and hast eaten of the tree, of which I commanded thee, saying: Thou shalt not eat of it; cursed is the ground for thy sake; in toil shalt thou eat of it all the days of thy life.
74	1	3	18	 Thorns also and thistles shall it bring forth to thee; and thou shalt eat the herb of the field.
75	1	3	19	 In the sweat of thy face shalt thou eat bread, till thou return unto the ground; for out of it wast thou taken; for dust thou art, and unto dust shalt thou return.'
76	1	3	20	 And the man called his wife's name Eve; because she was the mother of all living.
77	1	3	21	 And the LORD God made for Adam and for his wife garments of skins, and clothed them.
78	1	3	22	 And the LORD God said: 'Behold, the man is become as one of us, to know good and evil; and now, lest he put forth his hand, and take also of the tree of life, and eat, and live for ever.'
79	1	3	23	 Therefore the LORD God sent him forth from the garden of Eden, to till the ground from whence he was taken.
80	1	3	24	 So He drove out the man; and He placed at the east of the garden of Eden the cherubim, and the flaming sword which turned every way, to keep the way to the tree of life.
81	1	4	1	 And the man knew Eve his wife; and she conceived and bore Cain, and said: 'I have gotten a man with the help of the LORD.'
82	1	4	2	 And again she bore his brother Abel. And Abel was a keeper of sheep, but Cain was a tiller of the ground.
83	1	4	3	 And in process of time it came to pass, that Cain brought of the fruit of the ground an offering unto the LORD.
84	1	4	4	 And Abel, he also brought of the firstlings of his flock and of the fat thereof. And the LORD had respect unto Abel and to his offering;
85	1	4	5	 but unto Cain and to his offering He had not respect. And Cain was very wroth, and his countenance fell.
86	1	4	6	 And the LORD said unto Cain: 'Why art thou wroth? and why is thy countenance fallen?
87	1	4	7	 If thou doest well, shall it not be lifted up? and if thou doest not well, sin coucheth at the door; and unto thee is its desire, but thou mayest rule over it.'
88	1	4	8	 And Cain spoke unto Abel his brother. And it came to pass, when they were in the field, that Cain rose up against Abel his brother, and slew him.
89	1	4	9	 And the LORD said unto Cain: 'Where is Abel thy brother?' And he said: 'I know not; am I my brother's keeper?'
90	1	4	10	 And He said: 'What hast thou done? the voice of thy brother's blood crieth unto Me from the ground.
91	1	4	11	 And now cursed art thou from the ground, which hath opened her mouth to receive thy brother's blood from thy hand.
92	1	4	12	 When thou tillest the ground, it shall not henceforth yield unto thee her strength; a fugitive and a wanderer shalt thou be in the earth.'
93	1	4	13	 And Cain said unto the LORD: 'My punishment is greater than I can bear.
94	1	4	14	 Behold, Thou hast driven me out this day from the face of the land; and from Thy face shall I be hid; and I shall be a fugitive and a wanderer in the earth; and it will come to pass, that whosoever findeth me will slay me.'
95	1	4	15	 And the LORD said unto him: 'Therefore whosoever slayeth Cain, vengeance shall be taken on him sevenfold.' And the LORD set a sign for Cain, lest any finding him should smite him.
96	1	4	16	 And Cain went out from the presence of the LORD, and dwelt in the land of Nod, on the east of Eden.
97	1	4	17	 And Cain knew his wife; and she conceived, and bore Enoch; and he builded a city, and called the name of the city after the name of his son Enoch.
98	1	4	18	 And unto Enoch was born Irad; and Irad begot Mehujael; and Mehujael begot Methushael; and Methushael begot Lamech.
99	1	4	19	 And Lamech took unto him two wives; the name of one was Adah, and the name of the other Zillah.
100	1	4	20	 And Adah bore Jabal; he was the father of such as dwell in tents and have cattle.
101	1	4	21	 And his brother's name was Jubal; he was the father of all such as handle the harp and pipe.
102	1	4	22	 And Zillah, she also bore Tubal-cain, the forger of every cutting instrument of brass and iron; and the sister of Tubal-cain was Naamah.
103	1	4	23	 And Lamech said unto his wives: Adah and Zillah, hear my voice; ye wives of Lamech, hearken unto my speech; for I have slain a man for wounding me, and a young man for bruising me;
104	1	4	24	 If Cain shall be avenged sevenfold, truly Lamech seventy and sevenfold.
105	1	4	25	 And Adam knew his wife again; and she bore a son, and called his name Seth: 'for God hath appointed me another seed instead of Abel; for Cain slew him.'
106	1	4	26	 And to Seth, to him also there was born a son; and he called his name Enosh; then began men to call upon the name of the LORD.
107	1	5	1	 This is the book of the generations of Adam. In the day that God created man, in the likeness of God made He him;
108	1	5	2	 male and female created He them, and blessed them, and called their name Adam, in the day when they were created.
109	1	5	3	 And Adam lived a hundred and thirty years, and begot a son in his own likeness, after his image; and called his name Seth.
110	1	5	4	 And the days of Adam after he begot Seth were eight hundred years; and he begot sons and daughters.
111	1	5	5	 And all the days that Adam lived were nine hundred and thirty years; and he died.
112	1	5	6	 And Seth lived a hundred and five years, and begot Enosh.
113	1	5	7	 And Seth lived after he begot Enosh eight hundred and seven years, and begot sons and daughters.
114	1	5	8	 And all the days of Seth were nine hundred and twelve years; and he died.
115	1	5	9	 And Enosh lived ninety years, and begot Kenan.
116	1	5	10	 And Enosh lived after he begot Kenan eight hundred and fifteen years, and begot sons and daughters.
117	1	5	11	 And all the days of Enosh were nine hundred and five years; and he died.
118	1	5	12	 And Kenan lived seventy years, and begot Mahalalel.
119	1	5	13	 And Kenan lived after he begot Mahalalel eight hundred and forty years, and begot sons and daughters.
120	1	5	14	 And all the days of Kenan were nine hundred and ten years; and he died.
121	1	5	15	 And Mahalalel lived sixty and five years, and begot Jared.
122	1	5	16	 And Mahalalel lived after he begot Jared eight hundred and thirty years, and begot sons and daughters.
123	1	5	17	 And all the days of Mahalalel were eight hundred ninety and five years; and he died.
124	1	5	18	 And Jared lived a hundred sixty and two years, and begot Enoch.
125	1	5	19	 And Jared lived after he begot Enoch eight hundred years, and begot sons and daughters.
126	1	5	20	 And all the days of Jared were nine hundred sixty and two years; and he died.
127	1	5	21	 And Enoch lived sixty and five years, and begot Methuselah.
128	1	5	22	 And Enoch walked with God after he begot Methuselah three hundred years, and begot sons and daughters.
129	1	5	23	 And all the days of Enoch were three hundred sixty and five years.
130	1	5	24	 And Enoch walked with God, and he was not; for God took him.
131	1	5	25	 And Methuselah lived a hundred eighty and seven years, and begot Lamech.
132	1	5	26	 And Methuselah lived after he begot Lamech seven hundred eighty and two years, and begot sons and daughters.
133	1	5	27	 And all the days of Methuselah were nine hundred sixty and nine years; and he died.
134	1	5	28	 And Lamech lived a hundred eighty and two years, and begot a son.
135	1	5	29	 And he called his name Noah, saying: 'This same shall comfort us in our work and in the toil of our hands, which cometh from the ground which the LORD hath cursed.'
136	1	5	30	 And Lamech lived after he begot Noah five hundred ninety and five years, and begot sons and daughters.
137	1	5	31	 And all the days of Lamech were seven hundred seventy and seven years; and he died.
138	1	5	32	 And Noah was five hundred years old; and Noah begot Shem, Ham, and Japheth.
139	1	6	1	 And it came to pass, when men began to multiply on the face of the earth, and daughters were born unto them,
140	1	6	2	 that the sons of God saw the daughters of men that they were fair; and they took them wives, whomsoever they chose.
141	1	6	3	 And the LORD said: 'My spirit shall not abide in man for ever, for that he also is flesh; therefore shall his days be a hundred and twenty years.'
142	1	6	4	 The Nephilim were in the earth in those days, and also after that, when the sons of God came in unto the daughters of men, and they bore children to them; the same were the mighty men that were of old, the men of renown.
143	1	6	5	 And the LORD saw that the wickedness of man was great in the earth, and that every imagination of the thoughts of his heart was only evil continually.
144	1	6	6	 And it repented the LORD that He had made man on the earth, and it grieved Him at His heart.
145	1	6	7	 And the LORD said: 'I will blot out man whom I have created from the face of the earth; both man, and beast, and creeping thing, and fowl of the air; for it repenteth Me that I have made them.'
146	1	6	8	 But Noah found grace in the eyes of the LORD.
147	1	6	9	 These are the generations of Noah. Noah was in his generations a man righteous and wholehearted; Noah walked with God.
148	1	6	10	 And Noah begot three sons, Shem, Ham, and Japheth.
149	1	6	11	 And the earth was corrupt before God, and the earth was filled with violence.
150	1	6	12	 And God saw the earth, and, behold, it was corrupt; for all flesh had corrupted their way upon the earth.
151	1	6	13	 And God said unto Noah: 'The end of all flesh is come before Me; for the earth is filled with violence through them; and, behold, I will destroy them with the earth.
152	1	6	14	 Make thee an ark of gopher wood; with rooms shalt thou make the ark, and shalt pitch it within and without with pitch.
153	1	6	15	 And this is how thou shalt make it: the length of the ark three hundred cubits, the breadth of it fifty cubits, and the height of it thirty cubits.
154	1	6	16	 A light shalt thou make to the ark, and to a cubit shalt thou finish it upward; and the door of the ark shalt thou set in the side thereof; with lower, second, and third stories shalt thou make it.
155	1	6	17	 And I, behold, I do bring the flood of waters upon the earth, to destroy all flesh, wherein is the breath of life, from under heaven; every thing that is in the earth shall perish.
156	1	6	18	 But I will establish My covenant with thee; and thou shalt come into the ark, thou, and thy sons, and thy wife, and thy sons' wives with thee.
157	1	6	19	 And of every living thing of all flesh, two of every sort shalt thou bring into the ark, to keep them alive with thee; they shall be male and female.
158	1	6	20	 Of the fowl after their kind, and of the cattle after their kind, of every creeping thing of the ground after its kind, two of every sort shall come unto thee, to keep them alive.
159	1	6	21	 And take thou unto thee of all food that is eaten, and gather it to thee; and it shall be for food for thee, and for them.'
160	1	6	22	 Thus did Noah; according to all that God commanded him, so did he.
161	1	7	1	 And the LORD said unto Noah: 'Come thou and all thy house into the ark; for thee have I seen righteous before Me in this generation.
162	1	7	2	 Of every clean beast thou shalt take to thee seven and seven, each with his mate; and of the beasts that are not clean two and two, each with his mate;
163	1	7	3	 of the fowl also of the air, seven and seven, male and female; to keep seed alive upon the face of all the earth.
164	1	7	4	 For yet seven days, and I will cause it to rain upon the earth forty days and forty nights; and every living substance that I have made will I blot out from off the face of the earth.'
165	1	7	5	 And Noah did according unto all that the LORD commanded him.
166	1	7	6	 And Noah was six hundred years old when the flood of waters was upon the earth.
167	1	7	7	 And Noah went in, and his sons, and his wife, and his sons' wives with him, into the ark, because of the waters of the flood.
168	1	7	8	 Of clean beasts, and of beasts that are not clean, and of fowls, and of every thing that creepeth upon the ground,
169	1	7	9	 there went in two and two unto Noah into the ark, male and female, as God commanded Noah.
170	1	7	10	 And it came to pass after the seven days, that the waters of the flood were upon the earth.
171	1	7	11	 In the six hundredth year of Noah's life, in the second month, on the seventeenth day of the month, on the same day were all the fountains of the great deep broken up, and the windows of heaven were opened.
172	1	7	12	 And the rain was upon the earth forty days and forty nights.
173	1	7	13	 In the selfsame day entered Noah, and Shem, and Ham, and Japheth, the sons of Noah, and Noah's wife, and the three wives of his sons with them, into the ark;
174	1	7	14	 they, and every beast after its kind, and all the cattle after their kind, and every creeping thing that creepeth upon the earth after its kind, and every fowl after its kind, every bird of every sort.
175	1	7	15	 And they went in unto Noah into the ark, two and two of all flesh wherein is the breath of life.
176	1	7	16	 And they that went in, went in male and female of all flesh, as God commanded him; and the LORD shut him in.
177	1	7	17	 And the flood was forty days upon the earth; and the waters increased, and bore up the ark, and it was lifted up above the earth.
178	1	7	18	 And the waters prevailed, and increased greatly upon the earth; and the ark went upon the face of the waters.
179	1	7	19	 And the waters prevailed exceedingly upon the earth; and all the high mountains that were under the whole heaven were covered.
180	1	7	20	 Fifteen cubits upward did the waters prevail; and the mountains were covered.
181	1	7	21	 And all flesh perished that moved upon the earth, both fowl, and cattle, and beast, and every swarming thing that swarmeth upon the earth, and every man;
182	1	7	22	 all in whose nostrils was the breath of the spirit of life, whatsoever was in the dry land, died.
183	1	7	23	 And He blotted out every living substance which was upon the face of the ground, both man, and cattle, and creeping thing, and fowl of the heaven; and they were blotted out from the earth; and Noah only was left, and they that were with him in the ark.
184	1	7	24	 And the waters prevailed upon the earth a hundred and fifty days.
185	1	8	1	 And God remembered Noah, and every living thing, and all the cattle that were with him in the ark; and God made a wind to pass over the earth, and the waters assuaged;
186	1	8	2	 the fountains also of the deep and the windows of heaven were stopped, and the rain from heaven was restrained.
187	1	8	3	 And the waters returned from off the earth continually; and after the end of a hundred and fifty days the waters decreased.
188	1	8	4	 And the ark rested in the seventh month, on the seventeenth day of the month, upon the mountains of Ararat.
189	1	8	5	 And the waters decreased continually until the tenth month; in the tenth month, on the first day of the month, were the tops of the mountains seen.
190	1	8	6	 And it came to pass at the end of forty days, that Noah opened the window of the ark which he had made.
191	1	8	7	 And he sent forth a raven, and it went forth to and fro, until the waters were dried up from off the earth.
192	1	8	8	 And he sent forth a dove from him, to see if the waters were abated from off the face of the ground.
193	1	8	9	 But the dove found no rest for the sole of her foot, and she returned unto him to the ark, for the waters were on the face of the whole earth; and he put forth his hand, and took her, and brought her in unto him into the ark.
194	1	8	10	 And he stayed yet other seven days; and again he sent forth the dove out of the ark.
195	1	8	11	 And the dove came in to him at eventide; and lo in her mouth an olive-leaf freshly plucked; so Noah knew that the waters were abated from off the earth.
196	1	8	12	 And he stayed yet other seven days; and sent forth the dove; and she returned not again unto him any more.
197	1	8	13	 And it came to pass in the six hundred and first year, in the first month, the first day of the month, the waters were dried up from off the earth; and Noah removed the covering of the ark, and looked, and behold, the face of the ground was dried.
198	1	8	14	 And in the second month, on the seven and twentieth day of the month, was the earth dry.
199	1	8	15	 And God spoke unto Noah, saying:
200	1	8	16	 'Go forth from the ark, thou, and thy wife, and thy sons, and thy sons' wives with thee.
201	1	8	17	 Bring forth with thee every living thing that is with thee of all flesh, both fowl, and cattle, and every creeping thing that creepeth upon the earth; that they may swarm in the earth, and be fruitful, and multiply upon the earth.'
202	1	8	18	 And Noah went forth, and his sons, and his wife, and his sons' wives with him;
203	1	8	19	 every beast, every creeping thing, and every fowl, whatsoever moveth upon the earth, after their families; went forth out of the ark.
204	1	8	20	 And Noah builded an altar unto the LORD; and took of every clean beast, and of every clean fowl, and offered burnt-offerings on the altar.
205	1	8	21	 And the LORD smelled the sweet savour; and the LORD said in His heart: 'I will not again curse the ground any more for man's sake; for the imagination of man's heart is evil from his youth; neither will I again smite any more every thing living, as I have done.
206	1	8	22	 While the earth remaineth, seedtime and harvest, and cold and heat, and summer and winter, and day and night shall not cease.'
207	1	9	1	 And God blessed Noah and his sons, and said unto them: 'Be fruitful and multiply, and replenish the earth.
208	1	9	2	 And the fear of you and the dread of you shall be upon every beast of the earth, and upon every fowl of the air, and upon all wherewith the ground teemeth, and upon all the fishes of the sea: into your hand are they delivered.
209	1	9	3	 Every moving thing that liveth shall be for food for you; as the green herb have I given you all.
210	1	9	4	 Only flesh with the life thereof, which is the blood thereof, shall ye not eat.
211	1	9	5	 And surely your blood of your lives will I require; at the hand of every beast will I require it; and at the hand of man, even at the hand of every man's brother, will I require the life of man.
212	1	9	6	 Whoso sheddeth man's blood, by man shall his blood be shed; for in the image of God made He man.
213	1	9	7	 And you, be ye fruitful, and multiply; swarm in the earth, and multiply therein.'
214	1	9	8	 And God spoke unto Noah, and to his sons with him, saying:
215	1	9	9	 'As for Me, behold, I establish My covenant with you, and with your seed after you;
216	1	9	10	 and with every living creature that is with you, the fowl, the cattle, and every beast of the earth with you; of all that go out of the ark, even every beast of the earth.
217	1	9	11	 And I will establish My covenant with you; neither shall all flesh be cut off any more by the waters of the flood; neither shall there any more be a flood to destroy the earth.'
218	1	9	12	 And God said: 'This is the token of the covenant which I make between Me and you and every living creature that is with you, for perpetual generations:
219	1	9	13	 I have set My bow in the cloud, and it shall be for a token of a covenant between Me and the earth.
220	1	9	14	 And it shall come to pass, when I bring clouds over the earth, and the bow is seen in the cloud,
221	1	9	15	 that I will remember My covenant, which is between Me and you and every living creature of all flesh; and the waters shall no more become a flood to destroy all flesh.
222	1	9	16	 And the bow shall be in the cloud; and I will look upon it, that I may remember the everlasting covenant between God and every living creature of all flesh that is upon the earth.'
223	1	9	17	 And God said unto Noah: 'This is the token of the covenant which I have established between Me and all flesh that is upon the earth.'
224	1	9	18	 And the sons of Noah, that went forth from the ark, were Shem, and Ham, and Japheth; and Ham is the father of Canaan.
225	1	9	19	 These three were the sons of Noah, and of these was the whole earth overspread.
226	1	9	20	 And Noah the husbandman began, and planted a vineyard.
227	1	9	21	 And he drank of the wine, and was drunken; and he was uncovered within his tent.
228	1	9	22	 And Ham, the father of Canaan, saw the nakedness of his father, and told his two brethren without.
229	1	9	23	 And Shem and Japheth took a garment, and laid it upon both their shoulders, and went backward, and covered the nakedness of their father; and their faces were backward, and they saw not their father's nakedness.
230	1	9	24	 And Noah awoke from his wine, and knew what his youngest son had done unto him.
231	1	9	25	 And he said: Cursed be Canaan; a servant of servants shall he be unto his brethren.
232	1	9	26	 And he said: Blessed be the LORD, the God of Shem; and let Canaan be their servant.
233	1	9	27	 God enlarge Japheth, and he shall dwell in the tents of Shem; and let Canaan be their servant.
234	1	9	28	 And Noah lived after the flood three hundred and fifty years.
235	1	9	29	 And all the days of Noah were nine hundred and fifty years; and he died.
236	1	10	1	 Now these are the generations of the sons of Noah: Shem, Ham, and Japheth; and unto them were sons born after the flood.

238	1	10	3	 And the sons of Gomer: Ashkenaz, and Riphath, and Togarmah.
239	1	10	4	 And the sons of Javan: Elishah, and Tarshish, Kittim, and Dodanim.

241	1	10	6	 And the sons of Ham: Cush, and Mizraim, and Put, and Canaan.
242	1	10	7	 And the sons of Cush: Seba, and Havilah, and Sabtah, and Raamah, and Sabteca; and the sons of Raamah: Sheba, and Dedan.
243	1	10	8	 And Cush begot Nimrod; he began to be a mighty one in the earth.
244	1	10	9	 He was a mighty hunter before the LORD; wherefore it is said: 'Like Nimrod a mighty hunter before the LORD.'

267	1	10	32	 These are the families of the sons of Noah, after their generations, in their nations; and of these were the nations divided in the earth after the flood.
268	1	11	1	 And the whole earth was of one language and of one speech.
269	1	11	2	 And it came to pass, as they journeyed east, that they found a plain in the land of Shinar; and they dwelt there.
270	1	11	3	 And they said one to another: 'Come, let us make brick, and burn them thoroughly.' And they had brick for stone, and slime had they for mortar.
271	1	11	4	 And they said: 'Come, let us build us a city, and a tower, with its top in heaven, and let us make us a name; lest we be scattered abroad upon the face of the whole earth.'
272	1	11	5	 And the LORD came down to see the city and the tower, which the children of men builded.
273	1	11	6	 And the LORD said: 'Behold, they are one people, and they have all one language; and this is what they begin to do; and now nothing will be withholden from them, which they purpose to do.
274	1	11	7	 Come, let us go down, and there confound their language, that they may not understand one another's speech.'
275	1	11	8	 So the LORD scattered them abroad from thence upon the face of all the earth; and they left off to build the city.
276	1	11	9	 Therefore was the name of it called Babel; because the LORD did there confound the language of all the earth; and from thence did the LORD scatter them abroad upon the face of all the earth.
277	1	11	10	 These are the generations of Shem. Shem was a hundred years old, and begot Arpachshad two years after the flood.

297	1	11	30	 And Sarai was barren; she had no child.

300	1	12	1	 Now the LORD said unto Abram: 'Get thee out of thy country, and from thy kindred, and from thy father's house, unto the land that I will show thee.

304	1	12	5	 And Abram took Sarai his wife, and Lot his brother's son, and all their substance that they had gathered, and the souls that they had gotten in Haran; and they went forth to go into the land of Canaan; and into the land of Canaan they came.
305	1	12	6	 And Abram passed through the land unto the place of Shechem, unto the terebinth of Moreh. And the Canaanite was then in the land.

308	1	12	9	 And Abram journeyed, going on still toward the South.

310	1	12	11	 And it came to pass, when he was come near to enter into Egypt, that he said unto Sarai his wife: 'Behold now, I know that thou art a fair woman to look upon.

312	1	12	13	 Say, I pray thee, thou art my sister; that it may be well with me for thy sake, and that my soul may live because of thee.'
313	1	12	14	 And it came to pass, that, when Abram was come into Egypt, the Egyptians beheld the woman that she was very fair.
314	1	12	15	 And the princes of Pharaoh saw her, and praised her to Pharaoh; and the woman was taken into Pharaoh's house.
315	1	12	16	 And he dealt well with Abram for her sake; and he had sheep, and oxen, and he-asses, and men-servants, and maid-servants, and she-asses, and camels.

362	1	15	1	 After these things the word of the LORD came unto Abram in a vision, saying: 'Fear not, Abram, I am thy shield, thy reward shall be exceeding great.'

383	1	16	1	 Now Sarai Abram's wife bore him no children; and she had a handmaid, an Egyptian, whose name was Hagar.

399	1	17	1	 And when Abram was ninety years old and nine, the LORD appeared to Abram, and said unto him: 'I am God Almighty; walk before Me, and be thou wholehearted.
400	1	17	2	 And I will make My covenant between Me and thee, and will multiply thee exceedingly.'
401	1	17	3	 And Abram fell on his face; and God talked with him, saying:
402	1	17	4	 'As for Me, behold, My covenant is with thee, and thou shalt be the father of a multitude of nations.
403	1	17	5	 Neither shall thy name any more be called Abram, but thy name shall be Abraham; for the father of a multitude of nations have I made thee.
404	1	17	6	 And I will make thee exceeding fruitful, and I will make nations of thee, and kings shall come out of thee.
405	1	17	7	 And I will establish My covenant between Me and thee and thy seed after thee throughout their generations for an everlasting covenant, to be a God unto thee and to thy seed after thee.
406	1	17	8	 And I will give unto thee, and to thy seed after thee, the land of thy sojournings, all the land of Canaan, for an everlasting possession; and I will be their God.'
407	1	17	9	 And God said unto Abraham: 'And as for thee, thou shalt keep My covenant, thou, and thy seed after thee throughout their generations.
408	1	17	10	 This is My covenant, which ye shall keep, between Me and you and thy seed after thee: every male among you shall be circumcised.
409	1	17	11	 And ye shall be circumcised in the flesh of your foreskin; and it shall be a token of a covenant betwixt Me and you.
410	1	17	12	 And he that is eight days old shall be circumcised among you, every male throughout your generations, he that is born in the house, or bought with money of any foreigner, that is not of thy seed.
411	1	17	13	 He that is born in thy house, and he that is bought with thy money, must needs be circumcised; and My covenant shall be in your flesh for an everlasting covenant.
412	1	17	14	 And the uncircumcised male who is not circumcised in the flesh of his foreskin, that soul shall be cut off from his people; he hath broken My covenant.'
413	1	17	15	 And God said unto Abraham: 'As for Sarai thy wife, thou shalt not call her name Sarai, but Sarah shall her name be.
414	1	17	16	 And I will bless her, and moreover I will give thee a son of her; yea, I will bless her, and she shall be a mother of nations; kings of peoples shall be of her.'
415	1	17	17	 Then Abraham fell upon his face, and laughed, and said in his heart: 'Shall a child be born unto him that is a hundred years old? and shall Sarah, that is ninety years old, bear?'
416	1	17	18	 And Abraham said unto God: 'Oh that Ishmael might live before Thee!'
417	1	17	19	 And God said: ''Nay, but Sarah thy wife shall bear thee a son; and thou shalt call his name Isaac; and I will establish My covenant with him for an everlasting covenant for his seed after him.
418	1	17	20	 And as for Ishmael, I have heard thee; behold, I have blessed him, and will make him fruitful, and will multiply him exceedingly; twelve princes shall he beget, and I will make him a great nation.
419	1	17	21	 But My covenant will I establish with Isaac, whom Sarah shall bear unto thee at this set time in the next year.'
420	1	17	22	 And He left off talking with him, and God went up from Abraham.
421	1	17	23	 And Abraham took Ishmael his son, and all that were born in his house, and all that were bought with his money, every male among the men of Abraham's house, and circumcised the flesh of their foreskin in the selfsame day, as God had said unto him.
422	1	17	24	 And Abraham was ninety years old and nine, when he was circumcised in the flesh of his foreskin.
423	1	17	25	 And Ishmael his son was thirteen years old, when he was circumcised in the flesh of his foreskin.
424	1	17	26	 In the selfsame day was Abraham circumcised, and Ishmael his son.
425	1	17	27	 And all the men of his house, those born in the house, and those bought with money of a foreigner, were circumcised with him.
426	1	18	1	 And the LORD appeared unto him by the terebinths of Mamre, as he sat in the tent door in the heat of the day;
427	1	18	2	 and he lifted up his eyes and looked, and, lo, three men stood over against him; and when he saw them, he ran to meet them from the tent door, and bowed down to the earth,
428	1	18	3	 and said: 'My lord, if now I have found favour in thy sight, pass not away, I pray thee, from thy servant.
429	1	18	4	 Let now a little water be fetched, and wash your feet, and recline yourselves under the tree.
430	1	18	5	 And I will fetch a morsel of bread, and stay ye your heart; after that ye shall pass on; forasmuch as ye are come to your servant.' And they said: 'So do, as thou hast said.'
431	1	18	6	 And Abraham hastened into the tent unto Sarah, and said: 'Make ready quickly three measures of fine meal, knead it, and make cakes.'
432	1	18	7	 And Abraham ran unto the herd, and fetched a calf tender and good, and gave it unto the servant; and he hastened to dress it.
433	1	18	8	 And he took curd, and milk, and the calf which he had dressed, and set it before them; and he stood by them under the tree, and they did eat.
434	1	18	9	 And they said unto him: 'Where is Sarah thy wife?' And he said: 'Behold, in the tent.'
435	1	18	10	 And He said: 'I will certainly return unto thee when the season cometh round; and, lo, Sarah thy wife shall have a son.' And Sarah heard in the tent door, which was behind him.--
436	1	18	11	 Now Abraham and Sarah were old, and well stricken in age; it had ceased to be with Sarah after the manner of women.--
437	1	18	12	 And Sarah laughed within herself, saying: 'After I am waxed old shall I have pleasure, my lord being old also?'
438	1	18	13	 And the LORD said unto Abraham: 'Wherefore did Sarah laugh, saying: Shall I of a surety bear a child, who am old?
439	1	18	14	 Is any thing too hard for the LORD. At the set time I will return unto thee, when the season cometh round, and Sarah shall have a son.'
440	1	18	15	 Then Sarah denied, saying: 'I laughed not'; for she was afraid. And He said: 'Nay; but thou didst laugh.'
441	1	18	16	 And the men rose up from thence, and looked out toward Sodom; and Abraham went with them to bring them on the way.
442	1	18	17	 And the LORD said: 'Shall I hide from Abraham that which I am doing;
443	1	18	18	 seeing that Abraham shall surely become a great and mighty nation, and all the nations of the earth shall be blessed in him?
444	1	18	19	 For I have known him, to the end that he may command his children and his household after him, that they may keep the way of the LORD, to do righteousness and justice; to the end that the LORD may bring upon Abraham that which He hath spoken of him.'
445	1	18	20	 And the LORD said: 'Verily, the cry of Sodom and Gomorrah is great, and, verily, their sin is exceeding grievous.
446	1	18	21	 I will go down now, and see whether they have done altogether according to the cry of it, which is come unto Me; and if not, I will know.'
447	1	18	22	 And the men turned from thence, and went toward Sodom; but Abraham stood yet before the LORD.
448	1	18	23	 And Abraham drew near, and said: 'Wilt Thou indeed sweep away the righteous with the wicked?
449	1	18	24	 Peradventure there are fifty righteous within the city; wilt Thou indeed sweep away and not forgive the place for the fifty righteous that are therein?
450	1	18	25	 That be far from Thee to do after this manner, to slay the righteous with the wicked, that so the righteous should be as the wicked; that be far from Thee; shall not the judge of all the earth do justly?'
451	1	18	26	 And the LORD said: 'If I find in Sodom fifty righteous within the city, then I will forgive all the place for their sake.'
452	1	18	27	 And Abraham answered and said: 'Behold now, I have taken upon me to speak unto the Lord, who am but dust and ashes.
453	1	18	28	 Peradventure there shall lack five of the fifty righteous; wilt Thou destroy all the city for lack of five?' And He said: 'I will not destroy it, if I find there forty and five.'
454	1	18	29	 And he spoke unto Him yet again, and said: 'Peradventure there shall be forty found there.' And He said: 'I will not do it for the forty's sake.'
455	1	18	30	 And he said: 'Oh, let not the Lord be angry, and I will speak. Peradventure there shall thirty be found there.' And He said: 'I will not do it, if I find thirty there.'
456	1	18	31	 And he said: 'Behold now, I have taken upon me to speak unto the Lord. Peradventure there shall be twenty found there.' And He said: 'I will not destroy it for the twenty's sake.'
457	1	18	32	 And he said: 'Oh, let not the Lord be angry, and I will speak yet but this once. Peradventure ten shall be found there.' And He said: 'I will not destroy it for the ten's sake.'
458	1	18	33	 And the LORD went His way, as soon as He had left off speaking to Abraham; and Abraham returned unto his place.
459	1	19	1	 And the two angels came to Sodom at even; and Lot sat in the gate of Sodom; and Lot saw them, and rose up to meet them; and he fell down on his face to the earth;
460	1	19	2	 and he said: 'Behold now, my lords, turn aside, I pray you, into your servant's house, and tarry all night, and wash your feet, and ye shall rise up early, and go on your way.' And they said: 'Nay; but we will abide in the broad place all night.'
461	1	19	3	 And he urged them greatly; and they turned in unto him, and entered into his house; and he made them a feast, and did bake unleavened bread, and they did eat.
462	1	19	4	 But before they lay down, the men of the city, even the men of Sodom, compassed the house round, both young and old, all the people from every quarter.
463	1	19	5	 And they called unto Lot, and said unto him: 'Where are the men that came in to thee this night? bring them out unto us, that we may know them.'

465	1	19	7	 And he said: 'I pray you, my brethren, do not so wickedly.
466	1	19	8	 Behold now, I have two daughters that have not known man; let me, I pray you, bring them out unto you, and do ye to them as is good in your eyes; only unto these men do nothing; forasmuch as they are come under the shadow of my roof.'
467	1	19	9	 And they said: 'Stand back.' And they said: 'This one fellow came in to sojourn, and he will needs play the judge; now will we deal worse with thee, than with them.' And they pressed sore upon the man, even Lot, and drew near to break the door.
468	1	19	10	 But the men put forth their hand, and brought Lot into the house to them, and the door they shut.

471	1	19	13	 for we will destroy this place, because the cry of them is waxed great before the LORD; and the LORD hath sent us to destroy it.'

473	1	19	15	 And when the morning arose, then the angels hastened Lot, saying: 'Arise, take thy wife, and thy two daughters that are here; lest thou be swept away in the iniquity of the city.'
474	1	19	16	 But he lingered; and the men laid hold upon his hand, and upon the hand of his wife, and upon the hand of his two daughters; the LORD being merciful unto him. And they brought him forth, and set him without the city.
475	1	19	17	 And it came to pass, when they had brought them forth abroad, that he said: 'Escape for thy life; look not behind thee, neither stay thou in all the Plain; escape to the mountain, lest thou be swept away.'
476	1	19	18	 And Lot said unto them: 'Oh, not so, my lord;
477	1	19	19	 behold now, thy servant hath found grace in thy sight, and thou hast magnified thy mercy, which thou hast shown unto me in saving my life; and I cannot escape to the mountain, lest the evil overtake me, and I die.
478	1	19	20	 Behold now, this city is near to flee unto, and it is a little one; oh, let me escape thither--is it not a little one? --and my soul shall live.'
479	1	19	21	 And he said unto him: 'See, I have accepted thee concerning this thing also, that I will not overthrow the city of which thou hast spoken.
480	1	19	22	 Hasten thou, escape thither; for I cannot do any thing till thou be come thither.' --Therefore the name of the city was called Zoar.--

488	1	19	30	 And Lot went up out of Zoar, and dwelt in the mountain, and his two daughters with him; for he feared to dwell in Zoar; and he dwelt in a cave, he and his two daughters.

492	1	19	34	 And it came to pass on the morrow, that the first-born said unto the younger: 'Behold, I lay yesternight with my father. Let us make him drink wine this night also; and go thou in, and lie with him, that we may preserve seed of our father.'

515	1	21	1	 And the LORD remembered Sarah as He had said, and the LORD did unto Sarah as He had spoken.

549	1	22	1	 And it came to pass after these things, that God did prove Abraham, and said unto him: 'Abraham'; and he said: 'Here am I.'

573	1	23	1	 And the life of Sarah was a hundred and seven and twenty years; these were the years of the life of Sarah.

575	1	23	3	 And Abraham rose up from before his dead, and spoke unto the children of Heth, saying:
576	1	23	4	 'I am a stranger and a sojourner with you: give me a possession of a burying-place with you, that I may bury my dead out of my sight.'
577	1	23	5	 And the children of Heth answered Abraham, saying unto him:
578	1	23	6	 'Hear us, my lord: thou art a mighty prince among us; in the choice of our sepulchres bury thy dead; none of us shall withhold from thee his sepulchre, but that thou mayest bury thy dead.'

585	1	23	13	 And he spoke unto Ephron in the hearing of the people of the land, saying: 'But if thou wilt, I pray thee, hear me: I will give the price of the field; take it of me, and I will bury my dead there.'
586	1	23	14	 And Ephron answered Abraham, saying unto him:
587	1	23	15	 'My lord, hearken unto me: a piece of land worth four hundred shekels of silver, what is that betwixt me and thee? bury therefore thy dead.'
588	1	23	16	 And Abraham hearkened unto Ephron; and Abraham weighed to Ephron the silver, which he had named in the hearing of the children of Heth, four hundred shekels of silver, current money with the merchant.
589	1	23	17	 So the field of Ephron, which was in Machpelah, which was before Mamre, the field, and the cave which was therein, and all the trees that were in the field, that were in all the border thereof round about, were made sure
590	1	23	18	 unto Abraham for a possession in the presence of the children of Heth, before all that went in at the gate of his city.
591	1	23	19	 And after this, Abraham buried Sarah his wife in the cave of the field of Machpelah before Mamre--the same is Hebron--in the land of Canaan.
592	1	23	20	 And the field, and the cave that is therein, were made sure unto Abraham for a possession of a burying-place by the children of Heth.
593	1	24	1	 And Abraham was old, well stricken in age; and the LORD had blessed Abraham in all things.
594	1	24	2	 And Abraham said unto his servant, the elder of his house, that ruled over all that he had: 'Put, I pray thee, thy hand under my thigh.
595	1	24	3	 And I will make thee swear by the LORD, the God of heaven and the God of the earth, that thou shalt not take a wife for my son of the daughters of the Canaanites, among whom I dwell.
596	1	24	4	 But thou shalt go unto my country, and to my kindred, and take a wife for my son, even for Isaac.'
597	1	24	5	 And the servant said unto him: 'Peradventure the woman will not be willing to follow me unto this land; must I needs bring thy son back unto the land from whence thou camest?'
598	1	24	6	 And Abraham said unto him: 'Beware thou that thou bring not my son back thither.
599	1	24	7	 The LORD, the God of heaven, who took me from my father's house, and from the land of my nativity, and who spoke unto me, and who swore unto me, saying: Unto thy seed will I give this land; He will send His angel before thee, and thou shalt take a wife for my son from thence.
600	1	24	8	 And if the woman be not willing to follow thee, then thou shalt be clear from this my oath; only thou shalt not bring my son back thither.'
601	1	24	9	 And the servant put his hand under the thigh of Abraham his master, and swore to him concerning this matter.
602	1	24	10	 And the servant took ten camels, of the camels of his master, and departed; having all goodly things of his master's in his hand; and he arose, and went to Aram-naharaim, unto the city of Nahor.
603	1	24	11	 And he made the camels to kneel down without the city by the well of water at the time of evening, the time that women go out to draw water.
604	1	24	12	 And he said: 'O LORD, the God of my master Abraham, send me, I pray Thee, good speed this day, and show kindness unto my master Abraham.
605	1	24	13	 Behold, I stand by the fountain of water; and the daughters of the men of the city come out to draw water.
606	1	24	14	 So let it come to pass, that the damsel to whom I shall say: Let down thy pitcher, I pray thee, that I may drink; and she shall say: Drink, and I will give thy camels drink also; let the same be she that Thou hast appointed for Thy servant, even for Isaac; and thereby shall I know that Thou hast shown kindness unto my master.'
607	1	24	15	 And it came to pass, before he had done speaking, that, behold, Rebekah came out, who was born to Bethuel the son of Milcah, the wife of Nahor, Abraham's brother, with her pitcher upon her shoulder.
608	1	24	16	 And the damsel was very fair to look upon, a virgin, neither had any man known her; and she went down to the fountain, and filled her pitcher, and came up.
609	1	24	17	 And the servant ran to meet her, and said: 'Give me to drink, I pray thee, a little water of thy pitcher.'
610	1	24	18	 And she said: 'Drink, my lord'; and she hastened, and let down her pitcher upon her hand, and gave him drink.
611	1	24	19	 And when she had done giving him drink, she said: 'I will draw for thy camels also, until they have done drinking.'
612	1	24	20	 And she hastened, and emptied her pitcher into the trough, and ran again unto the well to draw, and drew for all his camels.
613	1	24	21	 And the man looked stedfastly on her; holding his peace, to know whether the LORD had made his journey prosperous or not.
614	1	24	22	 And it came to pass, as the camels had done drinking, that the man took a golden ring of half a shekel weight, and two bracelets for her hands of ten shekels weight of gold;
615	1	24	23	 and said: 'Whose daughter art thou? tell me, I pray thee. Is there room in thy father's house for us to lodge in?'
616	1	24	24	 And she said unto him: 'I am the daughter of Bethuel the son of Milcah, whom she bore unto Nahor.'
617	1	24	25	 She said moreover unto him: 'We have both straw and provender enough, and room to lodge in.'
618	1	24	26	 And the man bowed his head, and prostrated himself before the LORD.
619	1	24	27	 And he said: 'Blessed be the LORD, the God of my master Abraham, who hath not forsaken His mercy and His truth toward my master; as for me, the LORD hath led me in the way to the house of my master's brethren.'
620	1	24	28	 And the damsel ran, and told her mother's house according to these words.
621	1	24	29	 And Rebekah had a brother, and his name was Laban; and Laban ran out unto the man, unto the fountain.
622	1	24	30	 And it came to pass, when he saw the ring, and the bracelets upon his sister's hands, and when he heard the words of Rebekah his sister, saying: 'Thus spoke the man unto me,' that he came unto the man; and, behold, he stood by the camels at the fountain.
623	1	24	31	 And he said: 'Come in, thou blessed of the LORD; wherefore standest thou without? for I have cleared the house, and made room for the camels.'
624	1	24	32	 And the man came into the house, and he ungirded the camels; and he gave straw and provender for the camels, and water to wash his feet and the feet of the men that were with him.
625	1	24	33	 And there was set food before him to eat; but he said: 'I will not eat, until I have told mine errand.' And he said: 'Speak on.'
626	1	24	34	 And he said: 'I am Abraham's servant.
627	1	24	35	 And the LORD hath blessed my master greatly; and he is become great; and He hath given him flocks and herds, and silver and gold, and men-servants and maid-servants, and camels and asses.
628	1	24	36	 And Sarah my master's wife bore a son to my master when she was old; and unto him hath he given all that he hath.
629	1	24	37	 And my master made me swear, saying: Thou shalt not take a wife for my son of the daughters of the Canaanites, in whose land I dwell.
630	1	24	38	 But thou shalt go unto my father's house, and to my kindred, and take a wife for my son.
631	1	24	39	 And I said unto my master: Peradventure the woman will not follow me.
632	1	24	40	 And he said unto me: The LORD, before whom I walk, will send His angel with thee, and prosper thy way; and thou shalt take a wife for my son of my kindred, and of my father's house;
633	1	24	41	 then shalt thou be clear from my oath, when thou comest to my kindred; and if they give her not to thee, thou shalt be clear from my oath.
634	1	24	42	 And I came this day unto the fountain, and said: O LORD, the God of my master Abraham, if now Thou do prosper my way which I go:
635	1	24	43	 behold, I stand by the fountain of water; and let it come to pass, that the maiden that cometh forth to draw, to whom I shall say: Give me, I pray thee, a little water from thy pitcher to drink;
636	1	24	44	 and she shall say to me: Both drink thou, and I will also draw for thy camels; let the same be the woman whom the LORD hath appointed for my master's son.
637	1	24	45	 And before I had done speaking to my heart, behold, Rebekah came forth with her pitcher on her shoulder; and she went down unto the fountain, and drew. And I said unto her: Let me drink, I pray thee.
638	1	24	46	 And she made haste, and let down her pitcher from her shoulder, and said: Drink, and I will give thy camels drink also. So I drank, and she made the camels drink also.
639	1	24	47	 And I asked her, and said: Whose daughter art thou? And she said: The daughter of Bethuel, Nahor's son, whom Milcah bore unto him. And I put the ring upon her nose, and the bracelets upon her hands.
640	1	24	48	 And I bowed my head, and prostrated myself before the LORD, and blessed the LORD, the God of my master Abraham, who had led me in the right way to take my master's brother's daughter for his son.
641	1	24	49	 And now if ye will deal kindly and truly with my master, tell me; and if not, tell me; that I may turn to the right hand, or to the left.'
642	1	24	50	 Then Laban and Bethuel answered and said: 'The thing proceedeth from the LORD; we cannot speak unto thee bad or good.
643	1	24	51	 Behold, Rebekah is before thee, take her, and go, and let her be thy master's son's wife, as the LORD hath spoken.'
644	1	24	52	 And it came to pass, that, when Abraham's servant heard their words, he bowed himself down to the earth unto the LORD.
645	1	24	53	 And the servant brought forth jewels of silver, and jewels of gold, and raiment, and gave them to Rebekah; he gave also to her brother and to her mother precious things.
646	1	24	54	 And they did eat and drink, he and the men that were with him, and tarried all night; and they rose up in the morning, and he said: 'Send me away unto my master.'
647	1	24	55	 And her brother and her mother said: 'Let the damsel abide with us a few days, at the least ten; after that she shall go.'
648	1	24	56	 And he said unto them: 'Delay me not, seeing the LORD hath prospered my way; send me away that I may go to my master.'
649	1	24	57	 And they said: 'We will call the damsel, and inquire at her mouth.'
650	1	24	58	 And they called Rebekah, and said unto her: 'Wilt thou go with this man?' And she said: 'I will go.'
651	1	24	59	 And they sent away Rebekah their sister, and her nurse, and Abraham's servant, and his men.
652	1	24	60	 And they blessed Rebekah, and said unto her: 'Our sister, be thou the mother of thousands of ten thousands, and let thy seed possess the gate of those that hate them.'
653	1	24	61	 And Rebekah arose, and her damsels, and they rode upon the camels, and followed the man. And the servant took Rebekah, and went his way.
654	1	24	62	 And Isaac came from the way of Beer-lahai-roi; for he dwelt in the land of the South.
655	1	24	63	 And Isaac went out to meditate in the field at the eventide; and he lifted up his eyes, and saw, and, behold, there were camels coming.
656	1	24	64	 And Rebekah lifted up her eyes, and when she saw Isaac, she alighted from the camel.
657	1	24	65	 And she said unto the servant: 'What man is this that walketh in the field to meet us?' And the servant said: 'It is my master.' And she took her veil, and covered herself.
658	1	24	66	 And the servant told Isaac all the things that he had done.
659	1	24	67	 And Isaac brought her into his mother Sarah's tent, and took Rebekah, and she became his wife; and he loved her. And Isaac was comforted for his mother.
660	1	25	1	 And Abraham took another wife, and her name was Keturah.
661	1	25	2	 And she bore him Zimran, and Jokshan, and Medan, and Midian, and Ishbak, and Shuah.
662	1	25	3	 And Jokshan begot Sheba, and Dedan. And the sons of Dedan were Asshurim, and Letushim, and Leummim.
663	1	25	4	 And the sons of Midian: Ephah, and Epher, and Hanoch, and Abida, and Eldaah. All these were the children of Keturah.
664	1	25	5	 And Abraham gave all that he had unto Isaac.
665	1	25	6	 But unto the sons of the concubines, that Abraham had, Abraham gave gifts; and he sent them away from Isaac his son, while he yet lived, eastward, unto the east country.
666	1	25	7	 And these are the days of the years of Abraham's life which he lived, a hundred threescore and fifteen years.
667	1	25	8	 And Abraham expired, and died in a good old age, an old man, and full of years; and was gathered to his people.
668	1	25	9	 And Isaac and Ishmael his sons buried him in the cave of Machpelah, in the field of Ephron the son of Zohar the Hittite, which is before Mamre;

670	1	25	11	 And it came to pass after the death of Abraham, that God blessed Isaac his son; and Isaac dwelt by Beer-lahai-roi.
671	1	25	12	 Now these are the generations of Ishmael, Abraham's son, whom Hagar the Egyptian, Sarah's handmaid, bore unto Abraham.
672	1	25	13	 And these are the names of the sons of Ishmael, by their names, according to their generations: the first-born of Ishmael, Nebaioth; and Kedar, and Adbeel, and Mibsam,
673	1	25	14	 and Mishma, and Dumah, and Massa;
674	1	25	15	 Hadad, and Tema, Jetur, Naphish, and Kedem;
675	1	25	16	 these are the sons of Ishmael, and these are their names, by their villages, and by their encampments; twelve princes according to their nations.
676	1	25	17	 And these are the years of the life of Ishmael, a hundred and thirty and seven years; and he expired and died; and was gathered unto his people.
677	1	25	18	 And they dwelt from Havilah unto Shur that is before Egypt, as thou goest toward Asshur: over against all his brethren he did settle.
678	1	25	19	 And these are the generations of Isaac, Abraham's son: Abraham begot Isaac.
679	1	25	20	 And Isaac was forty years old when he took Rebekah, the daughter of Bethuel the Aramean, of Paddan-aram, the sister of Laban the Aramean, to be his wife.
680	1	25	21	 And Isaac entreated the LORD for his wife, because she was barren; and the LORD let Himself be entreated of him, and Rebekah his wife conceived.
681	1	25	22	 And the children struggled together within her; and she said: 'If it be so, wherefore do I live?' And she went to inquire of the LORD.
682	1	25	23	 And the LORD said unto her: Two nations are in thy womb, and two peoples shall be separated from thy bowels; and the one people shall be stronger than the other people; and the elder shall serve the younger.
683	1	25	24	 And when her days to be delivered were fulfilled, behold, there were twins in her womb.
684	1	25	25	 And the first came forth ruddy, all over like a hairy mantle; and they called his name Esau.
685	1	25	26	 And after that came forth his brother, and his hand had hold on Esau's heel; and his name was called Jacob. And Isaac was threescore years old when she bore them.
686	1	25	27	 And the boys grew; and Esau was a cunning hunter, a man of the field; and Jacob was a quiet man, dwelling in tents.
687	1	25	28	 Now Isaac loved Esau, because he did eat of his venison; and Rebekah loved Jacob.
688	1	25	29	 And Jacob sod pottage; and Esau came in from the field, and he was faint.
689	1	25	30	 And Esau said to Jacob: 'Let me swallow, I pray thee, some of this red, red pottage; for I am faint.' Therefore was his name called Edom.
690	1	25	31	 And Jacob said: 'Sell me first thy birth right.'
691	1	25	32	 And Esau said: 'Behold, I am at the point to die; and what profit shall the birthright do to me?'
692	1	25	33	 And Jacob said: 'Swear to me first'; and he swore unto him; and he sold his birthright unto Jacob.
693	1	25	34	 And Jacob gave Esau bread and pottage of lentils; and he did eat and drink, and rose up, and went his way. So Esau despised his birthright.
694	1	26	1	 And there was a famine in the land, beside the first famine that was in the days of Abraham. And Isaac went unto Abimelech king of the Philistines unto Gerar.
695	1	26	2	 And the LORD appeared unto him, and said: 'Go not down unto Egypt; dwell in the land which I shall tell thee of.
696	1	26	3	 Sojourn in this land, and I will be with thee, and will bless thee; for unto thee, and unto thy seed, I will give all these lands, and I will establish the oath which I swore unto Abraham thy father;
697	1	26	4	 and I will multiply thy seed as the stars of heaven, and will give unto thy seed all these lands; and by thy seed shall all the nations of the earth bless themselves;
698	1	26	5	 because that Abraham hearkened to My voice, and kept My charge, My commandments, My statutes, and My laws.'
699	1	26	6	 And Isaac dwelt in Gerar.
700	1	26	7	 And the men of the place asked him of his wife; and he said: 'She is my sister'; for he feared to say: 'My wife'; 'lest the men of the place should kill me for Rebekah, because she is fair to look upon.'
701	1	26	8	 And it came to pass, when he had been there a long time, that Abimelech king of the Philistines looked out at a window, and saw, and, behold, Isaac was sporting with Rebekah his wife.
702	1	26	9	 And Abimelech called Isaac, and said: 'Behold, of a surety she is thy wife; and how saidst thou: She is my sister?' And Isaac said unto him: 'Because I said: Lest I die because of her.'
703	1	26	10	 And Abimelech said: 'What is this thou hast done unto us? one of the people might easily have lain with thy wife, and thou wouldest have brought guiltiness upon us.'
704	1	26	11	 And Abimelech charged all the people, saying: 'He that toucheth this man or his wife shall surely be put to death.'
705	1	26	12	 And Isaac sowed in that land, and found in the same year a hundred-fold; and the LORD blessed him.
706	1	26	13	 And the man waxed great, and grew more and more until he became very great.
707	1	26	14	 And he had possessions of flocks, and possessions of herds, and a great household; and the Philistines envied him.
708	1	26	15	 Now all the wells which his father's servants had digged in the days of Abraham his father, the Philistines had stopped them, and filled them with earth.
709	1	26	16	 And Abimelech said unto Isaac: 'Go from us; for thou art much mightier than we.'
710	1	26	17	 And Isaac departed thence, and encamped in the valley of Gerar, and dwelt there.
711	1	26	18	 And Isaac digged again the wells of water, which they had digged in the days of Abraham his father; for the Philistines had stopped them after the death of Abraham; and he called their names after the names by which his father had called them.
712	1	26	19	 And Isaac's servants digged in the valley, and found there a well of living water.
713	1	26	20	 And the herdmen of Gerar strove with Isaac's herdmen, saying: 'The water is ours.' And he called the name of the well Esek; because they contended with him.
714	1	26	21	 And they digged another well, and they strove for that also. And he called the name of it Sitnah.
715	1	26	22	 And he removed from thence, and digged another well; and for that they strove not. And he called the name of it Rehoboth; and he said: 'For now the LORD hath made room for us, and we shall be fruitful in the land.'
716	1	26	23	 And he went up from thence to Beer-sheba.
717	1	26	24	 And the LORD appeared unto him the same night, and said: 'I am the God of Abraham thy father. Fear not, for I am with thee, and will bless thee, and multiply thy seed for My servant Abraham's sake.'
718	1	26	25	 And he builded an altar there, and called upon the name of the LORD, and pitched his tent there; and there Isaac's servants digged a well.
719	1	26	26	 Then Abimelech went to him from Gerar, and Ahuzzath his friend, and Phicol the captain of his host.
720	1	26	27	 And Isaac said unto them: 'Wherefore are ye come unto me, seeing ye hate me, and have sent me away from you?'
721	1	26	28	 And they said: 'We saw plainly that the LORD was with thee; and we said: Let there now be an oath betwixt us, even betwixt us and thee, and let us make a covenant with thee;
722	1	26	29	 that thou wilt do us no hurt, as we have not touched thee, and as we have done unto thee nothing but good, and have sent thee away in peace; thou art now the blessed of the LORD.'
723	1	26	30	 And he made them a feast, and they did eat and drink.
724	1	26	31	 And they rose up betimes in the morning, and swore one to another; and Isaac sent them away, and they departed from him in peace.
725	1	26	32	 And it came to pass the same day, that Isaac's servants came, and told him concerning the well which they had digged, and said unto him: 'We have found water.'
726	1	26	33	 And he called it Shibah. Therefore the name of the city is Beer-sheba unto this day.
727	1	26	34	 And when Esau was forty years old, he took to wife Judith the daughter of Beeri the Hittite, and Basemath the daughter of Elon the Hittite.
728	1	26	35	 And they were a bitterness of spirit unto Isaac and to Rebekah.
729	1	27	1	 And it came to pass, that when Isaac was old, and his eyes were dim, so that he could not see, he called Esau his elder son, and said unto him: 'My son'; and he said unto him: 'Here am I.'
730	1	27	2	 And he said: 'Behold now, I am old, I know not the day of my death.
731	1	27	3	 Now therefore take, I pray thee, thy weapons, thy quiver and thy bow, and go out to the field, and take me venison;
732	1	27	4	 and make me savoury food, such as I love, and bring it to me, that I may eat; that my soul may bless thee before I die.'
733	1	27	5	 And Rebekah heard when Isaac spoke to Esau his son. And Esau went to the field to hunt for venison, and to bring it.
734	1	27	6	 And Rebekah spoke unto Jacob her son, saying: 'Behold, I heard thy father speak unto Esau thy brother, saying:
735	1	27	7	 Bring me venison, and make me savoury food, that I may eat, and bless thee before the LORD before my death.

746	1	27	18	 And he came unto his father, and said: 'My father'; and he said: 'Here am I; who art thou, my son?'
747	1	27	19	 And Jacob said unto his father: 'I am Esau thy first-born; I have done according as thou badest me. Arise, I pray thee, sit and eat of my venison, that thy soul may bless me.'
748	1	27	20	 And Isaac said unto his son: 'How is it that thou hast found it so quickly, my son?' And he said: 'Because the LORD thy God sent me good speed.'
749	1	27	21	 And Isaac said unto Jacob: 'Come near, I pray thee, that I may feel thee, my son, whether thou be my very son Esau or not.'
750	1	27	22	 And Jacob went near unto Isaac his father; and he felt him, and said: 'The voice is the voice of Jacob, but the hands are the hands of Esau.'
751	1	27	23	 And he discerned him not, because his hands were hairy, as his brother Esau's hands; so he blessed him.
752	1	27	24	 And he said: 'Art thou my very son Esau?' And he said: 'I am.'
753	1	27	25	 And he said: 'Bring it near to me, and I will eat of my son's venison, that my soul may bless thee.' And he brought it near to him, and he did eat; and he brought him wine, and he drank.
754	1	27	26	 And his father Isaac said unto him: 'Come near now, and kiss me, my son.'
755	1	27	27	 And he came near, and kissed him. And he smelled the smell of his raiment, and blessed him, and said: See, the smell of my son is as the smell of a field which the LORD hath blessed.
756	1	27	28	 So God give thee of the dew of heaven, and of the fat places of the earth, and plenty of corn and wine.
757	1	27	29	 Let peoples serve thee, and nations bow down to thee. Be lord over thy brethren, and let thy mother's sons bow down to thee. Cursed be every one that curseth thee, and blessed be every one that blesseth thee.
758	1	27	30	 And it came to pass, as soon as Isaac had made an end of blessing Jacob, and Jacob was yet scarce gone out from the presence of Isaac his father, that Esau his brother came in from his hunting.
759	1	27	31	 And he also made savoury food, and brought it unto his father; and he said unto his father: 'Let my father arise, and eat of his son's venison, that thy soul may bless me.'
760	1	27	32	 And Isaac his father said unto him: 'Who art thou?' And he said: 'I am thy son, thy first-born, Esau.'
761	1	27	33	 And Isaac trembled very exceedingly, and said: 'Who then is he that hath taken venison, and brought it me, and I have eaten of all before thou camest, and have blessed him? yea, and he shall be blessed.'
762	1	27	34	 When Esau heard the words of his father, he cried with an exceeding great and bitter cry, and said unto his father: 'Bless me, even me also, O my father.'
763	1	27	35	 And he said: 'Thy brother came with guile, and hath taken away thy blessing.'
764	1	27	36	 And he said: 'Is not he rightly named Jacob? for he hath supplanted me these two times: he took away my birthright; and, behold, now he hath taken away my blessing.' And he said: 'Hast thou not reserved a blessing for me?'
765	1	27	37	 And Isaac answered and said unto Esau: 'Behold, I have made him thy lord, and all his brethren have I given to him for servants; and with corn and wine have I sustained him; and what then shall I do for thee, my son?'
766	1	27	38	 And Esau said unto his father: 'Hast thou but one blessing, my father? bless me, even me also, O my father.' And Esau lifted up his voice, and wept.
767	1	27	39	 And Isaac his father answered and said unto him: Behold, of the fat places of the earth shall be thy dwelling, and of the dew of heaven from above;
768	1	27	40	 And by thy sword shalt thou live, and thou shalt serve thy brother; and it shall come to pass when thou shalt break loose, that thou shalt shake his yoke from off thy neck.
769	1	27	41	 And Esau hated Jacob because of the blessing wherewith his father blessed him. And Esau said in his heart: 'Let the days of mourning for my father be at hand; then will I slay my brother Jacob.'
770	1	27	42	 And the words of Esau her elder son were told to Rebekah; and she sent and called Jacob her younger son, and said unto him: 'Behold, thy brother Esau, as touching thee, doth comfort himself, purposing to kill thee.
771	1	27	43	 Now therefore, my son, hearken to my voice; and arise, flee thou to Laban my brother to Haran;
772	1	27	44	 and tarry with him a few days, until thy brother's fury turn away;
773	1	27	45	 until thy brother's anger turn away from thee, and he forget that which thou hast done to him; then I will send, and fetch thee from thence; why should I be bereaved of you both in one day?'
774	1	27	46	 And Rebekah said to Isaac: 'I am weary of my life because of the daughters of Heth. If Jacob take a wife of the daughters of Heth, such as these, of the daughters of the land, what good shall my life do me?'
775	1	28	1	 And Isaac called Jacob, and blessed him, and charged him, and said unto him: 'Thou shalt not take a wife of the daughters of Canaan.

777	1	28	3	 And God Almighty bless thee, and make thee fruitful, and multiply thee, that thou mayest be a congregation of peoples;

779	1	28	5	 And Isaac sent away Jacob; and he went to Paddan-aram unto Laban, son of Bethuel the Aramean, the brother of Rebekah, Jacob's and Esau's mother.
780	1	28	6	 Now Esau saw that Isaac had blessed Jacob and sent him away to Paddan-aram, to take him a wife from thence; and that as he blessed him he gave him a charge, saying: 'Thou shalt not take a wife of the daughters of Canaan';

784	1	28	10	 And Jacob went out from Beer-sheba, and went toward Haran.
785	1	28	11	 And he lighted upon the place, and tarried there all night, because the sun was set; and he took one of the stones of the place, and put it under his head, and lay down in that place to sleep.
786	1	28	12	 And he dreamed, and behold a ladder set up on the earth, and the top of it reached to heaven; and behold the angels of God ascending and descending on it.
787	1	28	13	 And, behold, the LORD stood beside him, and said: 'I am the LORD, the God of Abraham thy father, and the God of Isaac. The land whereon thou liest, to thee will I give it, and to thy seed.
788	1	28	14	 And thy seed shall be as the dust of the earth, and thou shalt spread abroad to the west, and to the east, and to the north, and to the south. And in thee and in thy seed shall all the families of the earth be blessed.
789	1	28	15	 And, behold, I am with thee, and will keep thee whithersoever thou goest, and will bring thee back into this land; for I will not leave thee, until I have done that which I have spoken to thee of.'
790	1	28	16	 And Jacob awaked out of his sleep, and he said: 'Surely the LORD is in this place; and I knew it not.'
791	1	28	17	 And he was afraid, and said: 'How full of awe is this place! this is none other than the house of God, and this is the gate of heaven.'
792	1	28	18	 And Jacob rose up early in the morning, and took the stone that he had put under his head, and set it up for a pillar, and poured oil upon the top of it.
793	1	28	19	 And he called the name of that place Beth-el, but the name of the city was Luz at the first.
794	1	28	20	 And Jacob vowed a vow, saying: 'If God will be with me, and will keep me in this way that I go, and will give me bread to eat, and raiment to put on,

796	1	28	22	 and this stone, which I have set up for a pillar, shall be God's house; and of all that Thou shalt give me I will surely give the tenth unto Thee.'
797	1	29	1	 Then Jacob went on his journey, and came to the land of the children of the east.
798	1	29	2	 And he looked, and behold a well in the field, and, lo, three flocks of sheep lying there by it. --For out of that well they watered the flocks. And the stone upon the well's mouth was great.
799	1	29	3	 And thither were all the flocks gathered; and they rolled the stone from the well's mouth, and watered the sheep, and put the stone back upon the well's mouth in its place.--
800	1	29	4	 And Jacob said unto them: 'My brethren, whence are ye?' And they said: 'Of Haran are we.'
801	1	29	5	 And he said unto them: 'Know ye Laban the son of Nahor?' And they said: 'We know him.'
802	1	29	6	 And he said unto them: 'Is it well with him?' And they said: 'It is well; and, behold, Rachel his daughter cometh with the sheep.'
803	1	29	7	 And he said: 'Lo, it is yet high day, neither is it time that the cattle should be gathered together; water ye the sheep, and go and feed them.'
804	1	29	8	 And they said: 'We cannot, until all the flocks be gathered together, and they roll the stone from the well's mouth; then we water the sheep.'

813	1	29	17	 And Leah's eyes were weak; but Rachel was of beautiful form and fair to look upon.

930	1	32	1	 (32:2) And Jacob went on his way, and the angels of God met him.

936	1	32	7	 (32:8) Then Jacob was greatly afraid and was distressed. And he divided the people that was with him, and the flocks, and the herds, and the camels, into two camps.
937	1	32	8	 (32:9) And he said: 'If Esau come to the one camp, and smite it, then the camp which is left shall escape.'

939	1	32	10	 (32:11) I am not worthy of all the mercies, and of all the truth, which Thou hast shown unto Thy servant; for with my staff I passed over this Jordan; and now I am become two camps.
940	1	32	11	 (32:12) Deliver me, I pray Thee, from the hand of my brother, from the hand of Esau; for I fear him, lest he come and smite me, the mother with the children.
941	1	32	12	 (32:13) And Thou saidst: I will surely do thee good, and make thy seed as the sand of the sea, which cannot be numbered for multitude.'

943	1	32	14	 (32:15) two hundred she-goats and twenty he-goats, two hundred ewes and twenty rams,
