948	1	32	19	 (32:20) And he commanded also the second, and the third, and all that followed the droves, saying: 'In this manner shall ye speak unto Esau, when ye find him;
949	1	32	20	 (32:21) and ye shall say: Moreover, behold, thy servant Jacob is behind us.' For he said: 'I will appease him with the present that goeth before me, and afterward I will see his face; peradventure he will accept me.'
950	1	32	21	 (32:22) So the present passed over before him; and he himself lodged that night in the camp.

952	1	32	23	 (32:24) And he took them, and sent them over the stream, and sent over that which he had.
953	1	32	24	 (32:25) And Jacob was left alone; and there wrestled a man with him until the breaking of the day.
954	1	32	25	 (32:26) And when he saw that he prevailed not against him, he touched the hollow of his thigh; and the hollow of Jacob's thigh was strained, as he wrestled with him.
955	1	32	26	 (32:27) And he said: 'Let me go, for the day breaketh.' And he said: 'I will not let thee go, except thou bless me.'
956	1	32	27	 (32:28) And he said unto him: 'What is thy name?' And be said: 'Jacob.'
957	1	32	28	 (32:29) And he said: 'Thy name shall be called no more Jacob, but Israel; for thou hast striven with God and with men, and hast prevailed.'
958	1	32	29	 (32:30) And Jacob asked him, and said: 'Tell me, I pray thee, thy name.' And he said: 'Wherefore is it that thou dost ask after my name?' And he blessed him there.
959	1	32	30	 (32:31) And Jacob called the name of the place Peniel: 'for I have seen God face to face, and my life is preserved.'
960	1	32	31	 (32:32) And the sun rose upon him as he passed over Peniel, and he limped upon his thigh.
961	1	32	32	 (32:33) Therefore the children of Israel eat not the sinew of the thigh-vein which is upon the hollow of the thigh, unto this day; because he touched the hollow of Jacob's thigh, even in the sinew of the thigh-vein.
962	1	33	1	 And Jacob lifted up his eyes and looked, and, behold, Esau came, and with him four hundred men. And he divided the children unto Leah, and unto Rachel, and unto the two handmaids.
963	1	33	2	 And he put the handmaids and their children foremost, and Leah and her children after, and Rachel and Joseph hindermost.
964	1	33	3	 And he himself passed over before them, and bowed himself to the ground seven times, until he came near to his brother.
965	1	33	4	 And Esau ran to meet him, and embraced him, and fell on his neck, and kissed him; and they wept.
966	1	33	5	 And he lifted up his eyes, and saw the women and the children; and said: 'Who are these with thee?' And he said: 'The children whom God hath graciously given thy servant.'
967	1	33	6	 Then the handmaids came near, they and their children, and they bowed down.
968	1	33	7	 And Leah also and her children came near, and bowed down; and after came Joseph near and Rachel, and they bowed down.
969	1	33	8	 And he said: 'What meanest thou by all this camp which I met?' And he said: 'To find favour in the sight of my lord.'
970	1	33	9	 And Esau said: 'I have enough; my brother, let that which thou hast be thine.'
971	1	33	10	 And Jacob said: 'Nay, I pray thee, if now I have found favour in thy sight, then receive my present at my hand; forasmuch as I have seen thy face, as one seeth the face of God, and thou wast pleased with me.
972	1	33	11	 Take, I pray thee, my gift that is brought to thee; because God hath dealt graciously with me, and because I have enough.' And he urged him, and he took it.
973	1	33	12	 And he said: 'Let us take our journey, and let us go, and I will go before thee.'
974	1	33	13	 And he said unto him: 'My lord knoweth that the children are tender, and that the flocks and herds giving suck are a care to me; and if they overdrive them one day, all the flocks will die.
975	1	33	14	 Let my lord, I pray thee, pass over before his servant; and I will journey on gently, according to the pace of the cattle that are before me and according to the pace of the children, until I come unto my lord unto Seir.'
976	1	33	15	 And Esau said: 'Let me now leave with thee some of the folk that are with me.' And he said: 'What needeth it? let me find favour in the sight of my lord.'
977	1	33	16	 So Esau returned that day on his way unto Seir.
978	1	33	17	 And Jacob journeyed to Succoth, and built him a house, and made booths for his cattle. Therefore the name of the place is called Succoth.
979	1	33	18	 And Jacob came in peace to the city of Shechem, which is in the land of Canaan, when he came from Paddan-aram; and encamped before the city.
980	1	33	19	 And he bought the parcel of ground, where he had spread his tent, at the hand of the children of Hamor, Shechem's father, for a hundred pieces of money.

982	1	34	1	 And Dinah the daughter of Leah, whom she had borne unto Jacob, went out to see the daughters of the land.
983	1	34	2	 And Shechem the son of Hamor the Hivite, the prince of the land, saw her; and he took her, and lay with her, and humbled her.
984	1	34	3	 And his soul did cleave unto Dinah the daughter of Jacob, and he loved the damsel, and spoke comfortingly unto the damsel.
985	1	34	4	 And Shechem spoke unto his father Hamor, saying: 'Get me this damsel to wife.'
986	1	34	5	 Now Jacob heard that he had defiled Dinah his daughter; and his sons were with his cattle in the field; and Jacob held his peace until they came.
987	1	34	6	 And Hamor the father of Shechem went out unto Jacob to speak with him.
988	1	34	7	 And the sons of Jacob came in from the field when they heard it; and the men were grieved, and they were very wroth, because he had wrought a vile deed in Israel in lying with Jacob's daughter; which thing ought not to be done.
989	1	34	8	 And Hamor spoke with them, saying 'The soul of my son Shechem longeth for your daughter. I pray you give her unto him to wife.
990	1	34	9	 And make ye marriages with us; give your daughters unto us, and take our daughters unto you.
991	1	34	10	 And ye shall dwell with us; and the land shall be before you; dwell and trade ye therein, and get you possessions therein.'
992	1	34	11	 And Shechem said unto her father and unto her brethren: 'Let me find favour in your eyes, and what ye shall say unto me I will give.
993	1	34	12	 Ask me never so much dowry and gift, and I will give according as ye shall say unto me; but give me the damsel to wife.'
994	1	34	13	 And the sons of Jacob answered Shechem and Hamor his father with guile, and spoke, because he had defiled Dinah their sister,
995	1	34	14	 and said unto them: 'We cannot do this thing, to give our sister to one that is uncircumcised; for that were a reproach unto us.
996	1	34	15	 Only on this condition will we consent unto you: if ye will be as we are, that every male of you be circumcised;
997	1	34	16	 then will we give our daughters unto you, and we will take your daughters to us, and we will dwell with you, and we will become one people.
998	1	34	17	 But if ye will not hearken unto us, to be circumcised; then will we take our daughter, and we will be gone.'
999	1	34	18	 And their words pleased Hamor, and Shechem Hamor's son.
1000	1	34	19	 And the young man deferred not to do the thing, because he had delight in Jacob's daughter. And he was honoured above all the house of his father.
1001	1	34	20	 And Hamor and Shechem his son came unto the gate of their city, and spoke with the men of their city, saying:
1002	1	34	21	 'These men are peaceable with us; therefore let them dwell in the land, and trade therein; for, behold, the land is large enough for them; let us take their daughters to us for wives, and let us give them our daughters.
1003	1	34	22	 Only on this condition will the men consent unto us to dwell with us, to become one people, if every male among us be circumcised, as they are circumcised.
1004	1	34	23	 Shall not their cattle and their substance and all their beasts be ours? only let us consent unto them, and they will dwell with us.'
1005	1	34	24	 And unto Hamor and unto Shechem his son hearkened all that went out of the gate of his city; and every male was circumcised, all that went out of the gate of his city.
1006	1	34	25	 And it came to pass on the third day, when they were in pain, that two of the sons of Jacob, Simeon and Levi, Dinah's brethren, took each man his sword, and came upon the city unawares, and slew all the males.
1007	1	34	26	 And they slew Hamor and Shechem his son with the edge of the sword, and took Dinah out of Shechem's house, and went forth.
1008	1	34	27	 The sons of Jacob came upon the slain, and spoiled the city, because they had defiled their sister.
1009	1	34	28	 They took their flocks and their herds and their asses, and that which was in the city and that which was in the field;
1010	1	34	29	 and all their wealth, and all their little ones and their wives, took they captive and spoiled, even all that was in the house.
1011	1	34	30	 And Jacob said to Simeon and Levi: 'Ye have troubled me, to make me odious unto the inhabitants of the land, even unto the Canaanites and the Perizzites; and, I being few in number, they will gather themselves together against me and smite me; and I shall be destroyed, I and my house.'
1012	1	34	31	 And they said: 'Should one deal with our sister as with a harlot?'
1013	1	35	1	 And God said unto Jacob: 'Arise, go up to Beth-el, and dwell there; and make there an altar unto God, who appeared unto thee when thou didst flee from the face of Esau thy brother.'
1014	1	35	2	 Then Jacob said unto his household, and to all that were with him: 'Put away the strange gods that are among you, and purify yourselves, and change your garments;
1015	1	35	3	 and let us arise, and go up to Beth-el; and I will make there an altar unto God, who answered me in the day of my distress, and was with me in the way which I went.'
1016	1	35	4	 And they gave unto Jacob all the foreign gods which were in their hand, and the rings which were in their ears; and Jacob hid them under the terebinth which was by Shechem.
1017	1	35	5	 And they journeyed; and a terror of God was upon the cities that were round about them, and they did not pursue after the sons of Jacob.

1024	1	35	12	 and the land which I gave unto Abraham and Isaac, to thee I will give it, and to thy seed after thee will I give the land.'
1025	1	35	13	 And God went up from him in the place where He spoke with him.

1027	1	35	15	 And Jacob called the name of the place where God spoke with him, Beth-el.

1085	1	37	1	 And Jacob dwelt in the land of his father's sojournings, in the land of Canaan.
1086	1	37	2	 These are the generations of Jacob. Joseph, being seventeen years old, was feeding the flock with his brethren, being still a lad even with the sons of Bilhah, and with the sons of Zilpah, his father's wives; and Joseph brought evil report of them unto their father.
1087	1	37	3	 Now Israel loved Joseph more than all his children, because he was the son of his old age; and he made him a coat of many colours.
1088	1	37	4	 And when his brethren saw that their father loved him more than all his brethren, they hated him, and could not speak peaceably unto him.
1089	1	37	5	 And Joseph dreamed a dream, and he told it to his brethren; and they hated him yet the more.
1090	1	37	6	 And he said unto them: 'Hear, I pray you, this dream which I have dreamed:
1091	1	37	7	 for, behold, we were binding sheaves in the field, and, lo, my sheaf arose, and also stood upright; and, behold, your sheaves came round about, and bowed down to my sheaf.'
1092	1	37	8	 And his brethren said to him: 'Shalt thou indeed reign over us? or shalt thou indeed have dominion over us?' And they hated him yet the more for his dreams, and for his words.
1093	1	37	9	 And he dreamed yet another dream, and told it to his brethren, and said: 'Behold, I have dreamed yet a dream: and, behold, the sun and the moon and eleven stars bowed down to me.'
1094	1	37	10	 And he told it to his father, and to his brethren; and his father rebuked him, and said unto him: 'What is this dream that thou hast dreamed? Shall I and thy mother and thy brethren indeed come to bow down to thee to the earth?'
1095	1	37	11	 And his brethren envied him; but his father kept the saying in mind.
1096	1	37	12	 And his brethren went to feed their father's flock in Shechem.

1098	1	37	14	 And he said to him: 'Go now, see whether it is well with thy brethren, and well with the flock; and bring me back word.' So he sent him out of the vale of Hebron, and he came to Shechem.
1099	1	37	15	 And a certain man found him, and, behold, he was wandering in the field. And the man asked him, saying: 'What seekest thou?'
1100	1	37	16	 And he said: 'I seek my brethren. Tell me, I pray thee, where they are feeding the flock.'
1101	1	37	17	 And the man said: 'They are departed hence; for I heard them say: Let us go to Dothan.' And Joseph went after his brethren, and found them in Dothan.
1102	1	37	18	 And they saw him afar off, and before he came near unto them, they conspired against him to slay him.
1103	1	37	19	 And they said one to another: 'Behold, this dreamer cometh.
1104	1	37	20	 Come now therefore, and let us slay him, and cast him into one of the pits, and we will say: An evil beast hath devoured him; and we shall see what will become of his dreams.'
1105	1	37	21	 And Reuben heard it, and delivered him out of their hand; and said: 'Let us not take his life.'

1107	1	37	23	 And it came to pass, when Joseph was come unto his brethren, that they stripped Joseph of his coat, the coat of many colours that was on him;
1108	1	37	24	 and they took him, and cast him into the pit--and the pit was empty, there was no water in it.
1109	1	37	25	 And they sat down to eat bread; and they lifted up their eyes and looked, and, behold, a caravan of Ishmaelites came from Gilead, with their camels bearing spicery and balm and ladanum, going to carry it down to Egypt.
1110	1	37	26	 And Judah said unto his brethren: 'What profit is it if we slay our brother and conceal his blood?

1117	1	37	33	 And he knew it, and said: 'It is my son's coat; an evil beast hath devoured him; Joseph is without doubt torn in pieces.'

1121	1	38	1	 And it came to pass at that time, that Judah went down from his brethren, and turned in to a certain Adullamite, whose name was Hirah.
1122	1	38	2	 And Judah saw there a daughter of a certain Canaanite whose name was Shua; and he took her, and went in unto her.

1124	1	38	4	 And she conceived again, and bore a son; and she called his name Onan.

1126	1	38	6	 And Judah took a wife for Er his first-born, and her name was Tamar.
1127	1	38	7	 And Er, Judah's first-born, was wicked in the sight of the LORD; and the LORD slew him.

1129	1	38	9	 And Onan knew that the seed would not be his; and it came to pass when he went in unto his brother's wife, that he spilled it on the ground, lest he should give seed to his brother.
1130	1	38	10	 And the thing which he did was evil in the sight of the LORD; and He slew him also.
1131	1	38	11	 Then said Judah to Tamar his daughter-in-law: 'Remain a widow in thy father's house, till Shelah my son be grown up'; for he said: 'Lest he also die, like his brethren.' And Tamar went and dwelt in her father's house.
1132	1	38	12	 And in process of time Shua's daughter, the wife of Judah, died; and Judah was comforted, and went up unto his sheep-shearers to Timnah, he and his friend Hirah the Adullamite.

1134	1	38	14	 And she put off from her the garments of her widowhood, and covered herself with her veil, and wrapped herself, and sat in the entrance of Enaim, which is by the way to Timnah; for she saw that Shelah was grown up, and she was not given unto him to wife.
1135	1	38	15	 When Judah saw her, he thought her to be a harlot; for she had covered her face.
1136	1	38	16	 And he turned unto her by the way, and said: 'Come, I pray thee, let me come in unto thee'; for he knew not that she was his daughter-in-law. And she said: 'What wilt thou give me, that thou mayest come in unto me?'

1151	1	39	1	 And Joseph was brought down to Egypt; and Potiphar, an officer of Pharaoh's, the captain of the guard, an Egyptian, bought him of the hand of the Ishmaelites, that had brought him down thither.

1174	1	40	1	 And it came to pass after these things, that the butler of the king of Egypt and his baker offended their lord the king of Egypt.

1197	1	41	1	 And it came to pass at the end of two full years, that Pharaoh dreamed: and, behold, he stood by the river.

1199	1	41	3	 And, behold, seven other kine came up after them out of the river, ill favoured and lean-fleshed; and stood by the other kine upon the brink of the river.

1227	1	41	31	 and the plenty shall not be known in the land by reason of that famine which followeth; for it shall be very grievous.

1503	1	49	29	 And be charged them, and said unto them: 'I am to be gathered unto my people; bury me with my fathers in the cave that is in the field of Ephron the Hittite,
1504	1	49	30	 in the cave that is in the field of Machpelah, which is before Mamre, in the land of Canaan, which Abraham bought with the field from Ephron the Hittite for a possession of a burying-place.
1505	1	49	31	 There they buried Abraham and Sarah his wife; there they buried Isaac and Rebekah his wife; and there I buried Leah.
1506	1	49	32	 The field and the cave that is therein, which was purchased from the children of Heth.'
1507	1	49	33	 And when Jacob made an end of charging his sons, he gathered up his feet into the bed, and expired, and was gathered unto his people.
1508	1	50	1	 And Joseph fell upon his father's face, and wept upon him, and kissed him.
1509	1	50	2	 And Joseph commanded his servants the physicians to embalm his father. And the physicians embalmed Israel.
1510	1	50	3	 And forty days were fulfilled for him; for so are fulfilled the days of embalming. And the Egyptians wept for him threescore and ten days.
1511	1	50	4	 And when the days of weeping for him were past, Joseph spoke unto the house of Pharaoh, saying: 'If now I have found favour in your eyes, speak, I pray you, in the ears of Pharaoh, saying:
1512	1	50	5	 My father made me swear, saying: Lo, I die; in my grave which I have digged for me in the land of Canaan, there shalt thou bury me. Now therefore let me go up, I pray thee, and bury my father, and I will come back.'
1513	1	50	6	 And Pharaoh said: 'Go up, and bury thy father, according as he made thee swear.'
1514	1	50	7	 And Joseph went up to bury his father; and with him went up all the servants of Pharaoh, the elders of his house, and all the elders of the land of Egypt,
1515	1	50	8	 and all the house of Joseph, and his brethren, and his father's house; only their little ones, and their flocks, and their herds, they left in the land of Goshen.
1516	1	50	9	 And there went up with him both chariots and horsemen; and it was a very great company.
1517	1	50	10	 And they came to the threshing-floor of Atad, which is beyond the Jordan, and there they wailed with a very great and sore wailing; and he made a mourning for his father seven days.
1518	1	50	11	 And when the inhabitants of the land, the Canaanites, saw the mourning in the floor of Atad, they said: 'This is a grievous mourning to the Egyptians.' Wherefore the name of it was called Abel-mizraim, which is beyond the Jordan.
1519	1	50	12	 And his sons did unto him according as he commanded them.
1520	1	50	13	 For his sons carried him into the land of Canaan, and buried him in the cave of the field of Machpelah, which Abraham bought with the field, for a possession of a burying-place, of Ephron the Hittite, in front of Mamre.
1521	1	50	14	 And Joseph returned into Egypt, he, and his brethren, and all that went up with him to bury his father, after he had buried his father.
1522	1	50	15	 And when Joseph's brethren saw that their father was dead, they said: 'It may be that Joseph will hate us, and will fully requite us all the evil which we did unto him.'
1523	1	50	16	 And they sent a message unto Joseph, saying: 'Thy father did command before he died, saying:
1524	1	50	17	 So shall ye say unto Joseph: Forgive, I pray thee now, the transgression of thy brethren, and their sin, for that they did unto thee evil. And now, we pray thee, forgive the transgression of the servants of the God of thy father.' And Joseph wept when they spoke unto him.
1525	1	50	18	 And his brethren also went and fell down before his face; and they said: 'Behold, we are thy bondmen.'
1526	1	50	19	 And Joseph said unto them: 'Fear not; for am I in the place of God?
1527	1	50	20	 And as for you, ye meant evil against me; but God meant it for good, to bring to pass, as it is this day, to save much people alive.
1528	1	50	21	 Now therefore fear ye not; I will sustain you, and your little ones.' And he comforted them, and spoke kindly unto them.
1529	1	50	22	 And Joseph dwelt in Egypt, he, and his father's house; and Joseph lived a hundred and ten years.
1530	1	50	23	 And Joseph saw Ephraim's children of the third generation; the children also of Machir the son of Manasseh were born upon Joseph's knees.
1531	1	50	24	 And Joseph said unto his brethren: 'I die; but God will surely remember you, and bring you up out of this land unto the land which He swore to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob.'
1532	1	50	25	 And Joseph took an oath of the children of Israel, saying: 'God will surely remember you, and ye shall carry up my bones from hence.'
1533	1	50	26	 So Joseph died, being a hundred and ten years old. And they embalmed him, and he was put in a coffin in Egypt.
1534	2	1	1	 NOW THESE are the names of the sons of Israel, who came into Egypt with Jacob; every man came with his household:
1535	2	1	2	 Reuben, Simeon, Levi, and Judah;
1536	2	1	3	 Issachar, Zebulun, and Benjamin;
1537	2	1	4	 Dan and Naphtali, Gad and Asher.
1538	2	1	5	 And all the souls that came out of the loins of Jacob were seventy souls; and Joseph was in Egypt already.
1539	2	1	6	 And Joseph died, and all his brethren, and all that generation.
1540	2	1	7	 And the children of Israel were fruitful, and increased abundantly, and multiplied, and waxed exceeding mighty; and the land was filled with them.
1541	2	1	8	 Now there arose a new king over Egypt, who knew not Joseph.
1542	2	1	9	 And he said unto his people: 'Behold, the people of the children of Israel are too many and too mighty for us;
1543	2	1	10	 come, let us deal wisely with them, lest they multiply, and it come to pass, that, when there befalleth us any war, they also join themselves unto our enemies, and fight against us, and get them up out of the land.'
1544	2	1	11	 Therefore they did set over them taskmasters to afflict them with their burdens. And they built for Pharaoh store-cities, Pithom and Raamses.
1545	2	1	12	 But the more they afflicted them, the more they multiplied and the more they spread abroad. And they were adread because of the children of Israel.
1546	2	1	13	 And the Egyptians made the children of Israel to serve with rigour.
1547	2	1	14	 And they made their lives bitter with hard service, in mortar and in brick, and in all manner of service in the field; in all their service, wherein they made them serve with rigour.
1548	2	1	15	 And the king of Egypt spoke to the Hebrew midwives, of whom the name of the one was Shiphrah, and the name of the other Puah;
1549	2	1	16	 and he said: 'When ye do the office of a midwife to the Hebrew women, ye shall look upon the birthstool: if it be a son, then ye shall kill him; but if it be a daughter, then she shall live.'
1550	2	1	17	 But the midwives feared God, and did not as the king of Egypt commanded them, but saved the men-children alive.
1551	2	1	18	 And the king of Egypt called for the midwives, and said unto them: 'Why have ye done this thing, and have saved the men-children alive?'
1552	2	1	19	 And the midwives said unto Pharaoh: 'Because the Hebrew women are not as the Egyptian women; for they are lively, and are delivered ere the midwife come unto them.'
1553	2	1	20	 And God dealt well with the midwives; and the people multiplied, and waxed very mighty.
1554	2	1	21	 And it came to pass, because the midwives feared God, that He made them houses.
1555	2	1	22	 And Pharaoh charged all his people, saying: 'Every son that is born ye shall cast into the river, and every daughter ye shall save alive.'
1556	2	2	1	 And there went a man of the house of Levi, and took to wife a daughter of Levi.
1557	2	2	2	 And the woman conceived, and bore a son; and when she saw him that he was a goodly child, she hid him three months.
1558	2	2	3	 And when she could not longer hide him, she took for him an ark of bulrushes, and daubed it with slime and with pitch; and she put the child therein, and laid it in the flags by the river's brink.
1559	2	2	4	 And his sister stood afar off, to know what would be done to him.
1560	2	2	5	 And the daughter of Pharaoh came down to bathe in the river; and her maidens walked along by the river-side; and she saw the ark among the flags, and sent her handmaid to fetch it.
1561	2	2	6	 And she opened it, and saw it, even the child; and behold a boy that wept. And she had compassion on him, and said: 'This is one of the Hebrews' children.'
1562	2	2	7	 Then said his sister to Pharaoh's daughter: 'Shall I go and call thee a nurse of the Hebrew women, that she may nurse the child for thee?'
1563	2	2	8	 And Pharaoh's daughter said to her: 'Go.' And the maiden went and called the child's mother.
1564	2	2	9	 And Pharaoh's daughter said unto her: 'Take this child away, and nurse it for me, and I will give thee thy wages.' And the woman took the child, and nursed it.
1565	2	2	10	 And the child grew, and she brought him unto Pharaoh's daughter, and he became her son. And she called his name Moses, and said: 'Because I drew him out of the water.'
1566	2	2	11	 And it came to pass in those days, when Moses was grown up, that he went out unto his brethren, and looked on their burdens; and he saw an Egyptian smiting a Hebrew, one of his brethren.
1567	2	2	12	 And he looked this way and that way, and when he saw that there was no man, he smote the Egyptian, and hid him in the sand.
1568	2	2	13	 And he went out the second day, and, behold, two men of the Hebrews were striving together; and he said to him that did the wrong: 'Wherefore smitest thou thy fellow?'
1569	2	2	14	 And he said: 'Who made thee a ruler and a judge over us? thinkest thou to kill me, as thou didst kill the Egyptian?' And Moses feared, and said: 'Surely the thing is known.'
1570	2	2	15	 Now when Pharaoh heard this thing, he sought to slay Moses. But Moses fled from the face of Pharaoh, and dwelt in the land of Midian; and he sat down by a well.
1571	2	2	16	 Now the priest of Midian had seven daughters; and they came and drew water, and filled the troughs to water their father's flock.
1572	2	2	17	 And the shepherds came and drove them away; but Moses stood up and helped them, and watered their flock.
1573	2	2	18	 And when they came to Reuel their father, he said: 'How is it that ye are come so soon to-day?'
1574	2	2	19	 And they said: 'An Egyptian delivered us out of the hand of the shepherds, and moreover he drew water for us, and watered the flock.'
1575	2	2	20	 And he said unto his daughters: 'And where is he? Why is it that ye have left the man? call him, that he may eat bread.'
1576	2	2	21	 And Moses was content to dwell with the man; and he gave Moses Zipporah his daughter.
1577	2	2	22	 And she bore a son, and he called his name Gershom; for he said: 'I have been a stranger in a strange land.'
1578	2	2	23	 And it came to pass in the course of those many days that the king of Egypt died; and the children of Israel sighed by reason of the bondage, and they cried, and their cry came up unto God by reason of the bondage.
1579	2	2	24	 And God heard their groaning, and God remembered His covenant with Abraham, with Isaac, and with Jacob.
1580	2	2	25	 And God saw the children of Israel, and God took cognizance of them.
1581	2	3	1	 Now Moses was keeping the flock of Jethro his father-in-law, the priest of Midian; and he led the flock to the farthest end of the wilderness, and came to the mountain of God, unto Horeb.
1582	2	3	2	 And the angel of the LORD appeared unto him in a flame of fire out of the midst of a bush; and he looked, and, behold, the bush burned with fire, and the bush was not consumed.
1583	2	3	3	 And Moses said: 'I will turn aside now, and see this great sight, why the bush is not burnt.'
1584	2	3	4	 And when the LORD saw that he turned aside to see, God called unto him out of the midst of the bush, and said: 'Moses, Moses.' And he said: 'Here am I.'
1585	2	3	5	 And He said: 'Draw not nigh hither; put off thy shoes from off thy feet, for the place whereon thou standest is holy ground.'
1586	2	3	6	 Moreover He said: 'I am the God of thy father, the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob.' And Moses hid his face; for he was afraid to look upon God.
1587	2	3	7	 And the LORD said: 'I have surely seen the affliction of My people that are in Egypt, and have heard their cry by reason of their taskmasters; for I know their pains;
1588	2	3	8	 and I am come down to deliver them out of the hand of the Egyptians, and to bring them up out of that land unto a good land and a large, unto a land flowing with milk and honey; unto the place of the Canaanite, and the Hittite, and the Amorite, and the Perizzite, and the Hivite, and the Jebusite.
1589	2	3	9	 And now, behold, the cry of the children of Israel is come unto Me; moreover I have seen the oppression wherewith the Egyptians oppress them.

1657	2	6	1	 And the LORD said unto Moses: 'Now shalt thou see what I will do to Pharaoh; for by a strong hand shall he let them go, and by a strong hand shall he drive them out of his land.'
1658	2	6	2	 And God spoke unto Moses, and said unto him: 'I am the LORD;
1659	2	6	3	 and I appeared unto Abraham, unto Isaac, and unto Jacob, as God Almighty, but by My name Yud-Kay-Vav-Kay* I made Me not known to them. [*"Yud-Kay-Vav-Kay" is the Yiddish circumlocution for the spelling of the tetragrammaton. In this verse, the original Jewish Publication Society text uses the Hebrew letters that correspond to the actual spelling of the name.]
1660	2	6	4	 And I have also established My covenant with them, to give them the land of Canaan, the land of their sojournings, wherein they sojourned.

1663	2	6	7	 and I will take you to Me for a people, and I will be to you a God; and ye shall know that I am the LORD your God, who brought you out from under the burdens of the Egyptians.

1665	2	6	9	 And Moses spoke so unto the children of Israel; but they hearkened not unto Moses for impatience of spirit, and for cruel bondage.

1669	2	6	13	 And the LORD spoke unto Moses and unto Aaron, and gave them a charge unto the children of Israel, and unto Pharaoh king of Egypt, to bring the children of Israel out of the land of Egypt.

1675	2	6	19	 And the sons of Merari: Mahli and Mushi. These are the families of the Levites according to their generations.
1676	2	6	20	 And Amram took him Jochebed his father's sister to wife; and she bore him Aaron and Moses. And the years of the life of Amram were a hundred and thirty and seven years.
1677	2	6	21	 And the sons of Izhar: Korah, and Nepheg, and Zichri.
1678	2	6	22	 And the sons of Uzziel: Mishael, and Elzaphan, and Sithri.
1679	2	6	23	 And Aaron took him Elisheba, the daughter of Amminadab, the sister of Nahshon, to wife; and she bore him Nadab and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar.
1680	2	6	24	 And the sons of Korah: Assir, and Elkanah, and Abiasaph; these are the families of the Korahites.
1681	2	6	25	 And Eleazar Aaron's son took him one of the daughters of Putiel to wife; and she bore him Phinehas. These are the heads of the fathers' houses of the Levites according to their families.
1682	2	6	26	 These are that Aaron and Moses, to whom the LORD said: 'Bring out the children of Israel from the land of Egypt according to their hosts.'
1683	2	6	27	 These are they that spoke to Pharaoh king of Egypt, to bring out the children of Israel from Egypt. These are that Moses and Aaron.
1684	2	6	28	 And it came to pass on the day when the LORD spoke unto Moses in the land of Egypt,
1685	2	6	29	 that the LORD spoke unto Moses, saying: 'I am the LORD; speak thou unto Pharaoh king of Egypt all that I speak unto thee.'
1686	2	6	30	 And Moses said before the LORD: 'Behold, I am of uncircumcised lips, and how shall Pharaoh hearken unto me?'
1687	2	7	1	 And the LORD said unto Moses: 'See, I have set thee in God's stead to Pharaoh; and Aaron thy brother shall be thy prophet.
1688	2	7	2	 Thou shalt speak all that I command thee; and Aaron thy brother shall speak unto Pharaoh, that he let the children of Israel go out of his land.
1689	2	7	3	 And I will harden Pharaoh's heart, and multiply My signs and My wonders in the land of Egypt.
1690	2	7	4	 But Pharaoh will not hearken unto you, and I will lay My hand upon Egypt, and bring forth My hosts, My people the children of Israel, out of the land of Egypt, by great judgments.
1691	2	7	5	 And the Egyptians shall know that I am the LORD, when I stretch forth My hand upon Egypt, and bring out the children of Israel from among them.'
1692	2	7	6	 And Moses and Aaron did so; as the LORD commanded them, so did they.
1693	2	7	7	 And Moses was fourscore years old, and Aaron fourscore and three years old, when they spoke unto Pharaoh.
1694	2	7	8	 And the LORD spoke unto Moses and unto Aaron, saying:
1695	2	7	9	 'When Pharaoh shall speak unto you, saying: Show a wonder for you; then thou shalt say unto Aaron: Take thy rod, and cast it down before Pharaoh, that it become a serpent.'
1696	2	7	10	 And Moses and Aaron went in unto Pharaoh, and they did so, as the LORD had commanded; and Aaron cast down his rod before Pharaoh and before his servants, and it became a serpent.
1697	2	7	11	 Then Pharaoh also called for the wise men and the sorcerers; and they also, the magicians of Egypt, did in like manner with their secret arts.
1698	2	7	12	 For they cast down every man his rod, and they became serpents; but Aaron's rod swallowed up their rods.
1699	2	7	13	 And Pharaoh's heart was hardened, and he hearkened not unto them; as the LORD had spoken.
1700	2	7	14	 And the LORD said unto Moses: 'Pharaoh's heart is stubborn, he refuseth to let the people go.
1701	2	7	15	 Get thee unto Pharaoh in the morning; lo, he goeth out unto the water; and thou shalt stand by the river's brink to meet him; and the rod which was turned to a serpent shalt thou take in thy hand.
1702	2	7	16	 And thou shalt say unto him: The LORD, the God of the Hebrews, hath sent me unto thee, saying: Let My people go, that they may serve Me in the wilderness; and, behold, hitherto thou hast not hearkened;
1703	2	7	17	 thus saith the LORD: In this thou shalt know that I am the LORD--behold, I will smite with the rod that is in my hand upon the waters which are in the river, and they shall be turned to blood.
1704	2	7	18	 And the fish that are in the river shall die, and the river shall become foul; and the Egyptians shall loathe to drink water from the river.'
1705	2	7	19	 And the LORD said unto Moses: 'Say unto Aaron: Take thy rod, and stretch out thy hand over the waters of Egypt, over their rivers, over their streams, and over their pools, and over all their ponds of water, that they may become blood; and there shall be blood throughout all the land of Egypt, both in vessels of wood and in vessels of stone.'
1706	2	7	20	 And Moses and Aaron did so, as the LORD commanded; and he lifted up the rod, and smote the waters that were in the river, in the sight of Pharaoh, and in the sight of his servants; and all the waters that were in the river were turned to blood.
1707	2	7	21	 And the fish that were in the river died; and the river became foul, and the Egyptians could not drink water from the river; and the blood was throughout all the land of Egypt.
1708	2	7	22	 And the magicians of Egypt did in like manner with their secret arts; and Pharaoh's heart was hardened, and he hearkened not unto them; as the LORD had spoken.
1709	2	7	23	 And Pharaoh turned and went into his house, neither did he lay even this to heart.
1710	2	7	24	 And all the Egyptians digged round about the river for water to drink; for they could not drink of the water of the river.
1711	2	7	25	 And seven days were fulfilled, after that the LORD had smitten the river.
1712	2	8	1	 (7:26) And the LORD spoke unto Moses: 'Go in unto Pharaoh, and say unto him: Thus saith the LORD: Let My people go, that they may serve Me.
1713	2	8	2	 (7:27) And if thou refuse to let them go, behold, I will smite all thy borders with frogs.
1714	2	8	3	 (7:28) And the river shall swarm with frogs, which shall go up and come into thy house, and into thy bed-chamber, and upon thy bed, and into the house of thy servants, and upon thy people, and into thine ovens, and into thy kneading-troughs.
1715	2	8	4	 (7:29) And the frogs shall come up both upon thee, and upon thy people, and upon all thy servants.'
1716	2	8	5	 (8:1) And the LORD said unto Moses: 'Say unto Aaron: Stretch forth thy hand with thy rod over the rivers, over the canals, and over the pools, and cause frogs to come up upon the land of Egypt.'
1717	2	8	6	 (8:2) And Aaron stretched out his hand over the waters of Egypt; and the frogs came up, and covered the land of Egypt.
1718	2	8	7	 (8:3) And the magicians did in like manner with their secret arts, and brought up frogs upon the land of Egypt.
1719	2	8	8	 (8:4) Then Pharaoh called for Moses and Aaron, and said: 'Entreat the LORD, that He take away the frogs from me, and from my people; and I will let the people go, that they may sacrifice unto the LORD.'
1720	2	8	9	 (8:5) And Moses said unto Pharaoh: 'Have thou this glory over me; against what time shall I entreat for thee, and for thy servants, and for thy people, that the frogs be destroyed from thee and thy houses, and remain in the river only?'
1721	2	8	10	 (8:6) And he said: 'Against to-morrow.' And he said: 'Be it according to thy word; that thou mayest know that there is none like unto the LORD our God.
1722	2	8	11	 (8:7) And the frogs shall depart from thee, and from thy houses, and from thy servants, and from thy people; they shall remain in the river only.'
1723	2	8	12	 (8:8) And Moses and Aaron went out from Pharaoh; and Moses cried unto the LORD concerning the frogs, which He had brought upon Pharaoh.
1724	2	8	13	 (8:9) And the LORD did according to the word of Moses; and the frogs died out of the houses, out of the courts, and out of the fields.
1725	2	8	14	 (8:10) And they gathered them together in heaps; and the land stank.
1726	2	8	15	 (8:11) But when Pharaoh saw that there was respite, he hardened his heart, and hearkened not unto them; as the LORD had spoken.
1727	2	8	16	 (8:12) And the LORD said unto Moses: 'Say unto Aaron: Stretch out thy rod, and smite the dust of the earth, that it may become gnats throughout all the land of Egypt.'
1728	2	8	17	 (8:13) And they did so; and Aaron stretched out his hand with his rod, and smote the dust of the earth, and there were gnats upon man, and upon beast; all the dust of the earth became gnats throughout all the land of Egypt.
1729	2	8	18	 (8:14) And the magicians did so with their secret arts to bring forth gnats, but they could not; and there were gnats upon man, and upon beast.
1730	2	8	19	 (8:15) Then the magicians said unto Pharaoh: 'This is the finger of God'; and Pharaoh's heart was hardened, and he hearkened not unto them; as the LORD had spoken.
1731	2	8	20	 (8:16) And the LORD said unto Moses: 'Rise up early in the morning, and stand before Pharaoh; lo, he cometh forth to the water; and say unto him: Thus saith the LORD: Let My people go, that they may serve Me.
1732	2	8	21	 (8:17) Else, if thou wilt not let My people go, behold, I will send swarms of flies upon thee, and upon thy servants, and upon thy people, and into thy houses; and the houses of the Egyptians shall be full of swarms of flies, and also the ground whereon they are.
1733	2	8	22	 (8:18) And I will set apart in that day the land of Goshen, in which My people dwell, that no swarms of flies shall be there; to the end that thou mayest know that I am the LORD in the midst of the earth.
1734	2	8	23	 (8:19) And I will put a division between My people and thy people--by to-morrow shall this sign be.'
1735	2	8	24	 (8:20) And the LORD did so; and there came grievous swarms of flies into the house of Pharaoh, and into his servants' houses; and in all the land of Egypt the land was ruined by reason of the swarms of flies.
1736	2	8	25	 (8:21) And Pharaoh called for Moses and for Aaron, and said: 'Go ye, sacrifice to your God in the land.'
1737	2	8	26	 (8:22) And Moses said: 'It is not meet so to do; for we shall sacrifice the abomination of the Egyptians to the LORD our God; lo, if we sacrifice the abomination of the Egyptians before their eyes, will they not stone us?
1738	2	8	27	 (8:23) We will go three days' journey into the wilderness, and sacrifice to the LORD our God, as He shall command us.'
1739	2	8	28	 (8:24) And Pharaoh said: 'I will let you go, that ye may sacrifice to the LORD your God in the wilderness; only ye shall not go very far away; entreat for me.'
1740	2	8	29	 (8:25) And Moses said: 'Behold, I go out from thee, and I will entreat the LORD that the swarms of flies may depart from Pharaoh, from his servants, and from his people, tomorrow; only let not Pharaoh deal deceitfully any more in not letting the people go to sacrifice to the LORD.'
1741	2	8	30	 (8:26) And Moses went out from Pharaoh, and entreated the LORD.
1742	2	8	31	 (8:27) And the LORD did according to the word of Moses; and He removed the swarms of flies from Pharaoh, from his servants, and from his people; there remained not one.
1743	2	8	32	 (8:28) And Pharaoh hardened his heart this time also, and he did not let the people go.
1744	2	9	1	 Then the LORD said unto Moses: 'Go in unto Pharaoh, and tell him: Thus saith the LORD, the God of the Hebrews: Let My people go, that they may serve Me.
1745	2	9	2	 For if thou refuse to let them go, and wilt hold them still,
1746	2	9	3	 behold, the hand of the LORD is upon thy cattle which are in the field, upon the horses, upon the asses, upon the camels, upon the herds, and upon the flocks; there shall be a very grievous murrain.
1747	2	9	4	 And the LORD shall make a division between the cattle of Israel and the cattle of Egypt; and there shall nothing die of all that belongeth to the children of Israel.'
1748	2	9	5	 And the LORD appointed a set time, saying: 'Tomorrow the LORD shall do this thing in the land.'
1749	2	9	6	 And the LORD did that thing on the morrow, and all the cattle of Egypt died; but of the cattle of the children of Israel died not one.
1750	2	9	7	 And Pharaoh sent, and, behold, there was not so much as one of the cattle of the Israelites dead. But the heart of Pharaoh was stubborn, and he did not let the people go.
1751	2	9	8	 And the LORD said unto Moses and unto Aaron: 'Take to you handfuls of soot of the furnace, and let Moses throw it heavenward in the sight of Pharaoh.
1752	2	9	9	 And it shall become small dust over all the land of Egypt, and shall be a boil breaking forth with blains upon man and upon beast, throughout all the land of Egypt.'
1753	2	9	10	 And they took soot of the furnace, and stood before Pharaoh; and Moses threw it up heavenward; and it became a boil breaking forth with blains upon man and upon beast.
1754	2	9	11	 And the magicians could not stand before Moses because of the boils; for the boils were upon the magicians, and upon all the Egyptians.
1755	2	9	12	 And the LORD hardened the heart of Pharaoh, and he hearkened not unto them; as the LORD had spoken unto Moses.
1756	2	9	13	 And the LORD said unto Moses: 'Rise up early in the morning, and stand before Pharaoh, and say unto him: Thus saith the LORD, the God of the Hebrews: Let My people go, that they may serve Me.
1757	2	9	14	 For I will this time send all My plagues upon thy person, and upon thy servants, and upon thy people; that thou mayest know that there is none like Me in all the earth.
1758	2	9	15	 Surely now I had put forth My hand, and smitten thee and thy people with pestilence, and thou hadst been cut off from the earth.
1759	2	9	16	 But in very deed for this cause have I made thee to stand, to show thee My power, and that My name may be declared throughout all the earth.
1760	2	9	17	 As yet exaltest thou thyself against My people, that thou wilt not let them go?
1761	2	9	18	 Behold, tomorrow about this time I will cause it to rain a very grievous hail, such as hath not been in Egypt since the day it was founded even until now.
1762	2	9	19	 Now therefore send, hasten in thy cattle and all that thou hast in the field; for every man and beast that shall be found in the field, and shall not be brought home, the hail shall come down upon them, and they shall die.'
1763	2	9	20	 He that feared the word of the LORD among the servants of Pharaoh made his servants and his cattle flee into the houses;
1764	2	9	21	 and he that regarded not the word of the LORD left his servants and his cattle in the field.
1765	2	9	22	 And the LORD said unto Moses: 'Stretch forth thy hand toward heaven, that there may be hail in all the land of Egypt, upon man, and upon beast, and upon every herb of the field, throughout the land of Egypt.'
1766	2	9	23	 And Moses stretched forth his rod toward heaven; and the LORD sent thunder and hail, and fire ran down unto the earth; and the LORD caused to hail upon the land of Egypt.
1767	2	9	24	 So there was hail, and fire flashing up amidst the hail, very grievous, such as had not been in all the land of Egypt since it became a nation.
1768	2	9	25	 And the hail smote throughout all the land of Egypt all that was in the field, both man and beast; and the hail smote every herb of the field, and broke every tree of the field.
1769	2	9	26	 Only in the land of Goshen, where the children of Israel were, was there no hail.
1770	2	9	27	 And Pharaoh sent, and called for Moses and Aaron, and said unto them: 'I have sinned this time; the LORD is righteous, and I and my people are wicked.
1771	2	9	28	 Entreat the LORD, and let there be enough of these mighty thunderings and hail; and I will let you go, and ye shall stay no longer.'
1772	2	9	29	 And Moses said unto him: 'As soon as I am gone out of the city, I will spread forth my hands unto the LORD; the thunders shall cease, neither shall there be any more hail; that thou mayest know that the earth is the LORD'S.
1773	2	9	30	 But as for thee and thy servants, I know that ye will not yet fear the LORD God.'--
1774	2	9	31	 And the flax and the barley were smitten; for the barley was in the ear, and the flax was in bloom.
1775	2	9	32	 But the wheat and the spelt were not smitten; for they ripen late.--
1776	2	9	33	 And Moses went out of the city from Pharaoh, and spread forth his hands unto the LORD; and the thunders and hail ceased, and the rain was not poured upon the earth.
1777	2	9	34	 And when Pharaoh saw that the rain and the hail and the thunders were ceased, he sinned yet more, and hardened his heart, he and his servants.
1778	2	9	35	 And the heart of Pharaoh was hardened, and he did not let the children of Israel go; as the LORD had spoken by Moses.
1779	2	10	1	 And the LORD said unto Moses: 'Go in unto Pharaoh; for I have hardened his heart, and the heart of his servants, that I might show these My signs in the midst of them;
1780	2	10	2	 and that thou mayest tell in the ears of thy son, and of thy son's son, what I have wrought upon Egypt, and My signs which I have done among them; that ye may know that I am the LORD.'
1781	2	10	3	 And Moses and Aaron went in unto Pharaoh, and said unto him: 'Thus saith the LORD, the God of the Hebrews: How long wilt thou refuse to humble thyself before Me? let My people go, that they may serve Me.
1782	2	10	4	 Else, if thou refuse to let My people go, behold, to-morrow will I bring locusts into thy border;
1783	2	10	5	 and they shall cover the face of the earth, that one shall not be able to see the earth; and they shall eat the residue of that which is escaped, which remaineth unto you from the hail, and shall eat every tree which groweth for you out of the field;
1784	2	10	6	 and thy houses shall be filled, and the houses of all thy servants, and the houses of all the Egyptians; as neither thy fathers nor thy fathers' fathers have seen, since the day that they were upon the earth unto this day.' And he turned, and went out from Pharaoh.
1785	2	10	7	 And Pharaoh's servants said unto him: 'How long shall this man be a snare unto us? let the men go, that they may serve the LORD their God, knowest thou not yet that Egypt is destroyed?'
1786	2	10	8	 And Moses and Aaron were brought again unto Pharaoh; and he said unto them: 'Go, serve the LORD your God; but who are they that shall go?'
1787	2	10	9	 And Moses said: 'We will go with our young and with our old, with our sons and with our daughters, with our flocks and with our herds we will go; for we must hold a feast unto the LORD.'
1788	2	10	10	 And he said unto them: 'So be the LORD with you, as I will let you go, and your little ones; see ye that evil is before your face.
1789	2	10	11	 Not so; go now ye that are men, and serve the LORD; for that is what ye desire.' And they were driven out from Pharaoh's presence.
1790	2	10	12	 And the LORD said unto Moses: 'Stretch out thy hand over the land of Egypt for the locusts, that they may come up upon the land of Egypt, and eat every herb of the land, even all that the hail hath left.'
1791	2	10	13	 And Moses stretched forth his rod over the land of Egypt, and the LORD brought an east wind upon the land all that day, and all the night; and when it was morning, the east wind brought the locusts.
1792	2	10	14	 And the locusts went up over all the land of Egypt, and rested in all the borders of Egypt; very grievous were they; before them there were no such locusts as they, neither after them shall be such.
1793	2	10	15	 For they covered the face of the whole earth, so that the land was darkened; and they did eat every herb of the land, and all the fruit of the trees which the hail had left; and there remained not any green thing, either tree or herb of the field, through all the land of Egypt.
1794	2	10	16	 Then Pharaoh called for Moses and Aaron in haste; and he said: 'I have sinned against the LORD your God, and against you.
1795	2	10	17	 Now therefore forgive, I pray thee, my sin only this once, and entreat the LORD your God, that He may take away from me this death only.'
1796	2	10	18	 And he went out from Pharaoh, and entreated the LORD.
1797	2	10	19	 And the LORD turned an exceeding strong west wind, which took up the locusts, and drove them into the Red Sea; there remained not one locust in all the border of Egypt.
1798	2	10	20	 But the LORD hardened Pharaoh's heart, and he did not let the children of Israel go.
1799	2	10	21	 And the LORD said unto Moses: 'Stretch out thy hand toward heaven, that there may be darkness over the land of Egypt, even darkness which may be felt.'
1800	2	10	22	 And Moses stretched forth his hand toward heaven; and there was a thick darkness in all the land of Egypt three days;
1801	2	10	23	 they saw not one another, neither rose any from his place for three days; but all the children of Israel had light in their dwellings.
1802	2	10	24	 And Pharaoh called unto Moses, and said: 'Go ye, serve the LORD; only let your flocks and your herds be stayed; let your little ones also go with you.'
1803	2	10	25	 And Moses said: 'Thou must also give into our hand sacrifices and burnt-offerings, that we may sacrifice unto the LORD our God.
1804	2	10	26	 Our cattle also shall go with us; there shall not a hoof be left behind; for thereof must we take to serve the LORD our God; and we know not with what we must serve the LORD, until we come thither.'
1805	2	10	27	 But the LORD hardened Pharaoh's heart, and he would not let them go.

1807	2	10	29	 And Moses said: 'Thou hast spoken well; I will see thy face again no more.'
1808	2	11	1	 And the LORD said unto Moses: 'Yet one plague more will I bring upon Pharaoh, and upon Egypt; afterwards he will let you go hence; when he shall let you go, he shall surely thrust you out hence altogether.
1809	2	11	2	 Speak now in the ears of the people, and let them ask every man of his neighbour, and every woman of her neighbour, jewels of silver, and jewels of gold.'
1810	2	11	3	 And the LORD gave the people favour in the sight of the Egyptians. Moreover the man Moses was very great in the land of Egypt, in the sight of Pharaoh's servants, and in the sight of the people.
1811	2	11	4	 And Moses said: 'Thus saith the LORD: About midnight will I go out into the midst of Egypt;
1812	2	11	5	 and all the first-born in the land of Egypt shall die, from the first-born of Pharaoh that sitteth upon his throne, even unto the first-born of the maid-servant that is behind the mill; and all the first-born of cattle.
1813	2	11	6	 And there shall be a great cry throughout all the land of Egypt, such as there hath been none like it, nor shall be like it any more.
1814	2	11	7	 But against any of the children of Israel shall not a dog whet his tongue, against man or beast; that ye may know how that the LORD doth put a difference between the Egyptians and Israel.

1816	2	11	9	 And the LORD said unto Moses: 'Pharaoh will not hearken unto you; that My wonders may be multiplied in the land of Egypt.'
1817	2	11	10	 And Moses and Aaron did all these wonders before Pharaoh; and the LORD hardened Pharaoh's heart, and he did not let the children of Israel go out of his land.
1818	2	12	1	 And the LORD spoke unto Moses and Aaron in the land of Egypt, saying:
1819	2	12	2	 'This month shall be unto you the beginning of months; it shall be the first month of the year to you.
1820	2	12	3	 Speak ye unto all the congregation of Israel, saying: In the tenth day of this month they shall take to them every man a lamb, according to their fathers' houses, a lamb for a household;
1821	2	12	4	 and if the household be too little for a lamb, then shall he and his neighbour next unto his house take one according to the number of the souls; according to every man's eating ye shall make your count for the lamb.
1822	2	12	5	 Your lamb shall be without blemish, a male of the first year; ye shall take it from the sheep, or from the goats;
1823	2	12	6	 and ye shall keep it unto the fourteenth day of the same month; and the whole assembly of the congregation of Israel shall kill it at dusk.
1824	2	12	7	 And they shall take of the blood, and put it on the two side-posts and on the lintel, upon the houses wherein they shall eat it.
1825	2	12	8	 And they shall eat the flesh in that night, roast with fire, and unleavened bread; with bitter herbs they shall eat it.
1826	2	12	9	 Eat not of it raw, nor sodden at all with water, but roast with fire; its head with its legs and with the inwards thereof.
1827	2	12	10	 And ye shall let nothing of it remain until the morning; but that which remaineth of it until the morning ye shall burn with fire.
1828	2	12	11	 And thus shall ye eat it: with your loins girded, your shoes on your feet, and your staff in your hand; and ye shall eat it in haste--it is the LORD'S passover.
1829	2	12	12	 For I will go through the land of Egypt in that night, and will smite all the first-born in the land of Egypt, both man and beast; and against all the gods of Egypt I will execute judgments: I am the LORD.
1830	2	12	13	 And the blood shall be to you for a token upon the houses where ye are; and when I see the blood, I will pass over you, and there shall no plague be upon you to destroy you, when I smite the land of Egypt.
1831	2	12	14	 And this day shall be unto you for a memorial, and ye shall keep it a feast to the LORD; throughout your generations ye shall keep it a feast by an ordinance for ever.
1832	2	12	15	 Seven days shall ye eat unleavened bread; howbeit the first day ye shall put away leaven out of your houses; for whosoever eateth leavened bread from the first day until the seventh day, that soul shall be cut off from Israel.
1833	2	12	16	 And in the first day there shall be to you a holy convocation, and in the seventh day a holy convocation; no manner of work shall be done in them, save that which every man must eat, that only may be done by you.
1834	2	12	17	 And ye shall observe the feast of unleavened bread; for in this selfsame day have I brought your hosts out of the land of Egypt; therefore shall ye observe this day throughout your generations by an ordinance for ever.
1835	2	12	18	 In the first month, on the fourteenth day of the month at even, ye shall eat unleavened bread, until the one and twentieth day of the month at even.
1836	2	12	19	 Seven days shall there be no leaven found in your houses; for whosoever eateth that which is leavened, that soul shall be cut off from the congregation of Israel, whether he be a sojourner, or one that is born in the land.
1837	2	12	20	 Ye shall eat nothing leavened; in all your habitations shall ye eat unleavened bread.'
1838	2	12	21	 Then Moses called for all the elders of Israel, and said unto them: 'Draw out, and take you lambs according to your families, and kill the passover lamb.
1839	2	12	22	 And ye shall take a bunch of hyssop, and dip it in the blood that is in the basin, and strike the lintel and the two side-posts with the blood that is in the basin; and none of you shall go out of the door of his house until the morning.
1840	2	12	23	 For the LORD will pass through to smite the Egyptians; and when He seeth the blood upon the lintel, and on the two side-posts, the LORD will pass over the door, and will not suffer the destroyer to come in unto your houses to smite you.
1841	2	12	24	 And ye shall observe this thing for an ordinance to thee and to thy sons for ever.
1842	2	12	25	 And it shall come to pass, when ye be come to the land which the LORD will give you, according as He hath promised, that ye shall keep this service.
1843	2	12	26	 And it shall come to pass, when your children shall say unto you: What mean ye by this service?
1844	2	12	27	 that ye shall say: It is the sacrifice of the LORD'S passover, for that He passed over the houses of the children of Israel in Egypt, when He smote the Egyptians, and delivered our houses.' And the people bowed the head and worshipped.
1845	2	12	28	 And the children of Israel went and did so; as the LORD had commanded Moses and Aaron, so did they.
1846	2	12	29	 And it came to pass at midnight, that the LORD smote all the firstborn in the land of Egypt, from the first-born of Pharaoh that sat on his throne unto the first-born of the captive that was in the dungeon; and all the first-born of cattle.
1847	2	12	30	 And Pharaoh rose up in the night, he, and all his servants, and all the Egyptians; and there was a great cry in Egypt; for there was not a house where there was not one dead.
1848	2	12	31	 And he called for Moses and Aaron by night and said: 'Rise up, get you forth from among my people, both ye and the children of Israel; and go, serve the LORD, as ye have said.
1849	2	12	32	 Take both your flocks and your herds, as ye have said, and be gone; and bless me also.'
1850	2	12	33	 And the Egyptians were urgent upon the people, to send them out of the land in haste; for they said: 'We are all dead men.'
1851	2	12	34	 And the people took their dough before it was leavened, their kneading-troughs being bound up in their clothes upon their shoulders.
1852	2	12	35	 And the children of Israel did according to the word of Moses; and they asked of the Egyptians jewels of silver, and jewels of gold, and raiment.
1853	2	12	36	 And the LORD gave the people favour in the sight of the Egyptians, so that they let them have what they asked. And they despoiled the Egyptians.
1854	2	12	37	 And the children of Israel journeyed from Rameses to Succoth, about six hundred thousand men on foot, beside children.
1855	2	12	38	 And a mixed multitude went up also with them; and flocks, and herds, even very much cattle.
1856	2	12	39	 And they baked unleavened cakes of the dough which they brought forth out of Egypt, for it was not leavened; because they were thrust out of Egypt, and could not tarry, neither had they prepared for themselves any victual.
1857	2	12	40	 Now the time that the children of Israel dwelt in Egypt was four hundred and thirty years.
1858	2	12	41	 And it came to pass at the end of four hundred and thirty years, even the selfsame day it came to pass, that all the host of the LORD went out from the land of Egypt.
1859	2	12	42	 It was a night of watching unto the LORD for bringing them out from the land of Egypt; this same night is a night of watching unto the LORD for all the children of Israel throughout their generations.
1860	2	12	43	 And the LORD said unto Moses and Aaron: 'This is the ordinance of the passover: there shall no alien eat thereof;
1861	2	12	44	 but every man's servant that is bought for money, when thou hast circumcised him, then shall he eat thereof.
1862	2	12	45	 A sojourner and a hired servant shall not eat thereof.
1863	2	12	46	 In one house shall it be eaten; thou shalt not carry forth aught of the flesh abroad out of the house; neither shall ye break a bone thereof.
1864	2	12	47	 All the congregation of Israel shall keep it.
1865	2	12	48	 And when a stranger shall sojourn with thee, and will keep the passover to the LORD, let all his males be circumcised, and then let him come near and keep it; and he shall be as one that is born in the land; but no uncircumcised person shall eat thereof.
1866	2	12	49	 One law shall be to him that is homeborn, and unto the stranger that sojourneth among you.'
1867	2	12	50	 Thus did all the children of Israel; as the LORD commanded Moses and Aaron, so did they.
1868	2	12	51	 And it came to pass the selfsame day that the LORD did bring the children of Israel out of the land of Egypt by their hosts.
1869	2	13	1	 And the LORD spoke unto Moses, saying:
1870	2	13	2	 'Sanctify unto Me all the first-born, whatsoever openeth the womb among the children of Israel, both of man and of beast, it is Mine.'
1871	2	13	3	 And Moses said unto the people: 'Remember this day, in which ye came out from Egypt, out of the house of bondage; for by strength of hand the LORD brought you out from this place; there shall no leavened bread be eaten.
1872	2	13	4	 This day ye go forth in the month Abib.
1873	2	13	5	 And it shall be when the LORD shall bring thee into the land of the Canaanite, and the Hittite, and the Amorite, and the Hivite, and the Jebusite, which He swore unto thy fathers to give thee, a land flowing with milk and honey, that thou shalt keep this service in this month.
1874	2	13	6	 Seven days thou shalt eat unleavened bread, and in the seventh day shall be a feast to the LORD.
1875	2	13	7	 Unleavened bread shall be eaten throughout the seven days; and there shall no leavened bread be seen with thee, neither shall there be leaven seen with thee, in all thy borders.
1876	2	13	8	 And thou shalt tell thy son in that day, saying: It is because of that which the LORD did for me when I came forth out of Egypt.
1877	2	13	9	 And it shall be for a sign unto thee upon thy hand, and for a memorial between thine eyes, that the law of the LORD may be in thy mouth; for with a strong hand hath the LORD brought thee out of Egypt.
1878	2	13	10	 Thou shalt therefore keep this ordinance in its season from year to year.
1879	2	13	11	 And it shall be when the LORD shall bring thee into the land of the Canaanite, as He swore unto thee and to thy fathers, and shall give it thee,
1880	2	13	12	 that thou shalt set apart unto the LORD all that openeth the womb; every firstling that is a male, which thou hast coming of a beast, shall be the LORD'S.
1881	2	13	13	 And every firstling of an ass thou shalt redeem with a lamb; and if thou wilt not redeem it, then thou shalt break its neck; and all the first-born of man among thy sons shalt thou redeem.
1882	2	13	14	 And it shall be when thy son asketh thee in time to come, saying: What is this? that thou shalt say unto him: By strength of hand the LORD brought us out from Egypt, from the house of bondage;
1883	2	13	15	 and it came to pass, when Pharaoh would hardly let us go that the LORD slew all the firstborn in the land of Egypt, both the first-born of man, and the first-born of beast; therefore I sacrifice to the LORD all that openeth the womb, being males; but all the first-born of my sons I redeem.
1884	2	13	16	 And it shall be for a sign upon thy hand, and for frontlets between thine eyes; for by strength of hand the LORD brought us forth out of Egypt.'
1885	2	13	17	 And it came to pass, when Pharaoh had let the people go, that God led them not by the way of the land of the Philistines, although that was near; for God said: 'Lest peradventure the people repent when they see war, and they return to Egypt.'
1886	2	13	18	 But God led the people about, by the way of the wilderness by the Red Sea; and the children of Israel went up armed out of the land of Egypt.

1890	2	13	22	 the pillar of cloud by day, and the pillar of fire by night, departed not from before the people.
1891	2	14	1	 And the LORD spoke unto Moses, saying:

1921	2	14	31	 And Israel saw the great work which the LORD did upon the Egyptians, and the people feared the LORD; and they believed in the LORD, and in His servant Moses.
1922	2	15	1	 Then sang Moses and the children of Israel this song unto the LORD, and spoke, saying: I will sing unto the LORD, for He is highly exalted; the horse and his rider hath He thrown into the sea.
1923	2	15	2	 The LORD is my strength and song, and He is become my salvation; this is my God, and I will glorify Him; my father's God, and I will exalt Him.

1925	2	15	4	 Pharaoh's chariots and his host hath He cast into the sea, and his chosen captains are sunk in the Red Sea.

1931	2	15	10	 Thou didst blow with Thy wind, the sea covered them; they sank as lead in the mighty waters.

1934	2	15	13	 Thou in Thy love hast led the people that Thou hast redeemed; Thou hast guided them in Thy strength to Thy holy habitation.
1935	2	15	14	 The peoples have heard, they tremble; pangs have taken hold on the inhabitants of Philistia.
1936	2	15	15	 Then were the chiefs of Edom affrighted; the mighty men of Moab, trembling taketh hold upon them; all the inhabitants of Canaan are melted away.

1949	2	16	1	 And they took their journey from Elim, and all the congregation of the children of Israel came unto the wilderness of Sin, which is between Elim and Sinai, on the fifteenth day of the second month after their departing out of the land of Egypt.
1950	2	16	2	 And the whole congregation of the children of Israel murmured against Moses and against Aaron in the wilderness;
1951	2	16	3	 and the children of Israel said unto them: 'Would that we had died by the hand of the LORD in the land of Egypt, when we sat by the flesh-pots, when we did eat bread to the full; for ye have brought us forth into this wilderness, to kill this whole assembly with hunger.'
1952	2	16	4	 Then said the LORD unto Moses: 'Behold, I will cause to rain bread from heaven for you; and the people shall go out and gather a day's portion every day, that I may prove them, whether they will walk in My law, or not.
1953	2	16	5	 And it shall come to pass on the sixth day that they shall prepare that which they bring in, and it shall be twice as much as they gather daily.'

1955	2	16	7	 and in the morning, then ye shall see the glory of the LORD; for that He hath heard your murmurings against the LORD; and what are we, that ye murmur against us?'
1956	2	16	8	 And Moses said: 'This shall be, when the LORD shall give you in the evening flesh to eat, and in the morning bread to the full; for that the LORD heareth your murmurings which ye murmur against Him; and what are we? your murmurings are not against us, but against the LORD.'
1957	2	16	9	 And Moses said unto Aaron: 'Say unto all the congregation of the children of Israel: Come near before the LORD; for He hath heard your murmurings.'
1958	2	16	10	 And it came to pass, as Aaron spoke unto the whole congregation of the children of Israel, that they looked toward the wilderness, and, behold, the glory of the LORD appeared in the cloud.
1959	2	16	11	 And the LORD spoke unto Moses, saying:
1960	2	16	12	 'I have heard the murmurings of the children of Israel. Speak unto them, saying: At dusk ye shall eat flesh, and in the morning ye shall be filled with bread; and ye shall know that I am the LORD your God.'
1961	2	16	13	 And it came to pass at even, that the quails came up, and covered the camp; and in the morning there was a layer of dew round about the camp.
1962	2	16	14	 And when the layer of dew was gone up, behold upon the face of the wilderness a fine, scale-like thing, fine as the hoar-frost on the ground.
1963	2	16	15	 And when the children of Israel saw it, they said one to another: 'What is it?' --for they knew not what it was. And Moses said unto them: 'It is the bread which the LORD hath given you to eat.
1964	2	16	16	 This is the thing which the LORD hath commanded: Gather ye of it every man according to his eating; an omer a head, according to the number of your persons, shall ye take it, every man for them that are in his tent.'
1965	2	16	17	 And the children of Israel did so, and gathered some more, some less.
1966	2	16	18	 And when they did mete it with an omer, he that gathered much had nothing over, and he that gathered little had no lack; they gathered every man according to his eating.
1967	2	16	19	 And Moses said unto them: 'Let no man leave of it till the morning.'
1968	2	16	20	 Notwithstanding they hearkened not unto Moses; but some of them left of it until the morning, and it bred worms, and rotted; and Moses was wroth with them.
1969	2	16	21	 And they gathered it morning by morning, every man according to his eating; and as the sun waxed hot, it melted.
1970	2	16	22	 And it came to pass that on the sixth day they gathered twice as much bread, two omers for each one; and all the rulers of the congregation came and told Moses.
1971	2	16	23	 And he said unto them: 'This is that which the LORD hath spoken: To-morrow is a solemn rest, a holy sabbath unto the LORD. Bake that which ye will bake, and seethe that which ye will seethe; and all that remaineth over lay up for you to be kept until the morning.'
1972	2	16	24	 And they laid it up till the morning, as Moses bade; and it did not rot, neither was there any worm therein.
1973	2	16	25	 And Moses said: 'Eat that to-day; for to-day is a sabbath unto the LORD; to-day ye shall not find it in the field.
1974	2	16	26	 Six days ye shall gather it; but on the seventh day is the sabbath, in it there shall be none.'
1975	2	16	27	 And it came to pass on the seventh day, that there went out some of the people to gather, and they found none.
1976	2	16	28	 And the LORD said unto Moses: 'How long refuse ye to keep My commandments and My laws?

1978	2	16	30	 So the people rested on the seventh day.

2020	2	18	20	 And thou shalt teach them the statutes and the laws, and shalt show them the way wherein they must walk, and the work that they must do.
2021	2	18	21	 Moreover thou shalt provide out of all the people able men, such as fear God, men of truth, hating unjust gain; and place such over them, to be rulers of thousands, rulers of hundreds, rulers of fifties, and rulers of tens.
2022	2	18	22	 And let them judge the people at all seasons; and it shall be, that every great matter they shall bring unto thee, but every small matter they shall judge themselves; so shall they make it easier for thee and bear the burden with thee.
2023	2	18	23	 If thou shalt do this thing, and God command thee so, then thou shalt be able to endure, and all this people also shall go to their place in peace.'
2024	2	18	24	 So Moses hearkened to the voice of his father-in-law, and did all that he had said.

2026	2	18	26	 And they judged the people at all seasons: the hard causes they brought unto Moses, but every small matter they judged themselves.
2027	2	18	27	 And Moses let his father-in-law depart; and he went his way into his own land.
2028	2	19	1	 In the third month after the children of Israel were gone forth out of the land of Egypt, the same day came they into the wilderness of Sinai.
2029	2	19	2	 And when they were departed from Rephidim, and were come to the wilderness of Sinai, they encamped in the wilderness; and there Israel encamped before the mount.
2030	2	19	3	 And Moses went up unto God, and the LORD called unto him out of the mountain, saying: 'Thus shalt thou say to the house of Jacob, and tell the children of Israel:
2031	2	19	4	 Ye have seen what I did unto the Egyptians, and how I bore you on eagles' wings, and brought you unto Myself.
2032	2	19	5	 Now therefore, if ye will hearken unto My voice indeed, and keep My covenant, then ye shall be Mine own treasure from among all peoples; for all the earth is Mine;
2033	2	19	6	 and ye shall be unto Me a kingdom of priests, and a holy nation. These are the words which thou shalt speak unto the children of Israel.'
2034	2	19	7	 And Moses came and called for the elders of the people, and set before them all these words which the LORD commanded him.
2035	2	19	8	 And all the people answered together, and said: 'All that the LORD hath spoken we will do.' And Moses reported the words of the people unto the LORD.
2036	2	19	9	 And the LORD said unto Moses: 'Lo, I come unto thee in a thick cloud, that the people may hear when I speak with thee, and may also believe thee for ever.' And Moses told the words of the people unto the LORD.
2037	2	19	10	 And the LORD said unto Moses: 'Go unto the people, and sanctify them to-day and to-morrow, and let them wash their garments,
2038	2	19	11	 and be ready against the third day; for the third day the LORD will come down in the sight of all the people upon mount Sinai.
2039	2	19	12	 And thou shalt set bounds unto the people round about, saying: Take heed to yourselves, that ye go not up into the mount, or touch the border of it; whosoever toucheth the mount shall be surely put to death;
2040	2	19	13	 no hand shall touch him, but he shall surely be stoned, or shot through; whether it be beast or man, it shall not live; when the ram's horn soundeth long, they shall come up to the mount.'
2041	2	19	14	 And Moses went down from the mount unto the people, and sanctified the people; and they washed their garments.
2042	2	19	15	 And he said unto the people: 'Be ready against the third day; come not near a woman.'
2043	2	19	16	 And it came to pass on the third day, when it was morning, that there were thunders and lightnings and a thick cloud upon the mount, and the voice of a horn exceeding loud; and all the people that were in the camp trembled.
2044	2	19	17	 And Moses brought forth the people out of the camp to meet God; and they stood at the nether part of the mount.
2045	2	19	18	 Now mount Sinai was altogether on smoke, because the LORD descended upon it in fire; and the smoke thereof ascended as the smoke of a furnace, and the whole mount quaked greatly.
2046	2	19	19	 And when the voice of the horn waxed louder and louder, Moses spoke, and God answered him by a voice.
2047	2	19	20	 And the LORD came down upon mount Sinai, to the top of the mount; and the LORD called Moses to the top of the mount; and Moses went up.
2048	2	19	21	 And the LORD said unto Moses: 'Go down, charge the people, lest they break through unto the LORD to gaze, and many of them perish.
2049	2	19	22	 And let the priests also, that come near to the LORD, sanctify themselves, lest the LORD break forth upon them.'
2050	2	19	23	 And Moses said unto the LORD: 'The people cannot come up to mount Sinai; for thou didst charge us, saying: Set bounds about the mount, and sanctify it.'
2051	2	19	24	 And the LORD said unto him: 'Go, get thee down, and thou shalt come up, thou, and Aaron with thee; but let not the priests and the people break through to come up unto the LORD, lest He break forth upon them.'

2053	2	20	1	 And God spoke all these words, saying:

2057	2	20	5	 thou shalt not bow down unto them, nor serve them; for I the LORD thy God am a jealous God, visiting the iniquity of the fathers upon the children unto the third and fourth generation of them that hate Me;
2058	2	20	6	 and showing mercy unto the thousandth generation of them that love Me and keep My commandments.

2063	2	20	11	 for in six days the LORD made heaven and earth, the sea, and all that in them is, and rested on the seventh day; wherefore the LORD blessed the sabbath day, and hallowed it.
