2555	2	35	23	 And every man, with whom was found blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine linen, and goats' hair, and rams' skins dyed red, and sealskins, brought them.
2556	2	35	24	 Every one that did set apart an offering of silver and brass brought the LORD'S offering; and every man, with whom was found acacia-wood for any work of the service, brought it.
2557	2	35	25	 And all the women that were wise-hearted did spin with their hands, and brought that which they had spun, the blue, and the purple, the scarlet, and the fine linen.
2558	2	35	26	 And all the women whose heart stirred them up in wisdom spun the goats' hair.
2559	2	35	27	 And the rulers brought the onyx stones, and the stones to be set, for the ephod, and for the breastplate;
2560	2	35	28	 and the spice, and the oil, for the light, and for the anointing oil, and for the sweet incense.
2561	2	35	29	 The children of Israel brought a freewill-offering unto the LORD; every man and woman, whose heart made them willing to bring for all the work, which the LORD had commanded by the hand of Moses to be made.
2562	2	35	30	 And Moses said unto the children of Israel: 'See, the LORD hath called by name Bezalel the son of Uri, the son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah.
2563	2	35	31	 And He hath filled him with the spirit of God, in wisdom, in understanding, and in knowledge, and in all manner of workmanship.
2564	2	35	32	 And to devise skilful works, to work in gold, and in silver, and in brass,
2565	2	35	33	 and in cutting of stones for setting, and in carving of wood, to work in all manner of skilful workmanship.
2566	2	35	34	 And He hath put in his heart that he may teach, both he, and Oholiab, the son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan.
2567	2	35	35	 Them hath He filled with wisdom of heart, to work all manner of workmanship, of the craftsman, and of the skilful workman, and of the weaver in colours, in blue, and in purple, in scarlet, and in fine linen, and of the weaver, even of them that do any workmanship, and of those that devise skilful works.
2568	2	36	1	 And Bezalel and Oholiab shall work, and every wise-hearted man, in whom the LORD hath put wisdom and understanding to know how to work all the work for the service of the sanctuary, according to all that the LORD hath commanded.'
2569	2	36	2	 And Moses called Bezalel and Oholiab, and every wise-hearted man, in whose heart the LORD had put wisdom, even every one whose heart stirred him up to come unto the work to do it.
2570	2	36	3	 And they received of Moses all the offering, which the children of Israel had brought for the work of the service of the sanctuary, wherewith to make it. And they brought yet unto him freewill-offerings every morning.
2571	2	36	4	 And all the wise men, that wrought all the work of the sanctuary, came every man from his work which they wrought.
2572	2	36	5	 And they spoke unto Moses, saying: 'The people bring much more than enough for the service of the work, which the LORD commanded to make.'
2573	2	36	6	 And Moses gave commandment, and they caused it to be proclaimed throughout the camp, saying: 'Let neither man nor woman make any more work for the offering of the sanctuary.' So the people were restrained from bringing.
2574	2	36	7	 For the stuff they had was sufficient for all the work to make it, and too much.
2575	2	36	8	 And every wise-hearted man among them that wrought the work made the tabernacle with ten curtains: of fine twined linen, and blue, and purple, and scarlet, with cherubim the work of the skilful workman made he them.
2576	2	36	9	 The length of each curtain was eight and twenty cubits, and the breadth of each curtain four cubits; all the curtains had one measure.
2577	2	36	10	 And he coupled five curtains one to another; and the other five curtains he coupled one to another.
2578	2	36	11	 And he made loops of blue upon the edge of the one curtain that was outmost in the first set; likewise he made in the edge of the curtain that was outmost in the second set.
2579	2	36	12	 Fifty loops made he in the one curtain, and fifty loops made he in the edge of the curtain that was in the second set; the loops were opposite one to another.
2580	2	36	13	 And he made fifty clasps of gold, and coupled the curtains one to another with the clasps; so the tabernacle was one.
2581	2	36	14	 And he made curtains of goats' hair for a tent over the tabernacle; eleven curtains he made them.
2582	2	36	15	 The length of each curtain was thirty cubits, and four cubits the breadth of each curtain; the eleven curtains had one measure.
2583	2	36	16	 And he coupled five curtains by themselves, and six curtains by themselves.
2584	2	36	17	 And he made fifty loops on the edge of the curtain that was outmost in the first set, and fifty loops made he upon the edge of the curtain which was outmost in the second set.
2585	2	36	18	 And he made fifty clasps of brass to couple the tent together, that it might be one.
2586	2	36	19	 And he made a covering for the tent of rams' skins dyed red, and a covering of sealskins above.
2587	2	36	20	 And he made the boards for the tabernacle of acacia-wood, standing up.
2588	2	36	21	 Ten cubits was the length of a board, and a cubit and a half the breadth of each board.
2589	2	36	22	 Each board had two tenons, joined one to another. Thus did he make for all the boards of the tabernacle.
2590	2	36	23	 And he made the boards for the tabernacle; twenty boards for the south side southward.
2591	2	36	24	 And he made forty sockets of silver under the twenty boards: two sockets under one board for its two tenons, and two sockets under another board for its two tenons.
2592	2	36	25	 And for the second side of the tabernacle, on the north side, he made twenty boards,
2593	2	36	26	 and their forty sockets of silver: two sockets under one board, and two sockets under another board.
2594	2	36	27	 And for the hinder part of the tabernacle westward he made six boards.
2595	2	36	28	 And two boards made he for the corners of the tabernacle in the hinder part;
2596	2	36	29	 that they might be double beneath, and in like manner they should be complete unto the top thereof unto the first ring. Thus he did to both of them in the two corners.
2597	2	36	30	 And there were eight boards, and their sockets of silver, sixteen sockets: under every board two sockets.
2598	2	36	31	 And he made bars of acacia-wood: five for the boards of the one side of the tabernacle,
2599	2	36	32	 and five bars for the boards of the other side of the tabernacle, and five bars for the boards of the tabernacle for the hinder part westward.
2600	2	36	33	 And he made the middle bar to pass through in the midst of the boards from the one end to the other.
2601	2	36	34	 And he overlaid the boards with gold, and made their rings of gold for holders for the bars, and overlaid the bars with gold.
2602	2	36	35	 And he made the veil of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen; with the cherubim the work of the skilful workman made he it.
2603	2	36	36	 And he made thereunto four pillars of acacia, and overlaid them with gold, their hooks being of gold; and he cast for them four sockets of silver.
2604	2	36	37	 And he made a screen for the door of the Tent, of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen, the work of the weaver in colours;
2605	2	36	38	 and the five pillars of it with their hooks; and he overlaid their capitals and their fillets with gold; and their five sockets were of brass.
2606	2	37	1	 And Bezalel made the ark of acacia-wood: two cubits and a half was the length of it, and a cubit and a half the breadth of it, and a cubit and a half the height of it.
2607	2	37	2	 And he overlaid it with pure gold within and without, and made a crown of gold to it round about.
2608	2	37	3	 And he cast for it four rings of gold, in the four feet thereof: even two rings on the one side of it, and two rings on the other side of it.
2609	2	37	4	 And he made staves of acacia-wood, and overlaid them with gold.
2610	2	37	5	 And he put the staves into the rings on the sides of the ark, to bear the ark.
2611	2	37	6	 And he made an ark-cover of pure gold: two cubits and a half was the length thereof, and a cubit and a half the breadth thereof.
2612	2	37	7	 And he made two cherubim of gold: of beaten work made he them, at the two ends of the ark-cover:
2613	2	37	8	 one cherub at the one end, and one cherub at the other end; of one piece with the ark-cover made he the cherubim at the two ends thereof.
2614	2	37	9	 And the cherubim spread out their wings on high, screening the ark-cover with their wings, with their faces one to another; toward the ark-cover were the faces of the cherubim.
2615	2	37	10	 And he made the table of acacia-wood: two cubits was the length thereof, and a cubit the breadth thereof, and a cubit and a half the height thereof.
2616	2	37	11	 And he overlaid it with pure gold, and made thereto a crown of gold round about.
2617	2	37	12	 And he made unto it a border of a hand-breadth round about, and made a golden crown to the border thereof round about.
2618	2	37	13	 And he cast for it four rings of gold, and put the rings in the four corners that were on the four feet thereof.
2619	2	37	14	 Close by the border were the rings, the holders for the staves to bear the table.
2620	2	37	15	 And he made the staves of acacia-wood, and overlaid them with gold, to bear the table.
2621	2	37	16	 And he made the vessels which were upon the table, the dishes thereof, and the pans thereof, and the bowls thereof, and the jars thereof, wherewith to pour out, of pure gold.
2622	2	37	17	 And he made the candlestick of pure gold: of beaten work made he the candlestick, even its base, and its shaft; its cups, its knops, and its flowers, were of one piece with it.
2623	2	37	18	 And there were six branches going out of the sides thereof: three branches of the candlestick out of the one side thereof, and three branches of the candlestick out of the other side thereof;
2624	2	37	19	 three cups made like almond-blossoms in one branch, a knop and a flower; and three cups made like almond-blossoms in the other branch, a knop and a flower. So for the six branches going out of the candlestick.
2625	2	37	20	 And in the candlestick were four cups made like almond-blossoms, the knops thereof, and the flowers thereof;
2626	2	37	21	 and a knop under two branches of one piece with it, and a knop under two branches of one piece with it, and a knop under two branches of one piece with it, for the six branches going out of it.
2627	2	37	22	 Their knops and their branches were of one piece with it; the whole of it was one beaten work of pure gold.
2628	2	37	23	 And he made the lamps thereof, seven, and the tongs thereof, and the snuffdishes thereof, of pure gold.
2629	2	37	24	 Of a talent of pure gold made he it, and all the vessels thereof.
2630	2	37	25	 And he made the altar of incense of acacia-wood: a cubit was the length thereof, and a cubit the breadth thereof, four-square; and two cubits was the height thereof; the horns thereof were of one piece with it.
2631	2	37	26	 And he overlaid it with pure gold, the top thereof, and the sides thereof round about, and the horns of it; and he made unto it a crown of gold round about.
2632	2	37	27	 And he made for it two golden rings under the crown thereof, upon the two ribs thereof, upon the two sides of it, for holders for staves wherewith to bear it.
2633	2	37	28	 And he made the staves of acacia-wood, and overlaid them with gold.
2634	2	37	29	 And he made the holy anointing oil, and the pure incense of sweet spices, after the art of the perfumer.
2635	2	38	1	 And he made the altar of burnt-offering of acacia-wood: five cubits was the length thereof, and five cubits the breadth thereof, four-square, and three cubits the height thereof.
2636	2	38	2	 And he made the horns thereof upon the four corners of it; the horns thereof were of one piece with it; and he overlaid it with brass.
2637	2	38	3	 And he made all the vessels of the altar, the pots, and the shovels, and the basins, the flesh-hooks, and the fire-pans; all the vessels thereof made he of brass.
2638	2	38	4	 And he made for the altar a grating of network of brass, under the ledge round it beneath, reaching halfway up.
2639	2	38	5	 And he cast four rings for the four ends of the grating of brass, to be holders for the staves.
2640	2	38	6	 And he made the staves of acacia-wood, and overlaid them with brass.
2641	2	38	7	 And he put the staves into the rings on the sides of the altar, wherewith to bear it; he made it hollow with planks.
2642	2	38	8	 And he made the laver of brass, and the base thereof of brass, of the mirrors of the serving women that did service at the door of the tent of meeting.
2643	2	38	9	 And he made the court; for the south side southward the hangings of the court were of fine twined linen, a hundred cubits.
2644	2	38	10	 Their pillars were twenty, and their sockets twenty, of brass; the hooks of the pillars and their fillets were of silver.
2645	2	38	11	 And for the north side a hundred cubits, their pillars twenty, and their sockets twenty, of brass; the hooks of the pillars and their fillets of silver.
2646	2	38	12	 And for the west side were hangings of fifty cubits, their pillars ten, and their sockets ten; the hooks of the pillars and their fillets of silver.
2647	2	38	13	 And for the east side eastward fifty cubits.
2648	2	38	14	 The hangings for the one side of the gate were fifteen cubits; their pillars three, and their sockets three.
2649	2	38	15	 And so for the other side; on this hand and that hand by the gate of the court were hangings of fifteen cubits; their pillars three, and their sockets three.
2650	2	38	16	 All the hangings of the court round about were of fine twined linen.
2651	2	38	17	 And the sockets for the pillars were of brass; the hooks of the pillars and their fillets of silver; and the overlaying of their capitals of silver; and all the pillars of the court were filleted with silver.
2652	2	38	18	 And the screen for the gate of the court was the work of the weaver in colours, of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen; and twenty cubits was the length, and the height in the breadth was five cubits, answerable to the hangings of the court.
2653	2	38	19	 And their pillars were four, and their sockets four of brass; their hooks of silver, and the overlaying of their capitals and their fillets of silver.
2654	2	38	20	 And all the pins of the tabernacle, and of the court round about, were of brass.
2655	2	38	21	 These are the accounts of the tabernacle, even the tabernacle of the testimony, as they were rendered according to the commandment of Moses, through the service of the Levites, by the hand of Ithamar, the son of Aaron the priest.--
2656	2	38	22	 And Bezalel the son of Uri, the son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah, made all that the LORD commanded Moses.
2657	2	38	23	 And with him was Oholiab, the son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan, a craftsman, and a skilful workman, and a weaver in colours, in blue, and in purple, and in scarlet, and fine linen.--
2658	2	38	24	 All the gold that was used for the work in all the work of the sanctuary, even the gold of the offering, was twenty and nine talents, and seven hundred and thirty shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary.
2659	2	38	25	 And the silver of them that were numbered of the congregation was a hundred talents, and a thousand seven hundred and three-score and fifteen shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary:
2660	2	38	26	 a beka a head, that is, half a shekel, after the shekel of the sanctuary, for every one that passed over to them that are numbered, from twenty years old and upward, for six hundred thousand and three thousand and five hundred and fifty men.
2661	2	38	27	 And the hundred talents of silver were for casting the sockets of the sanctuary, and the sockets of the veil: a hundred sockets for the hundred talents, a talent for a socket.
2662	2	38	28	 And of the thousand seven hundred seventy and five shekels he made hooks for the pillars, and overlaid their capitals, and made fillets for them.
2663	2	38	29	 And the brass of the offering was seventy talents and two thousand and four hundred shekels.
2664	2	38	30	 And therewith he made the sockets to the door of the tent of meeting, and the brazen altar, and the brazen grating for it, and all the vessels of the altar,
2665	2	38	31	 and the sockets of the court round about, and the sockets of the gate of the court, and all the pins of the tabernacle, and all the pins of the court round about.
2666	2	39	1	 And of the blue, and purple, and scarlet, they made plaited garments, for ministering in the holy place, and made the holy garments for Aaron, as the LORD commanded Moses.
2667	2	39	2	 And he made the ephod of gold, blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen.
2668	2	39	3	 And they did beat the gold into thin plates, and cut it into threads, to work it in the blue, and in the purple, and in the scarlet, and in the fine linen, the work of the skilful workman.
2669	2	39	4	 They made shoulder-pieces for it, joined together; at the two ends was it joined together.
2670	2	39	5	 And the skilfully woven band, that was upon it, wherewith to gird it on, was of the same piece and like the work thereof: of gold, of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen, as the LORD commanded Moses.
2671	2	39	6	 And they wrought the onyx stones, inclosed in settings of gold, graven with the engravings of a signet, according to the names of the children of Israel.
2672	2	39	7	 And he put them on the shoulder-pieces of the ephod, to be stones of memorial for the children of Israel, as the LORD commanded Moses.
2673	2	39	8	 And he made the breastplate, the work of the skilful workman, like the work of the ephod: of gold, of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen.
2674	2	39	9	 It was four-square; they made the breastplate double; a span was the length thereof, and a span the breadth thereof, being double.
2675	2	39	10	 And they set in it four rows of stones: a row of carnelian, topaz, and smaragd was the first row.
2676	2	39	11	 And the second row, a carbuncle, a sapphire, and an emerald.
2677	2	39	12	 And the third row, a jacinth, an agate, and an amethyst.
2678	2	39	13	 And the fourth row, a beryl, an onyx, and a jasper; they were inclosed in fittings of gold in their settings.
2679	2	39	14	 And the stones were according to the names of the children of Israel, twelve, according to their names, like the engravings of a signet, every one according to his name, for the twelve tribes.
2680	2	39	15	 And they made upon the breastplate plaited chains, of wreathen work of pure gold.
2681	2	39	16	 And they made two settings of gold, and two gold rings; and put the two rings on the two ends of the breastplate.
2682	2	39	17	 And they put the two wreathen chains of gold on the two rings at the ends of the breastplate.
2683	2	39	18	 And the other two ends of the two wreathen chains they put on the two settings, and put them on the shoulder-pieces of the ephod, in the forepart thereof.
2684	2	39	19	 And they made two rings of gold, and put them upon the two ends of the breastplate, upon the edge thereof, which was toward the side of the ephod inward.
2685	2	39	20	 And they made two rings of gold, and put them on the two shoulder-pieces of the ephod underneath, in the forepart thereof, close by the coupling thereof, above the skilfully woven band of the ephod.
2686	2	39	21	 And they did bind the breastplate by the rings thereof unto the rings of the ephod with a thread of blue, that it might be upon the skilfully woven band of the ephod, and that the breastplate might not be loosed from the ephod; as the LORD commanded Moses.
2687	2	39	22	 And he made the robe of the ephod of woven work, all of blue;
2688	2	39	23	 and the hole of the robe in the midst thereof, as the hole of a coat of mail, with a binding round about the hole of it, that it should not be rent.
2689	2	39	24	 And they made upon the skirts of the robe pomegranates of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and twined linen.
2690	2	39	25	 And they made bells of pure gold, and put the bells between the pomegranates upon the skirts of the robe round about, between the pomegranates:
2691	2	39	26	 a bell and a pomegranate, a bell and a pomegranate, upon the skirts of the robe round about, to minister in; as the LORD commanded Moses.
2692	2	39	27	 And they made the tunics of fine linen of woven work for Aaron, and for his sons,
2693	2	39	28	 and the mitre of fine linen, and the goodly head-tires of fine linen, and the linen breeches of fine twined linen,
2694	2	39	29	 and the girdle of fine twined linen, and blue, and purple, and scarlet, the work of the weaver in colours; as the LORD commanded Moses.
2695	2	39	30	 And they made the plate of the holy crown of pure gold, and wrote upon it a writing, like the engravings of a signet: HOLY TO THE LORD.
2696	2	39	31	 And they tied unto it a thread of blue, to fasten it upon the mitre above; as the LORD commanded Moses.
2697	2	39	32	 Thus was finished all the work of the tabernacle of the tent of meeting; and the children of Israel did according to all that the LORD commanded Moses, so did they.
2698	2	39	33	 And they brought the tabernacle unto Moses, the Tent, and all its furniture, its clasps, its boards, its bars, and its pillars, and its sockets;
2699	2	39	34	 and the covering of rams' skins dyed red, and the covering of sealskins, and the veil of the screen;
2700	2	39	35	 the ark of the testimony, and the staves thereof, and the ark-cover;
2701	2	39	36	 the table, all the vessels thereof, and the showbread;
2702	2	39	37	 the pure candlestick, the lamps thereof, even the lamps to be set in order, and all the vessels thereof, and the oil for the light;
2703	2	39	38	 and the golden altar, and the anointing oil, and the sweet incense, and the screen for the door of the Tent;
2704	2	39	39	 the brazen altar, and its grating of brass, its staves, and all its vessels, the laver and its base;
2705	2	39	40	 the hangings of the court, its pillars, and its sockets, and the screen for the gate of the court, the cords thereof, and the pins thereof, and all the instruments of the service of the tabernacle of the tent of meeting;
2706	2	39	41	 the plaited garments for ministering in the holy place; the holy garments for Aaron the priest, and the garments of his sons, to minister in the priest's office.
2707	2	39	42	 According to all that the LORD commanded Moses, so the children of Israel did all the work.
2708	2	39	43	 And Moses saw all the work, and, behold, they had done it; as the LORD had commanded, even so had they done it. And Moses blessed them.
2709	2	40	1	 And the LORD spoke unto Moses, saying:
2710	2	40	2	 'On the first day of the first month shalt thou rear up the tabernacle of the tent of meeting.
2711	2	40	3	 And thou shalt put therein the ark of the testimony, and thou shalt screen the ark with the veil.
2712	2	40	4	 And thou shalt bring in the table, and set in order the bread that is upon it; and thou shalt bring in the candlestick, and light the lamps thereof.
2713	2	40	5	 And thou shalt set the golden altar for incense before the ark of the testimony, and put the screen of the door to the tabernacle.
2714	2	40	6	 And thou shalt set the altar of burnt-offering before the door of the tabernacle of the tent of meeting.
2715	2	40	7	 And thou shalt set the laver between the tent of meeting and the altar, and shalt put water therein.
2716	2	40	8	 And thou shalt set up the court round about, and hang up the screen of the gate of the court.
2717	2	40	9	 And thou shalt take the anointing oil, and anoint the tabernacle, and all that is therein, and shalt hallow it, and all the furniture thereof; and it shall be holy.
2718	2	40	10	 And thou shalt anoint the altar of burnt-offering, and all its vessels, and sanctify the altar; and the altar shall be most holy.
2719	2	40	11	 And thou shalt anoint the laver and its base, and sanctify it.
2720	2	40	12	 And thou shalt bring Aaron and his sons unto the door of the tent of meeting, and shalt wash them with water.
2721	2	40	13	 And thou shalt put upon Aaron the holy garments; and thou shalt anoint him, and sanctify him, that he may minister unto Me in the priest's office.
2722	2	40	14	 And thou shalt bring his sons, and put tunics upon them.
2723	2	40	15	 And thou shalt anoint them, as thou didst anoint their father, that they may minister unto Me in the priest's office; and their anointing shall be to them for an everlasting priesthood throughout their generations.'
2724	2	40	16	 Thus did Moses; according to all that the LORD commanded him, so did he.
2725	2	40	17	 And it came to pass in the first month in the second year, on the first day of the month, that the tabernacle was reared up.
2726	2	40	18	 And Moses reared up the tabernacle, and laid its sockets, and set up the boards thereof, and put in the bars thereof, and reared up its pillars.
2727	2	40	19	 And he spread the tent over the tabernacle, and put the covering of the tent above upon it; as the LORD commanded Moses.
2728	2	40	20	 And he took and put the testimony into the ark, and set the staves on the ark, and put the ark-cover above upon the ark.
2729	2	40	21	 And he brought the ark into the tabernacle, and set up the veil of the screen, and screened the ark of the testimony; as the LORD commanded Moses.
2730	2	40	22	 And he put the table in the tent of meeting, upon the side of the tabernacle northward, without the veil.
2731	2	40	23	 And he set a row of bread in order upon it before the LORD; as the LORD commanded Moses.
2732	2	40	24	 And he put the candlestick in the tent of meeting, over against the table, on the side of the tabernacle southward.
2733	2	40	25	 And he lighted the lamps before the LORD; as the LORD commanded Moses.
2734	2	40	26	 And he put the golden altar in the tent of meeting before the veil;
2735	2	40	27	 and he burnt thereon incense of sweet spices; as the LORD commanded Moses.
2736	2	40	28	 And he put the screen of the door to the tabernacle.
2737	2	40	29	 And the altar of burnt-offering he set at the door of the tabernacle of the tent of meeting, and offered upon it the burnt-offering and the meal-offering; as the LORD commanded Moses.
2738	2	40	30	 And he set the laver between the tent of meeting and the altar, and put water therein, wherewith to wash;
2739	2	40	31	 that Moses and Aaron and his sons might wash their hands and their feet thereat;
2740	2	40	32	 when they went into the tent of meeting, and when they came near unto the altar, they should wash; as the LORD commanded Moses.
2741	2	40	33	 And he reared up the court round about the tabernacle and the altar, and set up the screen of the gate of the court. So Moses finished the work.
2742	2	40	34	 Then the cloud covered the tent of meeting, and the glory of the LORD filled the tabernacle.
2743	2	40	35	 And Moses was not able to enter into the tent of meeting, because the cloud abode thereon, and the glory of the LORD filled the tabernacle.--
2744	2	40	36	 And whenever the cloud was taken up from over the tabernacle, the children of Israel went onward, throughout all their journeys.
2745	2	40	37	 But if the cloud was not taken up, then they journeyed not till the day that it was taken up.
2746	2	40	38	 For the cloud of the LORD was upon the tabernacle by day, and there was fire therein by night, in the sight of all the house of Israel, throughout all their journeys.--
2747	3	1	1	 THE LORD called unto Moses, and spoke unto him out of the tent of meeting, saying:
2748	3	1	2	 Speak unto the children of Israel, and say unto them: When any man of you bringeth an offering unto the LORD, ye shall bring your offering of the cattle, even of the herd or of the flock.
2749	3	1	3	 If his offering be a burnt-offering of the herd, he shall offer it a male without blemish; he shall bring it to the door of the tent of meeting, that he may be accepted before the LORD.
2750	3	1	4	 And he shall lay his hand upon the head of the burnt-offering; and it shall be accepted for him to make atonement for him.
2751	3	1	5	 And he shall kill the bullock before the LORD; and Aaron's sons, the priests, shall present the blood, and dash the blood round about against the altar that is at the door of the tent of meeting.
2752	3	1	6	 And he shall flay the burnt-offering, and cut it into its pieces.
2753	3	1	7	 And the sons of Aaron the priest shall put fire upon the altar, and lay wood in order upon the fire.
2754	3	1	8	 And Aaron's sons, the priests, shall lay the pieces, and the head, and the suet, in order upon the wood that is on the fire which is upon the altar;
2755	3	1	9	 but its inwards and its legs shall he wash with water; and the priest shall make the whole smoke on the altar, for a burnt-offering, an offering made by fire, of a sweet savour unto the LORD.
2756	3	1	10	 And if his offering be of the flock, whether of the sheep, or of the goats, for a burnt-offering, he shall offer it a male without blemish.
2757	3	1	11	 And he shall kill it on the side of the altar northward before the LORD; and Aaron's sons, the priests, shall dash its blood against the altar round about.
2758	3	1	12	 And he shall cut it into its pieces; and the priest shall lay them, with its head and its suet, in order on the wood that is on the fire which is upon the altar.
2759	3	1	13	 But the inwards and the legs shall he wash with water; and the priest shall offer the whole, and make it smoke upon the altar; it is a burnt-offering, an offering made by fire, of a sweet savour unto the LORD.
2760	3	1	14	 And if his offering to the LORD be a burnt-offering of fowls, then he shall bring his offering of turtle-doves, or of young pigeons.
2761	3	1	15	 And the priest shall bring it unto the altar, and pinch off its head, and make it smoke on the altar; and the blood thereof shall be drained out on the side of the altar.
2762	3	1	16	 And he shall take away its crop with the feathers thereof, and cast it beside the altar on the east part, in the place of the ashes.
2763	3	1	17	 And he shall rend it by the wings thereof, but shall not divide it asunder; and the priest shall make it smoke upon the altar, upon the wood that is upon the fire; it is a burnt-offering, an offering made by fire, of a sweet savour unto the LORD.
2764	3	2	1	 And when any one bringeth a meal-offering unto the LORD, his offering shall be of fine flour; and he shall pour oil upon it, and put frankincense thereon.
2765	3	2	2	 And he shall bring it to Aaron's sons the priests; and he shall take thereout his handful of the fine flour thereof, and of the oil thereof, together with all the frankincense thereof; and the priest shall make the memorial-part thereof smoke upon the altar, an offering made by fire, of a sweet savour unto the LORD.
2766	3	2	3	 But that which is left of the meal-offering shall be Aaron's and his sons'; it is a thing most holy of the offerings of the LORD made by fire.
2767	3	2	4	 And when thou bringest a meal-offering baked in the oven, it shall be unleavened cakes of fine flour mingled with oil, or unleavened wafers spread with oil.
2768	3	2	5	 And if thy offering be a meal-offering baked on a griddle, it shall be of fine flour unleavened, mingled with oil.
2769	3	2	6	 Thou shalt break it in pieces, and pour oil thereon; it is a meal-offering.
2770	3	2	7	 And if thy offering be a meal-offering of the stewing-pan, it shall be made of fine flour with oil.
2771	3	2	8	 And thou shalt bring the meal-offering that is made of these things unto the LORD; and it shall be presented unto the priest, and he shall bring it unto the altar.
2772	3	2	9	 And the priest shall take off from the meal-offering the memorial-part thereof, and shall make it smoke upon the altar--an offering made by fire, of a sweet savour unto the LORD.
2773	3	2	10	 But that which is left of the meal-offering shall be Aaron's and his sons'; it is a thing most holy of the offerings of the LORD made by fire.
2774	3	2	11	 No meal-offering, which ye shall bring unto the LORD, shall be made with leaven; for ye shall make no leaven, nor any honey, smoke as an offering made by fire unto the LORD.
2775	3	2	12	 As an offering of first-fruits ye may bring them unto the LORD; but they shall not come up for a sweet savour on the altar.
2776	3	2	13	 And every meal-offering of thine shalt thou season with salt; neither shalt thou suffer the salt of the covenant of thy God to be lacking from thy meal-offering; with all thy offerings thou shalt offer salt.
2777	3	2	14	 And if thou bring a meal-offering of first-fruits unto the LORD, thou shalt bring for the meal-offering of thy first-fruits corn in the ear parched with fire, even groats of the fresh ear.
2778	3	2	15	 And thou shalt put oil upon it, and lay frankincense thereon; it is a meal-offering.
2779	3	2	16	 And the priest shall make the memorial-part of it smoke, even of the groats thereof, and of the oil thereof, with all the frankincense thereof; it is an offering made by fire unto the LORD.
2780	3	3	1	 And if his offering be a sacrifice of peace-offerings: if he offer of the herd, whether male or female, he shall offer it without blemish before the LORD.
2781	3	3	2	 And he shall lay his hand upon the head of his offering, and kill it at the door of the tent of meeting; and Aaron's sons the priests shall dash the blood against the altar round about.
2782	3	3	3	 And he shall present of the sacrifice of peace-offerings an offering made by fire unto the LORD: the fat that covereth the inwards, and all the fat that is upon the inwards,
2783	3	3	4	 and the two kidneys, and the fat that is on them, which is by the loins, and the lobe above the liver, which he shall take away hard by the kidneys.
2784	3	3	5	 And Aaron's sons shall make it smoke on the altar upon the burnt-offering, which is upon the wood that is on the fire; it is an offering made by fire, of a sweet savour unto the LORD.
2785	3	3	6	 And if his offering for a sacrifice of peace-offerings unto the LORD be of the flock, male or female, he shall offer it without blemish.
2786	3	3	7	 If he bring a lamb for his offering, then shall he present it before the LORD.
2787	3	3	8	 And he shall lay his hand upon the head of his offering, and kill it before the tent of meeting; and Aaron's sons shall dash the blood thereof against the altar round about.
2788	3	3	9	 And he shall present of the sacrifice of peace-offerings an offering made by fire unto the LORD: the fat thereof, the fat tail entire, which he shall take away hard by the rump-bone; and the fat that covereth the inwards, and all the fat that is upon the inwards,
2789	3	3	10	 and the two kidneys, and the fat that is upon them, which is by the loins, and the lobe above the liver, which he shall take away by the kidneys.
2790	3	3	11	 And the priest shall make it smoke upon the altar; it is the food of the offering made by fire unto the LORD.
2791	3	3	12	 And if his offering be a goat, then he shall present it before the LORD.
2792	3	3	13	 And he shall lay his hand upon the head of it, and kill it before the tent of meeting; and the sons of Aaron shall dash the blood thereof against the altar round about.
2793	3	3	14	 And he shall present thereof his offering, even an offering made by fire unto the LORD: the fat that covereth the inwards, and all the fat that is upon the inwards,
2794	3	3	15	 and the two kidneys, and the fat that is upon them, which is by the loins, and the lobe above the liver, which he shall take away by the kidneys.
2795	3	3	16	 And the priest shall make them smoke upon the altar; it is the food of the offering made by fire, for a sweet savour; all the fat is the LORD'S.
2796	3	3	17	 It shall be a perpetual statute throughout your generations in all your dwellings, that ye shall eat neither fat nor blood.
2797	3	4	1	 And the LORD spoke unto Moses, saying:
2798	3	4	2	 Speak unto the children of Israel, saying: If any one shall sin through error, in any of the things which the LORD hath commanded not to be done, and shall do any one of them:
2799	3	4	3	 if the anointed priest shall sin so as to bring guilt on the people, then let him offer for his sin, which he hath sinned, a young bullock without blemish unto the LORD for a sin-offering.
2800	3	4	4	 And he shall bring the bullock unto the door of the tent of meeting before the LORD; and he shall lay his hand upon the head of the bullock, and kill the bullock before the LORD.
2801	3	4	5	 And the anointed priest shall take of the blood of the bullock, and bring it to the tent of meeting.
2802	3	4	6	 And the priest shall dip his finger in the blood, and sprinkle of the blood seven times before the LORD, in front of the veil of the sanctuary.
2803	3	4	7	 And the priest shall put of the blood upon the horns of the altar of sweet incense before the LORD, which is in the tent of meeting; and all the remaining blood of the bullock shall he pour out at the base of the altar of burnt-offering, which is at the door of the tent of meeting.
2804	3	4	8	 And all the fat of the bullock of the sin-offering he shall take off from it; the fat that covereth the inwards, and all the fat that is upon the inwards,
2805	3	4	9	 and the two kidneys, and the fat that is upon them, which is by the loins, and the lobe above the liver, which he shall take away by kidneys,
2806	3	4	10	 as it is taken off from the ox of the sacrifice of peace-offerings; and the priest shall make them smoke upon the altar of burnt-offering.
2807	3	4	11	 But the skin of the bullock, and all its flesh, with its head, and with its legs, and its inwards, and its dung,
2808	3	4	12	 even the whole bullock shall he carry forth without the camp unto a clean place, where the ashes are poured out, and burn it on wood with fire; where the ashes are poured out shall it be burnt.
2809	3	4	13	 And if the whole congregation of Israel shall err, the thing being hid from the eyes of the assembly, and do any of the things which the LORD hath commanded not to be done, and are guilty:
2810	3	4	14	 when the sin wherein they have sinned is known, then the assembly shall offer a young bullock for a sin-offering, and bring it before the tent of meeting.
2811	3	4	15	 And the elders of the congregation shall lay their hands upon the head of the bullock before the LORD; and the bullock shall be killed before the LORD.
2812	3	4	16	 And the anointed priest shall bring of the blood of the bullock to the tent of meeting.
2813	3	4	17	 And the priest shall dip his finger in the blood, and sprinkle it seven times before the LORD, in front of the veil.
2814	3	4	18	 And he shall put of the blood upon the horns of the altar which is before the LORD, that is in the tent of meeting, and all the remaining blood shall he pour out at the base of the altar of burnt-offering, which is at the door of the tent of meeting.
2815	3	4	19	 And all the fat thereof shall he take off from it, and make it smoke upon the altar.
2816	3	4	20	 Thus shall he do with the bullock; as he did with the bullock of the sin-offering, so shall he do with this; and the priest shall make atonement for them, and they shall be forgiven.
2817	3	4	21	 And he shall carry forth the bullock without the camp, and burn it as he burned the first bullock; it is the sin-offering for the assembly.
2818	3	4	22	 When a ruler sinneth, and doeth through error any one of all the things which the LORD his God hath commanded not to be done, and is guilty:
2819	3	4	23	 if his sin, wherein he hath sinned, be known to him, he shall bring for his offering a goat, a male without blemish.
2820	3	4	24	 And he shall lay his hand upon the head of the goat, and kill it in the place where they kill the burnt-offering before the LORD; it is a sin-offering.
2821	3	4	25	 And the priest shall take of the blood of the sin-offering with his finger, and put it upon the horns of the altar of burnt-offering, and the remaining blood thereof shall he pour out at the base of the altar of burnt-offering.
2822	3	4	26	 And all the fat thereof shall he make smoke upon the altar, as the fat of the sacrifice of peace-offerings; and the priest shall make atonement for him as concerning his sin, and he shall be forgiven.
2823	3	4	27	 And if any one of the common people sin through error, in doing any of the things which the LORD hath commanded not to be done, and be guilty:
2824	3	4	28	 if his sin, which he hath sinned, be known to him, then he shall bring for his offering a goat, a female without blemish, for his sin which he hath sinned.
2825	3	4	29	 And he shall lay his hand upon the head of the sin-offering, and kill the sin-offering in the place of burnt-offering.
2826	3	4	30	 And the priest shall take of the blood thereof with his finger, and put it upon the horns of the altar of burnt-offering, and all the remaining blood thereof shall he pour out at the base of the altar.
2827	3	4	31	 And all the fat thereof shall he take away, as the fat is taken away from off the sacrifice of peace-offerings; and the priest shall make it smoke upon the altar for a sweet savour unto the LORD; and the priest shall make atonement for him, and he shall be forgiven.
2828	3	4	32	 And if he bring a lamb as his offering for a sin-offering, he shall bring it a female without blemish.
2829	3	4	33	 And he shall lay his hand upon the head of the sin-offering, and kill it for a sin-offering in the place where they kill the burnt-offering.
2830	3	4	34	 And the priest shall take of the blood of the sin-offering with his finger, and put it upon the horns of the altar of burnt-offering, and all the remaining blood thereof shall he pour out at the base of the altar.
2831	3	4	35	 And all the fat thereof shall he take away, as the fat of the lamb is taken away from the sacrifice of peace-offerings; and the priest shall make them smoke on the altar, upon the offerings of the LORD made by fire; and the priest shall make atonement for him as touching his sin that he hath sinned, and he shall be forgiven.
2832	3	5	1	 And if any one sin, in that he heareth the voice of adjuration, he being a witness, whether he hath seen or known, if he do not utter it, then he shall bear his iniquity;
2833	3	5	2	 or if any one touch any unclean thing, whether it be the carcass of an unclean beast, or the carcass of unclean cattle, or the carcass of unclean swarming things, and be guilty, it being hidden from him that he is unclean;
2834	3	5	3	 or if he touch the uncleanness of man, whatsoever his uncleanness be wherewith he is unclean, and it be hid from him; and, when he knoweth of it, be guilty;
2835	3	5	4	 or if any one swear clearly with his lips to do evil, or to do good, whatsoever it be that a man shall utter clearly with an oath, and it be hid from him; and, when he knoweth of it, be guilty in one of these things;
2836	3	5	5	 and it shall be, when he shall be guilty in one of these things, that he shall confess that wherein he hath sinned;
2837	3	5	6	 and he shall bring his forfeit unto the LORD for his sin which he hath sinned, a female from the flock, a lamb or a goat, for a sin-offering; and the priest shall make atonement for him as concerning his sin.
2838	3	5	7	 And if his means suffice not for a lamb, then he shall bring his forfeit for that wherein he hath sinned, two turtle-doves, or two young pigeons, unto the LORD: one for a sin-offering, and the other for a burnt-offering.
2839	3	5	8	 And he shall bring them unto the priest, who shall offer that which is for the sin-offering first, and pinch off its head close by its neck, but shall not divide it asunder.
2840	3	5	9	 And he shall sprinkle of the blood of the sin-offering upon the side of the altar; and the rest of the blood shall be drained out at the base of the altar; it is a sin-offering.
2841	3	5	10	 And he shall prepare the second for a burnt-offering, according to the ordinance; and the priest shall make atonement for him as concerning his sin which he hath sinned, and he shall be forgiven.
2842	3	5	11	 But if his means suffice not for two turtledoves, or two young pigeons, then he shall bring his offering for that wherein he hath sinned, the tenth part of an ephah of fine flour for a sin-offering; he shall put no oil upon it, neither shall he put any frankincense thereon; for it is a sin-offering.
2843	3	5	12	 And he shall bring it to the priest, and the priest shall take his handful of it as the memorial-part thereof, and make it smoke on the altar, upon the offerings of the LORD made by fire; it is a sin-offering.
2844	3	5	13	 And the priest shall make atonement for him as touching his sin that he hath sinned in any of these things, and he shall be forgiven; and the remnant shall be the priest's, as the meal-offering.
2845	3	5	14	 And the LORD spoke unto Moses, saying:
2846	3	5	15	 If any one commit a trespass, and sin through error, in the holy things of the LORD, then he shall bring his forfeit unto the LORD, a ram without blemish out of the flock, according to thy valuation in silver by shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary, for a guilt-offering.
2847	3	5	16	 And he shall make restitution for that which he hath done amiss in the holy thing, and shall add the fifth part thereto, and give it unto the priest; and the priest shall make atonement for him with the ram of the guilt-offering, and he shall be forgiven.
2848	3	5	17	 And if any one sin, and do any of the things which the LORD hath commanded not to be done, though he know it not, yet is he guilty, and shall bear his iniquity.
2849	3	5	18	 And he shall bring a ram without blemish out of the flock, according to thy valuation, for a guilt-offering, unto the priest; and the priest shall make atonement for him concerning the error which he committed, though he knew it not, and he shall be forgiven.
2850	3	5	19	 It is a guilt-offering--he is certainly guilty before the LORD.
2851	3	6	1	 (5:20) And the LORD spoke unto Moses, saying:
2852	3	6	2	 (5:21) If any one sin, and commit a trespass against the LORD, and deal falsely with his neighbour in a matter of deposit, or of pledge, or of robbery, or have oppressed his neighbour;
2853	3	6	3	 (5:22) or have found that which was lost, and deal falsely therein, and swear to a lie; in any of all these that a man doeth, sinning therein;
2854	3	6	4	 (5:23) then it shall be, if he hath sinned, and is guilty, that he shall restore that which he took by robbery, or the thing which he hath gotten by oppression, or the deposit which was deposited with him, or the lost thing which he found,
2855	3	6	5	 (5:24) or any thing about which he hath sworn falsely, he shall even restore it in full, and shall add the fifth part more thereto; unto him to whom it appertaineth shall he give it, in the day of his being guilty.
2856	3	6	6	 (5:25) And he shall bring his forfeit unto the LORD, a ram without blemish out of the flock, according to thy valuation, for a guilt-offering, unto the priest.
2857	3	6	7	 (5:26) And the priest shall make atonement for him before the LORD, and he shall be forgiven, concerning whatsoever he doeth so as to be guilty thereby.
2858	3	6	8	 (6:1) And the LORD spoke unto Moses, saying:
2859	3	6	9	 (6:2) Command Aaron and his sons, saying: This is the law of the burnt-offering: it is that which goeth up on its firewood upon the altar all night unto the morning; and the fire of the altar shall be kept burning thereby.
2860	3	6	10	 (6:3) And the priest shall put on his linen garment, and his linen breeches shall he put upon his flesh; and he shall take up the ashes whereto the fire hath consumed the burnt-offering on the altar, and he shall put them beside the altar.
2861	3	6	11	 (6:4) And he shall put off his garments, and put on other garments, and carry forth the ashes without the camp unto a clean place.
2862	3	6	12	 (6:5) And the fire upon the altar shall be kept burning thereby, it shall not go out; and the priest shall kindle wood on it every morning; and he shall lay the burnt-offering in order upon it, and shall make smoke thereon the fat of the peace-offerings.
2863	3	6	13	 (6:6) Fire shall be kept burning upon the altar continually; it shall not go out.
2864	3	6	14	 (6:7) And this is the law of the meal-offering: the sons of Aaron shall offer it before the LORD, in front of the altar.
2865	3	6	15	 (6:8) And he shall take up therefrom his handful, of the fine flour of the meal-offering, and of the oil thereof, and all the frankincense which is upon the meal-offering, and shall make the memorial-part thereof smoke upon the altar for a sweet savour unto the LORD.
2866	3	6	16	 (6:9) And that which is left thereof shall Aaron and his sons eat; it shall be eaten without leaven in a holy place; in the court of the tent of meeting they shall eat it.
2867	3	6	17	 (6:10) It shall not be baked with leaven. I have given it as their portion of My offerings made by fire; it is most holy, as the sin-offering, and as the guilt-offering.
2868	3	6	18	 (6:11) Every male among the children of Aaron may eat of it, as a due for ever throughout your generations, from the offerings of the LORD made by fire; whatsoever toucheth them shall be holy.
2869	3	6	19	 (6:12) And the LORD spoke unto Moses, saying:
2870	3	6	20	 (6:13) This is the offering of Aaron and of his sons, which they shall offer unto the LORD in the day when he is anointed: the tenth part of an ephah of fine flour for a meal-offering perpetually, half of it in the morning, and half thereof in the evening.
2871	3	6	21	 (6:14) On a griddle it shall be made with oil; when it is soaked, thou shalt bring it in; in broken pieces shalt thou offer the meal-offering for a sweet savour unto the LORD.
2872	3	6	22	 (6:15) And the anointed priest that shall be in his stead from among his sons shall offer it, it is a due for ever; it shall be wholly made to smoke unto the LORD.
2873	3	6	23	 (6:16) And every meal-offering of the priest shall be wholly made to smoke; it shall not be eaten.
2874	3	6	24	 (6:17) And the LORD spoke unto Moses, saying:
2875	3	6	25	 (6:18) Speak unto Aaron and to his sons, saying: This is the law of the sin-offering: in the place where the burnt-offering is killed shall the sin-offering be killed before the LORD; it is most holy.
2876	3	6	26	 (6:19) The priest that offereth it for sin shall eat it; in a holy place shall it be eaten, in the court of the tent of meeting.
2877	3	6	27	 (6:20) Whatsoever shall touch the flesh thereof shall be holy; and when there is sprinkled of the blood thereof upon any garment, thou shalt wash that whereon it was sprinkled in a holy place.
2878	3	6	28	 (6:21) But the earthen vessel wherein it is sodden shall be broken; and if it be sodden in a brazen vessel, it shall be scoured, and rinsed in water.
2879	3	6	29	 (6:22 Every male among the priests may eat thereof; it is most holy.
2880	3	6	30	 (6:23) And no sin-offering, whereof any of the blood is brought into the tent of meeting to make atonement in the holy place, shall be eaten; it shall be burnt with fire.
2881	3	7	1	 And this is the law of the guilt-offering: it is most holy.
2882	3	7	2	 In the place where they kill the burnt-offering shall they kill the guilt-offering: and the blood thereof shall be dashed against the altar round about.
2883	3	7	3	 And he shall offer of it all the fat thereof: the fat tail, and the fat that covereth the inwards,
2884	3	7	4	 and the two kidneys, and the fat that is on them, which is by the loins, and the lobe above the liver, which he shall take away by the kidneys.
2885	3	7	5	 And the priest shall make them smoke upon the altar for an offering made by fire unto the LORD; it is a guilt-offering.
2886	3	7	6	 Every male among the priests may eat thereof; it shall be eaten in a holy place; it is most holy.
2887	3	7	7	 As is the sin-offering, so is the guilt-offering; there is one law for them; the priest that maketh atonement therewith, he shall have it.
2888	3	7	8	 And the priest that offereth any man's burnt-offering, even the priest shall have to himself the skin of the burnt-offering which he hath offered.
2889	3	7	9	 And every meal-offering that is baked in the oven, and all that is dressed in the stewing-pan, and on the griddle, shall be the priest's that offereth it.
2890	3	7	10	 And every meal-offering, mingled with oil, or dry, shall all the sons of Aaron have, one as well as another.
2891	3	7	11	 And this is the law of the sacrifice of peace-offerings, which one may offer unto the LORD.
2892	3	7	12	 If he offer it for a thanksgiving, then he shall offer with the sacrifice of thanksgiving unleavened cakes mingled with oil, and unleavened wafers spread with oil, and cakes mingled with oil, of fine flour soaked.
2893	3	7	13	 With cakes of leavened bread he shall present his offering with the sacrifice of his peace-offerings for thanksgiving.
2894	3	7	14	 And of it he shall present one out of each offering for a gift unto the LORD; it shall be the priest's that dasheth the blood of the peace-offerings against the altar.
2895	3	7	15	 And the flesh of the sacrifice of his peace-offerings for thanksgiving shall be eaten on the day of his offering; he shall not leave any of it until the morning.
2896	3	7	16	 But if the sacrifice of his offering be a vow, or a freewill-offering, it shall be eaten on the day that he offereth his sacrifice; and on the morrow that which remaineth of it may be eaten.
2897	3	7	17	 But that which remaineth of the flesh of the sacrifice on the third day shall be burnt with fire.
2898	3	7	18	 And if any of the flesh of the sacrifice of his peace-offerings be at all eaten on the third day, it shall not be accepted, neither shall it be imputed unto him that offereth it; it shall be an abhorred thing, and the soul that eateth of it shall bear his iniquity.
2899	3	7	19	 And the flesh that toucheth any unclean thing shall not be eaten; it shall be burnt with fire. And as for the flesh, every one that is clean may eat thereof.
2900	3	7	20	 But the soul that eateth of the flesh of the sacrifice of peace-offerings, that pertain unto the LORD, having his uncleanness upon him, that soul shall be cut off from his people.
2901	3	7	21	 And when any one shall touch any unclean thing, whether it be the uncleanness of man, or an unclean beast, or any unclean detestable thing, and eat of the flesh of the sacrifice of peace-offerings, which pertain unto the LORD, that soul shall be cut off from his people.
2902	3	7	22	 And the LORD spoke unto Moses, saying:
2903	3	7	23	 Speak unto the children of Israel, saying: Ye shall eat no fat, of ox, or sheep, or goat.
2904	3	7	24	 And the fat of that which dieth of itself, and the fat of that which is torn of beasts, may be used for any other service; but ye shall in no wise eat of it.
2905	3	7	25	 For whosoever eateth the fat of the beast, of which men present an offering made by fire unto the LORD, even the soul that eateth it shall be cut off from his people.
2906	3	7	26	 And ye shall eat no manner of blood, whether it be of fowl or of beast, in any of your dwellings.
2907	3	7	27	 Whosoever it be that eateth any blood, that soul shall be cut off from his people.
2908	3	7	28	 And the LORD spoke unto Moses, saying:
2909	3	7	29	 Speak unto the children of Israel, saying: He that offereth his sacrifice of peace-offerings unto the LORD shall bring his offering unto the LORD out of his sacrifice of peace-offerings.
2910	3	7	30	 His own hands shall bring the offerings of the LORD made by fire: the fat with the breast shall he bring, that the breast may be waved for a wave-offering before the LORD.
2911	3	7	31	 And the priest shall make the fat smoke upon the altar; but the breast shall be Aaron's and his sons'.
2912	3	7	32	 And the right thigh shall ye give unto the priest for a heave-offering out of your sacrifices of peace-offerings.
2913	3	7	33	 He among the sons of Aaron, that offereth the blood of the peace-offerings, and the fat, shall have the right thigh for a portion.
2914	3	7	34	 For the breast of waving and the thigh of heaving have I taken of the children of Israel out of their sacrifices of peace-offerings, and have given them unto Aaron the priest and unto his sons as a due for ever from the children of Israel.
2915	3	7	35	 This is the consecrated portion of Aaron, and the consecrated portion of his sons, out of the offerings of the LORD made by fire, in the day when they were presented to minister unto the LORD in the priest's office;
2916	3	7	36	 which the LORD commanded to be given them of the children of Israel, in the day that they were anointed. It is a due for ever throughout their generations.
2917	3	7	37	 This is the law of the burnt-offering, of the meal-offering, and of the sin-offering, and of the guilt-offering, and of the consecration-offering, and of the sacrifice of peace-offerings;
2918	3	7	38	 which the LORD commanded Moses in mount Sinai, in the day that he commanded the children of Israel to present their offerings unto the LORD, in the wilderness of Sinai.
2919	3	8	1	 And the LORD spoke unto Moses, saying:
2920	3	8	2	 'Take Aaron and his sons with him, and the garments, and the anointing oil, and the bullock of the sin-offering, and the two rams, and the basket of unleavened bread;
2921	3	8	3	 and assemble thou all the congregation at the door of the tent of meeting.'
2922	3	8	4	 And Moses did as the LORD commanded him; and the congregation was assembled at the door of the tent of meeting.
2923	3	8	5	 And Moses said unto the congregation: 'This is the thing which the LORD hath commanded to be done.'
2924	3	8	6	 And Moses brought Aaron and his sons, and washed them with water.
2925	3	8	7	 And he put upon him the tunic, and girded him with the girdle, and clothed him with the robe, and put the ephod upon him, and he girded him with the skilfully woven band of the ephod, and bound it unto him therewith.
2926	3	8	8	 And he placed the breastplate upon him; and in the breastplate he put the Urim and the Thummim.
2927	3	8	9	 And he set the mitre upon his head; and upon the mitre, in front, did he set the golden plate, the holy crown; as the LORD commanded Moses.
2928	3	8	10	 And Moses took the anointing oil, and anointed the tabernacle and all that was therein, and sanctified them.
2929	3	8	11	 And he sprinkled thereof upon the altar seven times, and anointed the altar and all its vessels, and the laver and its base, to sanctify them.
2930	3	8	12	 And he poured of the anointing oil upon Aaron's head, and anointed him, to sanctify him.
2931	3	8	13	 And Moses brought Aaron's sons, and clothed them with tunics, and girded them with girdles, and bound head-tires upon them; as the LORD commanded Moses.
2932	3	8	14	 And the bullock of the sin-offering was brought; and Aaron and his sons laid their hands upon the head of the bullock of the sin-offering.
2933	3	8	15	 And when it was slain, Moses took the blood, and put it upon the horns of the altar round about with his finger, and purified the altar, and poured out the remaining blood at the base of the altar, and sanctified it, to make atonement for it.
2934	3	8	16	 And he took all the fat that was upon the inwards, and the lobe of the liver, and the two kidneys, and their fat, and Moses made it smoke upon the altar.
2935	3	8	17	 But the bullock, and its skin, and its flesh, and its dung, were burnt with fire without the camp; as the LORD commanded Moses.
2936	3	8	18	 And the ram of the burnt-offering was presented; and Aaron and his sons laid their hands upon the head of the ram.
2937	3	8	19	 And when it was killed, Moses dashed the blood against the altar round about.
2938	3	8	20	 And when the ram was cut into its pieces, Moses made the head, and the pieces, and the suet smoke.
2939	3	8	21	 And when the inwards and the legs were washed with water, Moses made the whole ram smoke upon the altar; it was a burnt-offering for a sweet savour; it was an offering made by fire unto the LORD; as the LORD commanded Moses.
2940	3	8	22	 And the other ram was presented, the ram of consecration, and Aaron and his sons laid their hands upon the head of the ram.
2941	3	8	23	 And when it was slain, Moses took of the blood thereof, and put it upon the tip of Aaron's right ear, and upon the thumb of his right hand, and upon the great toe of his right foot.
2942	3	8	24	 And Aaron's sons were brought, and Moses put of the blood upon the tip of their right ear, and upon the thumb of their right hand, and upon the great toe of their right foot; and Moses dashed the blood against the altar round about.
2943	3	8	25	 And he took the fat, and the fat tail, and all the fat that was upon the inwards, and the lobe of the liver, and the two kidneys, and their fat, and the right thigh.
2944	3	8	26	 And out of the basket of unleavened bread, that was before the LORD, he took one unleavened cake, and one cake of oiled bread, and one wafer, and placed them on the fat, and upon the right thigh.
2945	3	8	27	 And he put the whole upon the hands of Aaron, and upon the hands of his sons, and waved them for a wave-offering before the LORD.
2946	3	8	28	 And Moses took them from off their hands, and made them smoke on the altar upon the burnt-offering; they were a consecration-offering for a sweet savour; it was an offering made by fire unto the LORD.
2947	3	8	29	 And Moses took the breast, and waved it for a wave-offering before the LORD; it was Moses' portion of the ram of consecration; as the LORD commanded Moses.
2948	3	8	30	 And Moses took of the anointing oil, and of the blood which was upon the altar, and sprinkled it upon Aaron, and upon his garments, and upon his sons, and upon his sons' garments with him, and sanctified Aaron, and his garments, and his sons, and his sons' garments with him.
2949	3	8	31	 And Moses said unto Aaron and to his sons: 'Boil the flesh at the door of the tent of meeting; and there eat it and the bread that is in the basket of consecration, as I commanded, saying: Aaron and his sons shall eat it.
2950	3	8	32	 And that which remaineth of the flesh and of the bread shall ye burn with fire.
2951	3	8	33	 And ye shall not go out from the door of the tent of meeting seven days, until the days of your consecration be fulfilled; for He shall consecrate you seven days.
2952	3	8	34	 As hath been done this day, so the LORD hath commanded to do, to make atonement for you.
2953	3	8	35	 And at the door of the tent of meeting shall ye abide day and night seven days, and keep the charge of the LORD, that ye die not; for so I am commanded.
2954	3	8	36	 And Aaron and his sons did all the things which the LORD commanded by the hand of Moses.
2955	3	9	1	 And it came to pass on the eighth day, that Moses called Aaron and his sons, and the elders of Israel;
2956	3	9	2	 and he said unto Aaron: 'Take thee a bull-calf for a sin-offering, and a ram for a burnt-offering, without blemish, and offer them before the LORD.
2957	3	9	3	 And unto the children of Israel thou shalt speak, saying: Take ye a he-goat for a sin-offering; and a calf and a lamb, both of the first year, without blemish, for a burnt-offering;
2958	3	9	4	 and an ox and a ram for peace-offerings, to sacrifice before the LORD; and a meal-offering mingled with oil; for to-day the LORD appeareth unto you.'
2959	3	9	5	 And they brought that which Moses commanded before the tent of meeting; and all the congregation drew near and stood before the LORD.
2960	3	9	6	 And Moses said: 'This is the thing which the LORD commanded that ye should do; that the glory of the LORD may appear unto you.'
2961	3	9	7	 And Moses said unto Aaron: 'Draw near unto the altar, and offer thy sin-offering, and thy burnt-offering, and make atonement for thyself, and for the people; and present the offering of the people, and make atonement for them; as the LORD commanded.'
2962	3	9	8	 So Aaron drew near unto the altar, and slew the calf of the sin-offering, which was for himself.

2964	3	9	10	 But the fat, and the kidneys, and the lobe of the liver of the sin-offering, he made smoke upon the altar; as the LORD commanded Moses.
2965	3	9	11	 And the flesh and the skin were burnt with fire without the camp.
2966	3	9	12	 And he slew the burnt-offering; and Aaron's sons delivered unto him the blood, and he dashed it against the altar round about.
2967	3	9	13	 And they delivered the burnt-offering unto him, piece by piece, and the head; and he made them smoke upon the altar.

2969	3	9	15	 And the people's offering was presented; and he took the goat of the sin-offering which was for the people, and slew it, and offered it for sin, as the first.
2970	3	9	16	 And the burnt-offering was presented; and he offered it according to the ordinance.
2971	3	9	17	 And the meal-offering was presented; and he filled his hand therefrom, and made it smoke upon the altar, besides the burnt-offering of the morning.
2972	3	9	18	 He slew also the ox and the ram, the sacrifice of peace-offerings, which was for the people; and Aaron's sons delivered unto him the blood, and he dashed it against the altar round about,

2976	3	9	22	 And Aaron lifted up his hands toward the people, and blessed them; and he came down from offering the sin-offering, and the burnt-offering, and the peace-offerings.
2977	3	9	23	 And Moses and Aaron went into the tent of meeting, and came out, and blessed the people; and the glory of the LORD appeared unto all the people.
2978	3	9	24	 And there came forth fire from before the LORD, and consumed upon the altar the burnt-offering and the fat; and when all the people saw it, they shouted, and fell on their faces.
2979	3	10	1	 And Nadab and Abihu, the sons of Aaron, took each of them his censer, and put fire therein, and laid incense thereon, and offered strange fire before the LORD, which He had not commanded them.
2980	3	10	2	 And there came forth fire from before the LORD, and devoured them, and they died before the LORD.
2981	3	10	3	 Then Moses said unto Aaron: 'This is it that the LORD spoke, saying: Through them that are nigh unto Me I will be sanctified, and before all the people I will be glorified.' And Aaron held his peace.
2982	3	10	4	 And Moses called Mishael and Elzaphan, the sons of Uzziel the uncle of Aaron, and said unto them: 'Draw near, carry your brethren from before the sanctuary out of the camp.'
2983	3	10	5	 So they drew near, and carried them in their tunics out of the camp, as Moses had said.
2984	3	10	6	 And Moses said unto Aaron, and unto Eleazar and unto Ithamar, his sons: 'Let not the hair of your heads go loose, neither tend your clothes, that ye die not, and that He be not wroth with all the congregation; but let your brethren, the whole house of Israel, bewail the burning which the LORD hath kindled.
2985	3	10	7	 And ye shall not go out from the door of the tent of meeting, lest ye die; for the anointing oil of the LORD is upon you.' And they did according to the word of Moses.
2986	3	10	8	 And the LORD spoke unto Aaron, saying:
2987	3	10	9	 'Drink no wine nor strong drink, thou, nor thy sons with thee, when ye go into the tent of meeting, that ye die not; it shall be a statute forever throughout your generations.
2988	3	10	10	 And that ye may put difference between the holy and the common, and between the unclean and the clean;
2989	3	10	11	 and that ye may teach the children of Israel all the statutes which the LORD hath spoken unto them by the hand of Moses.'
2990	3	10	12	 And Moses spoke unto Aaron, and unto Eleazar and unto Ithamar, his sons that were left: 'Take the meal-offering that remaineth of the offerings of the LORD made by fire, and eat it without leaven beside the altar; for it is most holy.
2991	3	10	13	 And ye shall eat it in a holy place, because it is thy due, and thy sons' due, of the offerings of the LORD made by fire; for so I am commanded.
2992	3	10	14	 And the breast of waving and the thigh of heaving shall ye eat in a clean place; thou, and thy sons, and thy daughters with thee; for they are given as thy due, and thy sons' due, out of the sacrifices of the peace-offerings of the children of Israel.
2993	3	10	15	 The thigh of heaving and the breast of waving shall they bring with the offerings of the fat made by fire, to wave it for a wave-offering before the LORD; and it shall be thine, and thy sons' with thee, as a due for ever; as the LORD hath commanded.'
2994	3	10	16	 And Moses diligently inquired for the goat of the sin-offering, and, behold, it was burnt; and he was angry with Eleazar and with Ithamar, the sons of Aaron that were left, saying:
2995	3	10	17	 'Wherefore have ye not eaten the sin-offering in the place of the sanctuary, seeing it is most holy, and He hath given it you to bear the iniquity of the congregation, to make atonement for them before the LORD?
2996	3	10	18	 Behold, the blood of it was not brought into the sanctuary within; ye should certainly have eaten it in the sanctuary, as I commanded.'
2997	3	10	19	 And Aaron spoke unto Moses: 'Behold, this day have they offered their sin-offering and their burnt-offering before the LORD, and there have befallen me such things as these; and if I had eaten the sin-offering to-day, would it have been well-pleasing in the sight of the LORD?
2998	3	10	20	 And when Moses heard that, it was well-pleasing in his sight.
2999	3	11	1	 And the LORD spoke unto Moses and to Aaron, saying unto them:
3000	3	11	2	 Speak unto the children of Israel, saying: These are the living things which ye may eat among all the beasts that are on the earth.
3001	3	11	3	 Whatsoever parteth the hoof, and is wholly cloven-footed, and cheweth the cud, among the beasts, that may ye eat.
3002	3	11	4	 Nevertheless these shall ye not eat of them that only chew the cud, or of them that only part the hoof: the camel, because he cheweth the cud but parteth not the hoof, he is unclean unto you.
3003	3	11	5	 And the rock-badger, because he cheweth the cud but parteth not the hoof, he is unclean unto you.
3004	3	11	6	 And the hare, because she cheweth the cud but parteth not the hoof, she is unclean unto you
3005	3	11	7	 And the swine, because he parteth the hoof, and is cloven-footed, but cheweth not the cud, he is unclean unto you.
3006	3	11	8	 Of their flesh ye shall not eat, and their carcasses ye shall not touch; they are unclean unto you.
3007	3	11	9	 These may ye eat of all that are in the waters: whatsoever hath fins and scales in the waters, in the seas, and in the rivers, them may ye eat.
3008	3	11	10	 And all that have not fins and scales in the seas, and in the rivers, of all that swarm in the waters, and of all the living creatures that are in the waters, they are a detestable thing unto you,
3009	3	11	11	 and they shall be a detestable thing unto you; ye shall not eat of their flesh, and their carcasses ye shall have in detestation.
3010	3	11	12	 Whatsoever hath no fins nor scales in the waters, that is a detestable thing unto you.
3011	3	11	13	 And these ye shall have in detestation among the fowls; they shall not be eaten, they are a detestable thing: the great vulture, and the bearded vulture, and the ospray;
3012	3	11	14	 and the kite, and the falcon after its kinds;
3013	3	11	15	 every raven after its kinds;
3014	3	11	16	 and the ostrich, and the night-hawk, and the sea-mew, and the hawk after its kinds;
3015	3	11	17	 and the little owl, and the cormorant, and the great owl;
3016	3	11	18	 and the horned owl, and the pelican, and the carrion-vulture;
3017	3	11	19	 and the stork, and the heron after its kinds, and the hoopoe, and the bat.
3018	3	11	20	 All winged swarming things that go upon all fours are a detestable thing unto you.
3019	3	11	21	 Yet these may ye eat of all winged swarming things that go upon all fours, which have jointed legs above their feet, wherewith to leap upon the earth;
3020	3	11	22	 even these of them ye may eat: the locust after its kinds, and the bald locust after its kinds, and the cricket after its kinds, and the grasshopper after its kinds.
3021	3	11	23	 But all winged swarming things, which have four feet, are a detestable thing unto you.
3022	3	11	24	 And by these ye shall become unclean; whosoever toucheth the carcass of them shall be unclean until even.
3023	3	11	25	 And whosoever beareth aught of the carcass of them shall wash his clothes, and be unclean until the even.
3024	3	11	26	 Every beast which parteth the hoof, but is not cloven footed, nor cheweth the cud, is unclean unto you; every one that to toucheth them shall be unclean.
3025	3	11	27	 And whatsoever goeth upon its paws, among all beasts that go on all fours, they are unclean unto you; whoso toucheth their carcass shall be unclean until the even.
3026	3	11	28	 And he that beareth the carcass of them shall wash his clothes, and be unclean until the even; they are unclean unto you.
3027	3	11	29	 And these are they which are unclean unto you among the swarming things that swarm upon the earth: the weasel, and the mouse, and the great lizard after its kinds,
3028	3	11	30	 and the gecko, and the land-crocodile, and the lizard, and the sand-lizard, and the chameleon.
3029	3	11	31	 These are they which are unclean to you among all that swarm; whosoever doth touch them, when they are dead, shall be unclean until the even.
3030	3	11	32	 And upon whatsoever any of them, when they are dead, doth fall, it shall be unclean; whether it be any vessel of wood, or raiment, or skin, or sack, whatsoever vessel it be, wherewith any work is done, it must be put into water, and it shall be unclean until the even; then shall it be clean.
3031	3	11	33	 And every earthen vessel whereinto any of them falleth, whatsoever is in it shall be unclean, and it ye shall break.
3032	3	11	34	 All food therein which may be eaten, that on which water cometh, shall be unclean; and all drink in every such vessel that may be drunk shall be unclean.
3033	3	11	35	 And every thing whereupon any part of their carcass falleth shall be unclean; whether oven, or range for pots, it shall be broken in pieces; they are unclean, and shall be unclean unto you.
3034	3	11	36	 Nevertheless a fountain or a cistern wherein is a gathering of water shall be clean; but he who toucheth their carcass shall be unclean.
3035	3	11	37	 And if aught of their carcass fall upon any sowing seed which is to be sown, it is clean.
3036	3	11	38	 But if water be put upon the seed, and aught of their carcass fall thereon, it is unclean unto you.
3037	3	11	39	 And if any beast, of which ye may eat, die, he that toucheth the carcass thereof shall be unclean until the even.
3038	3	11	40	 And he that eateth of the carcass of it shall wash his clothes, and be unclean until the even; he also that beareth the carcass of it shall wash his clothes, and be unclean until the even.
3039	3	11	41	 And every swarming thing that swarmeth upon the earth is a detestable thing; it shall not be eaten.
3040	3	11	42	 Whatsoever goeth upon the belly, and whatsoever goeth upon all fours, or whatsoever hath many feet, even all swarming things that swarm upon the earth, them ye shall not eat; for they are a detestable thing.
3041	3	11	43	 Ye shall not make yourselves detestable with any swarming thing that swarmeth, neither shall ye make yourselves unclean with them, that ye should be defiled thereby.
3042	3	11	44	 For I am the LORD your God; sanctify yourselves therefore, and be ye holy; for I am holy; neither shall ye defile yourselves with any manner of swarming thing that moveth upon the earth.
3043	3	11	45	 For I am the LORD that brought you up out of the land of Egypt, to be your God; ye shall therefore be holy, for I am holy.
3044	3	11	46	 This is the law of the beast, and of the fowl, and of every living creature that moveth in the waters, and of every creature that swarmeth upon the earth;
3045	3	11	47	 to make a difference between the unclean and the clean, and between the living thing that may be eaten and the living thing that may not be eaten.
3046	3	12	1	 And the LORD spoke unto Moses, saying:
3047	3	12	2	 Speak unto the children of Israel, saying: If a woman be delivered, and bear a man-child, then she shall be unclean seven days; as in the days of the impurity of her sickness shall she be unclean.
3048	3	12	3	 And in the eighth day the flesh of his foreskin shall be circumcised.
3049	3	12	4	 And she shall continue in the blood of purification three and thirty days; she shall touch no hallowed thing, nor come into the sanctuary, until the days of her purification be fulfilled.
3050	3	12	5	 But if she bear a maid-child, then she shall be unclean two weeks, as in her impurity; and she shall continue in the blood of purification threescore and six days.
3051	3	12	6	 And when the days of her purification are fulfilled, for a son, or for a daughter, she shall bring a lamb of the first year for a burnt-offering, and a young pigeon, or a turtle-dove, for a sin-offering, unto the door of the tent of meeting, unto the priest.
3052	3	12	7	 And he shall offer it before the LORD, and make atonement for her; and she shall be cleansed from the fountain of her blood. This is the law for her that beareth, whether a male or a female.
3053	3	12	8	 And if her means suffice not for a lamb, then she shall take two turtle-doves, or two young pigeons: the one for a burnt-offering, and the other for a sin-offering; and the priest shall make atonement for her, and she shall be clean.
3054	3	13	1	 And the LORD spoke unto Moses and unto Aaron, saying:
3055	3	13	2	 When a man shall have in the skin of his flesh a rising, or a scab, or a bright spot, and it become in the skin of his flesh the plague of leprosy, then he shall be brought unto Aaron the priest, or unto one of his sons the priests.
3056	3	13	3	 And the priest shall look upon the plague in the skin of the flesh; and if the hair in the plague be turned white, and the appearance of the plague be deeper than the skin of his flesh, it is the plague of leprosy; and the priest shall look on him, and pronounce him unclean.
3057	3	13	4	 And if the bright spot be white in the skin of his flesh, and the appearance thereof be not deeper than the skin, and the hair thereof be not turned white, then the priest shall shut up him that hath the plague seven days.
3058	3	13	5	 And the priest shall look on him the seventh day; and, behold, if the plague stay in its appearance, and the plague be not spread in the skin, then the priest shall shut him up seven days more.
3059	3	13	6	 And the priest shall look on him again the seventh day; and, behold, if the plague be dim, and the plague be not spread in the skin, then the priest shall pronounce him clean: it is a scab; and he shall wash his clothes, and be clean.
3060	3	13	7	 But if the scab spread abroad in the skin, after that he hath shown himself to the priest for his cleansing, he shall show himself to the priest again.
3061	3	13	8	 And the priest shall look, and, behold, if the scab be spread in the skin, then the priest shall pronounce him unclean: it is leprosy.
3062	3	13	9	 When the plague of leprosy is in a man, then he shall be brought unto the priest.
3063	3	13	10	 And the priest shall look, and, behold, if there be a white rising in the skin, and it have turned the hair white, and there be quick raw flesh in the rising,
3064	3	13	11	 it is an old leprosy in the skin of his flesh, and the priest shall pronounce him unclean; he shall not shut him up; for he is unclean.
3065	3	13	12	 And if the leprosy break out abroad in the skin, and the leprosy cover all the skin of him that hath the plague from his head even to his feet, as far as appeareth to the priest;
3066	3	13	13	 then the priest shall look; and, behold, if the leprosy have covered all his flesh, he shall pronounce him clean that hath the plague; it is all turned white: he is clean.
3067	3	13	14	 But whensoever raw flesh appeareth in him, he shall be unclean.
3068	3	13	15	 And the priest shall look on the raw flesh, and pronounce him unclean; the raw flesh is unclean: it is leprosy.
