3069	3	13	16	 But if the raw flesh again be turned into white, then he shall come unto the priest;
3070	3	13	17	 and the priest shall look on him; and, behold, if the plague be turned into white, then the priest shall pronounce him clean that hath the plague: he is clean.
3071	3	13	18	 And when the flesh hath in the skin thereof a boil, and it is healed,
3072	3	13	19	 and in the place of the boil there is a white rising, or a bright spot, reddish-white, then it shall be shown to the priest.
3073	3	13	20	 And the priest shall look; and, behold, if the appearance thereof be lower than the skin, and the hair thereof be turned white, then the priest shall pronounce him unclean: it is the plague of leprosy, it hath broken out in the boil.
3074	3	13	21	 But if the priest look on it, and, behold, there be no white hairs therein, and it be not lower than the skin, but be dim, then the priest shall shut him up seven days.
3075	3	13	22	 And if it spread abroad in the skin, then the priest shall pronounce him unclean: it is a plague.
3076	3	13	23	 But if the bright spot stay in its place, and be not spread, it is the scar of the boil; and the priest shall pronounce him clean.
3077	3	13	24	 Or when the flesh hath in the skin thereof a burning by fire, and the quick flesh of the burning become a bright spot, reddish-white, or white;
3078	3	13	25	 then the priest shall look upon it; and, behold, if the hair in the bright spot be turned white, and the appearance thereof be deeper than the skin, it is leprosy, it hath broken out in the burning; and the priest shall pronounce him unclean: it is the plague of leprosy.
3079	3	13	26	 But if the priest look on it, and, behold, there be no white hair in the bright spot, and it be no lower than the skin, but be dim; then the priest shall shut him up seven days.
3080	3	13	27	 And the priest shall look upon him the seventh day; if it spread abroad in the skin, then the priest shall pronounce him unclean: it is the plague of leprosy.
3081	3	13	28	 And if the bright spot stay in its place, and be not spread in the skin, but be dim, it is the rising of the burning, and the priest shall pronounce him clean; for it is the scar of the burning.
3082	3	13	29	 And when a man or woman hath a plague upon the head or upon the beard,
3083	3	13	30	 then the priest shall look on the plague; and, behold, if the appearance thereof be deeper than the skin, and there be in it yellow thin hair, then the priest shall pronounce him unclean: it is a scall, it is leprosy of the head or of the beard.
3084	3	13	31	 And if the priest look on the plague of the scall, and, behold, the appearance thereof be not deeper than the skin, and there be no black hair in it, then the priest shall shut up him that hath the plague of the scall seven days.
3085	3	13	32	 And in the seventh day the priest shall look on the plague; and, behold, if the scall be not spread, and there be in it no yellow hair, and the appearance of the scall be not deeper than the skin,
3086	3	13	33	 then he shall be shaven, but the scall shall he not shave; and the priest shall shut up him that hath the scall seven days more.
3087	3	13	34	 And in the seventh day the priest shall look on the scall; and, behold, if the scall be not spread in the skin, and the appearance thereof be not deeper than the skin, then the priest shall pronounce him clean; and he shall wash his clothes, and be clean.
3088	3	13	35	 But if the scall spread abroad in the skin after his cleansing,
3089	3	13	36	 then the priest shall look on him; and, behold, if the scall be spread in the skin, the priest shall not seek for the yellow hair: he is unclean.
3090	3	13	37	 But if the scall stay in its appearance, and black hair be grown up therein; the scall is healed, he is clean; and the priest shall pronounce him clean.
3091	3	13	38	 And if a man or a woman have in the skin of their flesh bright spots, even white bright spots;
3092	3	13	39	 then the priest shall look; and, behold, if the bright spots in the skin of their flesh be of a dull white, it is a tetter, it hath broken out in the skin: he is clean.
3093	3	13	40	 And if a man's hair be fallen off his head, he is bald; yet is he clean.
3094	3	13	41	 And if his hair be fallen off from the front part of his head, he is forehead-bald; yet is he clean.
3095	3	13	42	 But if there be in the bald head, or the bald forehead, a reddish-white plague, it is leprosy breaking out in his bald head, or his bald forehead.
3096	3	13	43	 Then the priest shall look upon him; and, behold, if the rising of the plague be reddish-white in his bald head, or in his bald forehead, as the appearance of leprosy in the skin of the flesh,
3097	3	13	44	 he is a leprous man, he is unclean; the priest shall surely pronounce him unclean: his plague is in his head.
3098	3	13	45	 And the leper in whom the plague is, his clothes shall be rent, and the hair of his head shall go loose, and he shall cover his upper lip, and shall cry: 'Unclean, unclean.'
3099	3	13	46	 All the days wherein the plague is in him he shall be unclean; he is unclean; he shall dwell alone; without the camp shall his dwelling be.
3100	3	13	47	 And when the plague of leprosy is in a garment, whether it be a woolen garment, or a linen garment;
3101	3	13	48	 or in the warp, or in the woof, whether they be of linen, or of wool; or in a skin, or in any thing made of skin.
3102	3	13	49	 If the plague be greenish or reddish in the garment, or in the skin, or in the warp, or in the woof, or in any thing of skin, it is the plague of leprosy, and shall be shown unto the priest.
3103	3	13	50	 And the priest shall look upon the plague, and shut up that which hath the plague seven days.
3104	3	13	51	 And he shall look on the plague on the seventh day: if the plague be spread in the garment, or in the warp, or in the woof, or in the skin, whatever service skin is used for, the plague is a malignant leprosy: it is unclean.
3105	3	13	52	 And he shall burn the garment, or the warp, or the woof, whether it be of wool or of linen, or any thing of skin, wherein the plague is; for it is a malignant leprosy; it shall be burnt in the fire.
3106	3	13	53	 And if the priest shall look, and, behold, the plague be not spread in the garment, or in the warp, or in the woof, or in any thing of skin;
3107	3	13	54	 then the priest shall command that they wash the thing wherein the plague is, and he shall shut it up seven days more.
3108	3	13	55	 And the priest shall look, after that the plague is washed; and, behold, if the plague have not changed its colour, and the plague be not spread, it is unclean; thou shalt burn it in the fire; it is a fret, whether the bareness be within or without.
3109	3	13	56	 And if the priest look, and, behold, the plague be dim after the washing thereof, then he shall rend it out of the garment, or out of the skin, or out of the warp, or out of the woof.
3110	3	13	57	 And if it appear still in the garment, or in the warp, or in the woof, or in any thing of skin, it is breaking out, thou shalt burn that wherein the plague is with fire.
3111	3	13	58	 And the garment, or the warp, or the woof, or whatsoever thing of skin it be, which thou shalt wash, if the plague be departed from them, then it shall be washed the second time, and shall be clean.
3112	3	13	59	 This is the law of the plague of leprosy in a garment of wool or linen, or in the warp, or in the woof, or in any thing of skin, to pronounce it clean, or to pronounce it unclean.
3113	3	14	1	 And the LORD spoke unto Moses, saying:
3114	3	14	2	 This shall be the law of the leper in the day of his cleansing: he shall be brought unto the priest.
3115	3	14	3	 And the priest shall go forth out of the camp; and the priest shall look, and, behold, if the plague of leprosy be healed in the leper;
3116	3	14	4	 then shall the priest command to take for him that is to be cleansed two living clean birds, and cedar-wood, and scarlet, and hyssop.
3117	3	14	5	 And the priest shall command to kill one of the birds in an earthen vessel over running water.
3118	3	14	6	 As for the living bird, he shall take it, and the cedar-wood, and the scarlet, and the hyssop, and shall dip them and the living bird in the blood of the bird that was killed over the running water.
3119	3	14	7	 And he shall sprinkle upon him that is to be cleansed from the leprosy seven times, and shall pronounce him clean, and shall let go the living bird into the open field.
3120	3	14	8	 And he that is to be cleansed shall wash his clothes, and shave off all his hair, and bathe himself in water, and he shall be clean; and after that he may come into the camp, but shall dwell outside his tent seven days.
3121	3	14	9	 And it shall be on the seventh day, that he shall shave all his hair off his head and his beard and his eyebrows, even all his hair he shall shave off; and he shall wash his clothes, and he shall bathe his flesh in water, and he shall be clean.
3122	3	14	10	 And on the eighth day he shall take two he-lambs without blemish, and one ewe-lamb of the first year without blemish, and three tenth parts of an ephah of fine flour for a meal-offering, mingled with oil, and one log of oil.
3123	3	14	11	 And the priest that cleanseth him shall set the man that is to be cleansed, and those things, before the LORD, at the door of the tent of meeting.
3124	3	14	12	 And the priest shall take one of the he-lambs, and offer him for a guilt-offering, and the log of oil, and wave them for a wave-offering before the LORD.
3125	3	14	13	 And he shall kill the he-lamb in the place where they kill the sin-offering and the burnt-offering, in the place of the sanctuary; for as the sin-offering is the priest's, so is the guilt-offering; it is most holy.
3126	3	14	14	 And the priest shall take of the blood of the guilt-offering, and the priest shall put it upon the tip of the right ear of him that is to be cleansed, and upon the thumb of his right hand, and upon the great toe of his right foot.
3127	3	14	15	 And the priest shall take of the log of oil, and pour it into the palm of his own left hand.
3128	3	14	16	 And the priest shall dip his right finger in the oil that is in his left hand, and shall sprinkle of the oil with his finger seven times before the LORD.
3129	3	14	17	 And of the rest of the oil that is in his hand shall the priest put upon the tip of the right ear of him that is to be cleansed, and upon the thumb of his right hand, and upon the great toe of his right foot, upon the blood of the guilt-offering.
3130	3	14	18	 And the rest of the oil that is in the priest's hand he shall put upon the head of him that is to be cleansed; and the priest shall make atonement for him before the LORD.
3131	3	14	19	 And the priest shall offer the sin-offering, and make atonement for him that is to be cleansed because of his uncleanness; and afterward he shall kill the burnt-offering.
3132	3	14	20	 And the priest shall offer the burnt-offering and the meal-offering upon the altar; and the priest shall make atonement for him, and he shall be clean.
3133	3	14	21	 And if he be poor, and his means suffice not, then he shall take one he-lamb for a guilt-offering to be waved, to make atonement for him, and one tenth part of an ephah of fine flour mingled with oil for a meal-offering, and a log of oil;
3134	3	14	22	 and two turtle-doves, or two young pigeons, such as his means suffice for; and the one shall be a sin-offering, and the other a burnt-offering.
3135	3	14	23	 And on the eighth day he shall bring them for his cleansing unto the priest, unto the door of the tent of meeting, before the LORD.
3136	3	14	24	 And the priest shall take the lamb of the guilt-offering, and the log of oil, and the priest shall wave them for a wave-offering before the LORD.
3137	3	14	25	 And he shall kill the lamb of the guilt-offering, and the priest shall take of the blood of the guilt-offering, and put it upon the tip of the right ear of him that is to be cleansed, and upon the thumb of his right hand, and upon the great toe of his right foot.
3138	3	14	26	 And the priest shall pour of the oil into the palm of his own left hand.
3139	3	14	27	 And the priest shall sprinkle with his right finger some of the oil that is in his left hand seven times before the LORD.
3140	3	14	28	 And the priest shall put of the oil that is in his hand upon the tip of the right ear of him that is to be cleansed, and upon the thumb of his right hand, and upon the great toe of his right foot, upon the place of the blood of the guilt-offering.
3141	3	14	29	 And the rest of the oil that is in the priest's hand he shall put upon the head of him that is to be cleansed, to make atonement for him before the LORD.
3142	3	14	30	 And he shall offer one of the turtle-doves, or of the young pigeons, such as his means suffice for;
3143	3	14	31	 even such as his means suffice for, the one for a sin-offering, and the other for a burnt-offering, with the meal-offering; and the priest shall make atonement for him that is to be cleansed before the LORD.
3144	3	14	32	 This is the law of him in whom is the plague of leprosy, whose means suffice not for that which pertaineth to his cleansing.
3145	3	14	33	 And the LORD spoke unto Moses and unto Aaron, saying:
3146	3	14	34	 When ye are come into the land of Canaan, which I give to you for a possession, and I put the plague of leprosy in a house of the land of your possession;
3147	3	14	35	 then he that owneth the house shall come and tell the priest, saying: 'There seemeth to me to be as it were a plague in the house.'
3148	3	14	36	 And the priest shall command that they empty the house, before the priest go in to see the plague, that all that is in the house be not made unclean; and afterward the priest shall go in to see the house.
3149	3	14	37	 And he shall look on the plague, and, behold, if the plague be in the walls of the house with hollow streaks, greenish or reddish, and the appearance thereof be lower than the wall;
3150	3	14	38	 then the priest shall go out of the house to the door of the house, and shut up the house seven days.
3151	3	14	39	 And the priest shall come again the seventh day, and shall look; and, behold, if the plague be spread in the walls of the house;
3152	3	14	40	 then the priest shall command that they take out the stones in which the plague is, and cast them into an unclean place without the city.
3153	3	14	41	 And he shall cause the house to be scraped within round about, and they shall pour out the mortar that they scrape off without the city into an unclean place.
3154	3	14	42	 And they shall take other stones, and put them in the place of those stones; and he shall take other mortar, and shall plaster the house.
3155	3	14	43	 And if the plague come again, and break out in the house, after that the stones have been taken out, and after the house hath been scraped, and after it is plastered;
3156	3	14	44	 then the priest shall come in and look; and, behold, if the plague be spread in the house, it is a malignant leprosy in the house: it is unclean.
3157	3	14	45	 And he shall break down the house, the stones of it, and the timber thereof, and all the mortar of the house; and he shall carry them forth out of the city into an unclean place.
3158	3	14	46	 Moreover he that goeth into the house all the while that it is shut up shall be unclean until the even.
3159	3	14	47	 And he that lieth in the house shall wash his clothes; and he that eateth in the house shall wash his clothes.
3160	3	14	48	 And if the priest shall come in, and look, and, behold, the plague hath not spread in the house, after the house was plastered; then the priest shall pronounce the house clean, because the plague is healed.
3161	3	14	49	 And he shall take to cleanse the house two birds, and cedar-wood, and scarlet, and hyssop.
3162	3	14	50	 And he shall kill one of the birds in an earthen vessel over running water.
3163	3	14	51	 And he shall take the cedar-wood, and the hyssop, and the scarlet, and the living bird, and dip them in the blood of the slain bird, and in the running water, and sprinkle the house seven times.
3164	3	14	52	 And he shall cleanse the house with the blood of the bird, and with the running water, and with the living bird, and with the cedar-wood, and with the hyssop, and with the scarlet.
3165	3	14	53	 But he shall let go the living bird out of the city into the open field; so shall he make atonement for the house; and it shall be clean.
3166	3	14	54	 This is the law for all manner of plague of leprosy, and for a scall;
3167	3	14	55	 and for the leprosy of a garment, and for a house;
3168	3	14	56	 and for a rising, and for a scab, and for a bright spot;
3169	3	14	57	 to teach when it is unclean, and when it is clean; this is the law of leprosy.
3170	3	15	1	 And the LORD spoke unto Moses and to Aaron, saying:
3171	3	15	2	 Speak unto the children of Israel, and say unto them: When any man hath an issue out of his flesh, his issue is unclean.
3172	3	15	3	 And this shall be his uncleanness in his issue: whether his flesh run with his issue, or his flesh be stopped from his issue, it is his uncleanness.
3173	3	15	4	 Every bed whereon he that hath the issue lieth shall be unclean; and every thing whereon he sitteth shall be unclean.
3174	3	15	5	 And whosoever toucheth his bed shall wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the even.
3175	3	15	6	 And he that sitteth on any thing whereon he that hath the issue sat shall wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the even.
3176	3	15	7	 And he that toucheth the flesh of him that hath the issue shall wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the even.
3177	3	15	8	 And if he that hath the issue spit upon him that is clean, then he shall wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the even.
3178	3	15	9	 And what saddle soever he that hath the issue rideth upon shall be unclean.
3179	3	15	10	 And whosoever toucheth any thing that was under him shall be unclean until the even; and he that beareth those things shall wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the even.
3180	3	15	11	 And whomsoever he that hath the issue toucheth, without having rinsed his hands in water, he shall wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the even.
3181	3	15	12	 And the earthen vessel, which he that hath the issue toucheth, shall be broken; and every vessel of wood shall be rinsed in water.
3182	3	15	13	 And when he that hath an issue is cleansed of his issue, then he shall number to himself seven days for his cleansing, and wash his clothes; and he shall bathe his flesh in running water, and shall be clean.
3183	3	15	14	 And on the eighth day he shall take to him two turtle-doves, or two young pigeons, and come before the LORD unto the door of the tent of meeting, and give them unto the priest.
3184	3	15	15	 And the priest shall offer them, the one for a sin-offering, and the other for a burnt-offering; and the priest shall make atonement for him before the LORD for his issue.
3185	3	15	16	 And if the flow of seed go out from a man, then he shall bathe all his flesh in water, and be unclean until the even.
3186	3	15	17	 And every garment, and every skin, whereon is the flow of seed, shall be washed with water, and be unclean until the even.
3187	3	15	18	 The woman also with whom a man shall lie carnally, they shall both bathe themselves in water, and be unclean until the even.
3188	3	15	19	 And if a woman have an issue, and her issue in her flesh be blood, she shall be in her impurity seven days; and whosoever toucheth her shall be unclean until the even.
3189	3	15	20	 And every thing that she lieth upon in her impurity shall be unclean; every thing also that she sitteth upon shall be unclean.
3190	3	15	21	 And whosoever toucheth her bed shall wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the even.
3191	3	15	22	 And whosoever toucheth any thing that she sitteth upon shall wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the even.
3192	3	15	23	 And if he be on the bed, or on any thing whereon she sitteth, when he toucheth it, he shall be unclean until the even.
3193	3	15	24	 And if any man lie with her, and her impurity be upon him, he shall be unclean seven days; and every bed whereon he lieth shall be unclean.
3194	3	15	25	 And if a woman have an issue of her blood many days not in the time of her impurity, or if she have an issue beyond the time of her impurity; all the days of the issue of her uncleanness she shall be as in the days of her impurity: she is unclean.
3195	3	15	26	 Every bed whereon she lieth all the days of her issue shall be unto her as the bed of her impurity; and every thing whereon she sitteth shall be unclean, as the uncleanness of her impurity.
3196	3	15	27	 And whosoever toucheth those things shall be unclean, and shall wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the even.
3197	3	15	28	 But if she be cleansed of her issue, then she shall number to herself seven days, and after that she shall be clean.
3198	3	15	29	 And on the eighth day she shall take unto her two turtle-doves, or two young pigeons, and bring them unto the priest, to the door of the tent of meeting.
3199	3	15	30	 And the priest shall offer the one for a sin-offering, and the other for a burnt-offering; and the priest shall make atonement for her before the LORD for the issue of her uncleanness.
3200	3	15	31	 Thus shall ye separate the children of Israel from their uncleanness; that they die not in their uncleanness, when they defile My tabernacle that is in the midst of them.
3201	3	15	32	 This is the law of him that hath an issue, and of him from whom the flow of seed goeth out, so that he is unclean thereby;
3202	3	15	33	 and of her that is sick with her impurity, and of them that have an issue, whether it be a man, or a woman; and of him that lieth with her that is unclean.
3203	3	16	1	 And the LORD spoke unto Moses, after the death of the two sons of Aaron, when they drew near before the LORD, and died;
3204	3	16	2	 and the LORD said unto Moses: 'Speak unto Aaron thy brother, that he come not at all times into the holy place within the veil, before the ark-cover which is upon the ark; that he die not; for I appear in the cloud upon the ark-cover.
3205	3	16	3	 Herewith shall Aaron come into the holy place: with a young bullock for a sin-offering, and a ram for a burnt-offering.
3206	3	16	4	 He shall put on the holy linen tunic, and he shall have the linen breeches upon his flesh, and shall be girded with the linen girdle, and with the linen mitre shall he be attired; they are the holy garments; and he shall bathe his flesh in water, and put them on.
3207	3	16	5	 And he shall take of the congregation of the children of Israel two he-goats for a sin-offering, and one ram for a burnt-offering.
3208	3	16	6	 And Aaron shall present the bullock of the sin-offering, which is for himself, and make atonement for himself, and for his house.
3209	3	16	7	 And he shall take the two goats, and set them before the LORD at the door of the tent of meeting.
3210	3	16	8	 And Aaron shall cast lots upon the two goats: one lot for the LORD, and the other lot for Azazel.
3211	3	16	9	 And Aaron shall present the goat upon which the lot fell for the LORD, and offer him for a sin-offering.
3212	3	16	10	 But the goat, on which the lot fell for Azazel, shall be set alive before the LORD, to make atonement over him, to send him away for Azazel into the wilderness.
3213	3	16	11	 And Aaron shall present the bullock of the sin-offering, which is for himself, and shall make atonement for himself, and for his house, and shall kill the bullock of the sin-offering which is for himself.
3214	3	16	12	 And he shall take a censer full of coals of fire from off the altar before the LORD, and his hands full of sweet incense beaten small, and bring it within the veil.
3215	3	16	13	 And he shall put the incense upon the fire before the LORD, that the cloud of the incense may cover the ark-cover that is upon the testimony, that he die not.
3216	3	16	14	 And he shall take of the blood of the bullock, and sprinkle it with his finger upon the ark-cover on the east; and before the ark-cover shall he sprinkle of the blood with his finger seven times.
3217	3	16	15	 Then shall he kill the goat of the sin-offering, that is for the people, and bring his blood within the veil, and do with his blood as he did with the blood of the bullock, and sprinkle it upon the ark-cover, and before the ark-cover.
3218	3	16	16	 And he shall make atonement for the holy place, because of the uncleannesses of the children of Israel, and because of their transgressions, even all their sins; and so shall he do for the tent of meeting, that dwelleth with them in the midst of their uncleannesses.
3219	3	16	17	 And there shall be no man in the tent of meeting when he goeth in to make atonement in the holy place, until he come out, and have made atonement for himself, and for his household, and for all the assembly of Israel.
3220	3	16	18	 And he shall go out unto the altar that is before the LORD, and make atonement for it; and shall take of the blood of the bullock, and of the blood of the goat, and put it upon the horns of the altar round about.
3221	3	16	19	 And he shall sprinkle of the blood upon it with his finger seven times, and cleanse it, and hallow it from the uncleannesses of the children of Israel.
3222	3	16	20	 And when he hath made an end of atoning for the holy place, and the tent of meeting, and the altar, he shall present the live goat.
3223	3	16	21	 And Aaron shall lay both his hands upon the head of the live goat, and confess over him all the iniquities of the children of Israel, and all their transgressions, even all their sins; and he shall put them upon the head of the goat, and shall send him away by the hand of an appointed man into the wilderness.
3224	3	16	22	 And the goat shall bear upon him all their iniquities unto a land which is cut off; and he shall let go the goat in the wilderness.
3225	3	16	23	 And Aaron shall come into the tent of meeting, and shall put off the linen garments, which he put on when he went into the holy place, and shall leave them there.
3226	3	16	24	 And he shall bathe his flesh in water in a holy place and put on his other vestments, and come forth, and offer his burnt-offering and the burnt-offering of the people, and make atonement for himself and for the people.
3227	3	16	25	 And the fat of the sin-offering shall he make smoke upon the altar.
3228	3	16	26	 And he that letteth go the goat for Azazel shall wash his clothes, and bathe his flesh in water, and afterward he may come into the camp.
3229	3	16	27	 And the bullock of the sin-offering, and the goat of the sin-offering, whose blood was brought in to make atonement in the holy place, shall be carried forth without the camp; and they shall burn in the fire their skins, and their flesh, and their dung.
3230	3	16	28	 And he that burneth them shall wash his clothes, and bathe his flesh in water, and afterward he may come into the camp.
3231	3	16	29	 And it shall be a statute for ever unto you: in the seventh month, on the tenth day of the month, ye shall afflict your souls, and shall do no manner of work, the home-born, or the stranger that sojourneth among you.
3232	3	16	30	 For on this day shall atonement be made for you, to cleanse you; from all your sins shall ye be clean before the LORD.
3233	3	16	31	 It is a sabbath of solemn rest unto you, and ye shall afflict your souls; it is a statute for ever.
3234	3	16	32	 And the priest, who shall be anointed and who shall be consecrated to be priest in his father's stead, shall make the atonement, and shall put on the linen garments, even the holy garments.
3235	3	16	33	 And he shall make atonement for the most holy place, and he shall make atonement for the tent of meeting and for the altar; and he shall make atonement for the priests and for all the people of the assembly.
3236	3	16	34	 And this shall be an everlasting statute unto you, to make atonement for the children of Israel because of all their sins once in the year.' And he did as the LORD commanded Moses.
3237	3	17	1	 And the LORD spoke unto Moses, saying:
3238	3	17	2	 Speak unto Aaron, and unto his sons, and unto all the children of Israel, and say unto them: This is the thing which the LORD hath commanded, saying:
3239	3	17	3	 What man soever there be of the house of Israel, that killeth an ox, or lamb, or goat, in the camp, or that killeth it without the camp,
3240	3	17	4	 and hath not brought it unto the door of the tent of meeting, to present it as an offering unto the LORD before the tabernacle of the LORD, blood shall be imputed unto that man; he hath shed blood; and that man shall be cut off from among his people.
3241	3	17	5	 To the end that the children of Israel may bring their sacrifices, which they sacrifice in the open field, even that they may bring them unto the LORD, unto the door of the tent of meeting, unto the priest, and sacrifice them for sacrifices of peace-offerings unto the LORD.
3242	3	17	6	 And the priest shall dash the blood against the altar of the LORD at the door of the tent of meeting, and make the fat smoke for a sweet savour unto the LORD.
3243	3	17	7	 And they shall no more sacrifice their sacrifices unto the satyrs, after whom they go astray. This shall be a statute for ever unto them throughout their generations.
3244	3	17	8	 And thou shalt say unto them: Whatsoever man there be of the house of Israel, or of the strangers that sojourn among them, that offereth a burnt-offering or sacrifice,
3245	3	17	9	 and bringeth it not unto the door of the tent of meeting, to sacrifice it unto the LORD, even that man shall be cut off from his people.
3246	3	17	10	 And whatsoever man there be of the house of Israel, or of the strangers that sojourn among them, that eateth any manner of blood, I will set My face against that soul that eateth blood, and will cut him off from among his people.
3247	3	17	11	 For the life of the flesh is in the blood; and I have given it to you upon the altar to make atonement for your souls; for it is the blood that maketh atonement by reason of the life.
3248	3	17	12	 Therefore I said unto the children of Israel: No soul of you shall eat blood, neither shall any stranger that sojourneth among you eat blood.
3249	3	17	13	 And whatsoever man there be of the children of Israel, or of the strangers that sojourn among them, that taketh in hunting any beast or fowl that may be eaten, he shall pour out the blood thereof, and cover it with dust.
3250	3	17	14	 For as to the life of all flesh, the blood thereof is all one with the life thereof; therefore I said unto the children of Israel: Ye shall eat the blood of no manner of flesh; for the life of all flesh is the blood thereof; whosoever eateth it shall be cut off.
3251	3	17	15	 And every soul that eateth that which dieth of itself, or that which is torn of beasts, whether he be home-born or a stranger, he shall wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the even; then shall he be clean.
3252	3	17	16	 But if he wash them not, nor bathe his flesh, then he shall bear his iniquity.
3253	3	18	1	 And the LORD spoke unto Moses, saying:
3254	3	18	2	 Speak unto the children of Israel, and say unto them: I am the LORD your God.
3255	3	18	3	 After the doings of the land of Egypt, wherein ye dwelt, shall ye not do; and after the doings of the land of Canaan, whither I bring you, shall ye not do; neither shall ye walk in their statutes.
3256	3	18	4	 Mine ordinances shall ye do, and My statutes shall ye keep, to walk therein: I am the LORD your God.
3257	3	18	5	 Ye shall therefore keep My statutes, and Mine ordinances, which if a man do, he shall live by them: I am the LORD.
3258	3	18	6	 None of you shall approach to any that is near of kin to him, to uncover their nakedness. I am the LORD.
3259	3	18	7	 The nakedness of thy father, and the nakedness of thy mother, shalt thou not uncover: she is thy mother; thou shalt not uncover her nakedness.
3260	3	18	8	 The nakedness of thy father's wife shalt thou not uncover: it is thy father's nakedness.
3261	3	18	9	 The nakedness of thy sister, the daughter of thy father, or the daughter of thy mother, whether born at home, or born abroad, even their nakedness thou shalt not uncover.
3262	3	18	10	 The nakedness of thy son's daughter, or of thy daughter's daughter, even their nakedness thou shalt not uncover; for theirs is thine own nakedness.
3263	3	18	11	 The nakedness of thy father's wife's daughter, begotten of thy father, she is thy sister, thou shalt not uncover her nakedness.
3264	3	18	12	 Thou shalt not uncover the nakedness of thy father's sister: she is thy father's near kinswoman.
3265	3	18	13	 Thou shalt not uncover the nakedness of thy mother's sister; for she is thy mother's near kinswoman.
3266	3	18	14	 Thou shalt not uncover the nakedness of thy fathers brother, thou shalt not approach to his wife: she is thine aunt.
3267	3	18	15	 Thou shalt not uncover the nakedness of thy daughter-in-law: she is thy son' wife; thou shalt not uncover her nakedness.
3268	3	18	16	 Thou shalt not uncover the nakedness of thy brother's wife: it is thy brother's nakedness.
3269	3	18	17	 Thou shalt not uncover the nakedness of a woman and her daughter; thou shalt not take her son's daughter, or her daughter's daughter, to uncover her nakedness: they are near kinswomen; it is lewdness.
3270	3	18	18	 And thou shalt not take a woman to her sister, to be a rival to her, to uncover her nakedness, beside the other in her lifetime.
3271	3	18	19	 And thou shalt not approach unto a woman to uncover her nakedness, as long as she is impure by her uncleanness.
3272	3	18	20	 And thou shalt not lie carnally with thy neighbour's wife, to defile thyself with her.
3273	3	18	21	 And thou shalt not give any of thy seed to set them apart to Molech, neither shalt thou profane the name of thy God: I am the LORD.
3274	3	18	22	 Thou shalt not lie with mankind, as with womankind; it is abomination.
3275	3	18	23	 And thou shalt not lie with any beast to defile thyself therewith; neither shall any woman stand before a beast, to lie down thereto; it is perversion.
3276	3	18	24	 Defile not ye yourselves in any of these things; for in all these the nations are defiled, which I cast out from before you.
3277	3	18	25	 And the land was defiled, therefore I did visit the iniquity thereof upon it, and the land vomited out her inhabitants.
3278	3	18	26	 Ye therefore shall keep My statutes and Mine ordinances, and shall not do any of these abominations; neither the home-born, nor the stranger that sojourneth among you--
3279	3	18	27	 for all these abominations have the men of the land done, that were before you, and the land is defiled--
3280	3	18	28	 that the land vomit not you out also, when ye defile it, as it vomited out the nation that was before you.
3281	3	18	29	 For whosoever shall do any of these abominations, even the souls that do them shall be cut off from among their people.
3282	3	18	30	 Therefore shall ye keep My charge, that ye do not any of these abominable customs, which were done before you, and that ye defile not yourselves therein: I am the LORD your God.
3283	3	19	1	 And the LORD spoke unto Moses, saying:
3284	3	19	2	 Speak unto all the congregation of the children of Israel, and say unto them: Ye shall be holy; for I the LORD your God am holy.
3285	3	19	3	 Ye shall fear every man his mother, and his father, and ye shall keep My sabbaths: I am the LORD your God.
3286	3	19	4	 Turn ye not unto the idols, nor make to yourselves molten gods: I am the LORD your God.
3287	3	19	5	 And when ye offer a sacrifice of peace-offerings unto the LORD, ye shall offer it that ye may be accepted.
3288	3	19	6	 It shall be eaten the same day ye offer it, and on the morrow; and if aught remain until the third day, it shall be burnt with fire.
3289	3	19	7	 And if it be eaten at all on the third day, it is a vile thing; it shall not be accepted.
3290	3	19	8	 But every one that eateth it shall bear his iniquity, because he hath profaned the holy thing of the LORD; and that soul shall be cut off from his people.
3291	3	19	9	 And when ye reap the harvest of your land, thou shalt not wholly reap the corner of thy field, neither shalt thou gather the gleaning of thy harvest.
3292	3	19	10	 And thou shalt not glean thy vineyard, neither shalt thou gather the fallen fruit of thy vineyard; thou shalt leave them for the poor and for the stranger: I am the LORD your God.
3293	3	19	11	 Ye shall not steal; neither shall ye deal falsely, nor lie one to another.
3294	3	19	12	 And ye shall not swear by My name falsely, so that thou profane the name of thy God: I am the LORD.
3295	3	19	13	 Thou shalt not oppress thy neighbour, nor rob him; the wages of a hired servant shall not abide with thee all night until the morning.
3296	3	19	14	 Thou shalt not curse the deaf, nor put a stumbling-block before the blind, but thou shalt fear thy God: I am the LORD.
3297	3	19	15	 Ye shall do no unrighteousness in judgment; thou shalt not respect the person of the poor, nor favour the person of the mighty; but in righteousness shalt thou judge thy neighbour.
3298	3	19	16	 Thou shalt not go up and down as a talebearer among thy people; neither shalt thou stand idly by the blood of thy neighbour: I am the LORD.
3299	3	19	17	 Thou shalt not hate thy brother in thy heart; thou shalt surely rebuke thy neighbour, and not bear sin because of him.
3300	3	19	18	 Thou shalt not take vengeance, nor bear any grudge against the children of thy people, but thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself: I am the LORD.
3301	3	19	19	 Ye shall keep My statutes. Thou shalt not let thy cattle gender with a diverse kind; thou shalt not sow thy field with two kinds of seed; neither shall there come upon thee a garment of two kinds of stuff mingled together.
3302	3	19	20	 And whosoever lieth carnally with a woman, that is a bondmaid, designated for a man, and not at all redeemed, nor was freedom given her; there shall be inquisition; they shall not be put to death, because she was not free.
3303	3	19	21	 And he shall bring his forfeit unto the LORD, unto the door of the tent of meeting, even a ram for a guilt-offering.
3304	3	19	22	 And the priest shall make atonement for him with the ram of the guilt-offering before the LORD for his sin which he hath sinned; and he shall be forgiven for his sin which he hath sinned.
3305	3	19	23	 And when ye shall come into the land, and shall have planted all manner of trees for food, then ye shall count the fruit thereof as forbidden; three years shall it be as forbidden unto you; it shall not be eaten.
3306	3	19	24	 And in the fourth year all the fruit thereof shall be holy, for giving praise unto the LORD.
3307	3	19	25	 But in the fifth year may ye eat of the fruit thereof, that it may yield unto you more richly the increase thereof: I am the LORD your God.
3308	3	19	26	 Ye shall not eat with the blood; neither shall ye practise divination nor soothsaying.
3309	3	19	27	 Ye shall not round the corners of your heads, neither shalt thou mar the corners of thy beard.
3310	3	19	28	 Ye shall not make any cuttings in your flesh for the dead, nor imprint any marks upon you: I am the LORD.
3311	3	19	29	 Profane not thy daughter, to make her a harlot, lest the land fall into harlotry, and the land become full of lewdness.
3312	3	19	30	 Ye shall keep My sabbaths, and reverence My sanctuary: I am the LORD.
3313	3	19	31	 Turn ye not unto the ghosts, nor unto familiar spirits; seek them not out, to be defiled by them: I am the LORD your God.
3314	3	19	32	 Thou shalt rise up before the hoary head, and honour the face of the old man, and thou shalt fear thy God: I am the LORD.
3315	3	19	33	 And if a stranger sojourn with thee in your land, ye shall not do him wrong.
3316	3	19	34	 The stranger that sojourneth with you shall be unto you as the home-born among you, and thou shalt love him as thyself; for ye were strangers in the land of Egypt: I am the LORD your God.
3317	3	19	35	 Ye shall do no unrighteousness in judgment, in meteyard, in weight, or in measure.
3318	3	19	36	 Just balances, just weights, a just ephah, and a just hin, shall ye have: I am the LORD your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt.
3319	3	19	37	 And ye shall observe all My statutes, and all Mine ordinances, and do them: I am the LORD.
3320	3	20	1	 And the LORD spoke unto Moses, saying:
3321	3	20	2	 Moreover, thou shalt say to the children of Israel: Whosoever he be of the children of Israel, or of the strangers that sojourn in Israel, that giveth of his seed unto Molech; he shall surely be put to death; the people of the land shall stone him with stones.
3322	3	20	3	 I also will set My face against that man, and will cut him off from among his people, because he hath given of his seed unto Molech, to defile My sanctuary, and to profane My holy name.
3323	3	20	4	 And if the people of the land do at all hide their eyes from that man, when he giveth of his seed unto Molech, and put him not to death;
3324	3	20	5	 then I will set My face against that man, and against his family, and will cut him off, and all that go astray after him, to go astray after Molech, from among their people.
3325	3	20	6	 And the soul that turneth unto the ghosts, and unto the familiar spirits, to go astray after them, I will even set My face against that soul, and will cut him off from among his people.
3326	3	20	7	 Sanctify yourselves therefore, and be ye holy; for I am the LORD your God.
3327	3	20	8	 And keep ye My statutes, and do them: I am the LORD who sanctify you.
3328	3	20	9	 For whatsoever man there be that curseth his father or his mother shall surely be put to death; he hath cursed his father or his mother; his blood shall be upon him.
3329	3	20	10	 And the man that committeth adultery with another man's wife, even he that committeth adultery with his neighbour's wife, both the adulterer and the adulteress shall surely be put to death.
3330	3	20	11	 And the man that lieth with his father's wife--he hath uncovered his father's nakedness--both of them shall surely be put to death; their blood shall be upon them.
3331	3	20	12	 And if a man lie with his daughter-in-law, both of them shall surely be put to death; they have wrought corruption; their blood shall be upon them.
3332	3	20	13	 And if a man lie with mankind, as with womankind, both of them have committed abomination: they shall surely be put to death; their blood shall be upon them.
3333	3	20	14	 And if a man take with his wife also her mother, it is wickedness: they shall be burnt with fire, both he and they; that there be no wickedness among you.
3334	3	20	15	 And if a man lie with a beast, he shall surely be put to death; and ye shall slay the beast.
3335	3	20	16	 And if a woman approach unto any beast, and lie down thereto, thou shalt kill the woman, and the beast: they shall surely be put to death; their blood shall be upon them.
3336	3	20	17	 And if a man shall take his sister, his father's daughter, or his mother's daughter, and see her nakedness, and she see his nakedness: it is a shameful thing; and they shall be cut off in the sight of the children of their people: he hath uncovered his sister's nakedness; he shall bear his iniquity.
3337	3	20	18	 And if a man shall lie with a woman having her sickness, and shall uncover her nakedness--he hath made naked her fountain, and she hath uncovered the fountain of her blood--both of them shall be cut off from among their people.
3338	3	20	19	 And thou shalt not uncover the nakedness of thy mother's sister, nor of thy father's sister; for he hath made naked his near kin; they shall bear their iniquity.
3339	3	20	20	 And if a man shall lie with his uncle's wife--he hath uncovered his uncle's nakedness--they shall bear their sin; they shall die childless.
3340	3	20	21	 And if a man shall take his brother's wife, it is impurity: he hath uncovered his brother's nakedness; they shall be childless.
3341	3	20	22	 Ye shall therefore keep all My statutes, and all Mine ordinances, and do them, that the land, whither I bring you to dwell therein, vomit you not out.
3342	3	20	23	 And ye shall not walk in the customs of the nation, which I am casting out before you; for they did all these things, and therefore I abhorred them.
3343	3	20	24	 But I have said unto you: 'Ye shall inherit their land, and I will give it unto you to possess it, a land flowing with milk and honey.' I am the LORD your God, who have set you apart from the peoples.
3344	3	20	25	 Ye shall therefore separate between the clean beast and the unclean, and between the unclean fowl and the clean; and ye shall not make your souls detestable by beast, or by fowl, or by any thing wherewith the ground teemeth, which I have set apart for you to hold unclean.
3345	3	20	26	 And ye shall be holy unto Me; for I the LORD am holy, and have set you apart from the peoples, that ye should be Mine.
3346	3	20	27	 A man also or a woman that divineth by a ghost or a familiar spirit, shall surely be put to death; they shall stone them with stones; their blood shall be upon them.
3347	3	21	1	 And the LORD said unto Moses: Speak unto the priests the sons of Aaron, and say unto them: There shall none defile himself for the dead among his people;
3348	3	21	2	 except for his kin, that is near unto him, for his mother, and for his father, and for his son, and for his daughter, and for his brother;
3349	3	21	3	 and for his sister a virgin, that is near unto him, that hath had no husband, for her may he defile himself.
3350	3	21	4	 He shall not defile himself, being a chief man among his people, to profane himself.
3351	3	21	5	 They shall not make baldness upon their head, neither shall they shave off the corners of their beard, nor make any cuttings in their flesh.
3352	3	21	6	 They shall be holy unto their God, and not profane the name of their God; for the offerings of the LORD made by fire, the bread of their God, they do offer; therefore they shall be holy.
3353	3	21	7	 They shall not take a woman that is a harlot, or profaned; neither shall they take a woman put away from her husband; for he is holy unto his God.
3354	3	21	8	 Thou shalt sanctify him therefore; for he offereth the bread of thy God; he shall be holy unto thee; for I the LORD, who sanctify you, am holy.
3355	3	21	9	 And the daughter of any priest, if she profane herself by playing the harlot, she profaneth her father: she shall be burnt with fire.
3356	3	21	10	 And the priest that is highest among his brethren, upon whose head the anointing oil is poured, and that is consecrated to put on the garments, shall not let the hair of his head go loose, nor rend his clothes;
3357	3	21	11	 neither shall he go in to any dead body, nor defile himself for his father, or for his mother;
3358	3	21	12	 neither shall he go out of the sanctuary, nor profane the sanctuary of his God; for the consecration of the anointing oil of his God is upon him: I am the LORD.
3359	3	21	13	 And he shall take a wife in her virginity.
3360	3	21	14	 A widow, or one divorced, or a profaned woman, or a harlot, these shall he not take; but a virgin of his own people shall he take to wife.
3361	3	21	15	 And he shall not profane his seed among his people; for I am the LORD who sanctify him.
3362	3	21	16	 And the LORD spoke unto Moses, saying:
3363	3	21	17	 Speak unto Aaron, saying: Whosoever he be of thy seed throughout their generations that hath a blemish, let him not approach to offer the bread of his God.
3364	3	21	18	 For whatsoever man he be that hath a blemish, he shall not approach: a blind man, or a lame, or he that hath any thing maimed, or anything too long,
3365	3	21	19	 or a man that is broken-footed, or broken-handed,
3366	3	21	20	 or crook-backed, or a dwarf, or that hath his eye overspread, or is scabbed, or scurvy, or hath his stones crushed;
3367	3	21	21	 no man of the seed of Aaron the priest, that hath a blemish, shall come nigh to offer the offerings of the LORD made by fire; he hath a blemish; he shall not come nigh to offer the bread of his God.
3368	3	21	22	 He may eat the bread of his God, both of the most holy, and of the holy.
3369	3	21	23	 Only he shall not go in unto the veil, nor come nigh unto the altar, because he hath a blemish; that he profane not My holy places; for I am the LORD who sanctify them.
3370	3	21	24	 So Moses spoke unto Aaron, and to his sons, and unto all the children of Israel.
3371	3	22	1	 And the LORD spoke unto Moses, saying:
3372	3	22	2	 Speak unto Aaron and to his sons, that they separate themselves from the holy things of the children of Israel, which they hallow unto Me, and that they profane not My holy name: I am the LORD.
3373	3	22	3	 Say unto them: Whosoever he be of all your seed throughout your generations, that approacheth unto the holy things, which the children of Israel hallow unto the LORD, having his uncleanness upon him, that soul shall be cut off from before Me: I am the LORD.
3374	3	22	4	 What man soever of the seed of Aaron is a leper, or hath an issue, he shall not eat of the holy things, until he be clean. And whoso toucheth any one that is unclean by the dead; or from whomsoever the flow of seed goeth out;
3375	3	22	5	 or whosoever toucheth any swarming thing, whereby he may be made unclean, or a man of whom he may take uncleanness, whatsoever uncleanness he hath;
3376	3	22	6	 the soul that toucheth any such shall be unclean until the even, and shall not eat of the holy things, unless he bathe his flesh in water.
3377	3	22	7	 And when the sun is down, he shall be clean; and afterward he may eat of the holy things, because it is his bread.
3378	3	22	8	 That which dieth of itself, or is torn of beasts, he shall not eat to defile himself therewith: I am the LORD.
3379	3	22	9	 They shall therefore keep My charge, lest they bear sin for it, and die therein, if they profane it: I am the LORD who sanctify them.
3380	3	22	10	 There shall no common man eat of the holy thing; a tenant of a priest, or a hired servant, shall not eat of the holy thing.
3381	3	22	11	 But if a priest buy any soul, the purchase of his money, he may eat of it; and such as are born in his house, they may eat of his bread.
3382	3	22	12	 And if a priest's daughter be married unto a common man, she shall not eat of that which is set apart from the holy things.
3383	3	22	13	 But if a priest's daughter be a widow, or divorced, and have no child, and is returned unto her father's house, as in her youth, she may eat of her father's bread; but there shall no common man eat thereof.
3384	3	22	14	 And if a man eat of the holy thing through error, then he shall put the fifth part thereof unto it, and shall give unto the priest the holy thing.
3385	3	22	15	 And they shall not profane the holy things of the children of Israel, which they set apart unto the LORD;
3386	3	22	16	 and so cause them to bear the iniquity that bringeth guilt, when they eat their holy things; for I am the LORD who sanctify them.
3387	3	22	17	 And the LORD spoke unto Moses, saying:
3388	3	22	18	 Speak unto Aaron, and to his sons, and unto all the children of Israel, and say unto them: Whosoever he be of the house of Israel, or of the strangers in Israel, that bringeth his offering, whether it be any of their vows, or any of their free-will-offerings, which are brought unto the LORD for a burnt-offering;
3389	3	22	19	 that ye may be accepted, ye shall offer a male without blemish, of the beeves, of the sheep, or of the goats.
3390	3	22	20	 But whatsoever hath a blemish, that shall ye not bring; for it shall not be acceptable for you.
3391	3	22	21	 And whosoever bringeth a sacrifice of peace-offerings unto the LORD in fulfilment of a vow clearly uttered, or for a freewill-offering, of the herd or of the flock, it shall be perfect to be accepted; there shall be no blemish therein.
3392	3	22	22	 Blind, or broken, or maimed, or having a wen, or scabbed, or scurvy, ye shall not offer these unto the LORD, nor make an offering by fire of them upon the altar unto the LORD.
3393	3	22	23	 Either a bullock or a lamb that hath any thing too long or too short, that mayest thou offer for a freewill-offering; but for a vow it shall not be accepted.
3394	3	22	24	 That which hath its stones bruised, or crushed, or torn, or cut, ye shall not offer unto the LORD; neither shall ye do thus in your land.
3395	3	22	25	 Neither from the hand of a foreigner shall ye offer the bread of your God of any of these, because their corruption is in them, there is a blemish in them; they shall not be accepted for you.
3396	3	22	26	 And the LORD spoke unto Moses, saying:
3397	3	22	27	 When a bullock, or a sheep, or a goat, is brought forth, then it shall be seven days under the dam; but from the eighth day and thenceforth it may be accepted for an offering made by fire unto the LORD.
3398	3	22	28	 And whether it be cow or ewe, ye shall not kill it and its young both in one day.
3399	3	22	29	 And when ye sacrifice a sacrifice of thanksgiving unto the LORD, ye shall sacrifice it that ye may be accepted.
3400	3	22	30	 On the same day it shall be eaten; ye shall leave none of it until the morning: I am the LORD.
3401	3	22	31	 And ye shall keep My commandments, and do them: I am the LORD.
3402	3	22	32	 And ye shall not profane My holy name; but I will be hallowed among the children of Israel: I am the LORD who hallow you,
3403	3	22	33	 that brought you out of the land of Egypt, to be your God: I am the LORD.
3404	3	23	1	 And the LORD spoke unto Moses, saying:
3405	3	23	2	 Speak unto the children of Israel, and say unto them: The appointed seasons of the LORD, which ye shall proclaim to be holy convocations, even these are My appointed seasons.
3406	3	23	3	 Six days shall work be done; but on the seventh day is a sabbath of solemn rest, a holy convocation; ye shall do no manner of work; it is a sabbath unto the LORD in all your dwellings.
3407	3	23	4	 These are the appointed seasons of the LORD, even holy convocations, which ye shall proclaim in their appointed season.
3408	3	23	5	 In the first month, on the fourteenth day of the month at dusk, is the LORD'S passover.
3409	3	23	6	 And on the fifteenth day of the same month is the feast of unleavened bread unto the LORD; seven days ye shall eat unleavened bread.
3410	3	23	7	 In the first day ye shall have a holy convocation; ye shall do no manner of servile work.
3411	3	23	8	 And ye shall bring an offering made by fire unto the LORD seven days; in the seventh day is a holy convocation; ye shall do no manner of servile work.
3412	3	23	9	 And the LORD spoke unto Moses saying:
3413	3	23	10	 Speak unto the children of Israel, and say unto them: When ye are come into the land which I give unto you, and shall reap the harvest thereof, then ye shall bring the sheaf of the first-fruits of your harvest unto the priest.
3414	3	23	11	 And he shall wave the sheaf before the LORD, to be accepted for you; on the morrow after the sabbath the priest shall wave it.
3415	3	23	12	 And in the day when ye wave the sheaf, ye shall offer a he-lamb without blemish of the first year for a burnt-offering unto the LORD.
3416	3	23	13	 And the meal-offering thereof shall be two tenth parts of an ephah of fine flour mingled with oil, an offering made by fire unto the LORD for a sweet savour; and the drink-offering thereof shall be of wine, the fourth part of a hin.
3417	3	23	14	 And ye shall eat neither bread, nor parched corn, nor fresh ears, until this selfsame day, until ye have brought the offering of your God; it is a statute for ever throughout your generations in all your dwellings.
3418	3	23	15	 And ye shall count unto you from the morrow after the day of rest, from the day that ye brought the sheaf of the waving; seven weeks shall there be complete;
3419	3	23	16	 even unto the morrow after the seventh week shall ye number fifty days; and ye shall present a new meal-offering unto the LORD.
3420	3	23	17	 Ye shall bring out of your dwellings two wave-loaves of two tenth parts of an ephah; they shall be of fine flour, they shall be baked with leaven, for first-fruits unto the LORD.
3421	3	23	18	 And ye shall present with the bread seven lambs without blemish of the first year, and one young bullock, and two rams; they shall be a burnt-offering unto the LORD, with their meal-offering, and their drink-offerings, even an offering made by fire, of a sweet savour unto the LORD.
3422	3	23	19	 And ye shall offer one he-goat for a sin-offering, and two he-lambs of the first year for a sacrifice of peace-offerings.
3423	3	23	20	 And the priest shall wave them with the bread of the first-fruits for a wave-offering before the LORD, with the two lambs; they shall be holy to the LORD for the priest.
3424	3	23	21	 And ye shall make proclamation on the selfsame day; there shall be a holy convocation unto you; ye shall do no manner of servile work; it is a statute for ever in all your dwellings throughout your generations.
3425	3	23	22	 And when ye reap the harvest of your land, thou shalt not wholly reap the corner of thy field, neither shalt thou gather the gleaning of thy harvest; thou shalt leave them for the poor, and for the stranger: I am the LORD your God.
3426	3	23	23	 And the LORD spoke unto Moses, saying:
3427	3	23	24	 Speak unto the children of Israel, saying: In the seventh month, in the first day of the month, shall be a solemn rest unto you, a memorial proclaimed with the blast of horns, a holy convocation.
3428	3	23	25	 Ye shall do no manner of servile work; and ye shall bring an offering made by fire unto the LORD.
3429	3	23	26	 And the LORD spoke unto Moses, saying:
3430	3	23	27	 Howbeit on the tenth day of this seventh month is the day of atonement; there shall be a holy convocation unto you, and ye shall afflict your souls; and ye shall bring an offering made by fire unto the LORD.
3431	3	23	28	 And ye shall do no manner of work in that same day; for it is a day of atonement, to make atonement for you before the LORD your God.
3432	3	23	29	 For whatsoever soul it be that shall not be afflicted in that same day, he shall be cut off from his people.
3433	3	23	30	 And whatsoever soul it be that doeth any manner of work in that same day, that soul will I destroy from among his people.
3434	3	23	31	 Ye shall do no manner of work; it is a statute for ever throughout your generations in all your dwellings.
3435	3	23	32	 It shall be unto you a sabbath of solemn rest, and ye shall afflict your souls; in the ninth day of the month at even, from even unto even, shall ye keep your sabbath.
3436	3	23	33	 And the LORD spoke unto Moses, saying:
3437	3	23	34	 Speak unto the children of Israel, saying: On the fifteenth day of this seventh month is the feast of tabernacles for seven days unto the LORD.
3438	3	23	35	 On the first day shall be a holy convocation; ye shall do no manner of servile work.
3439	3	23	36	 Seven days ye shall bring an offering made by fire unto the LORD; on the eighth day shall be a holy convocation unto you; and ye shall bring an offering made by fire unto the LORD; it is a day of solemn assembly; ye shall do no manner of servile work.
3440	3	23	37	 These are the appointed seasons of the LORD, which ye shall proclaim to be holy convocations, to bring an offering made by fire unto the LORD, a burnt-offering, and a meal-offering, a sacrifice, and drink-offerings, each on its own day;
3441	3	23	38	 beside the sabbaths of the LORD, and beside your gifts, and beside all your vows, and beside all your freewill-offerings, which ye give unto the LORD.
3442	3	23	39	 Howbeit on the fifteenth day of the seventh month, when ye have gathered in the fruits of the land, ye shall keep the feast of the LORD seven days; on the first day shall be a solemn rest, and on the eighth day shall be a solemn rest.
3443	3	23	40	 And ye shall take you on the first day the fruit of goodly trees, branches of palm-trees, and boughs of thick trees, and willows of the brook, and ye shall rejoice before the LORD your God seven days.
3444	3	23	41	 And ye shall keep it a feast unto the LORD seven days in the year; it is a statute for ever in your generations; ye shall keep it in the seventh month.
3445	3	23	42	 Ye shall dwell in booths seven days; all that are home-born in Israel shall dwell in booths;
3446	3	23	43	 that your generations may know that I made the children of Israel to dwell in booths, when I brought them out of the land of Egypt: I am the LORD your God.
3447	3	23	44	 And Moses declared unto the children of Israel the appointed seasons of the LORD.
3448	3	24	1	 And the LORD spoke unto Moses, saying:
3449	3	24	2	 'Command the children of Israel, that they bring unto thee pure olive oil beaten for the light, to cause a lamp to burn continually.
3450	3	24	3	 Without the veil of the testimony, in the tent of meeting, shall Aaron order it from evening to morning before the LORD continually; it shall be a statute for ever throughout your generations.
3451	3	24	4	 He shall order the lamps upon the pure candlestick before the LORD continually.
3452	3	24	5	 And thou shalt take fine flour, and bake twelve cakes thereof: two tenth parts of an ephah shall be in one cake.
3453	3	24	6	 And thou shalt set them in two rows, six in a row, upon the pure table before the LORD.
3454	3	24	7	 And thou shalt put pure frankincense with each row, that it may be to the bread for a memorial-part, even an offering made by fire unto the LORD.
3455	3	24	8	 Every sabbath day he shall set it in order before the LORD continually; it is from the children of Israel, an everlasting covenant.
3456	3	24	9	 And it shall be for Aaron and his sons; and they shall eat it in a holy place; for it is most holy unto him of the offerings of the LORD made by fire, a perpetual due.'
3457	3	24	10	 And the son of an Israelitish woman, whose father was an Egyptian, went out among the children of Israel; and the son of the Israelitish woman and a man of Israel strove together in the camp.
3458	3	24	11	 And the son of the Israelitish woman blasphemed the Name, and cursed; and they brought him unto Moses. And his mother's name was Shelomith, the daughter of Dibri, of the tribe of Dan.
3459	3	24	12	 And they put him in ward, that it might be declared unto them at the mouth of the LORD.
3460	3	24	13	 And the LORD spoke unto Moses, saying:
3461	3	24	14	 'Bring forth him that hath cursed without the camp; and let all that heard him lay their hands upon his head, and let all the congregation stone him.
3462	3	24	15	 And thou shalt speak unto the children of Israel, saying: Whosoever curseth his God shall bear his sin.
3463	3	24	16	 And he that blasphemeth the name of the LORD, he shall surely be put to death; all the congregation shall certainly stone him; as well the stranger, as the home-born, when he blasphemeth the Name, shall be put to death.
3464	3	24	17	 And he that smiteth any man mortally shall surely be put to death.
3465	3	24	18	 And he that smiteth a beast mortally shall make it good: life for life.
3466	3	24	19	 And if a man maim his neighbour; as he hath done, so shall it be done to him:
3467	3	24	20	 breach for breach, eye for eye, tooth for tooth; as he hath maimed a man, so shall it be rendered unto him.
3468	3	24	21	 And he that killeth a beast shall make it good; and he that killeth a man shall be put to death.
3469	3	24	22	 Ye shall have one manner of law, as well for the stranger, as for the home-born; for I am the LORD your God.'
3470	3	24	23	 And Moses spoke to the children of Israel, and they brought forth him that had cursed out of the camp, and stoned him with stones. And the children of Israel did as the LORD commanded Moses.
3471	3	25	1	 And the LORD spoke unto Moses in mount Sinai, saying:
3472	3	25	2	 Speak unto the children of Israel, and say unto them: When ye come into the land which I give you, then shall the land keep a sabbath unto the LORD.
3473	3	25	3	 Six years thou shalt sow thy field, and six years thou shalt prune thy vineyard, and gather in the produce thereof.
3474	3	25	4	 But in the seventh year shall be a sabbath of solemn rest for the land, a sabbath unto the LORD; thou shalt neither sow thy field, nor prune thy vineyard.
3475	3	25	5	 That which groweth of itself of thy harvest thou shalt not reap, and the grapes of thy undressed vine thou shalt not gather; it shall be a year of solemn rest for the land.
3476	3	25	6	 And the sabbath-produce of the land shall be for food for you: for thee, and for thy servant and for thy maid, and for thy hired servant and for the settler by thy side that sojourn with thee;
3477	3	25	7	 and for thy cattle, and for the beasts that are in thy land, shall all the increase thereof be for food.
3478	3	25	8	 And thou shalt number seven sabbaths of years unto thee, seven times seven years; and there shall be unto thee the days of seven sabbaths of years, even forty and nine years.
3479	3	25	9	 Then shalt thou make proclamation with the blast of the horn on the tenth day of the seventh month; in the day of atonement shall ye make proclamation with the horn throughout all your land.
3480	3	25	10	 And ye shall hallow the fiftieth year, and proclaim liberty throughout the land unto all the inhabitants thereof; it shall be a jubilee unto you; and ye shall return every man unto his possession, and ye shall return every man unto his family.
3481	3	25	11	 A jubilee shall that fiftieth year be unto you; ye shall not sow, neither reap that which groweth of itself in it, nor gather the grapes in it of the undressed vines.
3482	3	25	12	 For it is a jubilee; it shall be holy unto you; ye shall eat the increase thereof out of the field.
3483	3	25	13	 In this year of jubilee ye shall return every man unto his possession.
3484	3	25	14	 And if thou sell aught unto thy neighbour, or buy of thy neighbour's hand, ye shall not wrong one another.
3485	3	25	15	 According to the number of years after the jubilee thou shalt buy of thy neighbour, and according unto the number of years of the crops he shall sell unto thee.
3486	3	25	16	 According to the multitude of the years thou shalt increase the price thereof, and according to the fewness of the years thou shalt diminish the price of it; for the number of crops doth he sell unto thee.
3487	3	25	17	 And ye shall not wrong one another; but thou shalt fear thy God; for I am the LORD your God.
3488	3	25	18	 Wherefore ye shall do My statutes, and keep Mine ordinances and do them; and ye shall dwell in the land in safety.
3489	3	25	19	 And the land shall yield her fruit, and ye shall eat until ye have enough, and dwell therein in safety.
3490	3	25	20	 And if ye shall say: 'What shall we eat the seventh year? behold, we may not sow, nor gather in our increase';
3491	3	25	21	 then I will command My blessing upon you in the sixth year, and it shall bring forth produce for the three years.
3492	3	25	22	 And ye shall sow the eighth year, and eat of the produce, the old store; until the ninth year, until her produce come in, ye shall eat the old store.
3493	3	25	23	 And the land shall not be sold in perpetuity; for the land is Mine; for ye are strangers and settlers with Me.
3494	3	25	24	 And in all the land of your possession ye shall grant a redemption for the land.
3495	3	25	25	 If thy brother be waxen poor, and sell some of his possession, then shall his kinsman that is next unto him come, and shall redeem that which his brother hath sold.
3496	3	25	26	 And if a man have no one to redeem it, and he be waxen rich and find sufficient means to redeem it;
3497	3	25	27	 then let him count the years of the sale thereof, and restore the overplus unto the man to whom he sold it; and he shall return unto his possession.
3498	3	25	28	 But if he have not sufficient means to get it back for himself, then that which he hath sold shall remain in the hand of him that hath bought it until the year of jubilee; and in the jubilee it shall go out, and he shall return unto his possession.
3499	3	25	29	 And if a man sell a dwelling-house in a walled city, then he may redeem it within a whole year after it is sold; for a full year shall he have the right of redemption.
3500	3	25	30	 And if it be not redeemed within the space of a full year, then the house that is in the walled city shall be made sure in perpetuity to him that bought it, throughout his generations; it shall not go out in the jubilee.
3501	3	25	31	 But the houses of the villages which have no wall round about them shall be reckoned with the fields of the country; they may be redeemed, and they shall go out in the jubilee.
3502	3	25	32	 But as for the cities of the Levites, the houses of the cities of their possession, the Levites shall have a perpetual right of redemption.
3503	3	25	33	 And if a man purchase of the Levites, then the house that was sold in the city of his possession, shall go out in the jubilee; for the houses of the cities of the Levites are their possession among the children of Israel.
3504	3	25	34	 But the fields of the open land about their cities may not be sold; for that is their perpetual possession.
3505	3	25	35	 And if thy brother be waxen poor, and his means fail with thee; then thou shalt uphold him: as a stranger and a settler shall he live with thee.
3506	3	25	36	 Take thou no interest of him or increase; but fear thy God; that thy brother may live with thee.
3507	3	25	37	 Thou shalt not give him thy money upon interest, nor give him thy victuals for increase.
3508	3	25	38	 I am the LORD your God, who brought you forth out of the land of Egypt, to give you the land of Canaan, to be your God.
3509	3	25	39	 And if thy brother be waxen poor with thee, and sell himself unto thee, thou shalt not make him to serve as a bondservant.
3510	3	25	40	 As a hired servant, and as a settler, he shall be with thee; he shall serve with thee unto the year of jubilee.
3511	3	25	41	 Then shall he go out from thee, he and his children with him, and shall return unto his own family, and unto the possession of his fathers shall he return.
3512	3	25	42	 For they are My servants, whom I brought forth out of the land of Egypt; they shall not be sold as bondmen.
3513	3	25	43	 Thou shalt not rule over him with rigour; but shalt fear thy God.
3514	3	25	44	 And as for thy bondmen, and thy bondmaids, whom thou mayest have: of the nations that are round about you, of them shall ye buy bondmen and bondmaids.
3515	3	25	45	 Moreover of the children of the strangers that do sojourn among you, of them may ye buy, and of their families that are with you, which they have begotten in your land; and they may be your possession.
3516	3	25	46	 And ye may make them an inheritance for your children after you, to hold for a possession: of them may ye take your bondmen for ever; but over your brethren the children of Israel ye shall not rule, one over another, with rigour.
3517	3	25	47	 And if a stranger who is a settler with thee be waxen rich, and thy brother be waxen poor beside him, and sell himself unto the stranger who is a settler with thee, or to the offshoot of a stranger's family,
3518	3	25	48	 after that he is sold he may be redeemed; one of his brethren may redeem him;
3519	3	25	49	 or his uncle, or his uncle's son, may redeem him, or any that is nigh of kin unto him of his family may redeem him; or if he be waxen rich, he may redeem himself.
3520	3	25	50	 And he shall reckon with him that bought him from the year that he sold himself to him unto the year of jubilee; and the price of his sale shall be according unto the number of years; according to the time of a hired servant shall he be with him.
3521	3	25	51	 If there be yet many years, according unto them he shall give back the price of his redemption out of the money that he was bought for.
3522	3	25	52	 And if there remain but few years unto the year of jubilee, then he shall reckon with him; according unto his years shall he give back the price of his redemption.
3523	3	25	53	 As a servant hired year by year shall he be with him; he shall not rule with rigour over him in thy sight.
3524	3	25	54	 And if he be not redeemed by any of these means, then he shall go out in the year of jubilee, he, and his children with him.
3525	3	25	55	 For unto Me the children of Israel are servants; they are My servants whom I brought forth out of the land of Egypt: I am the LORD your God.
3526	3	26	1	 Ye shall make you no idols, neither shall ye rear you up a graven image, or a pillar, neither shall ye place any figured stone in your land, to bow down unto it; for I am the LORD your God.
3527	3	26	2	 Ye shall keep My sabbaths, and reverence My sanctuary: I am the LORD.
3528	3	26	3	 If ye walk in My statutes, and keep My commandments, and do them;
3529	3	26	4	 then I will give your rains in their season, and the land shall yield her produce, and the trees of the field shall yield their fruit.
3530	3	26	5	 And your threshing shall reach unto the vintage, and the vintage shall reach unto the sowing time; and ye shall eat your bread until ye have enough, and dwell in your land safely.
3531	3	26	6	 And I will give peace in the land, and ye shall lie down, and none shall make you afraid; and I will cause evil beasts to cease out of the land, neither shall the sword go through your land.
3532	3	26	7	 And ye shall chase your enemies, and they shall fall before you by the sword.
3533	3	26	8	 And five of you shall chase a hundred, and a hundred of you shall chase ten thousand; and your enemies shall fall before you by the sword.
3534	3	26	9	 And I will have respect unto you, and make you fruitful, and multiply you; and will establish My covenant with you.
3535	3	26	10	 And ye shall eat old store long kept, and ye shall bring forth the old from before the new.
3536	3	26	11	 And I will set My tabernacle among you, and My soul shall not abhor you.
3537	3	26	12	 And I will walk among you, and will be your God, and ye shall be My people.
3538	3	26	13	 I am the LORD your God, who brought you forth out of the land of Egypt, that ye should not be their bondmen; and I have broken the bars of your yoke, and made you go upright.
3539	3	26	14	 But if ye will not hearken unto Me, and will not do all these commandments;
3540	3	26	15	 and if ye shall reject My statutes, and if your soul abhor Mine ordinances, so that ye will not do all My commandments, but break My covenant;
3541	3	26	16	 I also will do this unto you: I will appoint terror over you, even consumption and fever, that shall make the eyes to fail, and the soul to languish; and ye shall sow your seed in vain, for your enemies shall eat it.
3542	3	26	17	 And I will set My face against you, and ye shall be smitten before your enemies; they that hate you shall rule over you; and ye shall flee when none pursueth you.
3543	3	26	18	 And if ye will not yet for these things hearken unto Me, then I will chastise you seven times more for your sins.
3544	3	26	19	 And I will break the pride of your power; and I will make your heaven as iron, and your earth as brass.
3545	3	26	20	 And your strength shall be spent in vain; for your land shall not yield her produce, neither shall the trees of the land yield their fruit.
3546	3	26	21	 And if ye walk contrary unto Me, and will not hearken unto Me; I will bring seven times more plagues upon you according to your sins.
3547	3	26	22	 And I will send the beast of the field among you, which shall rob you of your children, and destroy your cattle, and make you few in number; and your ways shall become desolate.
3548	3	26	23	 And if in spite of these things ye will not be corrected unto Me, but will walk contrary unto Me;
3549	3	26	24	 then will I also walk contrary unto you; and I will smite you, even I, seven times for your sins.
3550	3	26	25	 And I will bring a sword upon you, that shall execute the vengeance of the covenant; and ye shall be gathered together within your cities; and I will send the pestilence among you; and ye shall be delivered into the hand of the enemy.
3551	3	26	26	 When I break your staff of bread, ten women shall bake your bread in one oven, and they shall deliver your bread again by weight; and ye shall eat, and not be satisfied.
3552	3	26	27	 And if ye will not for all this hearken unto Me, but walk contrary unto Me;
3553	3	26	28	 then I will walk contrary unto you in fury; and I also will chastise you seven times for your sins.
3554	3	26	29	 And ye shall eat the flesh of your sons, and the flesh of your daughters shall ye eat.
3555	3	26	30	 And I will destroy your high places, and cut down your sun-pillars, and cast your carcasses upon the carcasses of your idols; and My soul shall abhor you.
3556	3	26	31	 And I will make your cities a waste, and will bring your sanctuaries unto desolation, and I will not smell the savour of your sweet odours.
3557	3	26	32	 And I will bring the land into desolation; and your enemies that dwell therein shall be astonished at it.
3558	3	26	33	 And you will I scatter among the nations, and I will draw out the sword after you; and your land shall be a desolation, and your cities shall be a waste.
3559	3	26	34	 Then shall the land be paid her sabbaths, as long as it lieth desolate, and ye are in your enemies' land; even then shall the land rest, and repay her sabbaths.
3560	3	26	35	 As long as it lieth desolate it shall have rest; even the rest which it had not in your sabbaths, when ye dwelt upon it.
3561	3	26	36	 And as for them that are left of you, I will send a faintness into their heart in the lands of their enemies; and the sound of a driven leaf shall chase them; and they shall flee, as one fleeth from the sword; and they shall fall when none pursueth.
3562	3	26	37	 And they shall stumble one upon another, as it were before the sword, when none pursueth; and ye shall have no power to stand before your enemies.
3563	3	26	38	 And ye shall perish among the nations, and the land of your enemies shall eat you up.
3564	3	26	39	 And they that are left of you shall pine away in their iniquity in your enemies' lands; and also in the iniquities of their fathers shall they pine away with them.
3565	3	26	40	 And they shall confess their iniquity, and the iniquity of their fathers, in their treachery which they committed against Me, and also that they have walked contrary unto Me.
3566	3	26	41	 I also will walk contrary unto them, and bring them into the land of their enemies; if then perchance their uncircumcised heart be humbled, and they then be paid the punishment of their iniquity;
3567	3	26	42	 then will I remember My covenant with Jacob, and also My covenant with Isaac, and also My covenant with Abraham will I remember; and I will remember the land.
3568	3	26	43	 For the land shall lie forsaken without them, and shall be paid her sabbaths, while she lieth desolate without them; and they shall be paid the punishment of their iniquity; because, even because they rejected Mine ordinances, and their soul abhorred My statutes.
3569	3	26	44	 And yet for all that, when they are in the land of their enemies, I will not reject them, neither will I abhor them, to destroy them utterly, and to break My covenant with them; for I am the LORD their God.
3570	3	26	45	 But I will for their sakes remember the covenant of their ancestors, whom I brought forth out of the land of Egypt in the sight of the nations, that I might be their God: I am the LORD.
3571	3	26	46	 These are the statutes and ordinances and laws, which the LORD made between Him and the children of Israel in mount Sinai by the hand of Moses.
3572	3	27	1	 And the LORD spoke unto Moses, saying:
