4147	4	14	38	 But Joshua the son of Nun, and Caleb the son of Jephunneh, remained alive of those men that went to spy out the land.
4148	4	14	39	 And Moses told these words unto all the children of Israel; and the people mourned greatly.
4149	4	14	40	 And they rose up early in the morning, and got them up to the top of the mountain, saying: 'Lo, we are here, and will go up unto the place which the LORD hath promised; for we have sinned.'
4150	4	14	41	 And Moses said: 'Wherefore now do ye transgress the commandment of the LORD, seeing it shall not prosper?
4151	4	14	42	 Go not up, for the LORD is not among you; that ye be not smitten down before your enemies.
4152	4	14	43	 For there the Amalekite and the Canaanite are before you, and ye shall fall by the sword; forasmuch as ye are turned back from following the LORD, and the LORD will not be with you.'
4153	4	14	44	 But they presumed to go up to the top of the mountain; nevertheless the ark of the covenant of the LORD, and Moses, departed not out of the camp.
4154	4	14	45	 Then the Amalekite and the Canaanite, who dwelt in that hill-country, came down, and smote them and beat them down, even unto Hormah.
4155	4	15	1	 And the LORD spoke unto Moses, saying:
4156	4	15	2	 Speak unto the children of Israel, and say unto them: When ye are come into the land of your habitations, which I give unto you,
4157	4	15	3	 and will make an offering by fire unto the LORD, a burnt-offering, or a sacrifice, in fulfilment of a vow clearly uttered, or as a freewill-offering, or in your appointed seasons, to make a sweet savour unto the LORD, of the herd, or of the flock;
4158	4	15	4	 then shall he that bringeth his offering present unto the LORD a meal-offering of a tenth part of an ephah of fine flour mingled with the fourth part of a hin of oil;
4159	4	15	5	 and wine for the drink-offering, the fourth part of a hin, shalt thou prepare with the burnt-offering or for the sacrifice, for each lamb.
4160	4	15	6	 Or for a ram, thou shalt prepare for a meal-offering two tenth parts of an ephah of fine flour mingled with the third part of a hin of oil;
4161	4	15	7	 and for the drink-offering thou shalt present the third part of a hin of wine, of a sweet savour unto the LORD.
4162	4	15	8	 And when thou preparest a bullock for a burnt-offering, or for a sacrifice, in fulfilment of a vow clearly uttered, or for peace-offerings unto the LORD;
4163	4	15	9	 then shall there be presented with the bullock a meal-offering of three tenth parts of an ephah of fine flour mingled with half a hin of oil.
4164	4	15	10	 And thou shalt present for the drink-offering half a hin of wine, for an offering made by fire, of a sweet savour unto the LORD.
4165	4	15	11	 Thus shall it be done for each bullock, or for each ram, or for each of the he-lambs, or of the kids.
4166	4	15	12	 According to the number that ye may prepare, so shall ye do for every one according to their number.
4167	4	15	13	 All that are home-born shall do these things after this manner, in presenting an offering made by fire, of a sweet savour unto the LORD.
4168	4	15	14	 And if a stranger sojourn with you, or whosoever may be among you, throughout your generations, and will offer an offering made by fire, of a sweet savour unto the LORD; as ye do, so he shall do.
4169	4	15	15	 As for the congregation, there shall be one statute both for you, and for the stranger that sojourneth with you, a statute for ever throughout your generations; as ye are, so shall the stranger be before the LORD.
4170	4	15	16	 One law and one ordinance shall be both for you, and for the stranger that sojourneth with you.
4171	4	15	17	 And the LORD spoke unto Moses, saying:
4172	4	15	18	 Speak unto the children of Israel, and say unto them: When ye come into the land whither I bring you,
4173	4	15	19	 then it shall be, that, when ye eat of the bread of the land, ye shall set apart a portion for a gift unto the LORD.
4174	4	15	20	 Of the first of your dough ye shall set apart a cake for a gift; as that which is set apart of the threshing-floor, so shall ye set it apart.
4175	4	15	21	 Of the first of your dough ye shall give unto the LORD a portion for a gift throughout your generations.
4176	4	15	22	 And when ye shall err, and not observe all these commandments, which the LORD hath spoken unto Moses,
4177	4	15	23	 even all that the LORD hath commanded you by the hand of Moses, from the day that the LORD gave commandment, and onward throughout your generations;
4178	4	15	24	 then it shall be, if it be done in error by the congregation, it being hid from their eyes, that all the congregation shall offer one young bullock for a burnt-offering, for a sweet savour unto the LORD--with the meal-offering thereof, and the drink-offering thereof, according to the ordinance--and one he-goat for a sin-offering.
4179	4	15	25	 And the priest shall make atonement for all the congregation of the children of Israel, and they shall be forgiven; for it was an error, and they have brought their offering, an offering made by fire unto the LORD, and their sin-offering before the LORD, for their error.
4180	4	15	26	 And all the congregation of the children of Israel shall be forgiven, and the stranger that sojourneth among them; for in respect of all the people it was done in error.
4181	4	15	27	 And if one person sin through error, then he shall offer a she-goat of the first year for a sin-offering.
4182	4	15	28	 And the priest shall make atonement for the soul that erreth, when he sinneth through error, before the LORD, to make atonement for him; and he shall be forgiven,
4183	4	15	29	 both he that is home-born among the children of Israel, and the stranger that sojourneth among them: ye shall have one law for him that doeth aught in error.
4184	4	15	30	 But the soul that doeth aught with a high hand, whether he be home-born or a stranger, the same blasphemeth the LORD; and that soul shall be cut off from among his people.
4185	4	15	31	 Because he hath despised the word of the LORD, and hath broken His commandment; that soul shall utterly be cut off, his iniquity shall be upon him.
4186	4	15	32	 And while the children of Israel were in the wilderness, they found a man gathering sticks upon the sabbath day.
4187	4	15	33	 And they that found him gathering sticks brought him unto Moses and Aaron, and unto all the congregation.
4188	4	15	34	 And they put him in ward, because it had not been declared what should be done to him.
4189	4	15	35	 And the LORD said unto Moses: 'The man shall surely be put to death; all the congregation shall stone him with stones without the camp.'
4190	4	15	36	 And all the congregation brought him without the camp, and stoned him with stones, and he died, as the LORD commanded Moses.
4191	4	15	37	 And the LORD spoke unto Moses, saying:
4192	4	15	38	 'Speak unto the children of Israel, and bid them that they make them throughout their generations fringes in the corners of their garments, and that they put with the fringe of each corner a thread of blue.
4193	4	15	39	 And it shall be unto you for a fringe, that ye may look upon it, and remember all the commandments of the LORD, and do them; and that ye go not about after your own heart and your own eyes, after which ye use to go astray;
4194	4	15	40	 that ye may remember and do all My commandments, and be holy unto your God.
4195	4	15	41	 I am the LORD your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, to be your God: I am the LORD your God.'
4196	4	16	1	 Now Korah, the son of Izhar, the son of Kohath, the son of Levi, with Dathan and Abiram, the sons of Eliab, and On, the son of Peleth, sons of Reuben, took men;
4197	4	16	2	 and they rose up in face of Moses, with certain of the children of Israel, two hundred and fifty men; they were princes of the congregation, the elect men of the assembly, men of renown;
4198	4	16	3	 and they assembled themselves together against Moses and against Aaron, and said unto them: 'Ye take too much upon you, seeing all the congregation are holy, every one of them, and the LORD is among them; wherefore then lift ye up yourselves above the assembly of the LORD?'
4199	4	16	4	 And when Moses heard it, he fell upon his face.
4200	4	16	5	 And he spoke unto Korah and unto all his company, saying: 'In the morning the LORD will show who are His, and who is holy, and will cause him to come near unto Him; even him whom He may choose will He cause to come near unto Him.
4201	4	16	6	 This do: take you censors, Korah, and all his company;
4202	4	16	7	 and put fire therein, and put incense upon them before the LORD to-morrow; and it shall be that the man whom the LORD doth choose, he shall be holy; ye take too much upon you, ye sons of Levi.'
4203	4	16	8	 And Moses said unto Korah: 'Hear now, ye sons of Levi:
4204	4	16	9	 is it but a small thing unto you, that the God of Israel hath separated you from the congregation of Israel, to bring you near to Himself, to do the service of the tabernacle of the LORD, and to stand before the congregation to minister unto them;
4205	4	16	10	 and that He hath brought thee near, and all thy brethren the sons of Levi with thee? and will ye seek the priesthood also?
4206	4	16	11	 Therefore thou and all thy company that are gathered together against the LORD--; and as to Aaron, what is he that ye murmur against him?'
4207	4	16	12	 And Moses sent to call Dathan and Abiram, the sons of Eliab; and they said: 'We will not come up;
4208	4	16	13	 is it a small thing that thou hast brought us up out of a land flowing with milk and honey, to kill us in the wilderness, but thou must needs make thyself also a prince over us?
4209	4	16	14	 Moreover thou hast not brought us into a land flowing with milk and honey, nor given us inheritance of fields and vineyards; wilt thou put out the eyes of these men? we will not come up.'
4210	4	16	15	 And Moses was very wroth, and said unto the LORD: 'Respect not thou their offering; I have not taken one ass from them, neither have I hurt one of them.'
4211	4	16	16	 And Moses said unto Korah: 'Be thou and all thy congregation before the LORD, thou, and they, and Aaron, to-morrow;
4212	4	16	17	 and take ye every man his fire-pan, and put incense upon them, and bring ye before the LORD every man his fire-pan, two hundred and fifty fire-pans; thou also, and Aaron, each his fire-pan.'
4213	4	16	18	 And they took every man his fire-pan, and put fire in them, and laid incense thereon, and stood at the door of the tent of meeting with Moses and Aaron.
4214	4	16	19	 And Korah assembled all the congregation against them unto the door of the tent of meeting; and the glory of the LORD appeared unto all the congregation.
4215	4	16	20	 And the LORD spoke unto Moses and unto Aaron, saying:
4216	4	16	21	 'Separate yourselves from among this congregation, that I may consume them in a moment.'
4217	4	16	22	 And they fell upon their faces, and said: 'O God, the God of the spirits of all flesh, shall one man sin, and wilt Thou be wroth with all the congregation?'
4218	4	16	23	 And the LORD spoke unto Moses, saying:
4219	4	16	24	 'Speak unto the congregation, saying: Get you up from about the dwelling of Korah, Dathan, and Abiram.'
4220	4	16	25	 And Moses rose up and went unto Dathan and Abiram; and the elders of Israel followed him.
4221	4	16	26	 And he spoke unto the congregation, saying: 'Depart, I pray you, from the tents of these wicked men, and touch nothing of theirs, lest ye be swept away in all their sins.'
4222	4	16	27	 So they got them up from the dwelling of Korah, Dathan, and Abiram, on every side; and Dathan and Abiram came out, and stood at the door of their tents, with their wives, and their sons, and their little ones.
4223	4	16	28	 And Moses said: 'Hereby ye shall know that the LORD hath sent me to do all these works, and that I have not done them of mine own mind.
4224	4	16	29	 If these men die the common death of all men, and be visited after the visitation of all men, then the LORD hath not sent Me.
4225	4	16	30	 But if the LORD make a new thing, and the ground open her mouth, and swallow them up, with all that appertain unto them, and they go down alive into the pit, then ye shall understand that these men have despised the LORD.'
4226	4	16	31	 And it came to pass, as he made an end of speaking all these words, that the ground did cleave asunder that was under them.
4227	4	16	32	 And the earth opened her mouth and swallowed them up, and their households, and all the men that appertained unto Korah, and all their goods.
4228	4	16	33	 So they, and all that appertained to them, went down alive into the pit; and the earth closed upon them, and they perished from among the assembly.
4229	4	16	34	 And all Israel that were round about them fled at the cry of them; for they said: 'Lest the earth swallow us up.'
4230	4	16	35	 And fire came forth from the LORD, and devoured the two hundred and fifty men that offered the incense.
4231	4	16	36	 (17:1) And the LORD spoke unto Moses, saying:

4233	4	16	38	 (17:3) even the fire-pans of these men who have sinned at the cost of their lives, and let them be made beaten plates for a covering of the altar--for they are become holy, because they were offered before the LORD--that they may be a sign unto the children of Israel.'
4234	4	16	39	 (17:4) And Eleazar the priest took the brazen fire-pans, which they that were burnt had offered; and they beat them out for a covering of the altar,
4235	4	16	40	 (17:5) to be a memorial unto the children of Israel, to the end that no common man, that is not of the seed of Aaron, draw near to burn incense before the LORD; that he fare not as Korah, and as his company; as the LORD spoke unto him by the hand of Moses.
4236	4	16	41	 (17:6) But on the morrow all the congregation of the children of Israel murmured against Moses and against Aaron, saying: 'Ye have killed the people of the LORD.'

4242	4	16	47	 (17:12) And Aaron took as Moses spoke, and ran into the midst of the assembly; and, behold, the plague was begun among the people; and he put on the incense, and made atonement for the people.
4243	4	16	48	 (17:13) And he stood between the dead and the living; and the plague was stayed.

4259	4	18	1	 And the LORD said unto Aaron: 'Thou and thy sons and thy fathers' house with thee shall bear the iniquity of the sanctuary; and thou and thy sons with thee shall bear the iniquity of your priesthood.
4260	4	18	2	 And thy brethren also, the tribe of Levi, the tribe of thy father, bring thou near with thee, that they may be joined unto thee, and minister unto thee, thou and thy sons with thee being before the tent of the testimony.
4261	4	18	3	 And they shall keep thy charge, and the charge of all the Tent; only they shall not come nigh unto the holy furniture and unto the altar, that they die not, neither they, nor ye.
4262	4	18	4	 And they shall be joined unto thee, and keep the charge of the tent of meeting, whatsoever the service of the Tent may be; but a common man shall not draw nigh unto you.
4263	4	18	5	 And ye shall keep the charge of the holy things, and the charge of the altar, that there be wrath no more upon the children of Israel.
4264	4	18	6	 And I, behold, I have taken your brethren the Levites from among the children of Israel; for you they are given as a gift unto the LORD, to do the service of the tent of meeting.
4265	4	18	7	 And thou and thy sons with thee shall keep your priesthood in everything that pertaineth to the altar, and to that within the veil; and ye shall serve; I give you the priesthood as a service of gift; and the common man that draweth nigh shall be put to death.'
4266	4	18	8	 And the LORD spoke unto Aaron: 'And I, behold, I have given thee the charge of My heave-offerings; even of all the hallowed things of the children of Israel unto thee have I given them for a consecrated portion, and to thy sons, as a due for ever.
4267	4	18	9	 This shall be thine of the most holy things, reserved from the fire: every offering of theirs, even every meal-offering of theirs, and every sin-offering of theirs, and every guilt-offering of theirs, which they may render unto Me, shall be most holy for thee and for thy sons.
4268	4	18	10	 In a most holy place shalt thou eat thereof; every male may eat thereof; it shall be holy unto thee.
4269	4	18	11	 And this is thine: the heave-offering of their gift, even all the wave-offerings of the children of Israel; I have given them unto thee, and to thy sons and to thy daughters with thee, as a due for ever; every one that is clean in thy house may eat thereof.
4270	4	18	12	 All the best of the oil, and all the best of the wine, and of the corn, the first part of them which they give unto the LORD, to thee have I given them.
4271	4	18	13	 The first-ripe fruits of all that is in their land, which they bring unto the LORD, shall be thine; every one that is clean in thy house may eat thereof.

4275	4	18	17	 But the firstling of an ox, or the firstling of a sheep, or the firstling of a goat, thou shalt not redeem; they are holy: thou shalt dash their blood against the altar, and shalt make their fat smoke for an offering made by fire, for a sweet savour unto the LORD.
4276	4	18	18	 And the flesh of them shall be thine, as the wave-breast and as the right thigh, it shall be thine.
4277	4	18	19	 All the heave-offerings of the holy things, which the children of Israel offer unto the LORD, have I given thee, and thy sons and thy daughters with thee, as a due for ever; it is an everlasting covenant of salt before the LORD unto thee and to thy seed with thee.'
4278	4	18	20	 And the LORD said unto Aaron: 'Thou shalt have no inheritance in their land, neither shalt thou have any portion among them; I am thy portion and thine inheritance among the children of Israel.
4279	4	18	21	 And unto the children of Levi, behold, I have given all the tithe in Israel for an inheritance, in return for their service which they serve, even the service of the tent of meeting.

4282	4	18	24	 For the tithe of the children of Israel, which they set apart as a gift unto the LORD, I have given to the Levites for an inheritance; therefore I have said unto them: Among the children of Israel they shall have no inheritance.'

4291	4	19	1	 And the LORD spoke unto Moses and unto Aaron, saying:
4292	4	19	2	 This is the statute of the law which the LORD hath commanded, saying: Speak unto the children of Israel, that they bring thee a red heifer, faultless, wherein is no blemish, and upon which never came yoke.
4293	4	19	3	 And ye shall give her unto Eleazar the priest, and she shall be brought forth without the camp, and she shall be slain before his face.
4294	4	19	4	 And Eleazar the priest shall take of her blood with his finger, and sprinkle of her blood toward the front of the tent of meeting seven times.
4295	4	19	5	 And the heifer shall be burnt in his sight; her skin, and her flesh, and her blood, with her dung, shall be burnt.
4296	4	19	6	 And the priest shall take cedar-wood, and hyssop, and scarlet, and cast it into the midst of the burning of the heifer.
4297	4	19	7	 Then the priest shall wash his clothes, and he shall bathe his flesh in water, and afterward he may come into the camp, and the priest shall be unclean until the even.
4298	4	19	8	 And he that burneth her shall wash his clothes in water, and bathe his flesh in water, and shall be unclean until the even.
4299	4	19	9	 And a man that is clean shall gather up the ashes of the heifer, and lay them up without the camp in a clean place, and it shall be kept for the congregation of the children of Israel for a water of sprinkling; it is a purification from sin.
4300	4	19	10	 And he that gathereth the ashes of the heifer shall wash his clothes, and be unclean until the even; and it shall be unto the children of Israel, and unto the stranger that sojourneth among them, for a statute for ever.
4301	4	19	11	 He that toucheth the dead, even any man's dead body, shall be unclean seven days;
4302	4	19	12	 the same shall purify himself therewith on the third day and on the seventh day, and he shall be clean; but if he purify not himself the third day and the seventh day, he shall not be clean.
4303	4	19	13	 Whosoever toucheth the dead, even the body of any man that is dead, and purifieth not himself--he hath defiled the tabernacle of the LORD--that soul shall be cut off from Israel; because the water of sprinkling was not dashed against him, he shall be unclean; his uncleanness is yet upon him.
4304	4	19	14	 This is the law: when a man dieth in a tent, every one that cometh into the tent, and every thing that is in the tent, shall be unclean seven days.
4305	4	19	15	 And every open vessel, which hath no covering close-bound upon it, is unclean.
4306	4	19	16	 And whosoever in the open field toucheth one that is slain with a sword, or one that dieth of himself, or a bone of a man, or a grave, shall be unclean seven days.
4307	4	19	17	 And for the unclean they shall take of the ashes of the burning of the purification from sin, and running water shall be put thereto in a vessel.
4308	4	19	18	 And a clean person shall take hyssop, and dip it in the water, and sprinkle it upon the tent, and upon all the vessels, and upon the persons that were there, and upon him that touched the bone, or the slain, or the dead, or the grave.
4309	4	19	19	 And the clean person shall sprinkle upon the unclean on the third day, and on the seventh day; and on the seventh day he shall purify him; and he shall wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and shall be clean at even.
4310	4	19	20	 But the man that shall be unclean, and shall not purify himself, that soul shall be cut off from the midst of the assembly, because he hath defiled the sanctuary of the LORD; the water of sprinkling hath not been dashed against him: he is unclean.
4311	4	19	21	 And it shall be a perpetual statute unto them; and he that sprinkleth the water of sprinkling shall wash his clothes; and he that toucheth the water of sprinkling shall be unclean until even.
4312	4	19	22	 And whatsoever the unclean person toucheth shall be unclean; and the soul that toucheth him shall be unclean until even.
4313	4	20	1	 And the children of Israel, even the whole congregation, came into the wilderness of Zin in the first month; and the people abode in Kadesh; and Miriam died there, and was buried there.
4314	4	20	2	 And there was no water for the congregation; and they assembled themselves together against Moses and against Aaron.
4315	4	20	3	 And the people strove with Moses, and spoke, saying: 'Would that we had perished when our brethren perished before the LORD!
4316	4	20	4	 And why have ye brought the assembly of the LORD into this wilderness, to die there, we and our cattle?
4317	4	20	5	 And wherefore have ye made us to come up out of Egypt, to bring us in unto this evil place? it is no place of seed, or of figs, or of vines, or of pomegranates; neither is there any water to drink.'
4318	4	20	6	 And Moses and Aaron went from the presence of the assembly unto the door of the tent of meeting, and fell upon their faces; and the glory of the LORD appeared unto them.
4319	4	20	7	 And the LORD spoke unto Moses, saying:
4320	4	20	8	 'Take the rod, and assemble the congregation, thou, and Aaron thy brother, and speak ye unto the rock before their eyes, that it give forth its water; and thou shalt bring forth to them water out of the rock; so thou shalt give the congregation and their cattle drink.'
4321	4	20	9	 And Moses took the rod from before the LORD, as He commanded him.
4322	4	20	10	 And Moses and Aaron gathered the assembly together before the rock, and he said unto them: 'Hear now, ye rebels; are we to bring you forth water out of this rock?'
4323	4	20	11	 And Moses lifted up his hand, and smote the rock with his rod twice; and water came forth abundantly, and the congregation drank, and their cattle.
4324	4	20	12	 And the LORD said unto Moses and Aaron: 'Because ye believed not in Me, to sanctify Me in the eyes of the children of Israel, therefore ye shall not bring this assembly into the land which I have given them.'
4325	4	20	13	 These are the waters of Meribah, where the children of Israel strove with the LORD, and He was sanctified in them.
4326	4	20	14	 And Moses sent messengers from Kadesh unto the king of Edom: 'Thus saith thy brother Israel: Thou knowest all the travail that hath befallen us;
4327	4	20	15	 how our fathers went down into Egypt, and we dwelt in Egypt a long time; and the Egyptians dealt ill with us, and our fathers;
4328	4	20	16	 and when we cried unto the LORD, He heard our voice, and sent an angel, and brought us forth out of Egypt; and, behold, we are in Kadesh, a city in the uttermost of thy border.
4329	4	20	17	 Let us pass, I pray thee, through thy land; we will not pass through field or through vineyard, neither will we drink of the water of the wells; we will go along the king's highway, we will not turn aside to the right hand nor to the left, until we have passed thy border.'
4330	4	20	18	 And Edom said unto him: 'Thou shalt not pass through me, lest I come out with the sword against thee.'
4331	4	20	19	 And the children of Israel said unto him: 'We will go up by the highway; and if we drink of thy water, I and my cattle, then will I give the price thereof; let me only pass through on my feet; there is no hurt.'
4332	4	20	20	 And he said: 'Thou shalt not pass through.' And Edom came out against him with much people, and with a strong hand.
4333	4	20	21	 Thus Edom refused to give Israel passage through his border; wherefore Israel turned away from him.
4334	4	20	22	 And they journeyed from Kadesh; and the children of Israel, even the whole congregation, came unto mount Hor.
4335	4	20	23	 And the LORD spoke unto Moses and Aaron in mount Hor, by the border of the land of Edom, saying:
4336	4	20	24	 'Aaron shall be gathered unto his people; for he shall not enter into the land which I have given unto the children of Israel, because ye rebelled against My word at the waters of Meribah.
4337	4	20	25	 Take Aaron and Eleazar his son, and bring them up unto mount Hor.
4338	4	20	26	 And strip Aaron of his garments, and put them upon Eleazar his son; and Aaron shall be gathered unto his people, and shall die there.'
4339	4	20	27	 And Moses did as the LORD commanded; and they went up into mount Hor in the sight of all the congregation.
4340	4	20	28	 And Moses stripped Aaron of his garments, and put them upon Eleazar his son; and Aaron died there in the top of the mount; and Moses and Eleazar came down from the mount.
4341	4	20	29	 And when all the congregation saw that Aaron was dead, they wept for Aaron thirty days, even all the house of Israel.
4342	4	21	1	 And the Canaanite, the king of Arad, who dwelt in the South, heard tell that Israel came by the way of Atharim; and he fought against Israel, and took some of them captive.
4343	4	21	2	 And Israel vowed a vow unto the LORD, and said: 'If Thou wilt indeed deliver this people into my hand, then I will utterly destroy their cities.'
4344	4	21	3	 And the LORD hearkened to the voice of Israel, and delivered up the Canaanites; and they utterly destroyed them and their cities; and the name of the place was called Hormah.
4345	4	21	4	 And they journeyed from mount Hor by the way to the Red Sea, to compass the land of Edom; and the soul of the people became impatient because of the way.
4346	4	21	5	 And the people spoke against God, and against Moses: 'Wherefore have ye brought us up out of Egypt to die in the wilderness? for there is no bread, and there is no water; and our soul loatheth this light bread.'
4347	4	21	6	 And the LORD sent fiery serpents among the people, and they bit the people; and much people of Israel died.
4348	4	21	7	 And the people came to Moses, and said: 'We have sinned, because we have spoken against the LORD, and against thee; pray unto the LORD, that He take away the serpents from us.' And Moses prayed for the people.
4349	4	21	8	 And the LORD said unto Moses: 'Make thee a fiery serpent, and set it upon a pole; and it shall come to pass, that every one that is bitten, when he seeth it, shall live.'
4350	4	21	9	 And Moses made a serpent of brass, and set it upon the pole; and it came to pass, that if a serpent had bitten any man, when he looked unto the serpent of brass, he lived.
4351	4	21	10	 And the children of Israel journeyed, and pitched in Oboth.
4352	4	21	11	 And they journeyed from Oboth, and pitched at Ije-abarim, in the wilderness which is in front of Moab, toward the sun-rising.

4354	4	21	13	 From thence they journeyed, and pitched on the other side of the Arnon, which is in the wilderness, that cometh out of the border of the Amorites. --For Arnon is the border of Moab, between Moab and the Amorites;
4355	4	21	14	 wherefore it is said in the book of the Wars of the LORD: Vaheb in Suphah, and the valleys of Arnon,

4362	4	21	21	 And Israel sent messengers unto Sihon king of the Amorites, saying:

4366	4	21	25	 And Israel took all these cities; and Israel dwelt in all the cities of the Amorites, in Heshbon, and in all the towns thereof.

4376	4	21	35	 So they smote him, and his sons, and all his people, until there was none left him remaining; and they possessed his land.
4377	4	22	1	 And the children of Israel journeyed, and pitched in the plains of Moab beyond the Jordan at Jericho.

4380	4	22	4	 And Moab said unto the elders of Midian: 'Now will this multitude lick up all that is round about us, as the ox licketh up the grass of the field.' --And Balak the son of Zippor was king of Moab at that time.--
4381	4	22	5	 And he sent messengers unto Balaam the son of Beor, to Pethor, which is by the River, to the land of the children of his people, to call him, saying: 'Behold, there is a people come out from Egypt; behold, they cover the face of the earth, and they abide over against me.
4382	4	22	6	 Come now therefore, I pray thee, curse me this people; for they are too mighty for me; peradventure I shall prevail, that we may smite them, and that I may drive them out of the land; for I know that he whom thou blessest is blessed, and he whom thou cursest is cursed.'

4491	4	26	1	 (25:19) And it came to pass after the plague, (26:1) that the LORD spoke unto Moses and unto Eleazar the son of Aaron the priest, saying:

4542	4	26	52	 And the LORD spoke unto Moses, saying:
4543	4	26	53	 'Unto these the land shall be divided for an inheritance according to the number of names.
4544	4	26	54	 To the more thou shalt give the more inheritance, and to the fewer thou shalt give the less inheritance; to each one according to those that were numbered of it shall its inheritance be given.
4545	4	26	55	 Notwithstanding the land shall be divided by lot; according to the names of the tribes of their fathers they shall inherit.
4546	4	26	56	 According to the lot shall their inheritance be divided between the more and the fewer.'
4547	4	26	57	 And these are they that were numbered of the Levites after their families: of Gershon, the family of the Gershonites; of Kohath, the family of the Kohathites; of Merari, the family of the Merarites.
4548	4	26	58	 These are the families of Levi: the family of the Libnites, the family of the Hebronites, the family of the Mahlites, the family of the Mushites, the family of the Korahites. And Kohath begot Amram.
4549	4	26	59	 And the name of Amram's wife was Jochebed, the daughter of Levi, who was born to Levi in Egypt; and she bore unto Amram Aaron and Moses, and Miriam their sister.
4550	4	26	60	 And unto Aaron were born Nadab and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar.
4551	4	26	61	 And Nadab and Abihu died, when they offered strange fire before the LORD.
4552	4	26	62	 And they that were numbered of them were twenty and three thousand, every male from a month old and upward; for they were not numbered among the children of Israel, because there was no inheritance given them among the children of Israel.
4553	4	26	63	 These are they that were numbered by Moses and Eleazar the priest, who numbered the children of Israel in the plains of Moab by the Jordan at Jericho.
4554	4	26	64	 But among these there was not a man of them that were numbered by Moses and Aaron the priest, who numbered the children of Israel in the wilderness of Sinai.
4555	4	26	65	 For the LORD had said of them: 'They shall surely die in the wilderness.' And there was not left a man of them, save Caleb the son of Jephunneh, and Joshua the son of Nun.
4556	4	27	1	 Then drew near the daughters of Zelophehad, the son of Hepher, the son of Gilead, the son of Machir, the son of Manasseh, of the families of Manasseh the son of Joseph; and these are the names of his daughters: Mahlah, Noah, and Hoglah, and Milcah, and Tirzah.
4557	4	27	2	 And they stood before Moses, and before Eleazar the priest, and before the princes and all the congregation, at the door of the tent of meeting, saying:
4558	4	27	3	 'Our father died in the wilderness, and he was not among the company of them that gathered themselves together against the LORD in the company of Korah, but he died in his own sin; and he had no sons.
4559	4	27	4	 Why should the name of our father be done away from among his family, because he had no son? Give unto us a possession among the brethren of our father.'
4560	4	27	5	 And Moses brought their cause before the LORD.
4561	4	27	6	 And the LORD spoke unto Moses, saying:
4562	4	27	7	 'The daughters of Zelophehad speak right: thou shalt surely give them a possession of an inheritance among their father's brethren; and thou shalt cause the inheritance of their father to pass unto them.
4563	4	27	8	 And thou shalt speak unto the children of Israel, saying: If a man die, and have no son, then ye shall cause his inheritance to pass unto his daughter.
4564	4	27	9	 And if he have no daughter, then ye shall give his inheritance unto his brethren.
4565	4	27	10	 And if he have no brethren, then ye shall give his inheritance unto his father's brethren.
4566	4	27	11	 And if his father have no brethren, then ye shall give his inheritance unto his kinsman that is next to him of his family, and he shall possess it. And it shall be unto the children of Israel a statute of judgment, as the LORD commanded Moses.'
4567	4	27	12	 And the LORD said unto Moses: 'Get thee up into this mountain of Abarim, and behold the land which I have given unto the children of Israel.
4568	4	27	13	 And when thou hast seen it, thou also shalt be gathered unto thy people, as Aaron thy brother was gathered;
4569	4	27	14	 because ye rebelled against My commandment in the wilderness of Zin, in the strife of the congregation, to sanctify Me at the waters before their eyes.' --These are the waters of Meribath-kadesh in the wilderness of Zin.--
4570	4	27	15	 And Moses spoke unto the LORD, saying:
4571	4	27	16	 'Let the LORD, the God of the spirits of all flesh, set a man over the congregation,
4572	4	27	17	 who may go out before them, and who may come in before them, and who may lead them out, and who may bring them in; that the congregation of the LORD be not as sheep which have no shepherd.'
4573	4	27	18	 And the LORD said unto Moses: 'Take thee Joshua the son of Nun, a man in whom is spirit, and lay thy hand upon him;
4574	4	27	19	 and set him before Eleazar the priest, and before all the congregation; and give him a charge in their sight.
4575	4	27	20	 And thou shalt put of thy honour upon him, that all the congregation of the children of Israel may hearken.
4576	4	27	21	 And he shall stand before Eleazar the priest, who shall inquire for him by the judgment of the Urim before the LORD; at his word shall they go out, and at his word they shall come in, both he, and all the children of Israel with him, even all the congregation.'
4577	4	27	22	 And Moses did as the LORD commanded him; and he took Joshua, and set him before Eleazar the priest, and before all the congregation.
4578	4	27	23	 And he laid his hands upon him, and gave him a charge, as the LORD spoke by the hand of Moses.
4579	4	28	1	 And the LORD spoke unto Moses, saying:
4580	4	28	2	 Command the children of Israel, and say unto them: My food which is presented unto Me for offerings made by fire, of a sweet savour unto Me, shall ye observe to offer unto Me in its due season.
4581	4	28	3	 And thou shalt say unto them: This is the offering made by fire which ye shall bring unto the LORD: he-lambs of the first year without blemish, two day by day, for a continual burnt-offering.
4582	4	28	4	 The one lamb shalt thou offer in the morning, and the other lamb shalt thou offer at dusk;
4583	4	28	5	 and the tenth part of an ephah of fine flour for a meal-offering, mingled with the fourth part of a hin of beaten oil.
4584	4	28	6	 It is a continual burnt-offering, which was offered in mount Sinai, for a sweet savour, an offering made by fire unto the LORD.
4585	4	28	7	 And the drink-offering thereof shall be the fourth part of a hin for the one lamb; in the holy place shalt thou pour out a drink-offering of strong drink unto the LORD.
4586	4	28	8	 And the other lamb shalt thou present at dusk; as the meal-offering of the morning, and as the drink-offering thereof, thou shalt present it, an offering made by fire, of a sweet savour unto the LORD.
4587	4	28	9	 And on the sabbath day two he-lambs of the first year without blemish, and two tenth parts of an ephah of fine flour for a meal-offering, mingled with oil, and the drink-offering thereof.
4588	4	28	10	 This is the burnt-offering of every sabbath, beside the continual burnt-offering, and the drink-offering thereof.
4589	4	28	11	 And in your new moons ye shall present a burnt-offering unto the LORD: two young bullocks, and one ram, seven he-lambs of the first year without blemish;
4590	4	28	12	 and three tenth parts of an ephah of fine flour for a meal-offering, mingled with oil, for each bullock; and two tenth parts of fine flour for a meal-offering, mingled with oil, for the one ram;
4591	4	28	13	 and a several tenth part of fine flour mingled with oil for a meal-offering unto every lamb; for a burnt-offering of a sweet savour, an offering made by fire unto the LORD.
4592	4	28	14	 And their drink-offerings shall be half a hin of wine for a bullock, and the third part of a hin for the ram, and the fourth part of a hin for a lamb. This is the burnt-offering of every new moon throughout the months of the year.
4593	4	28	15	 And one he-goat for a sin-offering unto the LORD; it shall be offered beside the continual burnt-offering, and the drink-offering thereof.
4594	4	28	16	 And in the first month, on the fourteenth day of the month, is the LORD'S passover.
4595	4	28	17	 And on the fifteenth day of this month shall be a feast; seven days shall unleavened bread be eaten.
4596	4	28	18	 In the first day shall be a holy convocation; ye shall do no manner of servile work;
4597	4	28	19	 but ye shall present an offering made by fire, a burnt-offering unto the LORD: two young bullocks, and one ram, and seven he-lambs of the first year; they shall be unto you without blemish;
4598	4	28	20	 and their meal-offering, fine flour mingled with oil; three tenth parts shall ye offer for a bullock, and two tenth parts for the ram;
4599	4	28	21	 a several tenth part shalt thou offer for every lamb of the seven lambs;
4600	4	28	22	 and one he-goat for a sin-offering, to make atonement for you.
4601	4	28	23	 Ye shall offer these beside the burnt-offering of the morning, which is for a continual burnt-offering.
4602	4	28	24	 After this manner ye shall offer daily, for seven days, the food of the offering made by fire, of a sweet savour unto the LORD; it shall be offered beside the continual burnt-offering, and the drink-offering thereof.
4603	4	28	25	 And on the seventh day ye shall have a holy convocation; ye shall do no manner of servile work.
4604	4	28	26	 Also in the day of the first-fruits, when ye bring a new meal-offering unto the LORD in your feast of weeks, ye shall have a holy convocation: ye shall do no manner of servile work;
4605	4	28	27	 but ye shall present a burnt-offering for a sweet savour unto the LORD: two young bullocks, one ram, seven he-lambs of the first year;
4606	4	28	28	 and their meal-offering, fine flour mingled with oil, three tenth parts for each bullock, two tenth parts for the one ram,
4607	4	28	29	 a several tenth part for every lamb of the seven lambs;
4608	4	28	30	 one he-goat, to make atonement for you.
4609	4	28	31	 Beside the continual burnt-offering, and the meal-offering thereof, ye shall offer them--they shall be unto you without blemish--and their drink-offerings.
4610	4	29	1	 And in the seventh month, on the first day of the month, ye shall have a holy convocation: ye shall do no manner of servile work; it is a day of blowing the horn unto you.
4611	4	29	2	 And ye shall prepare a burnt-offering for a sweet savour unto the LORD: one young bullock, one ram, seven he-lambs of the first year without blemish;
4612	4	29	3	 and their meal-offering, fine flour mingled with oil, three tenth parts for the bullock, two tenth part for the ram,
4613	4	29	4	 and one tenth part for every lamb of the seven lambs;
4614	4	29	5	 and one he-goat for a sin-offering, to make atonement for you;
4615	4	29	6	 beside the burnt-offering of the new moon, and the meal-offering thereof, and the continual burnt-offering and the meal-offering thereof, and their drink-offerings, according unto their ordinance, for a sweet savour, an offering made by fire unto the LORD.
4616	4	29	7	 And on the tenth day of this seventh month ye shall have a holy convocation; and ye shall afflict your souls; ye shall do no manner of work;
4617	4	29	8	 but ye shall present a burnt-offering unto the LORD for a sweet savour: one young bullock, one ram, seven he-lambs of the first year; they shall be unto you without blemish;
4618	4	29	9	 and their meal-offering, fine flour mingled with oil, three tenth parts for the bullock, two tenth parts for the one ram,
4619	4	29	10	 a several tenth part for every lamb of the seven lambs;
4620	4	29	11	 one he-goat for a sin-offering; beside the sin-offering of atonement, and the continual burnt-offering, and the meal-offering thereof, and their drink-offerings.
4621	4	29	12	 And on the fifteenth day of the seventh month ye shall have a holy convocation: ye shall do no manner of servile work, and ye shall keep a feast unto the LORD seven days;
4622	4	29	13	 and ye shall present a burnt-offering, an offering made by fire, of a sweet savour unto the LORD: thirteen young bullocks, two rams, fourteen he-lambs of the first year; they shall be without blemish;
4623	4	29	14	 and their meal-offering, fine flour mingled with oil, three tenth parts for every bullock of the thirteen bullocks, two tenth parts for each ram of the two rams,
4624	4	29	15	 and a several tenth part for every lamb of the fourteen lambs;
4625	4	29	16	 and one he-goat for a sin-offering beside the continual burnt-offering, the meal-offering thereof, and the drink-offering thereof.
4626	4	29	17	 And on the second day ye shall present twelve young bullocks, two rams, fourteen he-lambs of the first year without blemish;
4627	4	29	18	 and their meal-offering and their drink-offerings for the bullocks, for the rams, and for the lambs, according to their number, after the ordinance;
4628	4	29	19	 and one he-goat for a sin-offering; beside the continual burnt-offering, and the meal-offering thereof, and their drink-offerings.
4629	4	29	20	 And on the third day eleven bullocks, two rams, fourteen he-lambs of the first year without blemish;
4630	4	29	21	 and their meal-offering and their drink-offerings for the bullocks, for the rams, and for the lambs, according to their number, after the ordinance;
4631	4	29	22	 and one he-goat for a sin-offering; beside the continual burnt-offering, and the meal-offering thereof, and the drink-offering thereof.
4632	4	29	23	 And on the fourth day ten bullocks, two rams, fourteen he-lambs of the first year without blemish;
4633	4	29	24	 their meal-offering and their drink-offerings for the bullocks, for the rams, and for the lambs, according to their number, after the ordinance;
4634	4	29	25	 and one he-goat for a sin-offering; beside the continual burnt-offering, the meal-offering thereof, and the drink-offering thereof.
4635	4	29	26	 And on the fifth day nine bullocks, two rams, fourteen he-lambs of the first year without blemish;
4636	4	29	27	 and their meal-offering and their drink-offerings for the bullocks, for the rams, and for the lambs, according to their number, after the ordinance;
4637	4	29	28	 and one he-goat for a sin-offering; beside the continual burnt-offering, and the meal-offering thereof, and the drink-offering thereof.
4638	4	29	29	 And on the sixth day eight bullocks, two rams, fourteen he-lambs of the first year without blemish;
4639	4	29	30	 and their meal-offering and their drink-offerings for the bullocks, for the rams, and for the lambs, according to their number, after the ordinance;
4640	4	29	31	 and one he-goat for a sin-offering; beside the continual burnt-offering, the meal-offering thereof, and the drink-offerings thereof.
4641	4	29	32	 And on the seventh day seven bullocks, two rams, fourteen he-lambs of the first year without blemish;
4642	4	29	33	 and their meal-offering and their drink-offerings for the bullocks, for the rams, and for the lambs, according to their number, after the ordinance;
4643	4	29	34	 and one he-goat for a sin-offering; beside the continual burnt-offering, the meal-offering thereof, and the drink-offering thereof.
4644	4	29	35	 On the eighth day ye shall have a solemn assembly: ye shall do no manner of servile work;
4645	4	29	36	 but ye shall present a burnt-offering, an offering made by fire, of a sweet savour unto the LORD: one bullock, one ram, seven he-lambs of the first year without blemish;
4646	4	29	37	 their meal-offering and their drink-offerings for the bullock, for the ram, and for the lambs, shall be according to their number, after the ordinance;
4647	4	29	38	 and one he-goat for a sin-offering; beside the continual burnt-offering, and the meal-offering thereof, and the drink-offering thereof.
4648	4	29	39	 These ye shall offer unto the LORD in your appointed seasons, beside your vows, and your freewill-offerings, whether they be your burnt-offerings, or your meal-offerings, or your drink-offerings, or your peace-offerings.
4649	4	29	40	 (30:1) And Moses told the children of Israel according to all that the LORD commanded Moses.
4650	4	30	1	 (30:2) And Moses spoke unto the heads of the tribes of the children of Israel, saying: This is the thing which the LORD hath commanded.
4651	4	30	2	 (30:3) When a man voweth a vow unto the LORD, or sweareth an oath to bind his soul with a bond, he shall not break his word; he shall do according to all that proceedeth out of his mouth.
4652	4	30	3	 (30:4) Also when a woman voweth a vow unto the LORD, and bindeth herself by a bond, being in her father's house, in her youth,
4653	4	30	4	 (30:5) and her father heareth her vow, or her bond wherewith she hath bound her soul, and her father holdeth his peace at her, then all her vows shall stand, and every bond wherewith she hath bound her soul shall stand.
4654	4	30	5	 (30:6) But if her father disallow her in the day that he heareth, none of her vows, or of her bonds wherewith she hath bound her soul, shall stand; and the LORD will forgive her, because her father disallowed her.
4655	4	30	6	 (30:7) And if she be married to a husband, while her vows are upon her, or the clear utterance of her lips, wherewith she hath bound her soul;
4656	4	30	7	 (30:8) and her husband hear it, whatsoever day it be that he heareth it, and hold his peace at her; then her vows shall stand, and her bonds wherewith she hath bound her soul shall stand.
4657	4	30	8	 (30:9) But if her husband disallow her in the day that he heareth it, then he shall make void her vow which is upon her, and the clear utterance of her lips, wherewith she hath bound her soul; and the LORD will forgive her.
4658	4	30	9	 (30:10) But the vow of a widow, or of her that is divorced, even every thing wherewith she hath bound her soul, shall stand against her.
4659	4	30	10	 (30:11) And if a woman vowed in her husband's house, or bound her soul by a bond with an oath,
4660	4	30	11	 (30:12) and her husband heard it, and held his peace at her, and disallowed her not, then all her vows shall stand, and every bond wherewith she bound her soul shall stand.
4661	4	30	12	 (30:13) But if her husband make them null and void in the day that he heareth them, then whatsoever proceeded out of her lips, whether it were her vows, or the bond of her soul, shall not stand: her husband hath made them void; and the LORD will forgive her.
4662	4	30	13	 (30:14) Every vow, and every binding oath to afflict the soul, her husband may let it stand, or her husband may make it void.
4663	4	30	14	 (30:15) But if her husband altogether hold his peace at her from day to day, then he causeth all her vows to stand, or all her bonds, which are upon her; he hath let them stand, because he held his peace at her in the day that he heard them.
4664	4	30	15	 (30:16) But if he shall make them null and void after that he hath heard them, then he shall bear her iniquity.
4665	4	30	16	 (30:17) These are the statutes, which the LORD commanded Moses, between a man and his wife, between a father and his daughter, being in her youth, in her father's house.
4666	4	31	1	 And the LORD spoke unto Moses, saying:
4667	4	31	2	 'Avenge the children of Israel of the Midianites; afterward shalt thou be gathered unto thy people.'
4668	4	31	3	 And Moses spoke unto the people, saying: 'Arm ye men from among you for the war, that they may go against Midian, to execute the LORD'S vengeance on Midian.
4669	4	31	4	 Of every tribe a thousand, throughout all the tribes of Israel, shall ye send to the war.'
4670	4	31	5	 So there were delivered, out of the thousands of Israel, a thousand of every tribe, twelve thousand armed for war.
4671	4	31	6	 And Moses sent them, a thousand of every tribe, to the war, them and Phinehas the son of Eleazar the priest, to the war, with the holy vessels and the trumpets for the alarm in his hand.
4672	4	31	7	 And they warred against Midian, as the LORD commanded Moses; and they slew every male.
4673	4	31	8	 And they slew the kings of Midian with the rest of their slain: Evi, and Rekem, and Zur, and Hur, and Reba, the five kings of Midian; Balaam also the son of Beor they slew with the sword.
4674	4	31	9	 And the children of Israel took captive the women of Midian and their little ones; and all their cattle, and all their flocks, and all their goods, they took for a prey.
4675	4	31	10	 And all their cities in the places wherein they dwelt, and all their encampments, they burnt with fire.
4676	4	31	11	 And they took all the spoil, and all the prey, both of man and of beast.
4677	4	31	12	 And they brought the captives, and the prey, and the spoil, unto Moses, and unto Eleazar the priest, and unto the congregation of the children of Israel, unto the camp, unto the plains of Moab, which are by the Jordan at Jericho.
4678	4	31	13	 And Moses, and Eleazar the priest, and all the princes of the congregation, went forth to meet them without the camp.
4679	4	31	14	 And Moses was wroth with the officers of the host, the captains of thousands and the captains of hundreds, who came from the service of the war.
4680	4	31	15	 And Moses said unto them: 'Have ye saved all the women alive?
4681	4	31	16	 Behold, these caused the children of Israel, through the counsel of Balaam, to revolt so as to break faith with the LORD in the matter of Peor, and so the plague was among the congregation of the LORD.
4682	4	31	17	 Now therefore kill every male among the little ones, and kill every woman that hath known man by lying with him.
4683	4	31	18	 But all the women children, that have not known man by lying with him, keep alive for yourselves.
4684	4	31	19	 And encamp ye without the camp seven days; whosoever hath killed any person, and whosoever hath touched any slain, purify yourselves on the third day and on the seventh day, ye and your captives.
4685	4	31	20	 And as to every garment, and all that is made of skin, and all work of goats' hair, and all things made of wood, ye shall purify.'
4686	4	31	21	 And Eleazar the priest said unto the men of war that went to the battle: 'This is the statute of the law which the LORD hath commanded Moses:
4687	4	31	22	 Howbeit the gold, and the silver, the brass, the iron, the tin, and the lead,
4688	4	31	23	 every thing that may abide the fire, ye shall make to go through the fire, and it shall be clean; nevertheless it shall be purified with the water of sprinkling; and all that abideth not the fire ye shall make to go through the water.
4689	4	31	24	 And ye shall wash your clothes on the seventh day, and ye shall be clean, and afterward ye may come into the camp.'
4690	4	31	25	 And the LORD spoke unto Moses, saying:
4691	4	31	26	 'Take the sum of the prey that was taken, both of man and of beast, thou, and Eleazar the priest, and the heads of the fathers' houses of the congregation;
4692	4	31	27	 and divide the prey into two parts: between the men skilled in war, that went out to battle, and all the congregation;
4693	4	31	28	 and levy a tribute unto the LORD of the men of war that went out to battle: one soul of five hundred, both of the persons, and of the beeves, and of the asses, and of the flocks;
4694	4	31	29	 take it of their half, and give it unto Eleazar the priest, as a portion set apart for the LORD.
4695	4	31	30	 And of the children of Israel's half, thou shalt take one drawn out of every fifty, of the persons, of the beeves, of the asses, and of the flocks, even of all the cattle, and give them unto the Levites, that keep the charge of the tabernacle of the LORD.'
4696	4	31	31	 And Moses and Eleazar the priest did as the LORD commanded Moses.
4697	4	31	32	 Now the prey, over and above the booty which the men of war took, was six hundred thousand and seventy thousand and five thousand sheep,
4698	4	31	33	 and threescore and twelve thousand beeves,
4699	4	31	34	 and threescore and one thousand asses,
4700	4	31	35	 and thirty and two thousand persons in all, of the women that had not known man by lying with him.
4701	4	31	36	 And the half, which was the portion of them that went out to war, was in number three hundred thousand and thirty thousand and seven thousand and five hundred sheep.
4702	4	31	37	 And the LORD'S tribute of the sheep was six hundred and threescore and fifteen.
4703	4	31	38	 And the beeves were thirty and six thousand, of which the LORD'S tribute was threescore and twelve.
4704	4	31	39	 And the asses were thirty thousand and five hundred, of which the LORD'S tribute was threescore and one.
4705	4	31	40	 And the persons were sixteen thousand, of whom the LORD'S tribute was thirty and two persons.
4706	4	31	41	 And Moses gave the tribute, which was set apart for the LORD, unto Eleazar the priest, as the LORD commanded Moses.
4707	4	31	42	 And of the children of Israel's half, which Moses divided off from the men that warred--
4708	4	31	43	 now the congregation's half was three hundred thousand and thirty thousand and seven thousand and five hundred sheep,
4709	4	31	44	 and thirty and six thousand beeves,
4710	4	31	45	 and thirty thousand and five hundred asses,
4711	4	31	46	 and sixteen thousand persons--
4712	4	31	47	 even of the children of Israel's half, Moses took one drawn out of every fifty, both of man and of beast, and gave them unto the Levites, that kept the charge of the tabernacle of the LORD; as the LORD commanded Moses.
4713	4	31	48	 And the officers that were over the thousands of the host, the captains of thousands, and the captains of hundreds, came near unto Moses;
4714	4	31	49	 and they said unto Moses: 'Thy servants have taken the sum of the men of war that are under our charge, and there lacketh not one man of us.
4715	4	31	50	 And we have brought the LORD'S offering, what every man hath gotten, of jewels of gold, armlets, and bracelets, signet-rings, ear-rings, and girdles, to make atonement for our souls before the LORD.'
4716	4	31	51	 And Moses and Eleazar the priest took the gold of them, even all wrought jewels.
4717	4	31	52	 And all the gold of the gift that they set apart for the LORD, of the captains of thousands, and of the captains of hundreds, was sixteen thousand seven hundred and fifty shekels.--
4718	4	31	53	 For the men of war had taken booty, every man for himself.--
4719	4	31	54	 And Moses and Eleazar the priest took the gold of the captains of thousands and of hundreds, and brought it into the tent of meeting, for a memorial for the children of Israel before the LORD.
4720	4	32	1	 Now the children of Reuben and the children of Gad had a very great multitude of cattle; and when they saw the land of Jazer, and the land of Gilead, that, behold, the place was a place for cattle,
4721	4	32	2	 the children of Gad and the children of Reuben came and spoke unto Moses, and to Eleazar the priest, and unto the princes of the congregation, saying:
4722	4	32	3	 'Ataroth, and Dibon, and Jazer, and Nimrah, and Heshbon, and Elealeh, and Sebam, and Nebo, and Beon,
4723	4	32	4	 the land which the LORD smote before the congregation of Israel, is a land for cattle, and thy servants have cattle.'
4724	4	32	5	 And they said: 'If we have found favour in thy sight, let this land be given unto thy servants for a possession; bring us not over the Jordan.'
4725	4	32	6	 And Moses said unto the children of Gad and to the children of Reuben: 'Shall your brethren go to the war, and shall ye sit here?
4726	4	32	7	 And wherefore will ye turn away the heart of the children of Israel from going over into the land which the LORD hath given them?
4727	4	32	8	 Thus did your fathers, when I sent them from Kadesh-barnea to see the land.
4728	4	32	9	 For when they went up unto the valley of Eshcol, and saw the land, they turned away the heart of the children of Israel, that they should not go into the land which the LORD had given them.
4729	4	32	10	 And the LORD'S anger was kindled in that day, and He swore, saying:
4730	4	32	11	 Surely none of the men that came up out of Egypt, from twenty years old and upward, shall see the land which I swore unto Abraham, unto Isaac, and unto Jacob; because they have not wholly followed Me;
4731	4	32	12	 save Caleb the son of Jephunneh the Kenizzite, and Joshua the son of Nun; because they have wholly followed the LORD.
4732	4	32	13	 And the LORD'S anger was kindled against Israel, and He made them wander to and fro in the wilderness forty years, until all the generation, that had done evil in the sight of the LORD, was consumed.
4733	4	32	14	 And, behold, ye are risen up in your fathers' stead, a brood of sinful men, to augment yet the fierce anger of the LORD toward Israel.
4734	4	32	15	 For if ye turn away from after Him, He will yet again leave them in the wilderness; and so ye will destroy all this people.'
4735	4	32	16	 And they came near unto him, and said: 'We will build sheepfolds here for our cattle, and cities for our little ones;
4736	4	32	17	 but we ourselves will be ready armed to go before the children of Israel, until we have brought them unto their place; and our little ones shall dwell in the fortified cities because of the inhabitants of the land.
4737	4	32	18	 We will not return unto our houses, until the children of Israel have inherited every man his inheritance.
4738	4	32	19	 For we will not inherit with them on the other side of the Jordan, and forward, because our inheritance is fallen to us on this side of the Jordan eastward.'
4739	4	32	20	 And Moses said unto them: 'If ye will do this thing: if ye will arm yourselves to go before the LORD to the war,
4740	4	32	21	 and every armed man of you will pass over the Jordan before the LORD, until He hath driven out His enemies from before Him,
4741	4	32	22	 and the land be subdued before the LORD, and ye return afterward; then ye shall be clear before the LORD, and before Israel, and this land shall be unto you for a possession before the LORD.
4742	4	32	23	 But if ye will not do so, behold, ye have sinned against the LORD; and know ye your sin which will find you.
4743	4	32	24	 Build you cities for your little ones, and folds for your sheep; and do that which hath proceeded out of your mouth.'
4744	4	32	25	 And the children of Gad and the children of Reuben spoke unto Moses, saying: 'Thy servants will do as my lord commandeth.
4745	4	32	26	 Our little ones, our wives, our flocks, and all our cattle, shall be there in the cities of Gilead;
4746	4	32	27	 but thy servants will pass over, every man that is armed for war, before the LORD to battle, as my lord saith.'
4747	4	32	28	 So Moses gave charge concerning them to Eleazar the priest, and to Joshua the son of Nun, and to the heads of the fathers' houses of the tribes of the children of Israel.
4748	4	32	29	 And Moses said unto them: 'If the children of Gad and the children of Reuben will pass with you over the Jordan, every man that is armed to battle, before the LORD, and the land shall be subdued before you, then ye shall give them the land of Gilead for a possession;
4749	4	32	30	 but if they will not pass over with you armed, they shall have possessions among you in the land of Canaan.'
4750	4	32	31	 And the children of Gad and the children of Reuben answered, saying: 'As the LORD hath said unto thy servants, so will we do.
4751	4	32	32	 We will pass over armed before the LORD into the land of Canaan, and the possession of our inheritance shall remain with us beyond the Jordan.'
