10661	13	10	1	 Now the Philistines fought against Israel; and the men of Israel fled from before the Philistines, and fell down slain in mount Gilboa.
10662	13	10	2	 And the Philistines followed hard after Saul and after his sons; and the Philistines slew Jonathan, and Abinadab, and Malchi-shua, the sons of Saul.
10663	13	10	3	 And the battle went sore against Saul, and the archers overtook him; and he was in anguish by reason of the archers.
10664	13	10	4	 Then said Saul unto his armour-bearer: 'Draw thy sword, and thrust me through therewith; lest these uncircumcised come and make a mock of me.' But his armour-bearer would not; for he was sore afraid. Therefore Saul took his sword, and fell upon it.
10665	13	10	5	 And when his armour-bearer saw that Saul was dead, he likewise fell upon his sword, and died.
10666	13	10	6	 So Saul died, and his three sons; and all his house died together.
10667	13	10	7	 And when all the men of Israel that were in the valley saw that Israel fled, and that Saul and his sons were dead, they forsook their cities, and fled; and the Philistines came and dwelt in them.
10668	13	10	8	 And it came to pass on the morrow, when the Philistines came to strip the slain, that they found Saul and his sons fallen in mount Gilboa.
10669	13	10	9	 And they stripped him, and took his head, and his armour, and sent into the land of the Philistines round about, to carry the tidings unto their idols, and to the people.
10670	13	10	10	 And they put his armour in the house of their gods, and fastened his head in the house of Dagon.
10671	13	10	11	 And when all Jabesh-gilead heard all that the Philistines had done to Saul,
10672	13	10	12	 all the valiant men arose, and took away the body of Saul, and the bodies of his sons, and brought them to Jabesh, and buried their bones under the terebinth in Jabesh, and fasted seven days.
10673	13	10	13	 So Saul died for his transgression which he committed against the LORD, because of the word of the LORD, which he kept not; and also for that he asked counsel of a ghost, to inquire thereby,
10674	13	10	14	 and inquired not of the LORD; therefore He slew him, and turned the kingdom unto David the son of Jesse.
10675	13	11	1	 Then all Israel gathered themselves to David unto Hebron, saying: 'Behold, we are thy bone and thy flesh.
10676	13	11	2	 In times past, even when Saul was king, it was thou that didst lead out and bring in Israel; and the LORD thy God said unto thee: Thou shalt feed My people Israel, and thou shalt be prince over My people Israel.'
10677	13	11	3	 So all the elders of Israel came to the king to Hebron; and David made a covenant with them in Hebron before the LORD; and they anointed David king over Israel, according to the word of the LORD by the hand of Samuel.
10678	13	11	4	 And David and all Israel went to Jerusalem--the same is Jebus--and the Jebusites, the inhabitants of the land, were there.
10679	13	11	5	 And the inhabitants of Jebus said to David: 'Thou shalt not come in hither.' Nevertheless David took the stronghold of Zion; the same is the city of David.
10680	13	11	6	 And David said: 'Whosoever smiteth the Jebusites first shall be chief and captain.' And Joab the son of Zeruiah went up first, and was made chief.
10681	13	11	7	 And David dwelt in the stronghold; therefore they called it the city of David.
10682	13	11	8	 And he built the city round about, from Millo even round about; and Joab repaired the rest of the city.
10683	13	11	9	 And David waxed greater and greater; for the LORD of hosts was with him.
10684	13	11	10	 Now these are the chief of the mighty men whom David had, who held strongly with him in his kingdom, together with all Israel, to make him king, according to the word of the LORD concerning Israel.
10685	13	11	11	 And this is the number of the mighty men whom David had: Jashobeam, the son of a Hachmonite, the chief of the captains; he lifted up his spear against three hundred and slew them at one time.
10686	13	11	12	 And after him was Eleazar the son of Dodo, the Ahohite, who was one of the three mighty men.
10687	13	11	13	 He was with David at Pas-dammim, and there the Philistines were gathered together to battle, where was a plot of ground full of barley; and the people fled from before the Philistines.
10688	13	11	14	 But they stood in the midst of the plot, and defended it, and slew the Philistines; and the LORD saved them by a great victory.
10689	13	11	15	 And three of the thirty chiefs went down to the rock to David, unto the cave of Adullam; and the host of the Philistines were encamped in the valley of Rephaim.
10690	13	11	16	 And David was then in the stronghold, and the garrison of the Philistines was then in Beth-lehem.
10691	13	11	17	 And David longed, and said: 'Oh that one would give me water to drink of the well of Beth-lehem, which is by the gate!'
10692	13	11	18	 And the three broke through the host of the Philistines, and drew water out of the well of Beth-lehem, that was by the gate, and took it, and brought it to David; but David would not drink thereof, but poured it out unto the LORD,
10693	13	11	19	 and said: 'My God forbid it me, that I should do this; shall I drink the blood of these men that have put their lives in jeopardy? for with the jeopardy of their lives they brought it.' Therefore he would not drink it. These things did the three mighty men.
10694	13	11	20	 And Abishai, the brother of Joab, he was chief of the three; for he lifted up his spear against three hundred and slew them, and had a name among the three.
10695	13	11	21	 Of the three in the second rank he was the most honourable, and was made their captain; howbeit he attained not to the first three.
10696	13	11	22	 Beniah the son of Jehoiada, the son of a valiant man of Kabzeel, who had done mighty deeds, he smote the two altar-hearths of Moab; he went down also and slew a lion in the midst of a pit in time of snow.
10697	13	11	23	 And he slew an Egyptian, a man of great stature, five cubits high; and in the Egyptian's hand was a spear like a weaver's beam; and he went down to him with a staff, and plucked the spear out of the Egyptian's hand, and slew him with his own spear.
10698	13	11	24	 These things did Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, and had a name among the three mighty men.
10699	13	11	25	 Behold, he was more honourable than the thirty, but he attained not to the first three; and David set him over his guard.
10700	13	11	26	 Also the mighty men of valour: Asahel the brother of Joab, Elhanan the son of Dodo of Beth-lehem;
10701	13	11	27	 Shammoth the Harorite, Helez the Pelonite;
10702	13	11	28	 Ira the son of Ikkesh the Tekoite, Abiezer the Anathothite;
10703	13	11	29	 Sibbecai the Hushathite, Ilai the Ahohite;
10704	13	11	30	 Mahrai the Netophathite, Heled the son of Baanah the Netophathite;
10705	13	11	31	 Ithai the son of Ribai of Gibeah of the children of Benjamin, Benaiah the Pirathonite;
10706	13	11	32	 Hurai of Nahale-gaash, Abiel the Arbathite;
10707	13	11	33	 Azmaveth the Baharumite, Eliahba the Shaalbonite;
10708	13	11	34	 the sons of Hashem the Gizonite, Jonathan the son of Shageh the Hararite;
10709	13	11	35	 Ahiam the son of Sacar the Hararite, Eliphal the son of Ur;
10710	13	11	36	 Hepher the Mecherathite, Ahijah the Pelonite;
10711	13	11	37	 Hezro the Carmelite, Naarai the son of Ezbai;
10712	13	11	38	 Joel the brother of Nathan, Mibhar the son of Hagri;
10713	13	11	39	 Zelek the Ammonite, Nahrai the Berothite, the armour-bearer of Joab the son of Zeruiah;
10714	13	11	40	 Ira the Ithrite, Gareb the Ithrite;
10715	13	11	41	 Uriah the Hittite, Zabad the son of Ahlai;
10716	13	11	42	 Adina the son of Shiza the Reubenite, a chief of the Reubenites, and thirty with him;
10717	13	11	43	 Hanan the son of Maacah, and Joshaphat the Mithnite;
10718	13	11	44	 Uzzia the Ashterathite, Shama and Jeiel the sons of Hotham the Aroerite;
10719	13	11	45	 Jediael the son of Shimri, and Joha his brother, the Tizite;
10720	13	11	46	 Eliel the Mahavite, and Jeribai, and Joshaviah, the sons of Elnaam, and Ithmah the Moabite;
10721	13	11	47	 Eliel, and Obed, and Jaasiel the Mezobaite.
10722	13	12	1	 Now these are they that came to David to Ziklag, while he was yet shut up because of Saul the son of Kish; and they were among the mighty men, his helpers in war.
10723	13	12	2	 They were armed with bows, and could use both the right hand and the left in slinging stones and in shooting arrows from the bow; they were of Saul's brethren of Benjamin.
10724	13	12	3	 The chief was Ahiezer, then Joash, the sons of Shemaah the Gibeathite; and Jeziel, and Pelet, the sons of Azmaveth; and Beracah, and Jehu the Anathothite;
10725	13	12	4	 and Ishmaiah the Gibeonite, a mighty man among the thirty, and over the thirty; (12:5) and Jeremiah, and Jahaziel, and Johanan, and Jozabad the Gederathite;
10726	13	12	5	 (12:6) Eluzai, and Jerimoth, and Bealiah, and Shemariah, and Shephatiah the Hariphite;
10727	13	12	6	 (12:7) Elkanah, and Isshiah, and Azarel, and Joezer, and Jashobeam, the Korahites;
10728	13	12	7	 (12:8) and Joelah, and Zebadiah, the sons of Jeroham of the troop.
10729	13	12	8	 (12:9) And of the Gadites there separated themselves unto David to the stronghold in the wilderness, mighty men of valour, men trained for war, that could handle shield and spear; whose faces were like the faces of lions, and they were as swift as the roes upon the mountains;
10730	13	12	9	 (12:10) Ezer the chief, Obadiah the second, Eliab the third;
10731	13	12	10	 (12:11) Mashmannah the fourth, Jeremiah the fifth;
10732	13	12	11	 (12:12) Attai the sixth, Eliel the seventh;
10733	13	12	12	 (12:13) Johanan the eighth, Elzabad the ninth;
10734	13	12	13	 (12:14) Jeremiah the tenth, Machbannai the eleventh.
10735	13	12	14	 (12:15) These of the sons of Gad were captains of the host; he that was least was equal to a hundred, and the greatest to a thousand.
10736	13	12	15	 (12:16) These are they that went over the Jordan in the first month, when it had overflown all its banks; and they put to flight all them of the valleys, both toward the east, and toward the west.
10737	13	12	16	 (12:17) And there came of the children of Benjamin and Judah to the stronghold unto David.
10738	13	12	17	 (12:18) And David went out to meet them, and answered and said unto them: 'If ye be come peaceably unto me to help me, my heart shall be knit unto you; but if ye be come to betray me to mine adversaries, seeing there is no wrong in my hands, the God of our fathers look thereon, and give judgment.'
10739	13	12	18	 (12:19) Then the spirit clothed Amasai, who was chief of the captains: Thine are we, David, and on thy side, thou son of Jesse; peace, peace be unto thee, and peace be to thy helpers; for thy God helpeth thee. Then David received them, and made them captains of the band.
10740	13	12	19	 (12:20) Of Manasseh also there fell away some to David, when he came with the Philistines against Saul to battle, but they helped them not; for the lords of the Philistines upon advisement sent him away, saying: 'He will fall away to his master Saul to the jeopardy of our heads.'
10741	13	12	20	 (12:21) As he went to Ziklag, there fell to him of Manasseh, Adnah, and Jozabad, and Jediael, and Michael, and Jozabad, and Elihu, and Zillethai, captains of thousands that were of Manasseh.
10742	13	12	21	 (12:22) And they helped David against the troop, for they were all mighty men of valour, and were captains in the host.
10743	13	12	22	 (12:23) For from day to day men came to David to help him, until there was a great host, like the host of God.
10744	13	12	23	 (12:24) And these are the numbers of the heads of them that were armed for war, who came to David to Hebron, to turn the kingdom of Saul to him, according to the word of the LORD.
10745	13	12	24	 (12:25) The children of Judah that bore shield and spear were six thousand and eight hundred, armed for war.
10746	13	12	25	 (12:26) Of the children of Simeon, mighty men of valour for the war, seven thousand and one hundred.
10747	13	12	26	 (12:27) Of the children of Levi four thousand and six hundred.
10748	13	12	27	 (12:28) And Jehoiada was the leader of the house of Aaron, and with him were three thousand and seven hundred;
10749	13	12	28	 (12:29) and Zadok, a young man mighty of valour, and of his father's house twenty and two captains.
10750	13	12	29	 (12:30) And of the children of Benjamin, the brethren of Saul, three thousand; for hitherto the greatest part of them had kept their allegiance to the house of Saul.
10751	13	12	30	 (12:31) And of the children of Ephraim twenty thousand and eight hundred, mighty men of valour, famous men in their fathers' houses.
10752	13	12	31	 (12:32) And of the half-tribe of Manasseh eighteen thousand, who were mentioned by name, to come and make David king.
10753	13	12	32	 (12:33) And of the children of Issachar, men that had understanding of the times, to know what Israel ought to do; the heads of them were two hundred; and all their brethren were at their commandment.
10754	13	12	33	 (12:34) Of Zebulun, such as were able to go out in the host, that could set the battle in array, with all manner of instruments of war, fifty thousand; and that could order the battle array, and were not of double heart.
10755	13	12	34	 (12:35) And of Naphtali a thousand captains, and with them with shield and spear thirty and seven thousand.
10756	13	12	35	 (12:36) And of the Danites that could set the battle in array, twenty and eight thousand and six hundred.
10757	13	12	36	 (12:37) And of Asher, such as were able to go out in the host, that could set the battle in array, forty thousand.
10758	13	12	37	 (12:38) And on the other side of the Jordan, of the Reubenites, and the Gadites, and of the half-tribe of Manasseh, with all manner of instruments of war for the battle, a hundred and twenty thousand.
10759	13	12	38	 (12:39) All these, being men of war, that could order the battle array, came with a whole heart to Hebron, to make David king over all Israel; and all the rest also of Israel were of one heart to make David king.
10760	13	12	39	 (12:40) And they were there with David three days, eating and drinking; for their brethren had made preparation for them.
10761	13	12	40	 (12:41) Moreover they that were nigh unto them, even as far as Issachar and Zebulun and Naphtali, brought bread on asses, and on camels, and on mules, and on oxen, victual of meal, cakes of figs, and clusters of raisins, and wine, and oil, and oxen, and sheep in abundance; for there was joy in Israel.
10762	13	13	1	 And David consulted with the captains of thousands and of hundreds, even with every leader.
10763	13	13	2	 And David said unto all the assembly of Israel: 'If it seem good unto you, and if it be of the LORD our God, let us send abroad everywhere unto our brethren that are left in all the land of Israel, and with them to the priests and Levites that are in their cities that have open land about them, that they may gather themselves unto us;
10764	13	13	3	 and let us bring back the ark of our God to us; for we sought not unto it in the days of Saul.'
10765	13	13	4	 And all the assembly said that they would do so; for the thing was right in the eyes of all the people.
10766	13	13	5	 So David assembled all Israel together, from Shihor the brook of Egypt even unto the entrance of Hamath, to bring the ark of God from Kiriath-jearim.
10767	13	13	6	 And David went up, and all Israel, to Baalah, that is, to Kiriath-jearim, which belonged to Judah, to bring up from thence the ark of God, the LORD that sitteth upon the cherubim, whereon is called the Name.
10768	13	13	7	 And they set the ark of God upon a new cart, and brought it out of the house of Abinadab; and Uzza and Ahio drove the cart.
10769	13	13	8	 And David and all Israel played before God with all their might; even with songs, and with harps, and with psalteries, and with timbrels, and with cymbals, and with trumpets.
10770	13	13	9	 And when they came unto the threshing-floor of Chidon, Uzza put forth his hand to hold the ark; for the oxen stumbled.
10771	13	13	10	 And the anger of the LORD was kindled against Uzza, and He smote him, because he put forth his hand to the ark; and there he died before God.
10772	13	13	11	 And David was displeased, because the LORD had broken forth upon Uzza; and that place was called Perez-uzza unto this day.
10773	13	13	12	 And David was afraid of God that day, saying: 'How shall I bring the ark of God home to me?'
10774	13	13	13	 So David removed not the ark unto him into the city of David, but carried it aside into the house of Obed-edom the Gittite.
10775	13	13	14	 And the ark of God remained with the family of Obed-edom in his house three months; and the LORD blessed the house of Obed-edom, and all that he had.
10776	13	14	1	 And Huram king of Tyre sent messengers to David, and cedar-trees, and masons, and carpenters, to build him a house.
10777	13	14	2	 And David perceived that the LORD had established him king over Israel, for his kingdom was exalted exceedingly, for His people Israel's sake.
10778	13	14	3	 And David took more wives at Jerusalem; and David begot more sons and daughters.
10779	13	14	4	 And these are the names of the children whom he had in Jerusalem: Shammua, and Shobab, Nathan, and Solomon;
10780	13	14	5	 and Ibhar, and Elishua, and Elpelet;
10781	13	14	6	 and Nogah, and Nepheg, and Japhia;
10782	13	14	7	 and Elishama, and Beeliada, and Eliphelet.
10783	13	14	8	 And when the Philistines heard that David was anointed king over all Israel, all the Philistines went up to seek David; and David heard of it, and went out to meet them.
10784	13	14	9	 Now the Philistines had come and made a raid in the valley of Rephaim.
10785	13	14	10	 And David inquired of God, saying: 'Shall I go up against the Philistines? and wilt Thou deliver them into my hand?' And the LORD said unto him: 'Go up; for I will deliver them into thy hand.'
10786	13	14	11	 So they came up to Baal-perazim, and David smote them there; and David said: 'God hath broken mine enemies by my hand, like the breach of waters.' Therefore they called the name of that place Baal-perazim.
10787	13	14	12	 And they left their gods there; and David gave commandment, and they were burned with fire.
10788	13	14	13	 And the Philistines yet again made a raid in the valley.
10789	13	14	14	 And David inquired again of God; and God said unto him: 'Thou shalt not go up after them; turn away from them, and come upon them over against the mulberry-trees.
10790	13	14	15	 And it shall be, when thou hearest the sound of marching in the tops of the mulberry-trees, that then thou shalt go out to battle; for God is gone out before thee to smite the host of the Philistines.'
10791	13	14	16	 And David did as God commanded him; and they smote the host of the Philistines from Gibeon even to Gezer.
10792	13	14	17	 And the fame of David went out into all lands; and the LORD brought the fear of him upon all nations.
10793	13	15	1	 And David made him houses in the city of David; and he prepared a place for the ark of God, and pitched for it a tent.
10794	13	15	2	 Then David said: 'None ought to carry the ark of God but the Levites; for them hath the LORD chosen to carry the ark of the LORD, and to minister unto Him for ever.'
10795	13	15	3	 And David assembled all Israel at Jerusalem, to bring up the ark of the LORD unto its place, which he had prepared for it.
10796	13	15	4	 And David gathered together the sons of Aaron, and the Levites;
10797	13	15	5	 of the sons of Kohath: Uriel the chief, and his brethren a hundred and twenty;
10798	13	15	6	 of the sons of Merari: Asaiah the chief, and his brethren two hundred and twenty;
10799	13	15	7	 of the sons of Gershom: Joel the chief, and his brethren a hundred and thirty;
10800	13	15	8	 of the sons of Elizaphan: Shemaiah the chief, and his brethren two hundred;
10801	13	15	9	 of the sons of Hebron: Eliel the chief, and his brethren fourscore;
10802	13	15	10	 of the sons of Uzziel: Amminadab the chief, and his brethren a hundred and twelve.
10803	13	15	11	 And David called for Zadok and Abiathar the priests, and for the Levites, for Uriel, Asaiah, and Joel, Shemaiah, and Eliel, and Amminadab,
10804	13	15	12	 and said unto them: 'Ye are the heads of the fathers' houses of the Levites; sanctify yourselves, both ye and your brethren, that ye may bring up the ark of the LORD, the God of Israel, unto the place that I have prepared for it.
10805	13	15	13	 For because ye bore it not at the first, the LORD our God made a breach upon us, for that we sought Him not according to the ordinance.'
10806	13	15	14	 So the priests and the Levites sanctified themselves to bring up the ark of the LORD, the God of Israel.
10807	13	15	15	 And the children of the Levites bore the ark of God upon their shoulders with the bars thereon, as Moses commanded according to the word of the LORD.
10808	13	15	16	 And David spoke to the chief of the Levites to appoint their brethren the singers, with instruments of music, psalteries and harps and cymbals, sounding aloud and lifting up the voice with joy.
10809	13	15	17	 So the Levites appointed Heman the son of Joel; and of his brethren, Asaph the son of Berechiah; and of the sons of Merari their brethren, Ethan the son of Kushaiah;
10810	13	15	18	 and with them their brethren of the second degree, Zechariah, Ben, and Jaaziel, and Shemiramoth, and Jehiel, and Unni, Eliab, and Benaiah, and Maaseiah, and Mattithiah, and Eliphalehu, and Mikneiah, and Obed-edom, and Jeiel, the doorkeepers.
10811	13	15	19	 So the singers, Heman, Asaph, and Ethan ,were appointed, with cymbals of brass to sound aloud;
10812	13	15	20	 and Zechariah, and Aziel, and Shemiramoth, and Jehiel, and Unni, and Eliab, and Maaseiah, and Benaiah, with psalteries set to Alamoth;
10813	13	15	21	 and Mattithiah, and Eliphalehu, and Mikneiahu, and Obed-edom, and Jeiel, and Azaziah, with harps on the Sheminith, to lead.
10814	13	15	22	 And Chenaniah, chief of the Levites, was over the song; he was master in the song, because he was skilful.
10815	13	15	23	 And Berechiah and Elkanah were door-keepers for the ark.
10816	13	15	24	 And Shebaniah, and Joshaphat, and Nethanel, and Amasai, and Zechariah, and Benaiah, and Eliezer, the priests, did blow with the trumpets before the ark of God; and Obed-edom and Jehiah were doorkeepers for the ark.
10817	13	15	25	 So David, and the elders of Israel, and the captains over thousands, went to bring up the ark of the covenant of the LORD out of the house of Obed-edom with joy.
10818	13	15	26	 And it came to pass, when God helped the Levites that bore the ark of the covenant of the LORD, that they sacrificed seven bullocks and seven rams.
10819	13	15	27	 And David was clothed with a robe of fine linen, and all the Levites that bore the ark, and the singers, and Chenaniah the master of the singers in the song; and David had upon him an ephod of linen.
10820	13	15	28	 Thus all Israel brought up the ark of the covenant of the LORD with shouting, and with sound of the horn, and with trumpets, and with cymbals, sounding aloud with psalteries and harps.
10821	13	15	29	 And it came to pass, as the ark of the covenant of the LORD came to the city of David, that Michal the daughter of Saul looked out at the window, and saw king David dancing and making merry; and she despised him in her heart.
10822	13	16	1	 And they brought in the ark of God, and set it in the midst of the tent that David had pitched for it, and they offered burnt-offerings and peace-offerings before God.
10823	13	16	2	 And when David had made an end of offering the burnt-offering and the peace-offerings, he blessed the people in the name of the LORD.
10824	13	16	3	 And he dealt to every one of Israel, both man and woman, to every one a loaf of bread, and a cake made in a pan, and a sweet cake.
10825	13	16	4	 And he appointed certain of the Levites to minister before the ark of the LORD, and to celebrate and to thank and praise the LORD, the God of Israel:
10826	13	16	5	 Asaph the chief, and second to him Zechariah, Jeiel, and Shemiramoth, and Jehiel, and Mattithiah, and Eliab, and Benaiah, and Obed-edom, and Jeiel, with psalteries and with harps; and Asaph with cymbals, sounding aloud;
10827	13	16	6	 and Benaiah and Jahaziel the priests with trumpets continually, before the ark of the covenant of God.
10828	13	16	7	 Then on that day did David first ordain to give thanks unto the LORD, by the hand of Asaph and his brethren.
10829	13	16	8	 O give thanks unto the LORD, call upon His name; make known His doings among the peoples.
10830	13	16	9	 Sing unto Him, sing praises unto Him; speak ye of all His marvellous works.
10831	13	16	10	 Glory ye in His holy name; let the heart of them rejoice that seek the LORD.
10832	13	16	11	 Seek ye the LORD and His strength; seek His face continually.
10833	13	16	12	 Remember His marvellous works that He hath done, His wonders, and the judgments of His mouth;
10834	13	16	13	 O ye seed of Israel His servant, ye children of Jacob, His chosen ones.
10835	13	16	14	 He is the LORD our God; His judgments are in all the earth.
10836	13	16	15	 Remember His covenant for ever, the word which He commanded to a thousand generations;
10837	13	16	16	 The covenant which He made with Abraham, and His oath unto Isaac;
10838	13	16	17	 And He established it unto Jacob for a statute, to Israel for an everlasting covenant;
10839	13	16	18	 Saying: 'Unto thee will I give the land of Canaan, the lot of your inheritance.'
10840	13	16	19	 When ye were but a few men in number, yea, very few, and sojourners in it,
10841	13	16	20	 And when they went about from nation to nation, and from one kingdom to another people,
10842	13	16	21	 He suffered no man to do them wrong, yea, for their sake He reproved kings:
10843	13	16	22	 'Touch not Mine anointed ones, and do My prophets no harm.'
10844	13	16	23	 Sing unto the LORD, all the earth; proclaim His salvation from day to day.
10845	13	16	24	 Declare His glory among the nations, His marvellous works among all the peoples.
10846	13	16	25	 For great is the LORD, and highly to be praised; He also is to be feared above all gods.
10847	13	16	26	 For all the gods of the peoples are things of nought; but the LORD made the heavens.
10848	13	16	27	 Honour and majesty are before Him; strength and gladness are in His place.
10849	13	16	28	 Ascribe unto the LORD, ye kindreds of the peoples, ascribe unto the LORD glory and strength.
10850	13	16	29	 Ascribe unto the LORD the glory due unto His name; bring an offering, and come before Him; worship the LORD in the beauty of holiness.
10851	13	16	30	 Tremble before Him, all the earth; the world also is established that it cannot be moved.
10852	13	16	31	 Let the heavens be glad, and let the earth rejoice; and let them say among the nations: 'The LORD reigneth.'
10853	13	16	32	 Let the sea roar, and the fulness thereof; let the field exult, and all that is therein;
10854	13	16	33	 Then shall the trees of the wood sing for joy, before the LORD, for He is come to judge the earth.
10855	13	16	34	 O give thanks unto the LORD; for He is good; for His mercy endureth for ever.
10856	13	16	35	 And say ye: 'Save us, O God of our salvation, and gather us together and deliver us from the nations, that we may give thanks unto Thy holy name, that we may triumph in Thy praise.'
10857	13	16	36	 Blessed be the LORD, the God of Israel, from everlasting even to everlasting. And all the people said: 'Amen,' and praised the LORD.
10858	13	16	37	 So he left there, before the ark of the covenant of the LORD, Asaph and his brethren, to minister before the ark continually, as every day's work required;
10859	13	16	38	 and Obed-edom with their brethren, threescore and eight; Obed-edom also the son of Jedithun and Hosah to be door-keepers;
10860	13	16	39	 and Zadok the priest, and his brethren the priests, before the tabernacle of the LORD in the high place that was at Gibeon,
10861	13	16	40	 to offer burnt-offerings unto the LORD upon the altar of burnt-offering continually morning and evening, even according to all that is written in the Law of the LORD, which He commanded unto Israel;
10862	13	16	41	 and with them Heman and Jeduthun, and the rest that were chosen, who were mentioned by name, to give thanks to the LORD, because His mercy endureth for ever;
10863	13	16	42	 and with them Heman and Jeduthun, to sound aloud with trumpets and cymbals, and with instruments for the songs of God; and the sons of Jeduthun to be at the gate.
10864	13	16	43	 And all the people departed every man to his house; and David returned to bless his house.
10865	13	17	1	 And it came to pass, when David dwelt in his house, that David said to Nathan the prophet: 'Lo, I dwell in a house of cedar, but the ark of the covenant of the LORD dwelleth under curtains.'
10866	13	17	2	 And Nathan said unto David: 'Do all that is in thy heart; for God is with thee.'
10867	13	17	3	 And it came to pass the same night, that the word of God came to Nathan, saying:
10868	13	17	4	 'Go and tell David My servant: Thus saith the LORD: Thou shalt not build Me a house to dwell in;
10869	13	17	5	 for I have not dwelt in a house since the day that I brought up Israel, unto this day; but have gone from tent to tent, and from one tabernacle to another.
10870	13	17	6	 In all places wherein I have walked among all Israel, spoke I a word with any of the judges of Israel, whom I commanded to feed My people, saying: Why have ye not built Me a house of cedar?
10871	13	17	7	 Now therefore thus shalt thou say unto My servant David: Thus saith the LORD of hosts: I took thee from the sheepcote, from following the sheep, that thou shouldest be prince over My people Israel;
10872	13	17	8	 and I have been with thee whithersoever thou wentest, and have cut off all thine enemies from before thee; and I will make thee a name, like unto the name of the great ones that are in the earth.
10873	13	17	9	 And I will appoint a place for My people Israel, and will plant them, that they may dwell in their own place, and be disquieted no more; neither shall the children of wickedness waste them any more, as at the first,
10874	13	17	10	 even from the day that I commanded judges to be over My people Israel; and I will subdue all thine enemies. Moreover I tell thee that the LORD will build thee a house.
10875	13	17	11	 And it shall come to pass, when thy days are fulfilled that thou must go to be with thy fathers, that I will set up thy seed after thee, who shall be of thy sons; and I will establish his kingdom.
10876	13	17	12	 He shall build Me a house, and I will establish his throne for ever.
10877	13	17	13	 I will be to him for a father, and he shall be to Me for a son; and I will not take My mercy away from him, as I took it from him that was before thee;
10878	13	17	14	 but I will settle him in My house and in My kingdom for ever; and his throne shall be established for ever.'
10879	13	17	15	 According to all these words, and according to all this vision, so did Nathan speak unto David.
10880	13	17	16	 Then David the king went in, and sat before the LORD; and he said: 'Who am I, O LORD God, and what is my house, that Thou hast brought me thus far?
10881	13	17	17	 And this was a small thing in Thine eyes, O God; but Thou hast spoken of Thy servant's house for a great while to come, and hast regarded me after the manner of a man of high degree, O LORD God.
10882	13	17	18	 What can David say yet more unto Thee concerning the honour which is done to Thy servant? for Thou knowest Thy servant.
10883	13	17	19	 O LORD, for Thy servant's sake, and according to Thine own heart, hast Thou wrought all this greatness, to make known all these great things.
10884	13	17	20	 O LORD, there is none like Thee, neither is there any God beside Thee, according to all that we have heard with our ears.
10885	13	17	21	 And who is like Thy people Israel, a nation one in the earth, whom God went to redeem unto Himself for a people, to make Thee a name by great and tremendous things, in driving out nations from before Thy people, whom Thou didst redeem out of Egypt.
10886	13	17	22	 For Thy people Israel didst Thou make Thine own people for ever; and Thou, LORD, becamest their God.
10887	13	17	23	 And now, O LORD, let the word that Thou hast spoken concerning Thy servant, and concerning his house, be established for ever, and do as Thou hast spoken.
10888	13	17	24	 Yea, let it be established, and let Thy name be magnified for ever, that it may be said: The LORD of hosts is the God of Israel, even a God to Israel; and the house of David Thy servant shall be established before Thee.
10889	13	17	25	 For Thou, O my God, hast revealed to Thy servant that Thou wilt build him a house; therefore hath Thy servant taken heart to pray before Thee.
10890	13	17	26	 And now, O LORD, Thou alone art God, and hast promised this good thing unto Thy servant;
10891	13	17	27	 and now it hath pleased Thee to bless the house of Thy servant, that it may continue for ever before Thee; for Thou, O LORD, hast blessed, and so let Thy servant be blessed for ever.'
10892	13	18	1	 And after this it came to pass, that David smote the Philistines, and subdued them, and took Gath and its towns out of the hand of the Philistines.
10893	13	18	2	 And he smote Moab; and the Moabites became servants to David, and brought presents.
10894	13	18	3	 And David smote Hadarezer king of Zobah by Hamath, as he went to establish his dominion at the river Euphrates.
10895	13	18	4	 And David took from him a thousand chariots, and seven thousand horsemen, and twenty thousand footmen; and David houghed all the chariot horses, but reserved of them for a hundred chariots.
10896	13	18	5	 And when the Arameans of Damascus came to succour Hadarezer king of Zobah, David smote of the Arameans two and twenty thousand men.
10897	13	18	6	 Then David put garrisons in Aram Damascus; and the Arameans became servants to David, and brought presents. And the LORD gave victory to David whithersoever he went.
10898	13	18	7	 And David took the shields of gold that were on the servants of Hadarezer, and brought them to Jerusalem.
10899	13	18	8	 And from Tibhath and from Cun, cities of Hadarezer, David took very much brass, wherewith Solomon made the brazen sea, and the pillars, and the vessels of brass.
10900	13	18	9	 And when Tou king of Hamath heard that David had smitten all the host of Hadarezer king of Zobah,
10901	13	18	10	 he sent Hadoram his son to king David, to salute him, and to bless him--because he had fought against Hadarezer and smitten him; for Hadarezer had wars with Tou--and he had with him all manner of vessels of gold and silver and brass.
10902	13	18	11	 These also did king David dedicate unto the LORD, with the silver and the gold that he carried away from all the nations; from Edom, and from Moab, and from the children of Ammon, and from the Philistines, and from Amalek.
10903	13	18	12	 Moreover Abishai the son of Zeruiah smote of the Edomites in the Valley of Salt eighteen thousand.
10904	13	18	13	 And he put garrisons in Edom; and all the Edomites became servants to David. And the LORD gave victory to David whithersoever he went.
10905	13	18	14	 And David reigned over all Israel; and he executed justice and righteousness unto all his people.
10906	13	18	15	 And Joab the son of Zeruiah was over the host; and Jehoshaphat the son of Ahilud was recorder.
10907	13	18	16	 And Zadok the son of Ahitub, and Abimelech the son of Abiathar, were priests; and Shavsha was scribe;
10908	13	18	17	 and Beniah the son of Jehoiada was over the Cherethites and the Pelethites; and the sons of David were chief about the king.
10909	13	19	1	 And it came to pass after this, that Nahash the king of the children of Ammon died, and his son reigned in his stead.
10910	13	19	2	 And David said: 'l will show kindness unto Hanun the son of Nahash, because his father showed kindness to me.' So David sent messengers to comfort him concerning his father. And David's servants came into the land of the children of Ammon to Hanun, to comfort him.
10911	13	19	3	 But the princes of the children of Ammon said to Hanun: 'Thinkest thou that David doth honour thy father, that he hath sent comforters unto thee? are not his servants come unto thee to search, and to overthrow, and to spy out the land?'
10912	13	19	4	 So Hanun took David's servants, and shaved them, and cut off their garments in the middle, even to their hips, and sent them away.
10913	13	19	5	 Then there went certain persons, and told David how the men were served. And he sent to meet them; for the men were greatly ashamed. And the king said: 'Tarry at Jericho until your beards be grown, and then return.'
10914	13	19	6	 And when the children of Ammon saw that they had made themselves odious to David, Hanun and the children of Ammon sent a thousand talents of silver to hire them chariots and horsemen out of Aram-naharaim, and out of Aram-maacah, and out of Zobah.
10915	13	19	7	 So they hired them thirty and two thousand chariots, and the king of Maacah and his people; who came and encamped before Medeba. And the children of Ammon gathered themselves together from their cities, and came to battle.
10916	13	19	8	 And when David heard of it, he sent Joab, and all the host of the mighty men.
10917	13	19	9	 And the children of Ammon came out and put the battle in array at the gate of the city; and the kings that were come were by themselves in the field.
10918	13	19	10	 Now when Joab saw that the battle was set against him before and behind, he chose of all the choice men of Israel, and put them in array against the Arameans.
10919	13	19	11	 And the rest of the people he committed into the hand of Abishai his brother, and they put themselves in array against the children of Ammon.
10920	13	19	12	 And he said: 'If the Arameans be too strong for me, then thou shalt help me; but if the children of Ammon be too strong for thee, then I will help thee.
10921	13	19	13	 Be of good courage, and let us prove strong for our people, and for the cities of our God; and the LORD do that which seemeth Him good.'
10922	13	19	14	 So Joab and the people that were with him drew nigh unto the battle to meet the Arameans; and they fled before him.
10923	13	19	15	 And when the children of Ammon saw that the Arameans were fled, they likewise fled before Abishai his brother, and entered into the city. Then Joab came to Jerusalem.
10924	13	19	16	 And when the Arameans saw that they were put to the worse before Israel, they sent messengers, and brought out the Arameans that were beyond the River, with Shophach the captain of the host of Hadarezer at their head.
10925	13	19	17	 And it was told David; and he gathered all Israel together, and passed over the Jordan, and came upon them, and set the battle in array against them. So when David had put the battle in array against the Arameans, they fought with him.
10926	13	19	18	 And the Arameans fled before Israel; and David slew of the Arameans the men of seven thousand chariots, and forty thousand footmen, and killed Shophach the captain of the host.
10927	13	19	19	 And when the servants of Hadarezer saw that they were put to the worse before Israel, they made peace with David, and served him; neither would the Arameans help the children of Ammon any more.
10928	13	20	1	 And it came to pass, at the time of the return of the year, at the time when kings go out to battle, that Joab led forth the power of the army, and wasted the country of the children of Ammon, and came and besieged Rabbah. But David tarried at Jerusalem. And Joab smote Rabbah, and overthrew it.
10929	13	20	2	 And David took the crown of Malcam from off his head, and found it to weigh a talent of gold, and there were precious stones in it; and it was set upon David's head; and he brought forth the spoil of the city, exceeding much.
10930	13	20	3	 And he brought forth the people that were therein, and cut them with saws, and with harrows of iron, and with axes. And thus did David unto all the cities of the children of Ammon. And David and all the people returned to Jerusalem.
10931	13	20	4	 And it came to pass after this, that there arose war at Gezer with the Philistines; then Sibbecai the Hushathite slew Sippai, of the sons of the giants; and they were subdued.
10932	13	20	5	 And there was again war with the Philistines; and Elhanan the son of Jair slew Lahmi the brother of Goliath the Gittite, the staff of whose spear was like a weaver's beam.
10933	13	20	6	 And there was again war at Gath, where was a man of great stature, whose fingers and toes were four and twenty, six on each hand, and six on each foot; and he also was born unto the giant.
10934	13	20	7	 And when he taunted Israel, Jonathan the son of Shimea David's brother slew him.
10935	13	20	8	 These were born unto the giant in Gath; and they fell by the hand of David and by the hand of his servants.
10936	13	21	1	 And Satan stood up against Israel, and moved David to number Israel.
10937	13	21	2	 And David said to Joab and to the princes of the people: 'Go, number Israel from Beersheba even to Dan; and bring me word, that I may know the sum of them.'
10938	13	21	3	 And Joab said: 'The LORD make His people a hundred times so many more as they are; but, my lord the king, are they not all my lord's servants? why doth my lord require this thing? why will he be a cause of guilt unto Israel?'
10939	13	21	4	 Nevertheless the king's word prevailed against Joab. Wherefore Joab departed and went throughout all Israel, and came to Jerusalem.
10940	13	21	5	 And Joab gave up the sum of the numbering of the people unto David. And all they of Israel were a thousand thousand and a hundred thousand men that drew sword; and Judah was four hundred three-score and ten thousand men that drew sword.
10941	13	21	6	 But Levi and Benjamin he did not number among them; for the king's word was abominable to Joab.
10942	13	21	7	 And God was displeased with this thing; therefore He smote Israel.
10943	13	21	8	 And David said unto God: 'I have sinned greatly, in that I have done this thing; but now, put away, I beseech Thee, the iniquity of Thy servant; for I have done very foolishly.'
10944	13	21	9	 And the LORD spoke unto Gad, David's seer, saying:
10945	13	21	10	 'Go and speak unto David, saying: Thus saith the LORD: I offer thee three things; choose thee one of them, that I may do it unto thee.'
10946	13	21	11	 So Gad came to David, and said unto him: 'Thus saith the LORD: Take which thou wilt:
10947	13	21	12	 either three years of famine; or three months to be swept away before thy foes, while the sword of thine enemies overtaketh thee; or else three days the sword of the LORD, even pestilence in the land, and the angel of the LORD destroying throughout all the borders of Israel. Now therefore consider what answer I shall return to Him that sent me.'
10948	13	21	13	 And David said unto Gad: 'I am in a great strait; let me fall now into the hand of the LORD, for very great are His mercies; and let me not fall into the hand of man.'
10949	13	21	14	 So the LORD sent a pestilence upon Israel; and there fell of Israel seventy thousand men.
10950	13	21	15	 And God sent an angel unto Jerusalem to destroy it; and as he was about to destroy, the LORD beheld, and He repented Him of the evil, and said to the destroying angel: 'It is enough; now stay thy hand.' And the angel of the LORD was standing by the threshing-floor of Ornan the Jebusite.
10951	13	21	16	 And David lifted up his eyes, and saw the angel of the LORD standing between the earth and the heaven, having a drawn sword in his hand stretched out over Jerusalem. Then David and the elders, clothed in sackcloth, fell upon their faces.
10952	13	21	17	 And David said unto God: 'Is it not I that commanded the people to be numbered? even I it is that have sinned and done very wickedly; but these sheep, what have they done? let Thy hand, I pray Thee, O LORD my God, be against me, and against my father's house; but not against Thy people, that they should be plagued.'
10953	13	21	18	 Then the angel of the LORD commanded Gad to say to David, that David should go up, and rear an altar unto the LORD in the threshing-floor of Ornan the Jebusite.
10954	13	21	19	 And David went up at the saying of Gad, which he spoke in the name of the LORD.
10955	13	21	20	 And Ornan turned back, and saw the angel; and his four sons that were with him hid themselves. Now Ornan was threshing wheat.
10956	13	21	21	 And as David came to Ornan, Ornan looked and saw David, and went out of the threshing-floor, and bowed down to David with his face to the ground.
10957	13	21	22	 Then David said to Ornan: 'Give me the place of this threshing-floor, that I may build thereon an altar unto the LORD; for the full price shalt thou give it me; that the plague may be stayed from the people.'
10958	13	21	23	 And Ornan said unto David: 'Take it to thee, and let my lord the king do that which is good in his eyes; lo, I give thee the oxen for burnt-offerings, and the threshing-instruments for wood, and the wheat for the meal-offering; I give it all'
10959	13	21	24	 And king David said to Ornan: 'Nay, but I will verily buy it for the full price; for I will not take that which is thine for the LORD, nor offer a burnt-offering without cost.'
10960	13	21	25	 So David gave to Ornan for the place six hundred shekels of gold by weight.
10961	13	21	26	 And David built there an altar unto the LORD, and offered burnt-offerings and peace-offerings, and called upon the LORD; and He answered him from heaven by fire upon the altar of burnt-offering.
10962	13	21	27	 And the LORD commanded the angel; and he put up his sword back into the sheath thereof.
10963	13	21	28	 At that time, when David saw that the LORD had answered him in the threshing-floor of Ornan the Jebusite, then he sacrificed there.
10964	13	21	29	 For the tabernacle of the LORD, which Moses made in the wilderness, and the altar of burnt-offering, were at that time in the high place at Gibeon.
10965	13	21	30	 But David could not go before it to inquire of God; for he was terrified because of the sword of the angel of the LORD.
10966	13	22	1	 Then David said: 'This is the house of the LORD God, and this is the altar of burnt-offering for Israel.'
10967	13	22	2	 And David commanded to gather together the strangers that were in the land of Israel; and he set masons to hew wrought stones to build the house of God.
10968	13	22	3	 And David prepared iron in abundance for the nails for the doors of the gates, and for the couplings; and brass in abundance without weight;
10969	13	22	4	 and cedar-trees without number; for the Zidonians and they of Tyre brought cedar-trees in abundance to David.
10970	13	22	5	 And David said: 'Solomon my son is young and tender, and the house that is to be builded for the LORD must be exceeding magnificent, of fame and of glory throughout all countries; I will therefore make preparation for him.' So David prepared abundantly before his death.
10971	13	22	6	 Then He called for Solomon his son, and charged him to build a house for the LORD, the God of Israel.
10972	13	22	7	 And David said to Solomon: 'My son, as for me, it was in my heart to build a house unto the name of the LORD my God.
10973	13	22	8	 But the word of the LORD came to me, saying: Thou hast shed blood abundantly, and hast made great wars; thou shalt not build a house unto My name, because thou hast shed much blood upon the earth in My sight.
10974	13	22	9	 Behold, a son shall be born to thee, who shall be a man of rest; and I will give him rest from all his enemies round about; for his name shall be Solomon, and I will give peace and quietness unto Israel in his days.
10975	13	22	10	 He shall build a house for My name; and he shall be to Me for a son, and I will be to him for a father; and I will establish the throne of his kingdom over Israel for ever.
10976	13	22	11	 Now, my son, the LORD be with thee; and prosper thou, and build the house of the LORD thy God, as He hath spoken concerning thee.
10977	13	22	12	 Only the LORD give thee discretion and understanding, and give thee charge concerning Israel; that so thou mayest keep the law of the LORD thy God.
10978	13	22	13	 Then shalt thou prosper, if thou observe to do the statutes and the ordinances which the LORD charged Moses with concerning Israel; be strong, and of good courage; fear not, neither be dismayed.
10979	13	22	14	 Now, behold, in my straits I have prepared for the house of the LORD a hundred thousand talents of gold, and a thousand thousand talents of silver; and of brass and iron without weight, for it is in abundance; timber also and stone have I prepared; and thou mayest add thereto.
10980	13	22	15	 Moreover there are workmen with thee in abundance, hewers and workers of stone and timber, and all men that are skilful in any manner of work;
10981	13	22	16	 of the gold, the silver, and the brass, and the iron, there is no number. Arise and be doing, and the LORD be with thee.'

10984	13	22	19	 Now set your heart and your soul to seek after the LORD your God; arise therefore, and build ye the sanctuary of the LORD God, to bring the ark of the covenant of the LORD, and the holy vessels of God, into the house that is to be built to the name of the LORD.'

11048	13	25	1	 Moreover David and the captains of the host separated for the service certain of the sons of Asaph, and of Heman, and of Jeduthun, who should prophesy with harps, with psalteries, and with cymbals; and the number of them that did the work according to their service was:

11111	13	27	1	 Now the children of Israel after their number, to wit, the heads of fathers' houses and the captains of thousands and of hundreds, and their officers that served the king, in any matter of the courses which came in and went out month by month throughout all the months of the year, of every course were twenty and four thousand.
11112	13	27	2	 Over the first course for the first month was Jashobeam the son of Zabdiel; and in his course were twenty and four thousand.
11113	13	27	3	 Of the children of Perez was he, and the chief of all the captains of the host for the first month.

11143	13	27	33	 and Ahithophel was the king's counsellor; and Hushai the Archite was the king's friend;

11145	13	28	1	 And David assembled all the princes of Israel, the princes of the tribes, and the captains of the companies that served the king by course, and the captains of thousands, and the captains of hundreds, and the rulers over all the substance and cattle of the king and of his sons, with the officers, and the mighty men, even all the mighty men of valour, unto Jerusalem.
11146	13	28	2	 Then David the king stood up upon his feet, and said: 'Hear me, my brethren, and my people; as for me, it was in my heart to build a house of rest for the ark of the covenant of the LORD, and for the footstool of our God; and I had made ready for the building.
11147	13	28	3	 But God said unto me: Thou shalt not build a house for My name, because thou art a man of war, and hast shed blood.
11148	13	28	4	 Howbeit the LORD, the God of Israel, chose me out of all the house of my father to be king over Israel for ever; for He hath chosen Judah to be prince, and in the house of Judah, the house of my father, and among the sons of my father He took pleasure in me to make me king over all Israel;
11149	13	28	5	 and of all my sons--for the LORD hath given me many sons--He hath chosen Solomon my son to sit upon the throne of the kingdom of the LORD over Israel.
11150	13	28	6	 And He said unto me: Solomon thy son, he shall build My house and My courts; for I have chosen him to be to Me for a son, and I will be to him for a father.
11151	13	28	7	 And I will establish his kingdom for ever, if he be constant to do My commandments and Mine ordinances, as at this day.
11152	13	28	8	 Now therefore, in the sight of all Israel, the congregation of the LORD, and in the hearing of our God, observe and seek out all the commandments of the LORD your God; that ye may possess this good land, and leave it for an inheritance to your children after you for ever.
11153	13	28	9	 And thou, Solomon my son, know thou the God of thy father, and serve Him with a whole heart and with a willing mind; for the LORD searcheth all hearts, and understandeth all the imaginations of the thoughts; if thou seek Him, He will be found of thee; but if thou forsake Him, He will cast thee off for ever.
11154	13	28	10	 Take heed now; for the LORD hath chosen thee to build a house for the sanctuary; be strong, and do it.'
11155	13	28	11	 Then David gave to Solomon his son the pattern of the porch of the temple, and of the houses thereof, and of the treasuries thereof, and of the upper rooms thereof, and of the inner chambers thereof, and of the place of the ark-cover;
11156	13	28	12	 and the pattern of all that he had by the spirit, for the courts of the house of the LORD, and for all the chambers round about, for the treasuries of the house of God, and for the treasuries of the hallowed things;
11157	13	28	13	 also for the courses of the priests and the Levites, and for all the work of the service of the house of the LORD, and for all the vessels of service in the house of the LORD:
11158	13	28	14	 of gold by weight for the vessels of gold, for all vessels of every kind of service; of silver for all the vessels of silver by weight, for all vessels of every kind of service;
11159	13	28	15	 by weight also for the candlesticks of gold, and for the lamps thereof, of gold, by weight for every candlestick and for the lamps thereof; and for the candlesticks of silver, silver by weight for every candlestick and for the lamps thereof, according to the use of every candlestick;
11160	13	28	16	 and the gold by weight for the tables of showbread, for every table; and silver for the tables of silver;
11161	13	28	17	 and the flesh-hooks, and the basins, and the jars, of pure gold; and for the golden bowls by weight for every bowl; and for the silver bowls by weight for every bowl;
11162	13	28	18	 and for the altar of incense refined gold by weight; and gold for the pattern of the chariot, even the cherubim, that spread out their wings, and covered the ark of the covenant of the LORD.
11163	13	28	19	 'All this do I give thee in writing, as the LORD hath made me wise by His hand upon me, even all the works of this pattern.'
11164	13	28	20	 And David said to Solomon his son: 'Be strong and of good courage, and do it; fear not, nor be dismayed; for the LORD God, even my God, is with thee; He will not fail thee, nor forsake thee, until all the work for the service of the house of the LORD be finished.
11165	13	28	21	 And, behold, there are the courses of the priests and the Levites, for all the service of the house of God; and there shall be with thee in all manner of work every willing man that hath skill, for any manner of service; also the captains and all the people will be wholly at thy commandment.'
11166	13	29	1	 And David the king said unto all the congregation: 'Solomon my son, whom alone God hath chosen, is yet young and tender, and the work is great; for the palace is not for man, but for the LORD God.
11167	13	29	2	 Now I have prepared with all my might for the house of my God the gold for the things of gold, and the silver for the things of silver, and the brass for the things of brass, the iron for the things of iron, and wood for the things of wood; onyx stones, and stones to be set, glistering stones, and of divers colours, and all manner of precious stones, and marble stones in abundance.
11168	13	29	3	 Moreover also, because I have set my affection on the house of my God, seeing that I have a treasure of mine own of gold and silver, I give it unto the house of my God, over and above all that I have prepared for the holy house,
11169	13	29	4	 even three thousand talents of gold, of the gold of Ophir, and seven thousand talents of refined silver, wherewith to overlay the walls of the houses;
11170	13	29	5	 of gold for the things of gold, and of silver for the things of silver, and for all manner of work to be made by the hands of artificers. Who then offereth willingly to consecrate himself this day unto the LORD?'
11171	13	29	6	 Then the princes of the fathers' houses, and the princes of the tribes of Israel, and the captains of thousands and of hundreds, with the rulers over the king's work, offered willingly;
11172	13	29	7	 and they gave for the service of the house of God of gold five thousand talents and ten thousand darics, and of silver ten thousand talents, and of brass eighteen thousand talents, and of iron a hundred thousand talents.
11173	13	29	8	 And they with whom precious stones were found gave them to the treasure of the house of the LORD, under the hand of Jehiel the Gershonite.
11174	13	29	9	 Then the people rejoiced, for that they offered willingly, because with a whole heart they offered willingly to the LORD; and David the king also rejoiced with great joy.
11175	13	29	10	 Wherefore David blessed the LORD before all the congregation; and David said: 'Blessed be Thou, O LORD, the God of Israel our father, for ever and ever.
11176	13	29	11	 Thine, O LORD, is the greatness, and the power, and the glory, and the victory, and the majesty; for all that is in the heaven and in the earth is Thine; Thine is the kingdom, O LORD, and Thou art exalted as head above all.
11177	13	29	12	 Both riches and honour come of Thee, and Thou rulest over all; and in Thy hand is power and might; and in Thy hand it is to make great, and to give strength unto all.
11178	13	29	13	 Now therefore, our God, we thank Thee, and praise Thy glorious name.
11179	13	29	14	 But who am I, and what is my people, that we should be able to offer so willingly after this sort? for all things come of Thee, and of Thine own have we given Thee.
11180	13	29	15	 For we are strangers before Thee, and sojourners, as all our fathers were: our days on the earth are as a shadow, and there is no abiding.
11181	13	29	16	 O LORD our God, all this store that we have prepared to build Thee a house for Thy holy name cometh of Thy hand, and is all Thine own.
11182	13	29	17	 I know also, my God, that Thou triest the heart, and hast pleasure in uprightness. As for me, in the uprightness of my heart I have willingly offered all these things; and now have I seen with joy Thy people, that are present here, offer willingly unto Thee.
11183	13	29	18	 O LORD, the God of Abraham, of Isaac, and of Israel, our fathers, keep this for ever, even the imagination of the thoughts of the heart of Thy people, and direct their heart unto Thee;
11184	13	29	19	 and give unto Solomon my son a whole heart, to keep Thy commandments, Thy testimonies, and Thy statutes, and to do all these things, and to build the palace, for which I have made, provision.'
11185	13	29	20	 And David said to all the congregation: 'Now bless the LORD your God.' And all the congregation blessed the LORD, the God of their fathers, and bowed down their heads, and prostrated themselves before the LORD, and before the king.
11186	13	29	21	 And they sacrificed sacrifices unto the LORD, and offered burnt-offerings unto the LORD, on the morrow after that day, even a thousand bullocks, a thousand rams, and a thousand lambs, with their drink-offerings, and sacrifices in abundance for all Israel;
11187	13	29	22	 and did eat and drink before the LORD on that day with great gladness. And they made Solomon the son of David king the second time, and anointed him unto the LORD to be prince, and Zadok to be priest.
11188	13	29	23	 Then Solomon sat on the throne of the LORD as king instead of David his father, and prospered; and all Israel hearkened to him.
11189	13	29	24	 And all the princes, and the mighty men, and all the sons likewise of king David, submitted themselves unto Solomon the king.
11190	13	29	25	 And the LORD magnified Solomon exceedingly in the sight of all Israel, and bestowed upon him such royal majesty as had not been on any king before him in Israel.
11191	13	29	26	 Now David the son of Jesse reigned over all Israel.
11192	13	29	27	 And the time that he reigned over Israel was forty years: seven years reigned he in Hebron, and thirty and three years reigned he in Jerusalem.
11193	13	29	28	 And he died in a good old age, full of days, riches, and honour; and Solomon his son reigned in his stead.
11194	13	29	29	 Now the acts of David the king, first and last, behold, they are written in the words of Samuel the seer, and in the words of Nathan the prophet, and in the words of Gad the seer;
11195	13	29	30	 with all his reign and his might, and the times that went over him, and over Israel, and over all the kingdoms of the countries.
11196	14	1	1	 AND SOLOMON the son of David was strengthened in his kingdom, and the LORD his God was with him, and magnified him exceedingly.
11197	14	1	2	 And Solomon spoke unto all Israel, to the captains of thousands and of hundreds, and to the judges, and to every prince in all Israel, the heads of the fathers' houses.
11198	14	1	3	 So Solomon, and all the congregation with him, went to the high place that was at Gibeon; for there was the tent of meeting of God, which Moses the servant of the LORD had made in the wilderness.
11199	14	1	4	 But the ark of God had David brought up from Kiriath-jearim to the place that David had prepared for it; for he had pitched a tent for it at Jerusalem.
11200	14	1	5	 Moreover the brazen altar, that Bezalel the son of Uri, the son of Hur, had made, had been put before the tabernacle of the LORD; and Solomon and the congregation sought unto it.
11201	14	1	6	 And Solomon offered there, upon the brazen altar before the LORD, which was at the tent of meeting, he offered a thousand burnt-offerings upon it.
11202	14	1	7	 In that night did God, appear unto Solomon, and said unto him: 'Ask what I shall give thee.'
11203	14	1	8	 And Solomon said unto God: 'Thou hast shown great kindness unto David my father, and hast made me king in his stead.
11204	14	1	9	 Now, O LORD God, let Thy promise unto David my father be established; for Thou hast made me king over a people like the dust of the earth in multitude.
11205	14	1	10	 Give me now wisdom and knowledge, that I may go out and come in before this people; for who can judge this Thy people, that is so great?'
11206	14	1	11	 And God said to Solomon: 'Because this was in thy heart, and thou hast not asked riches, wealth, or honour, nor the life of them that hate thee, neither yet hast asked long life, but hast asked wisdom and knowledge for thyself, that thou mayest judge My people, over whom I have made thee king;
11207	14	1	12	 wisdom and knowledge is granted unto thee, and I will give thee riches, and wealth, and honour, such as none of the kings have had that have been before thee, neither shall there any after thee have the like.'
11208	14	1	13	 So Solomon came from his journey to the high place that was at Gibeon, from before the tent of meeting, unto Jerusalem; and he reigned over Israel.
11209	14	1	14	 And Solomon gathered chariots and horsemen; and he had a thousand and four hundred chariots, and twelve thousand horsemen, that he placed in the chariot cities, and with the king at Jerusalem.
11210	14	1	15	 And the king made silver and gold to be in Jerusalem as stones, and cedars made he to be as the sycamore-trees that are in the Lowland, for abundance.
11211	14	1	16	 And the horses which Solomon had were brought out of Egypt; also out of Keve, the king's merchants buying them of the men of Keve at a price.
11212	14	1	17	 And they fetched up, and brought out of Egypt a chariot for six hundred shekels of silver, and a horse for a hundred and fifty; and so for all the kings of the Hittites, and the kings of Aram, did they bring them out by their means.
11213	14	2	1	 (1:18) Now Solomon purposed to build a house for the name of the LORD, and a house for his kingdom.
11214	14	2	2	 (2:1) And Solomon counted out threescore and ten thousand men to bear burdens, and fourscore thousand men that were hewers in the mountains, and three thousand and six hundred to oversee them.
11215	14	2	3	 (2:2) And Solomon sent to Huram the king of Tyre, saying: 'As thou didst deal with David my father, and didst send him cedars to build him a house to dwell therein ,even so deal with me.
11216	14	2	4	 (2:3) Behold, I am about to build a house for the name of the LORD my God, to dedicate it to Him, and to burn before Him incense of sweet spices, and for the continual showbread, and for the burnt-offerings morning and evening, on the sabbaths, and on the new moons, and on the appointed seasons of the LORD our God. This is an ordinance for ever to Israel.
11217	14	2	5	 (2:4) And the house which I build is great; for great is our God above all gods.
11218	14	2	6	 (2:5) But who is able to build Him a house, seeing the heaven and the heaven of heavens cannot contain Him? who am I then, that I should build Him a house, save only to offer before Him?
11219	14	2	7	 (2:6) Now therefore send me a man skilful to work in gold, and in silver, and in brass, and in iron, and in purple, and crimson, and blue, and that hath skill to grave all manner of gravings, to be with the skilful men that are with me in Judah and in Jerusalem, whom David my father did provide.
11220	14	2	8	 (2:7) Send me also cedar-trees, cypress-trees, and sandal-wood, out of Lebanon; for I know that thy servants have skill to cut timber in Lebanon; and, behold, my servants shall be with thy servants,
11221	14	2	9	 (2:8) even to prepare me timber in abundance; for the house which I am about to build shall be great and wonderful.
11222	14	2	10	 (2:9) And, behold, I will give to thy servants, the hewers that cut timber, twenty thousand measures of beaten wheat, and twenty thousand measures of barley, and twenty thousand baths of wine, and twenty thousand baths of oil.'
11223	14	2	11	 (2:10) Then Huram the king of Tyre answered in writing, which he sent to Solomon: 'Because the LORD loveth His people, He hath made thee king over them.'
11224	14	2	12	 (2:11) Huram said moreover: 'Blessed be the LORD, the God of Israel, that made heaven and earth, who hath given to David the king a wise son, endued with discretion and understanding, that should build a house for the LORD, and a house for his kingdom.
11225	14	2	13	 (2:12) And now I have sent a skilful man, endued with understanding, even Huram my master craftsman,
11226	14	2	14	 (2:13) the son of a woman of the daughters of Dan, and his father was a man of Tyre, skilful to work in gold, and in silver, in brass, in iron, in stone, and in timber, in purple, in blue, and in fine linen, and in crimson; also to grave any manner of graving, and to devise any device; to do whatever may be set before him, with thy skilful men, and with the skilful men of my lord David thy father.
11227	14	2	15	 (2:14) Now therefore the wheat and the barley, the oil and the wine, which my lord hath spoken of, let him send unto his servants;
11228	14	2	16	 (2:15) and we will cut wood out of Lebanon, as much as thou shalt need; and we will bring it to thee in floats by sea to Joppa; and thou shalt carry it up to Jerusalem.'
11229	14	2	17	 (2:16) And Solomon numbered all the strangers that were in the land of Israel, after the numbering wherewith David his father had numbered them; and they were found a hundred and fifty thousand and three thousand and six hundred.
11230	14	2	18	 (2:17) And he set threescore and ten thousand of them to bear burdens, and fourscore thousand to be hewers in the mountains, and three thousand and six hundred overseers to set the people at work.
11231	14	3	1	 Then Solomon began to build the house of the LORD at Jerusalem in mount Moriah, where the LORD appeared unto David his father; for which provision had been made in the Place of David, in the threshingfloor of Ornan the Jebusite.
11232	14	3	2	 And he began to build in the second day of the second month, in the fourth year of his reign.
11233	14	3	3	 Now these are the foundations which Solomon laid for the building of the house of God. The length by cubits after the ancient measure was threescore cubits, and the breadth twenty cubits.
11234	14	3	4	 And the porch that was before the house, the length of it, according to the breadth of the house, was twenty cubits, and the height a hundred and twenty; and he overlaid it within with pure gold.
11235	14	3	5	 And the greater house he covered with cypress-wood, which he overlaid with fine gold, and wrought thereon palm-trees and chains.
11236	14	3	6	 And he garnished the house with precious stones for beauty; and the gold was gold of Parvaim.
11237	14	3	7	 He overlaid also the house, the beams, the thresholds, and the walls thereof, and the doors thereof, with gold; and graved cherubim on the walls.
11238	14	3	8	 And he made the most holy place; the length thereof, according to the breadth of the house, was twenty cubits, and the breadth thereof twenty cubits; and he overlaid it with fine gold, amounting to six hundred talents.
11239	14	3	9	 And the weight of the nails was fifty shekels of gold. And he overlaid the upper chambers with gold.
11240	14	3	10	 And in the most holy place he made two cherubim of image work; and they overlaid them with gold.
11241	14	3	11	 And the wings of the cherubim were twenty cubits long: the wing of the one cherub was five cubits, reaching to the wall of the house; and the other wing was likewise five cubits, reaching to the wing of the other cherub.
11242	14	3	12	 And the wing of the other cherub was five cubits, reaching to the wall of the house; and the other wing was five cubits also, joining to the wing of the other cherub.
11243	14	3	13	 The wings of these cherubim spread themselves forth twenty cubits; and they stood on their feet, and their faces were inward.
11244	14	3	14	 And he made the veil of blue, and purple, and crimson, and fine linen, and wrought cherubim thereon.
11245	14	3	15	 Also he made before the house two pillars of thirty and five cubits high, and the capital that was on the top of each of them was five cubits.
11246	14	3	16	 And he made chains in the Sanctuary, and put them on the tops of the pillars; and he made a hundred pomegranates, and put them on the chains.
11247	14	3	17	 And he set up the pillars before the temple, one on the right hand, and the other on the left; and called the name of that on the right hand Jachin, and the name of that on the left Boaz.
11248	14	4	1	 Moreover he made an altar of brass, twenty cubits the length thereof, and twenty cubits the breadth thereof, and ten cubits the height thereof.
11249	14	4	2	 Also he made the molten sea of ten cubits from brim to brim, round in compass, and the height thereof was five cubits; and a line of thirty cubits did compass it round about.
11250	14	4	3	 And under it was the similitude of oxen, which did compass it round about, for ten cubits, compassing the sea round about. The oxen were in two rows, cast when it was cast.
11251	14	4	4	 It stood upon twelve oxen, three looking toward the north, and three looking toward the west, and three looking toward the south, and three looking toward the east; and the sea was set upon them above, and all their hinder parts were inward.
11252	14	4	5	 And it was a handbreadth thick; and the brim thereof was wrought like the brim of a cup, like the flower of a lily: it received and held three thousand baths.
11253	14	4	6	 He made also ten lavers, and put five on the right hand, and five on the left, to wash in them; such things as belonged to the burnt-offering they washed in them; but the sea was for the priests to wash in.
11254	14	4	7	 And he made the ten candlesticks of gold according to the ordinance concerning them; and he set them in the temple, five on the right hand, and five on the left.
11255	14	4	8	 He made also ten tables, and placed them in the temple, five on the right side, and five on the left. And he made a hundred basins of gold.
11256	14	4	9	 Furthermore he made the court of the priests, and the great court, and doors for the court, and overlaid the doors of them with brass.
11257	14	4	10	 And he set the sea on the right side of the house eastward, toward the south.
11258	14	4	11	 And Huram made the pots, and the shovels, and the basins. So Huram made an end of doing the work that he wrought for king Solomon in the house of God:
11259	14	4	12	 the two pillars, and the bowls, and the two capitals which were on the top of the pillars; and the two networks to cover the two bowls of the capitals that were on the top of the pillars;
11260	14	4	13	 and the four hundred pomegranates for the two networks: two rows of pomegranates for each network, to cover the two bowls of the capitals that were upon the top of the pillars.
11261	14	4	14	 He made also the bases, and the lavers made he upon the bases;
11262	14	4	15	 one sea, and the twelve oxen under it.
11263	14	4	16	 The pots also, and the shovels, and the flesh-hooks, and all the vessels thereof, did Huram his master craftsman make for king Solomon for the house of the LORD of bright brass.
11264	14	4	17	 In the plain of the Jordan did the king cast them, in the clay ground between Succoth and Zeredah.
11265	14	4	18	 Thus Solomon made all these vessels in great abundance; for the weight of the brass could not be found out.
11266	14	4	19	 And Solomon made all the vessels that were in the house of God, the golden altar also, and the tables whereon was the showbread;
11267	14	4	20	 and the candlesticks with their lamps, that they should burn according to the ordinance before the Sanctuary, of pure gold;
11268	14	4	21	 and the flowers, and the lamps, and the tongs, of gold, and that perfect gold;
11269	14	4	22	 and the snuffers, and the basins, and the pans, and the fire-pans, of pure gold. And as for the entry of the house, the inner doors thereof for the most holy place, and the doors of the house, that is, of the temple, were of gold.
11270	14	5	1	 Thus all the work that Solomon wrought for the house of the LORD was finished. And Solomon brought in the things that David his father had hallowed; even the silver, and the gold, and all the vessels, and put them in the treasuries of the house of God.
11271	14	5	2	 Then Solomon assembled the elders of Israel, and all the heads of the tribes, the princes of the fathers' houses of the children of Israel, unto Jerusalem, to bring up the ark of the covenant of the LORD out of the city of David, which is Zion.
11272	14	5	3	 And all the men of Israel assembled themselves unto the king at the feast, which was in the seventh month.
11273	14	5	4	 And all the elders of Israel came, and the Levites took up the ark.
11274	14	5	5	 And they brought up the ark, and the tent of meeting, and all the holy vessels that were in the Tent; these did the priests and the Levites bring up.
11275	14	5	6	 And king Solomon and all the congregation of Israel, that were assembled unto him, were before the ark, sacrificing sheep and oxen, that could not be counted nor numbered for multitude.
11276	14	5	7	 And the priests brought in the ark of the covenant of the LORD unto its place, into the Sanctuary of the house, to the most holy place, even under the wings of the cherubim.
11277	14	5	8	 For the cherubim spread forth their wings over the place of the ark, and the cherubim covered the ark and the staves thereof above.
11278	14	5	9	 And the staves were so long that the ends of the staves were seen from the ark before the Sanctuary; but they could not be seen without; and there they are unto this day.
11279	14	5	10	 There was nothing in the ark save the two tables which Moses put there at Horeb, when the LORD made a covenant with the children of Israel, when they came out of Egypt.
11280	14	5	11	 And it came to pass, when the priests were come out of the holy place--for all the priests that were present had sanctified themselves, and did not keep their courses;
11281	14	5	12	 also the Levites who were the singers, all of them, even Asaph, Heman, Jeduthun, and their sons and their brethren, arrayed in fine linen, with cymbals and psalteries and harps, stood at the east end of the altar, and with them a hundred and twenty priests sounding with trumpets--
11282	14	5	13	 it came even to pass, when the trumpeters and singers were as one, to make one sound to be heard in praising and thanking the LORD; and when they lifted up their voice with the trumpets and cymbals and instruments of music, and praised the LORD: 'for He is good, for His mercy endureth for ever'; that then the house was filled with a cloud, even the house of the LORD,
11283	14	5	14	 so that the priests could not stand to minister by reason of the cloud; for the glory of the LORD filled the house of God.
11284	14	6	1	 Then spoke Solomon: The LORD hath said that He would dwell in the thick darkness.
11285	14	6	2	 But I have built Thee a house of habitation, and a place for Thee to dwell in for ever.
11286	14	6	3	 And the king turned his face, and blessed all the congregation of Israel; and all the congregation of Israel stood.
11287	14	6	4	 And he said: 'Blessed be the LORD, the God of Israel, who spoke with His mouth unto David my father, and hath with His hands fulfilled it, saying:
11288	14	6	5	 Since the day that I brought forth My people out of the land of Egypt, I chose no city out of all the tribes of Israel to build a house in, that My name might be there; neither chose I any man to be prince over My people Israel;
11289	14	6	6	 but I have chosen Jerusalem, that My name might be there; and have chosen David to be over My people Israel.
11290	14	6	7	 Now it was in the heart of David my father to build a house for the name of the LORD, the God of Israel.
11291	14	6	8	 But the LORD said unto David my father: Whereas it was in thy heart to build a house for My name, thou didst well that it was in thy heart;
11292	14	6	9	 nevertheless thou shalt not build the house, but thy son that shall come forth out of thy loins, he shall build the house for My name.
11293	14	6	10	 And the LORD hath established His word that He spoke; for I am risen up in the room of David my father, and sit on the throne of Israel, as the LORD promised, and have built the house for the name of the LORD, the God of Israel.
11294	14	6	11	 And there have I set the ark, wherein is the covenant of the LORD, which He made with the children of Israel.'
11295	14	6	12	 And he stood before the altar of the LORD in the presence of all the congregation of Israel, and spread forth his hands--
11296	14	6	13	 for Solomon had made a brazen scaffold, of five cubits long, and five cubits broad, and three cubits high, and had set it in the midst of the court; and upon it he stood, and kneeled down upon his knees before all the congregation of Israel, and spread forth his hands toward heaven--
11297	14	6	14	 and he said: 'O LORD, the God of Israel, there is no God like Thee, in the heaven, or in the earth; who keepest covenant and mercy with Thy servants, that walk before Thee with all their heart;
11298	14	6	15	 who hast kept with Thy servant David my father that which Thou didst promise him; yea, Thou spokest with Thy mouth, and hast fulfilled it with Thy hand, as it is this day.
11299	14	6	16	 Now therefore, O LORD, the God of Israel, keep with Thy servant David my father that which Thou hast promised him, saying: There shall not fail thee a man in My sight to sit on the throne of Israel; if only thy children take heed to their way, to walk in My law as thou hast walked before Me.
11300	14	6	17	 Now therefore, O LORD, the God of Israel, let Thy word be verified, which Thou spokest unto Thy servant David.
