14230	19	22	25	 (22:26) From Thee cometh my praise in the great congregation; I will pay my vows before them that fear Him.
14231	19	22	26	 (22:27) Let the humble eat and be satisfied; let them praise the LORD that seek after Him; may your heart be quickened for ever!

14382	19	33	15	 He that fashioneth the hearts of them all, that considereth all their doings.
14383	19	33	16	 A king is not saved by the multitude of a host; a mighty man is not delivered by great strength.

14386	19	33	19	 To deliver their soul from death, and to keep them alive in famine.

14423	19	35	12	 They repay me evil for good; bereavement is come to my soul.

14425	19	35	14	 I went about as though it had been my friend or my brother; I bowed down mournful, as one that mourneth for his mother.

14601	19	45	3	 (45:4) Gird thy sword upon thy thigh, O mighty one, Thy glory and thy majesty.
14602	19	45	4	 (45:5) And in thy majesty prosper, ride on, in behalf of truth and meekness and righteousness; and let thy right hand teach thee tremendous things.
14603	19	45	5	 (45:6) Thine arrows are sharp--the peoples fall under thee-- they sink into the heart of the king's enemies.

14676	19	50	7	 'Hear, O My people, and I will speak; O Israel, and I will testify against thee: God, thy God, am I.
14677	19	50	8	 I will not reprove thee for thy sacrifices; and thy burnt-offerings are continually before Me.
14678	19	50	9	 I will take no bullock out of thy house, nor he-goats out of thy folds.
14679	19	50	10	 For every beast of the forest is Mine, and the cattle upon a thousand hills.
14680	19	50	11	 I know all the fowls of the mountains; and the wild beasts of the field are Mine.
14681	19	50	12	 If I were hungry, I would not tell thee; for the world is Mine, and the fulness thereof.
14682	19	50	13	 Do I eat the flesh of bulls, or drink the blood of goats?
14683	19	50	14	 Offer unto God the sacrifice of thanksgiving; and pay thy vows unto the Most High;
14684	19	50	15	 And call upon Me in the day of trouble; I will deliver thee, and thou shalt honour Me.'
14685	19	50	16	 But unto the wicked God saith: 'What hast thou to do to declare My statutes, and that thou hast taken My covenant in thy mouth?
14686	19	50	17	 Seeing thou hatest instruction, and castest My words behind thee.
14687	19	50	18	 When thou sawest a thief, thou hadst company with him, and with adulterers was thy portion.
14688	19	50	19	 Thou hast let loose thy mouth for evil, and thy tongue frameth deceit.
14689	19	50	20	 Thou sittest and speakest against thy brother; thou slanderest thine own mother's son.
14690	19	50	21	 These things hast thou done, and should I have kept silence? Thou hadst thought that I was altogether such a one as thyself; but I will reprove thee, and set the cause before thine eyes.
14691	19	50	22	 Now consider this, ye that forget God, lest I tear in pieces, and there be none to deliver.
14692	19	50	23	 Whoso offereth the sacrifice of thanksgiving honoureth Me; and to him that ordereth his way aright will I show the salvation of God.'

14996	19	71	19	 Thy righteousness also, O God, which reacheth unto high heaven; Thou who hast done great things, O God, who is like unto Thee?
14997	19	71	20	 Thou, who hast made me to see many and sore troubles, wilt quicken me again, and bring me up again from the depths of the earth.
14998	19	71	21	 Thou wilt increase my greatness, and turn and comfort me.
14999	19	71	22	 I also will give thanks unto Thee with the psaltery, even unto Thy truth, O my God; I will sing praises unto Thee with the harp, O Thou Holy One of Israel.
15000	19	71	23	 My lips shall greatly rejoice when I sing praises unto Thee; and my soul, which Thou hast redeemed.
15001	19	71	24	 My tongue also shall tell of Thy righteousness all the day; for they are ashamed, for they are abashed, that seek my hurt.
15002	19	72	1	 A Psalm of Solomon. Give the king Thy judgments, O God, and Thy righteousness unto the king's son;
15003	19	72	2	 That he may judge Thy people with righteousness, and Thy poor with justice.
15004	19	72	3	 Let the mountains bear peace to the people, and the hills, through righteousness.
15005	19	72	4	 May he judge the poor of the people, and save the children of the needy, and crush the oppressor.
15006	19	72	5	 They shall fear Thee while the sun endureth, and so long as the moon, throughout all generations.
15007	19	72	6	 May he come down like rain upon the mown grass, as showers that water the earth.
15008	19	72	7	 In his days let the righteous flourish, and abundance of peace, till the moon be no more.
15009	19	72	8	 May he have dominion also from sea to sea, and from the River unto the ends of the earth.
15010	19	72	9	 Let them that dwell in the wilderness bow before him; and his enemies lick the dust.
15011	19	72	10	 The kings of Tarshish and of the isles shall render tribute; the kings of Sheba and Seba shall offer gifts.
15012	19	72	11	 Yea, all kings shall prostrate themselves before him; all nations shall serve him.
15013	19	72	12	 For he will deliver the needy when he crieth; the poor also, and him that hath no helper.
15014	19	72	13	 He will have pity on the poor and needy, and the souls of the needy he will save.
15015	19	72	14	 He will redeem their soul from oppression and violence, and precious will their blood be in his sight.
15016	19	72	15	 That they may live, and that he may give them of the gold of Sheba, that they may pray for him continually, yea, bless him all the day.
15017	19	72	16	 May he be as a rich cornfield in the land upon the top of the mountains; may his fruit rustle like Lebanon; and may they blossom out of the city like grass of the earth.
15018	19	72	17	 May his name endure for ever; may his name be continued as long as the sun; may men also bless themselves by him; may all nations call him happy.
15019	19	72	18	 Blessed be the LORD God, the God of Israel, who only doeth wondrous things;
15020	19	72	19	 And blessed be His glorious name for ever; and let the whole earth be filled with His glory. Amen, and Amen.

15022	19	73	1	 A Psalm of Asaph. Surely God is good to Israel, even to such as are pure in heart.
15023	19	73	2	 But as for me, my feet were almost gone; my steps had well nigh slipped.
15024	19	73	3	 For I was envious at the arrogant, when I saw the prosperity of the wicked.
15025	19	73	4	 For there are no pangs at their death, and their body is sound.
15026	19	73	5	 In the trouble of man they are not; neither are they plagued like men.
15027	19	73	6	 Therefore pride is as a chain about their neck; violence covereth them as a garment.
15028	19	73	7	 Their eyes stand forth from fatness; they are gone beyond the imaginations of their heart.
15029	19	73	8	 They scoff, and in wickedness utter oppression; they speak as if there were none on high.
15030	19	73	9	 They have set their mouth against the heavens, and their tongue walketh through the earth.
15031	19	73	10	 Therefore His people return hither; and waters of fullness are drained out by them.
15032	19	73	11	 And they say: 'How doth God know? And is there knowledge in the Most High?'
15033	19	73	12	 Behold, such are the wicked; and they that are always at ease increase riches.
15034	19	73	13	 Surely in vain have I cleansed my heart, and washed my hands in innocency;
15035	19	73	14	 For all the day have I been plagued, and my chastisement came every morning.
15036	19	73	15	 If I had said: 'I will speak thus', behold, I had been faithless to the generation of Thy children.
15037	19	73	16	 And when I pondered how I might know this, it was wearisome in mine eyes;
15038	19	73	17	 Until I entered into the sanctuary of God, and considered their end.
15039	19	73	18	 Surely Thou settest them in slippery places; Thou hurlest them down to utter ruin.
15040	19	73	19	 How are they become a desolation in a moment! They are wholly consumed by terrors.
15041	19	73	20	 As a dream when one awaketh, so, O Lord, when Thou arousest Thyself, Thou wilt despise their semblance.
15042	19	73	21	 For my heart was in a ferment, and I was pricked in my reins.
15043	19	73	22	 But I was brutish, and ignorant; I was as a beast before Thee.
15044	19	73	23	 Nevertheless I am continually with Thee; Thou holdest my right hand.
15045	19	73	24	 Thou wilt guide me with Thy counsel, and afterward receive me with glory.
15046	19	73	25	 Whom have I in heaven but Thee? And beside Thee I desire none upon earth.
15047	19	73	26	 My flesh and my heart faileth; but God is the rock of my heart and my portion for ever.
15048	19	73	27	 For, lo, they that go far from Thee shall perish; Thou dost destroy all them that go astray from Thee.
15049	19	73	28	 But as for me, the nearness of God is my good; I have made the Lord GOD my refuge, that I may tell of all Thy works.
15050	19	74	1	 Maschil of Asaph. Why, O God, hast Thou cast us off for ever? Why doth Thine anger smoke against the flock of Thy pasture?
15051	19	74	2	 Remember Thy congregation, which Thou hast gotten of old, which Thou hast redeemed to be the tribe of Thine inheritance; and mount Zion, wherein Thou hast dwelt.
15052	19	74	3	 Lift up Thy steps because of the perpetual ruins, even all the evil that the enemy hath done in the sanctuary.
15053	19	74	4	 Thine adversaries have roared in the midst of Thy meeting-place; they have set up their own signs for signs.
15054	19	74	5	 It seemed as when men wield upwards axes in a thicket of trees.
15055	19	74	6	 And now all the carved work thereof together they strike down with hatchet and hammers.
15056	19	74	7	 They have set Thy sanctuary on fire; they have profaned the dwelling-place of Thy name even to the ground.
15057	19	74	8	 They said in their heart: 'Let us make havoc of them altogether'; they have burned up all the meeting-places of God in the land.
15058	19	74	9	 We see not our signs; there is no more any prophet; neither is there among us any that knoweth how long.
15059	19	74	10	 How long, O God, shall the adversary reproach? Shall the enemy blaspheme Thy name for ever?
15060	19	74	11	 Why withdrawest Thou Thy hand, even Thy right hand? Draw it out of Thy bosom and consume them.
15061	19	74	12	 Yet God is my King of old, working salvation in the midst of the earth.
15062	19	74	13	 Thou didst break the sea in pieces by Thy strength; Thou didst shatter the heads of the sea-monsters in the waters.
15063	19	74	14	 Thou didst crush the heads of leviathan, Thou gavest him to be food to the folk inhabiting the wilderness.
15064	19	74	15	 Thou didst cleave fountain and brook; Thou driedst up ever-flowing rivers.
15065	19	74	16	 Thine is the day, Thine also the night; Thou hast established luminary and sun.
15066	19	74	17	 Thou hast set all the borders of the earth; Thou hast made summer and winter.

15069	19	74	20	 Look upon the covenant; for the dark places of the land are full of the habitations of violence.
15070	19	74	21	 O let not the oppressed turn back in confusion; let the poor and needy praise Thy name.

15072	19	74	23	 Forget not the voice of Thine adversaries, the tumult of those that rise up against Thee which ascendeth continually.

15115	19	78	1	 Maschil of Asaph. Give ear, O my people, to my teaching; incline your ears to the words of my mouth.
15116	19	78	2	 I will open my mouth with a parable; I will utter dark sayings concerning days of old;
15117	19	78	3	 That which we have heard and known, and our fathers have told us,
15118	19	78	4	 We will not hide from their children, telling to the generation to come the praises of the LORD, and His strength, and His wondrous works that He hath done.
15119	19	78	5	 For He established a testimony in Jacob, and appointed a law in Israel, which He commanded our fathers, that they should make them known to their children;
15120	19	78	6	 That the generation to come might know them, even the children that should be born; who should arise and tell them to their children,
15121	19	78	7	 That they might put their confidence in God, and not forget the works of God, but keep His commandments;
15122	19	78	8	 And might not be as their fathers, a stubborn and rebellious generation; a generation that set not their heart aright, and whose spirit was not stedfast with God.
15123	19	78	9	 The children of Ephraim were as archers handling the bow, that turned back in the day of battle.
15124	19	78	10	 They kept not the covenant of God, and refused to walk in His law;
15125	19	78	11	 And they forgot His doings, and His wondrous works that He had shown them.
15126	19	78	12	 Marvellous things did He in the sight of their fathers, in the land of Egypt, in the field of Zoan.
15127	19	78	13	 He cleaved the sea, and caused them to pass through; and He made the waters to stand as a heap.
15128	19	78	14	 By day also He led them with a cloud, and all the night with a light of fire.
15129	19	78	15	 He cleaved rocks in the wilderness, and gave them drink abundantly as out of the great deep.
15130	19	78	16	 He brought streams also out of the rock, and caused waters to run down like rivers.
15131	19	78	17	 Yet went they on still to sin against Him, to rebel against the Most High in the desert.
15132	19	78	18	 And they tried God in their heart by asking food for their craving.
15133	19	78	19	 Yea, they spoke against God; they said: 'Can God prepare a table in the wilderness?
15134	19	78	20	 Behold, He smote the rock, that waters gushed out, and streams overflowed; can He give bread also? or will He provide flesh for His people?'
15135	19	78	21	 Therefore the LORD heard, and was wroth; and a fire was kindled against Jacob, and anger also went up against Israel;
15136	19	78	22	 Because they believed not in God, and trusted not in His salvation.
15137	19	78	23	 And He commanded the skies above, and opened the doors of heaven;
15138	19	78	24	 And He caused manna to rain upon them for food, and gave them of the corn of heaven.
15139	19	78	25	 Man did eat the bread of the mighty; He sent them provisions to the full.
15140	19	78	26	 He caused the east wind to set forth in heaven; and by His power He brought on the south wind.
15141	19	78	27	 He caused flesh also to rain upon them as the dust, and winged fowl as the sand of the seas;
15142	19	78	28	 And He let it fall in the midst of their camp, round about their dwellings.
15143	19	78	29	 So they did eat, and were well filled; and He gave them that which they craved.
15144	19	78	30	 They were not estranged from their craving, their food was yet in their mouths,
15145	19	78	31	 When the anger of God went up against them, and slew of the lustieth among them, and smote down the young men of Israel.
15146	19	78	32	 For all this they sinned still, and believed not in His wondrous works.
15147	19	78	33	 Therefore He ended their days as a breath, and their years in terror.
15148	19	78	34	 When He slew them, then they would inquire after Him, and turn back and seek God earnestly.
15149	19	78	35	 And they remembered that God was their Rock, and the Most High God their redeemer.
15150	19	78	36	 But they beguiled Him with their mouth, and lied unto Him with their tongue.
15151	19	78	37	 For their heart was not stedfast with Him, neither were they faithful in His covenant.
15152	19	78	38	 But He, being full of compassion, forgiveth iniquity, and destroyeth not; yea, many a time doth He turn His anger away, and doth not stir up all His wrath.
15153	19	78	39	 So He remembered that they were but flesh, a wind that passeth away, and cometh not again.
15154	19	78	40	 How oft did they rebel against Him in the wilderness, and grieve Him in the desert!
15155	19	78	41	 And still again they tried God, and set bounds to the Holy One of Israel.
15156	19	78	42	 They remembered not His hand, nor the day when He redeemed them from the adversary.
15157	19	78	43	 How He set His signs in Egypt, and His wonders in the field of Zoan;
15158	19	78	44	 And turned their rivers into blood, so that they could not drink their streams.
15159	19	78	45	 He sent among them swarms of flies, which devoured them; and frogs, which destroyed them.
15160	19	78	46	 He gave also their increase unto the caterpillar, and their labour unto the locust.
15161	19	78	47	 He destroyed their vines with hail, and their sycamore-trees with frost.
15162	19	78	48	 He gave over their cattle also to the hail, and their flocks to fiery bolts.
15163	19	78	49	 He sent forth upon them the fierceness of His anger, wrath, and indignation, and trouble, a sending of messengers of evil.
15164	19	78	50	 He levelled a path for His anger; He spared not their soul from death, but gave their life over to the pestilence;
15165	19	78	51	 And smote all the first-born in Egypt, the first-fruits of their strength in the tents of Ham;
15166	19	78	52	 But He made His own people to go forth like sheep, and guided them in the wilderness like a flock.
15167	19	78	53	 And He led them safely, and they feared not; but the sea overwhelmed their enemies.
15168	19	78	54	 And He brought them to His holy border, to the mountain, which His right hand had gotten.
15169	19	78	55	 He drove out the nations also before them, and allotted them for an inheritance by line, and made the tribes of Israel to dwell in their tents.
15170	19	78	56	 Yet they tried and provoked God, the Most High, and kept not His testimonies;
15171	19	78	57	 But turned back, and dealt treacherously like their fathers; they were turned aside like a deceitful bow.
15172	19	78	58	 For they provoked Him with their high places, and moved Him to jealousy with their graven images.
15173	19	78	59	 God heard, and was wroth, and He greatly abhorred Israel;
15174	19	78	60	 And He forsook the tabernacle of Shiloh, the tent which He had made to dwell among men;
15175	19	78	61	 And delivered His strength into captivity, and His glory into the adversary's hand.
15176	19	78	62	 He gave His people over also unto the sword; and was wroth with His inheritance.
15177	19	78	63	 Fire devoured their young men; and their virgins had no marriage-song.
15178	19	78	64	 Their priests fell by the sword; and their widows made no lamentation.
15179	19	78	65	 Then the Lord awaked as one asleep, like a mighty man recovering from wine.
15180	19	78	66	 And He smote His adversaries backward; He put upon them a perpetual reproach.
15181	19	78	67	 Moreover He abhorred the tent of Joseph, and chose not the tribe of Ephraim;
15182	19	78	68	 But chose the tribe of Judah, the mount Zion which He loved.
15183	19	78	69	 And He built His sanctuary like the heights, like the earth which He hath founded for ever.
15184	19	78	70	 He chose David also His servant, and took him from the sheepfolds;
15185	19	78	71	 From following the ewes that give suck He brought him, to be shepherd over Jacob His people, and Israel His inheritance.
15186	19	78	72	 So he shepherded them according to the integrity of his heart; and lead them by the skilfulness of his hands.

16402	20	1	1	 THE PROVERBS of Solomon the son of David, king of Israel;
16403	20	1	2	 To know wisdom and instruction; to comprehend the words of understanding;
16404	20	1	3	 To receive the discipline of wisdom, justice, and right, and equity;
16405	20	1	4	 To give prudence to the simple, to the young man knowledge and discretion;
16406	20	1	5	 That the wise man may hear, and increase in learning, and the man of understanding may attain unto wise counsels;
16407	20	1	6	 To understand a proverb, and a figure; the words of the wise, and their dark sayings.
16408	20	1	7	 The fear of the LORD is the beginning of knowledge; but the foolish despise wisdom and discipline.
16409	20	1	8	 Hear, my son, the instruction of thy father, and forsake not the teaching of thy mother;
16410	20	1	9	 For they shall be a chaplet of grace unto thy head, and chains about thy neck.
16411	20	1	10	 My son, if sinners entice thee, consent thou not.
16412	20	1	11	 If they say: 'Come with us, let us lie in wait for blood, let us lurk for the innocent without cause;
16413	20	1	12	 Let us swallow them up alive as the grave, and whole, as those that go down into the pit;
16414	20	1	13	 We shall find all precious substance, we shall fill our houses with spoil;
16415	20	1	14	 Cast in thy lot among us; let us all have one purse'--
16416	20	1	15	 My son, walk not thou in the way with them, restrain thy foot from their path;
16417	20	1	16	 For their feet run to evil, and they make haste to shed blood.
16418	20	1	17	 For in vain the net is spread in the eyes of any bird;
16419	20	1	18	 And these lie in wait for their own blood, they lurk for their own lives.
16420	20	1	19	 So are the ways of every one that is greedy of gain; it taketh away the life of the owners thereof.
16421	20	1	20	 Wisdom crieth aloud in the streets, she uttereth her voice in the broad places;
16422	20	1	21	 She calleth at the head of the noisy streets, at the entrances of the gates, in the city, she uttereth her words:
16423	20	1	22	 'How long, ye thoughtless, will ye love thoughtlessness? And how long will scorners delight them in scorning, and fools hate knowledge?
16424	20	1	23	 Turn you at my reproof; behold, I will pour out my spirit unto you, I will make known my words unto you.
16425	20	1	24	 Because I have called, and ye refused, I have stretched out my hand, and no man attended,
16426	20	1	25	 But ye have set at nought all my counsel, and would none of my reproof;
16427	20	1	26	 I also, in your calamity, will laugh, I will mock when your dread cometh;
16428	20	1	27	 When your dread cometh as a storm, and your calamity cometh on as a whirlwind; when trouble and distress come upon you.
16429	20	1	28	 Then will they call me, but I will not answer, they will seek me earnestly, but they shall not find me.
16430	20	1	29	 For that they hated knowledge, and did not choose the fear of the LORD;
16431	20	1	30	 They would none of my counsel, they despised all my reproof.
16432	20	1	31	 Therefore shall they eat of the fruit of their own way, and be filled with their own devices.
16433	20	1	32	 For the waywardness of the thoughtless shall slay them, and the confidence of fools shall destroy them.
16434	20	1	33	 But whoso hearkeneth unto me shall dwell securely, and shall be quiet without fear of evil.'
16435	20	2	1	 My son, if thou wilt receive my words, and lay up my commandments with thee;
16436	20	2	2	 So that thou make thine ear attend unto wisdom, and thy heart incline to discernment;
16437	20	2	3	 Yea, if thou call for understanding, and lift up thy voice for discernment;
16438	20	2	4	 If thou seek her as silver, and search for her as for hid treasures;
16439	20	2	5	 Then shalt thou understand the fear of the LORD, and find the knowledge of God.
16440	20	2	6	 For the LORD giveth wisdom, out of His mouth cometh knowledge and discernment;
16441	20	2	7	 He layeth up sound wisdom for the upright, He is a shield to them that walk in integrity;
16442	20	2	8	 That He may guard the paths of justice, and preserve the way of His godly ones.
16443	20	2	9	 Then shalt thou understand righteousness and justice, and equity, yea, every good path.
16444	20	2	10	 For wisdom shall enter into thy heart, and knowledge shall be pleasant unto thy soul;
16445	20	2	11	 Discretion shall watch over thee, discernment shall guard thee;
16446	20	2	12	 To deliver thee from the way of evil, from the men that speak froward things;
16447	20	2	13	 Who leave the paths of uprightness, to walk in the ways of darkness;
16448	20	2	14	 Who rejoice to do evil, and delight in the frowardness of evil;

16451	20	2	17	 That forsaketh the lord of her youth, and forgetteth the covenant of her God.
16452	20	2	18	 For her house sinketh down unto death, and her paths unto the shades;
16453	20	2	19	 None that go unto her return, neither do they attain unto the paths of life;
16454	20	2	20	 That thou mayest walk in the way of good men, and keep the paths of the righteous.
16455	20	2	21	 For the upright shall dwell in the land, and the whole-hearted shall remain in it.
16456	20	2	22	 But the wicked shall be cut off from the land, and the faithless shall be plucked up out of it.
16457	20	3	1	 My son, forget not my teaching; but let thy heart keep my commandments;
16458	20	3	2	 For length of days, and years of life, and peace, will they add to thee.
16459	20	3	3	 Let not kindness and truth forsake thee; bind them about thy neck, write them upon the table of thy heart;
16460	20	3	4	 So shalt thou find grace and good favour in the sight of God and man.
16461	20	3	5	 Trust in the LORD with all thy heart, and lean not upon thine own understanding.
16462	20	3	6	 In all thy ways acknowledge Him, and He will direct thy paths.
16463	20	3	7	 Be not wise in thine own eyes; fear the LORD, and depart from evil;
16464	20	3	8	 It shall be health to thy navel, and marrow to thy bones.
16465	20	3	9	 Honour the LORD with thy substance, and with the first-fruits of all thine increase;
16466	20	3	10	 So shall thy barns be filled with plenty, and thy vats shall overflow with new wine.
16467	20	3	11	 My son, despise not the chastening of the LORD, neither spurn thou His correction;
16468	20	3	12	 For whom the LORD loveth He correcteth, even as a father the son in whom he delighteth.
16469	20	3	13	 Happy is the man that findeth wisdom, and the man that obtaineth understanding.
16470	20	3	14	 For the merchandise of it is better than the merchandise of silver, and the gain thereof than fine gold.
16471	20	3	15	 She is more precious than rubies; and all the things thou canst desire are not to be compared unto her.
16472	20	3	16	 Length of days is in her right hand; in her left hand are riches and honour.
16473	20	3	17	 Her ways are ways of pleasantness, and all her paths are peace.
16474	20	3	18	 She is a tree of life to them that lay hold upon her, and happy is every one that holdest her fast.
16475	20	3	19	 The LORD by wisdom founded the earth; by understanding He established the heavens.
16476	20	3	20	 By His knowledge the depths were broken up, and the skies drop down the dew.
16477	20	3	21	 My son, let not them depart from thine eyes; keep sound wisdom and discretion;
16478	20	3	22	 So shall they be life unto thy soul, and grace to thy neck.
16479	20	3	23	 Then shalt thou walk in thy way securely, and thou shalt not dash thy foot.
16480	20	3	24	 When thou liest down, thou shalt not be afraid; yea, thou shalt lie down, and thy sleep shall be sweet.
16481	20	3	25	 Be not afraid of sudden terror, neither of the destruction of the wicked, when it cometh;
16482	20	3	26	 For the LORD will be thy confidence, and will keep thy foot from being caught.
16483	20	3	27	 Withhold not good from him to whom it is due, when it is in the power of thy hand to do it.
16484	20	3	28	 Say not unto thy neighbour: 'Go, and come again, and to-morrow I will give'; when thou hast it by thee.
16485	20	3	29	 Devise not evil against thy neighbour, seeing he dwelleth securely by thee.
16486	20	3	30	 Strive not with a man without cause, if he have done thee no harm.
16487	20	3	31	 Envy thou not the man of violence, and choose none of his ways.
16488	20	3	32	 For the perverse is an abomination to the LORD; but His counsel is with the upright.
16489	20	3	33	 The curse of the LORD is in the house of the wicked; but He blesseth the habitation of the righteous.
16490	20	3	34	 If it concerneth the scorners, He scorneth them, but unto the humble He giveth grace.
16491	20	3	35	 The wise shall inherit honour; but as for the fools, they carry away shame.
16492	20	4	1	 Hear, ye children, the instruction of a father, and attend to know understanding.
16493	20	4	2	 For I give you good doctrine; forsake ye not my teaching.
16494	20	4	3	 For I was a son unto my father, tender and an only one in the sight of my mother.
16495	20	4	4	 And he taught me, and said unto me: 'Let thy heart hold fast my words, keep my commandments, and live;
16496	20	4	5	 Get wisdom, get understanding; forget not, neither decline from the words of my mouth;
16497	20	4	6	 Forsake her not, and she will preserve thee; love her, and she will keep thee.
16498	20	4	7	 The beginning of wisdom is: Get wisdom; yea, with all thy getting get understanding.
16499	20	4	8	 Extol her, and she will exalt thee; she will bring thee to honour, when thou dost embrace her.
16500	20	4	9	 She will give to thy head a chaplet of grace; a crown of glory will she bestow on thee.'
16501	20	4	10	 Hear, O my son, and receive my sayings; and the years of thy life shall be many.
16502	20	4	11	 I have taught thee in the way of wisdom; I have led thee in paths of uprightness.
16503	20	4	12	 When thou goest, thy step shall not be straitened; and if thou runnest, thou shalt not stumble.
16504	20	4	13	 Take fast hold of instruction, let her not go; keep her, for she is thy life.
16505	20	4	14	 Enter not into the path of the wicked, and walk not in the way of evil men.
16506	20	4	15	 Avoid it, pass not by it; turn from it, and pass on.
16507	20	4	16	 For they sleep not, except they have done evil; and their sleep is taken away, unless they cause some to fall.
16508	20	4	17	 For they eat the bread of wickedness, and drink the wine of violence.
16509	20	4	18	 But the path of the righteous is as the light of dawn, that shineth more and more unto the perfect day.
16510	20	4	19	 The way of the wicked is as darkness; they know not at what they stumble.
16511	20	4	20	 My son, attend to my words; incline thine ear unto my sayings.
16512	20	4	21	 Let them not depart from thine eyes; keep them in the midst of thy heart.
16513	20	4	22	 For they are life unto those that find them, and health to all their flesh.
16514	20	4	23	 Above all that thou guardest keep thy heart; for out of it are the issues of life.
16515	20	4	24	 Put away from thee a froward mouth, and perverse lips put far from thee.
16516	20	4	25	 Let thine eyes look right on, and let thine eyelids look straight before thee.
16517	20	4	26	 Make plain the path of thy feet, and let all thy ways be established.
16518	20	4	27	 Turn not to the right hand nor to the left; remove thy foot from evil.
16519	20	5	1	 My son, attend unto my wisdom; incline thine ear to my understanding;
16520	20	5	2	 That thou mayest preserve discretion, and that thy lips may keep knowledge.
16521	20	5	3	 For the lips of a strange woman drop honey, and her mouth is smoother than oil;
16522	20	5	4	 But her end is bitter as wormwood, sharp as a two-edged sword.
16523	20	5	5	 Her feet go down to death; her steps take hold on the nether-world;
16524	20	5	6	 Lest she should walk the even path of life, her ways wander, but she knoweth it not.
16525	20	5	7	 Now therefore, O ye children, hearken unto me, and depart not from the words of my mouth.
16526	20	5	8	 Remove thy way far from her, and come not nigh the door of her house;
16527	20	5	9	 Lest thou give thy vigour unto others, and thy years unto the cruel;
16528	20	5	10	 Lest strangers be filled with thy strength, and thy labours be in the house of an alien;
16529	20	5	11	 And thou moan, when thine end cometh, when thy flesh and thy body are consumed,
16530	20	5	12	 And say: 'How have I hated instruction, and my heart despised reproof;
16531	20	5	13	 Neither have I hearkened to the voice of my teachers, nor inclined mine ear to them that instructed me!
16532	20	5	14	 I was well nigh in all evil in the midst of the congregation and assembly.'
16533	20	5	15	 Drink waters out of thine own cistern, and running waters out of thine own well.
16534	20	5	16	 Let thy springs be dispersed abroad, and courses of water in the streets.
16535	20	5	17	 Let them be only thine own, and not strangers' with thee.
16536	20	5	18	 Let thy fountain be blessed; and have joy of the wife of thy youth.
16537	20	5	19	 A lovely hind and a graceful doe, let her breasts satisfy thee at all times; with her love be thou ravished always.
16538	20	5	20	 Why then wilt thou, my son, be ravished with a strange woman, and embrace the bosom of an alien?
16539	20	5	21	 For the ways of man are before the eyes of the LORD, and He maketh even all his paths.
16540	20	5	22	 His own iniquities shall ensnare the wicked, and he shall be holden with the cords of his sin.
16541	20	5	23	 He shall die for lack of instruction; and in the greatness of his folly he shall reel.
16542	20	6	1	 My son, if thou art become surety for thy neighbour, if thou hast struck thy hands for a stranger--
16543	20	6	2	 Thou art snared by the words of thy mouth, thou art caught by the words of thy mouth--
16544	20	6	3	 Do this now, my son, and deliver thyself, seeing thou art come into the hand of thy neighbour; go, humble thyself, and urge thy neighbour.
16545	20	6	4	 Give not sleep to thine eyes, nor slumber to thine eyelids.
16546	20	6	5	 Deliver thyself as a gazelle from the hand of the hunter, and as a bird from the hand of the fowler.
16547	20	6	6	 Go to the ant, thou sluggard; consider her ways, and be wise;
16548	20	6	7	 Which having no chief, overseer, or ruler,
16549	20	6	8	 Provideth her bread in the summer, and gatherest her food in the harvest.
16550	20	6	9	 How long wilt thou sleep, O sluggard? When wilt thou arise out of thy sleep?
16551	20	6	10	 'Yet a little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of the hands to sleep'--
16552	20	6	11	 So shall thy poverty come as a runner, and thy want as an armed man.
16553	20	6	12	 A base person, a man of iniquity, is he that walketh with a froward mouth;
16554	20	6	13	 That winketh with his eyes, that scrapeth with his feet, that pointeth with his fingers;
16555	20	6	14	 Frowardness is in his heart, he deviseth evil continually; he soweth discord.
16556	20	6	15	 Therefore shall his calamity come suddenly; on a sudden shall he be broken, and that without remedy.
16557	20	6	16	 There are six things which the LORD hateth, yea, seven which are an abomination unto Him:
16558	20	6	17	 Haughty eyes, a lying tongue, and hands that shed innocent blood;
16559	20	6	18	 A heart that deviseth wicked thoughts, feet that are swift in running to evil;
16560	20	6	19	 A false witness that breatheth out lies, and he that soweth discord among brethren.
16561	20	6	20	 My son, keep the commandment of thy father, and forsake not the teaching of thy mother;
16562	20	6	21	 Bind them continually upon thy heart, tie them about thy neck.
16563	20	6	22	 When thou walkest, it shall lead thee, when thou liest down, it shall watch over thee; and when thou awakest, it shall talk with thee.
16564	20	6	23	 For the commandment is a lamp, and the teaching is light, and reproofs of instruction are the way of life;
16565	20	6	24	 To keep thee from the evil woman, from the smoothness of the alien tongue.
16566	20	6	25	 Lust not after her beauty in thy heart; neither let her captivate thee with her eyelids.
16567	20	6	26	 For on account of a harlot a man is brought to a loaf of bread, but the adulteress hunteth for the precious life.
16568	20	6	27	 Can a man take fire in his bosom, and his clothes not be burned?
16569	20	6	28	 Or can one walk upon hot coals, and his feet not be scorched?
16570	20	6	29	 So he that goeth in to his neighbour's wife; whosoever toucheth her shall not go unpunished.
16571	20	6	30	 Men do not despise a thief, if he steal to satisfy his soul when he is hungry;
16572	20	6	31	 But if he be found, he must restore sevenfold, he must give all the substance of his house.
16573	20	6	32	 He that committeth adultery with a woman lacketh understanding; he doeth it that would destroy his own soul.
16574	20	6	33	 Wounds and dishonour shall he get, and his reproach shall not be wiped away.
16575	20	6	34	 For jealousy is the rage of a man, and he will not spare in the day of vengeance.
16576	20	6	35	 He will not regard any ransom; neither will he rest content, though thou givest many gifts.
16577	20	7	1	 My son, keep my words, and lay up my commandments with thee.
16578	20	7	2	 Keep my commandments and live, and my teaching as the apple of thine eye.
16579	20	7	3	 Bind them upon thy fingers, write them upon the table of thy heart.
16580	20	7	4	 Say unto wisdom: 'Thou art my sister', and call understanding thy kinswoman;
16581	20	7	5	 That they may keep thee from the strange woman, from the alien woman that maketh smooth her words.
16582	20	7	6	 For at the window of my house I looked forth through my lattice;
16583	20	7	7	 And I beheld among the thoughtless ones, I discerned among the youths, a young man void of understanding,
16584	20	7	8	 Passing through the street near her corner, and he went the way to her house;
16585	20	7	9	 In the twilight, in the evening of the day, in the blackness of night and the darkness.
16586	20	7	10	 And, behold, there met him a woman with the attire of a harlot, and wily of heart.
16587	20	7	11	 She is riotous and rebellious, her feet abide not in her house;
16588	20	7	12	 Now she is in the streets, now in the broad places, and lieth in wait at every corner.
16589	20	7	13	 So she caught him, and kissed him, and with an impudent face she said unto him:
16590	20	7	14	 'Sacrifices of peace-offerings were due from me; this day have I paid my vows.
16591	20	7	15	 Therefore came I forth to meet thee, to seek thy face, and I have found thee.
16592	20	7	16	 I have decked my couch with coverlets, with striped cloths of the yarn of Egypt.
16593	20	7	17	 I have perfumed my bed with myrrh, aloes, and cinnamon.
16594	20	7	18	 Come, let us take our fill of love until the morning; let us solace ourselves with loves.
16595	20	7	19	 For my husband is not at home, he is gone a long journey;
16596	20	7	20	 He hath taken the bag of money with him; he will come home at the full moon.'
16597	20	7	21	 With her much fair speech she causeth him to yield, with the blandishment of her lips she enticeth him away.
16598	20	7	22	 He goeth after her straightway, as an ox that goeth to the slaughter, or as one in fetters to the correction of the fool;
16599	20	7	23	 Till an arrow strike through his liver; as a bird hasteneth to the snare-- and knoweth not that it is at the cost of his life.
16600	20	7	24	 Now therefore, O ye children, hearken unto me, and attend to the words of my mouth.
16601	20	7	25	 Let not thy heart decline to her ways, go not astray in her paths.

16603	20	7	27	 Her house is the way to the nether-world, going down to the chambers of death.
16604	20	8	1	 Doth not wisdom call, and understanding put forth her voice?
16605	20	8	2	 In the top of high places by the way, where the paths meet, she standeth;
16606	20	8	3	 Beside the gates, at the entry of the city, at the coming in at the doors, she crieth aloud:
16607	20	8	4	 'Unto you, O men, I call, and my voice is to the sons of men.
16608	20	8	5	 O ye thoughtless, understand prudence, and, ye fools, be ye of an understanding heart.
16609	20	8	6	 Hear, for I will speak excellent things, and the opening of my lips shall be right things.
16610	20	8	7	 For my mouth shall utter truth, and wickedness is an abomination to my lips.
16611	20	8	8	 All the words of my mouth are in righteousness, there is nothing perverse or crooked in them.
16612	20	8	9	 They are all plain to him that understandeth, and right to them that find knowledge.
16613	20	8	10	 Receive my instruction, and not silver, and knowledge rather than choice gold.
16614	20	8	11	 For wisdom is better than rubies, and all things desirable are not to be compared unto her.
16615	20	8	12	 I wisdom dwell with prudence, and find out knowledge of devices.
16616	20	8	13	 The fear of the LORD is to hate evil; pride, and arrogancy, and the evil way, and the froward mouth, do I hate.
16617	20	8	14	 Counsel is mine, and sound wisdom; I am understanding, power is mine.
16618	20	8	15	 By me kings reign, and princes decree justice.
16619	20	8	16	 By me princes rule, and nobles, even all the judges of the earth.
16620	20	8	17	 I love them that love me, and those that seek me earnestly shall find me.
16621	20	8	18	 Riches and honour are with me; yea, enduring riches and righteousness.
16622	20	8	19	 My fruit is better than gold, yea, than fine gold; and my produce than choice silver.
16623	20	8	20	 I walk in the way of righteousness, in the midst of the paths of justice;
16624	20	8	21	 That I may cause those that love me to inherit substance, and that I may fill their treasuries.
16625	20	8	22	 The LORD made me as the beginning of His way, the first of His works of old.
16626	20	8	23	 I was set up from everlasting, from the beginning, or ever the earth was.
16627	20	8	24	 When there were no depths, I was brought forth; when there were no fountains abounding with water.
16628	20	8	25	 Before the mountains were settled, before the hills was I brought forth;
16629	20	8	26	 While as yet He had not made the earth, nor the fields, nor the beginning of the dust of the world.
16630	20	8	27	 When He established the heavens, I was there; when He set a circle upon the face of the deep,
16631	20	8	28	 When He made firm the skies above, when the fountains of the deep showed their might,
16632	20	8	29	 When He gave to the sea His decree, that the waters should not transgress His commandment, when He appointed the foundations of the earth;
16633	20	8	30	 Then I was by Him, as a nursling; and I was daily all delight, playing always before Him,
16634	20	8	31	 Playing in His habitable earth, and my delights are with the sons of men.
16635	20	8	32	 Now therefore, ye children, hearken unto me; for happy are they that keep my ways.
16636	20	8	33	 Hear instruction, and be wise, and refuse it not.
16637	20	8	34	 Happy is the man that hearkeneth to me, watching daily at my gates, waiting at the posts of my doors.
16638	20	8	35	 For whoso findeth me findeth life, and obtaineth favour of the LORD.
16639	20	8	36	 But he that misseth me wrongeth his own soul; all they that hate me love death.'
16640	20	9	1	 Wisdom hath builded her house, she hath hewn out her seven pillars;
16641	20	9	2	 She hath prepared her meat, she hath mingled her wine; she hath also furnished her table.
16642	20	9	3	 She hath sent forth her maidens, she calleth, upon the highest places of the city:
16643	20	9	4	 'Whoso is thoughtless, let him turn in hither'; as for him that lacketh understanding, she saith to him:
16644	20	9	5	 'Come, eat of my bread, and drink of the wine which I have mingled.
16645	20	9	6	 Forsake all thoughtlessness, and live; and walk in the way of understanding.
16646	20	9	7	 He that correcteth a scorner getteth to himself shame, and he that reproveth a wicked man, it becometh unto him a blot.
16647	20	9	8	 Reprove not a scorner, lest he hate thee; reprove a wise man, and he will love thee.
16648	20	9	9	 Give to a wise man, and he will be yet wiser; teach a righteous man, and he will increase in learning.
16649	20	9	10	 The fear of the LORD is the beginning of wisdom, and the knowledge of the All-holy is understanding.
16650	20	9	11	 For by me thy days shall be multiplied, and the years of thy life shall be increased.

16653	20	9	14	 And she sitteth at the door of her house, on a seat in the high places of the city,
16654	20	9	15	 To call to them that pass by, who go right on their ways:

16656	20	9	17	 'Stolen waters are sweet, and bread eaten in secret is pleasant.'
16657	20	9	18	 But he knoweth not that the shades are there; that her guests are in the depths of the nether-world.
16658	20	10	1	 The proverbs of Solomon. A wise son maketh a glad father; but a foolish son is the grief of his mother.
16659	20	10	2	 Treasures of wickedness profit nothing; but righteousness delivereth from death.
16660	20	10	3	 The LORD will not suffer the soul of the righteous to famish; but He thrusteth away the desire of the wicked.
16661	20	10	4	 He becometh poor that dealeth with a slack hand; but the hand of the diligent maketh rich.
16662	20	10	5	 A wise son gathereth in summer; but a son that doeth shamefully sleepeth in harvest.
16663	20	10	6	 Blessings are upon the head of the righteous; but the mouth of the wicked concealeth violence.
16664	20	10	7	 The memory of the righteous shall be for a blessing; but the name of the wicked shall rot.
16665	20	10	8	 The wise in heart will receive commandments; but a prating fool shall fall.
16666	20	10	9	 He that walketh uprightly walketh securely; but he that perverteth his ways shall be found out.
16667	20	10	10	 He that winketh with the eye causeth sorrow; and a prating fool shall fall.
16668	20	10	11	 The mouth of the righteous is a fountain of life; but the mouth of the wicked concealeth violence.
16669	20	10	12	 Hatred stirreth up strifes; but love covereth all transgressions.
16670	20	10	13	 In the lips of him that hath discernment wisdom is found; but a rod is for the back of him that is void of understanding.
16671	20	10	14	 Wise men lay up knowledge; but the mouth of the foolish is an imminent ruin.
16672	20	10	15	 The rich man's wealth is his strong city; the ruin of the poor is their poverty.
16673	20	10	16	 The wages of the righteous is life; the increase of the wicked is sin.
16674	20	10	17	 He is in the way of life that heedeth instruction; but he that forsaketh reproof erreth.
16675	20	10	18	 He that hideth hatred is of lying lips; and he that uttereth a slander is a fool.
16676	20	10	19	 In the multitude of words there wanteth not transgression; but he that refraineth his lips is wise.
16677	20	10	20	 The tongue of the righteous is as choice silver; the heart of the wicked is little worth.
16678	20	10	21	 The lips of the righteous feed many; but the foolish die for want of understanding.
16679	20	10	22	 The blessing of the LORD, it maketh rich, and toil addeth nothing thereto.
16680	20	10	23	 It is as sport to a fool to do wickedness, and so is wisdom to a man of discernment.
16681	20	10	24	 The fear of the wicked, it shall come upon him; and the desire of the righteous shall be granted.
16682	20	10	25	 When the whirlwind passeth, the wicked is no more; but the righteous is an everlasting foundation.
16683	20	10	26	 As vinegar to the teeth, and as smoke to the eyes, so is the sluggard to them that send him.
16684	20	10	27	 The fear of the LORD prolongeth days; but the years of the wicked shall be shortened.
16685	20	10	28	 The hope of the righteous is gladness; but the expectation of the wicked shall perish.
16686	20	10	29	 The way of the LORD is a stronghold to the upright, but ruin to the workers of iniquity.
16687	20	10	30	 The righteous shall never be moved; but the wicked shall not inhabit the land.
16688	20	10	31	 The mouth of the righteous buddeth with wisdom; but the froward tongue shall be cut off.
16689	20	10	32	 The lips of the righteous know what is acceptable; but the mouth of the wicked is all frowardness.
16690	20	11	1	 A false balance is an abomination to the LORD; but a perfect weight is His delight.
16691	20	11	2	 When pride cometh, then cometh shame; but with the lowly is wisdom.
16692	20	11	3	 The integrity of the upright shall guide them; but the perverseness of the faithless shall destroy them.
16693	20	11	4	 Riches profit not in the day of wrath; but righteousness delivereth from death.
16694	20	11	5	 The righteousness of the sincere shall make straight his way; but the wicked shall fall by his own wickedness.
16695	20	11	6	 The righteousness of the upright shall deliver them; but the faithless shall be trapped in their own crafty device.
16696	20	11	7	 When a wicked man dieth, his expectation shall perish, and the hope of strength perisheth.
16697	20	11	8	 The righteous is delivered out of trouble, and the wicked cometh in his stead.
16698	20	11	9	 With his mouth the impious man destroyeth his neighbour; but through knowledge shall the righteous be delivered.
16699	20	11	10	 When it goeth well with the righteous, the city rejoiceth; and when the wicked perish, there is joy.
16700	20	11	11	 By the blessing of the upright a city is exalted; but it is overthrown by the mouth of the wicked.
16701	20	11	12	 He that despiseth his neighbour lacketh understanding; but a man of discernment holdeth his peace.
16702	20	11	13	 He that goeth about as a talebearer revealeth secrets; but he that is of a faithful spirit concealeth a matter.
16703	20	11	14	 Where no wise direction is, a people falleth; but in the multitude of counsellors there is safety.
16704	20	11	15	 He that is surety for a stranger shall smart for it; but he that hateth them that strike hands is secure.
16705	20	11	16	 A gracious woman obtaineth honour; and strong men obtain riches.
16706	20	11	17	 The merciful man doeth good to his own soul; but he that is cruel troubleth his own flesh.
16707	20	11	18	 The wicked earneth deceitful wages; but he that soweth righteousness hath a sure reward.
16708	20	11	19	 Stedfast righteousness tendeth to life; but he that pursueth evil pursueth it to his own death.
16709	20	11	20	 They that are perverse in heart are an abomination to the LORD; but such as are upright in their way are His delight.
16710	20	11	21	 My hand upon it! the evil man shall not be unpunished; but the seed of the righteous shall escape.
16711	20	11	22	 As a ring of gold in a swine's snout, so is a fair woman that turneth aside from discretion.

16957	20	20	2	 The terror of a king is as the roaring of a lion: he that provoketh him to anger forfeiteth his life.

16959	20	20	4	 The sluggard will not plow when winter setteth in; therefore he shall beg in harvest, and have nothing.
16960	20	20	5	 Counsel in the heart of man is like deep water; but a man of understanding will draw it out.
16961	20	20	6	 Most men will proclaim every one his own goodness; but a faithful man who can find?
16962	20	20	7	 He that walketh in his integrity as a just man, happy are his children after him.
16963	20	20	8	 A king that sitteth on the throne of judgment scattereth away all evil with his eyes.
16964	20	20	9	 Who can say: 'I have made my heart clean, I am pure from my sin'?
16965	20	20	10	 Divers weights, and divers measures, both of them alike are abomination to the LORD.
16966	20	20	11	 Even a child is known by his doings, whether his work be pure, and whether it be right.
16967	20	20	12	 The hearing ear, and the seeing eye, the LORD hath made even both of them.
16968	20	20	13	 Love not sleep, lest thou come to poverty; open thine eyes, and thou shalt have bread in plenty.
16969	20	20	14	 'It is bad, it is bad', saith the buyer; but when he is gone his way, then he boasteth.
16970	20	20	15	 There is gold, and a multitude of rubies; but the lips of knowledge are a precious jewel.
16971	20	20	16	 Take his garment that is surety for a stranger; and hold him in pledge that is surety for an alien woman.
16972	20	20	17	 Bread of falsehood is sweet to a man; but afterwards his mouth shall be filled with gravel.
16973	20	20	18	 Every purpose is established by counsel; and with good advice carry on war.
16974	20	20	19	 He that goeth about as a talebearer revealeth secrets; therefore meddle not with him that openeth wide his lips.
16975	20	20	20	 Whoso curseth his father or his mother, his lamp shall be put out in the blackest darkness.
16976	20	20	21	 An estate may be gotten hastily at the beginning; but the end thereof shall not be blessed.
16977	20	20	22	 Say not thou: 'I will requite evil'; wait for the LORD, and He will save thee.
16978	20	20	23	 Divers weights are an abomination to the LORD; and a false balance is not good.
16979	20	20	24	 A man's goings are of the LORD; how then can man look to his way?
16980	20	20	25	 It is a snare to a man rashly to say: 'Holy', and after vows to make inquiry.
16981	20	20	26	 A wise king sifteth the wicked, and turneth the wheel over them.
16982	20	20	27	 The spirit of man is the lamp of the LORD, searching all the inward parts.
16983	20	20	28	 Mercy and truth preserve the king; and his throne is upheld by mercy.
16984	20	20	29	 The glory of young men is their strength; and the beauty of old men is the hoary head.
16985	20	20	30	 Sharp wounds cleanse away evil; so do stripes that reach the inward parts.
16986	20	21	1	 The king's heart is in the hand of the LORD, as the watercourses: He turneth it whithersoever He will.
16987	20	21	2	 Every way of a man is right in his own eyes; but the LORD weigheth the hearts.
16988	20	21	3	 To do righteousness and justice is more acceptable to the LORD than sacrifice.
16989	20	21	4	 A haughty look, and a proud heart--the tillage of the wicked is sin.
16990	20	21	5	 The thoughts of the diligent tend only to plenteousness; but every one that is hasty hasteth only to want.
16991	20	21	6	 The getting of treasures by a lying tongue is a vapour driven to and fro; they that seek them seek death.
16992	20	21	7	 The violence of the wicked shall drag them away; because they refuse to do justly.
16993	20	21	8	 The way of man is froward and strange; but as for the pure, his work is right.
16994	20	21	9	 It is better to dwell in a corner of the housetop, than in a house in common with a contentious woman.
16995	20	21	10	 The soul of the wicked desireth evil; his neighbour findeth no favour in his eyes.
16996	20	21	11	 When the scorner is punished, the thoughtless is made wise; and when the wise is instructed, he receiveth knowledge.
16997	20	21	12	 The Righteous One considereth the house of the wicked; overthrowing the wicked to their ruin.
16998	20	21	13	 Whoso stoppeth his ears at the cry of the poor, he also shall cry himself, but shall not be answered.
16999	20	21	14	 A gift in secret pacifieth anger, and a present in the bosom strong wrath.
17000	20	21	15	 To do justly is joy to the righteous, but ruin to the workers of iniquity.
17001	20	21	16	 The man that strayeth out of the way of understanding shall rest in the congregation of the shades.
17002	20	21	17	 He that loveth pleasure shall be a poor man; he that loveth wine and oil shall not be rich.
17003	20	21	18	 The wicked is a ransom for the righteous; and the faithless cometh in the stead of the upright.
17004	20	21	19	 It is better to dwell in a desert land, than with a contentious and fretful woman.
17005	20	21	20	 There is desirable treasure and oil in the dwelling of the wise; but a foolish man swalloweth it up.
17006	20	21	21	 He that followeth after righteousness and mercy findeth life, prosperity, and honour.
17007	20	21	22	 A wise man scaleth the city of the mighty, and bringeth down the stronghold wherein it trusteth.
17008	20	21	23	 Whoso keepeth his mouth and his tongue keepeth his soul from troubles.
17009	20	21	24	 A proud and haughty man, scorner is his name, even he that dealeth in overbearing pride.
17010	20	21	25	 The desire of the slothful killeth him; for his hands refuse to labour.
17011	20	21	26	 There is that coveteth greedily all the day long; but the righteous giveth and spareth not.
17012	20	21	27	 The sacrifice of the wicked is an abomination; how much more, when he bringeth it with the proceeds of wickedness?
17013	20	21	28	 A false witness shall perish; but the man that obeyeth shall speak unchallenged.
17014	20	21	29	 A wicked man hardeneth his face; but as for the upright, he looketh well to his way.
17015	20	21	30	 There is no wisdom nor understanding nor counsel against the LORD.
17016	20	21	31	 The horse is prepared against the day of battle; but victory is of the LORD.
17017	20	22	1	 A good name is rather to be chosen than great riches, and loving favour rather than silver and gold.
17018	20	22	2	 The rich and the poor meet together--the LORD is the maker of them all.
17019	20	22	3	 A prudent man seeth the evil, and hideth himself; but the thoughtless pass on, and are punished.
17020	20	22	4	 The reward of humility is the fear of the LORD, even riches, and honour, and life.
17021	20	22	5	 Thorns and snares are in the way of the froward; he that keepeth his soul holdeth himself far from them.
17022	20	22	6	 Train up a child in the way he should go, and even when he is old, he will not depart from it.
17023	20	22	7	 The rich ruleth over the poor, and the borrower is servant to the lender.
17024	20	22	8	 He that soweth iniquity shall reap vanity; and the rod of his wrath shall fail.

17026	20	22	10	 Cast out the scorner, and contention will go out; yea, strife and shame will cease.
17027	20	22	11	 He that loveth pureness of heart, that hath grace in his lips, the king shall be his friend.
17028	20	22	12	 The eyes of the LORD preserve him that hath knowledge, but He overthroweth the words of the faithless man.
17029	20	22	13	 The sluggard saith: 'There is a lion without; I shall be slain in the streets.'
17030	20	22	14	 The mouth of strange women is a deep pit: he that is abhorred of the LORD shall fall therein.
17031	20	22	15	 Foolishness is bound up in the heart of a child; but the rod of correction shall drive it far from him.
17032	20	22	16	 One may oppress the poor, yet will their gain increase; one may give to the rich, yet will want come.
17033	20	22	17	 Incline thine ear, and hear the words of the wise, and apply thy heart unto my knowledge.
17034	20	22	18	 For it is a pleasant thing if thou keep them within thee; let them be established altogether upon thy lips.
17035	20	22	19	 That thy trust may be in the LORD, I have made them known to thee this day, even to thee.
17036	20	22	20	 Have not I written unto thee excellent things of counsels and knowledge;
17037	20	22	21	 That I might make thee know the certainty of the words of truth, that thou mightest bring back words of truth to them that send thee?
17038	20	22	22	 Rob not the weak, because he is weak, neither crush the poor in the gate;
17039	20	22	23	 For the LORD will plead their cause, and despoil of life those that despoil them.
17040	20	22	24	 Make no friendship with a man that is given to anger; and with a wrathful man thou shalt not go;
17041	20	22	25	 Lest thou learn his ways, and get a snare to thy soul.
17042	20	22	26	 Be thou not of them that strike hands, or of them that are sureties for debts;
17043	20	22	27	 If thou hast not wherewith to pay, why should he take away thy bed from under thee?
17044	20	22	28	 Remove not the ancient landmark, which thy fathers have set.
17045	20	22	29	 Seest thou a man diligent in his business? he shall stand before kings; he shall not stand before mean men.
17046	20	23	1	 When thou sittest to eat with a ruler, consider well him that is before thee;
17047	20	23	2	 And put a knife to thy throat, if thou be a man given to appetite.
17048	20	23	3	 Be not desirous of his dainties; seeing they are deceitful food.

17052	20	23	7	 For as one that hath reckoned within himself, so is he: 'Eat and drink', saith he to thee; but his heart is not with thee.

17063	20	23	18	 For surely there is a future; and thy hope shall not be cut off.
17064	20	23	19	 Hear thou, my son, and be wise, and guide thy heart in the way.

17068	20	23	23	 Buy the truth, and sell it not; also wisdom, and instruction, and understanding.

17070	20	23	25	 Let thy father and thy mother be glad, and let her that bore thee rejoice.
17071	20	23	26	 My son, give me thy heart, and let thine eyes observe my ways.
17072	20	23	27	 For a harlot is a deep ditch; and an alien woman is a narrow pit.
17073	20	23	28	 She also lieth in wait as a robber, and increaseth the faithless among men.
17074	20	23	29	 Who crieth: 'Woe'? who: 'Alas'? Who hath contentions? who hath raving? who hath wounds without cause? who hath redness of eyes?
17075	20	23	30	 They that tarry long at the wine; they that go to try mixed wine.
17076	20	23	31	 Look not thou upon the wine when it is red, when it giveth its colour in the cup, when it glideth down smoothly;
17077	20	23	32	 At the last it biteth like a serpent, and stingeth like a basilisk.
17078	20	23	33	 Thine eyes shall behold strange things, and thy heart shall utter confused things.
17079	20	23	34	 Yea, thou shalt be as he that lieth down in the midst of the sea, or as he that lieth upon the top of a mast.
17080	20	23	35	 'They have struck me, and I felt it not, they have beaten me, and I knew it not; when shall I awake? I will seek it yet again.'
17081	20	24	1	 Be not thou envious of evil men, neither desire to be with them.
17082	20	24	2	 For their heart studieth destruction, and their lips talk of mischief.
17083	20	24	3	 Through wisdom is a house builded; and by understanding it is established;
17084	20	24	4	 And by knowledge are the chambers filled with all precious and pleasant riches.
17085	20	24	5	 A wise man is strong; yea, a man of knowledge increaseth strength.
17086	20	24	6	 For with wise advice thou shalt make thy war; and in the multitude of counsellors there is safety.
17087	20	24	7	 Wisdom is as unattainable to a fool as corals; he openeth not his mouth in the gate.
17088	20	24	8	 He that deviseth to do evil, men shall call him a mischievous person.

17090	20	24	10	 If thou faint in the day of adversity, thy strength is small indeed.
17091	20	24	11	 Deliver them that are drawn unto death; and those that are ready to be slain wilt thou forbear to rescue?
17092	20	24	12	 If thou sayest: 'Behold, we knew not this', doth not He that weigheth the hearts consider it? And He that keepeth thy soul, doth not He know it? And shall not He render to every man according to his works?
17093	20	24	13	 My son, eat thou honey, for it is good, and the honeycomb is sweet to thy taste;
17094	20	24	14	 So know thou wisdom to be unto thy soul; if thou hast found it, then shall there be a future, and thy hope shall not be cut off.

17096	20	24	16	 For a righteous man falleth seven times, and riseth up again, but the wicked stumble under adversity.

17098	20	24	18	 Lest the LORD see it, and it displease Him, and He turn away His wrath from him.

17105	20	24	25	 But to them that decide justly shall be delight, and a good blessing shall come upon them.
17106	20	24	26	 He kisseth the lips that giveth a right answer.

17111	20	24	31	 And, lo, it was all grown over with thistles, the face thereof was covered with nettles, and the stone wall thereof was broken down.
17112	20	24	32	 Then I beheld, and considered well; I saw, and received instruction.
17113	20	24	33	 'Yet a little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of the hands to sleep'--
17114	20	24	34	 So shall thy poverty come as a runner, and thy want as an armed man.
17115	20	25	1	 These also are proverbs of Solomon, which the men of Hezekiah king of Judah copied out.
17116	20	25	2	 It is the glory of God to conceal a thing; but the glory of kings is to search out a matter.

17119	20	25	5	 Take away the wicked from before the king, and his throne shall be established in righteousness.

17122	20	25	8	 Go not forth hastily to strive, lest thou know not what to do in the end thereof, when thy neighbour hath put thee to shame.

17198	20	28	1	 The wicked flee when no man pursueth; but the righteous are secure as a young lion.
