22167	28	5	14	 For I will be unto Ephraim as a lion, and as a young lion to the house of Judah; I, even I, will tear and go away, I will take away, and there shall be none to deliver.
22168	28	5	15	 I will go and return to My place, till they acknowledge their guilt, and seek My face; in their trouble they will seek Me earnestly:
22169	28	6	1	 'Come, and let us return unto the LORD; for He hath torn, and He will heal us, He hath smitten, and He will bind us up.
22170	28	6	2	 After two days will He revive us, on the third day He will raise us up, that we may live in His presence.
22171	28	6	3	 And let us know, eagerly strive to know the LORD, His going forth is sure as the morning; and He shall come unto us as the rain, as the latter rain that watereth the earth.'
22172	28	6	4	 O Ephraim, what shall I do unto thee? O Judah, what shall I do unto thee? for your goodness is as a morning cloud, and as the dew that early passeth away.
22173	28	6	5	 Therefore have I hewed them by the prophets, I have slain them by the words of My mouth; and thy judgment goeth forth as the light.
22174	28	6	6	 For I desire mercy, and not sacrifice, and the knowledge of God rather than burnt-offerings.
22175	28	6	7	 But they like men have transgressed the covenant; there have they dealt treacherously against Me.
22176	28	6	8	 Gilead is a city of them that work iniquity, it is covered with footprints of blood.
22177	28	6	9	 And as troops of robbers wait for a man, so doth the company of priests; they murder in the way toward Shechem; yea, they commit enormity.
22178	28	6	10	 In the house of Israel I have seen a horrible thing; there harlotry is found in Ephraim, Israel is defiled.
22179	28	6	11	 Also, O Judah, there is a harvest appointed for thee! When I would turn the captivity of My people,
22180	28	7	1	 when I would heal Israel, then is the iniquity of Ephraim uncovered, and the wickedness of Samaria, for they commit falsehood; and the thief entereth in, and the troop of robbers maketh a raid without.
22181	28	7	2	 And let them not say to their heart--I remember all their wickedness; now their own doings have beset them about, they are before My face.
22182	28	7	3	 They make the king glad with their wickedness, and the princes with their lies.
22183	28	7	4	 They are all adulterers, as an oven heated by the baker, who ceaseth to stir from the kneading of the dough until it be leavened.
22184	28	7	5	 On the day of our king the princes make him sick with the heat of wine, he stretcheth out his hand with scorners.
22185	28	7	6	 For they have made ready their heart like an oven, while they lie in wait; their baker sleepeth all the night, in the morning it burneth as a flaming fire.
22186	28	7	7	 They are all hot as an oven, and devour their judges; all their kings are fallen, there is none among them that calleth unto Me.
22187	28	7	8	 Ephraim, he mixeth himself with the peoples; Ephraim is become a cake not turned.
22188	28	7	9	 Strangers have devoured his strength, and he knoweth it not; yea, gray hairs are here and there upon him, and he knoweth it not.
22189	28	7	10	 And the pride of Israel testifieth to his face; but they have not returned unto the LORD their God, nor sought Him, for all this.
22190	28	7	11	 And Ephraim is become like a silly dove, without understanding; they call unto Egypt, they go to Assyria.
22191	28	7	12	 Even as they go, I will spread My net upon them; I will bring them down as the fowls of the heaven; I will chastise them, as their congregation hath been made to hear.
22192	28	7	13	 Woe unto them! for they have strayed from Me; Destruction unto them! for they have transgressed against Me; Shall I then redeem them, seeing they have spoken lies against Me?
22193	28	7	14	 And they have not cried unto Me with their heart, though they wail upon their beds; they assemble themselves for corn and wine, they rebel against Me.
22194	28	7	15	 Though I have trained and strengthened their arms, yet do they devise evil against Me.
22195	28	7	16	 They return, but not upwards; they are become like a deceitful bow; their princes shall fall by the sword for the rage of their tongue; this shall be their derision in the land of Egypt.
22196	28	8	1	 Set the horn to thy mouth. As a vulture he cometh against the house of the LORD; because they have transgressed My covenant, and trespassed against My law.
22197	28	8	2	 Will they cry unto Me: 'My God, we Israel know Thee'?
22198	28	8	3	 Israel hath cast off that which is good; the enemy shall pursue him.
22199	28	8	4	 They have set up kings, but not from Me, they have made princes, and I knew it not; of their silver and their gold have they made them idols, that they may be cut off.
22200	28	8	5	 Thy calf, O Samaria, is cast off; Mine anger is kindled against them; how long will it be ere they attain to innocency?
22201	28	8	6	 For from Israel is even this: the craftsman made it, and it is no God; yea, the calf of Samaria shall be broken in shivers.
22202	28	8	7	 For they sow the wind, and they shall reap the whirlwind; it hath no stalk, the bud that shall yield no meal; if so be it yield, strangers shall swallow it up.
22203	28	8	8	 Israel is swallowed up; now are they become among the nations as a vessel wherein is no value.
22204	28	8	9	 For they are gone up to Assyria, like a wild ass alone by himself; Ephraim hath hired lovers.
22205	28	8	10	 Yea, though they hire among the nations, now will I gather them up; and they begin to be minished by reason of the burden of king and princes.
22206	28	8	11	 For Ephraim hath multiplied altars to sin, yea, altars have been unto him to sin.
22207	28	8	12	 Though I write for him never so many things of My Law, they are accounted as a stranger's.
22208	28	8	13	 As for the sacrifices that are made by fire unto Me, let them sacrifice flesh and eat it, for the LORD accepteth them not. Now will He remember their iniquity, and punish their sins; they shall return to Egypt.
22209	28	8	14	 For Israel hath forgotten his Maker, and builded palaces, and Judah hath multiplied fortified cities; but I will send a fire upon his cities, and it shall devour the castles thereof.
22210	28	9	1	 Rejoice not, O Israel, unto exultation, like the peoples, for thou hast gone astray from thy God, thou hast loved a harlot's hire upon every corn-floor.
22211	28	9	2	 The threshing-floor and the wine-press shall not feed them, and the new wine shall fail her.
22212	28	9	3	 They shall not dwell in the LORD'S land; but Ephraim shall return to Egypt, and they shall eat unclean food in Assyria.
22213	28	9	4	 They shall not pour out wine-offerings to the LORD, neither shall they be pleasing unto Him; their sacrifices shall be unto them as the bread of mourners, all that eat thereof shall be polluted; for their bread shall be for their appetite, it shall not come into the house of the LORD.
22214	28	9	5	 What will ye do in the day of the appointed season, and in the day of the feast of the LORD?
22215	28	9	6	 For, lo, they are gone away from destruction, yet Egypt shall gather them up, Memphis shall bury them; their precious treasures of silver, nettles shall possess them, thorns shall be in their tents.
22216	28	9	7	 The days of visitation are come, the days of recompense are come, Israel shall know it. The prophet is a fool, the man of the spirit is mad! For the multitude of thine iniquity, the enmity is great.
22217	28	9	8	 Ephraim is a watchman with my God; as for the prophet, a fowler's snare is in all his ways, and enmity in the house of his God.
22218	28	9	9	 They have deeply corrupted themselves, as in the days of Gibeah; He will remember their iniquity, He will punish their sins.
22219	28	9	10	 I found Israel like grapes in the wilderness, I saw your fathers as the first-ripe in the fig-tree at her first season; but so soon as they came to Baal-peor, they separated themselves unto the shameful thing, and became detestable like that which they loved.
22220	28	9	11	 As for Ephraim, their glory shall fly away like a bird; there shall be no birth, and none with child, and no conception.
22221	28	9	12	 Yea, though they bring up their children, yet will I bereave them, that there be not a man left; yea, woe also to them when I depart from them!
22222	28	9	13	 Ephraim, like as I have seen Tyre, is planted in a pleasant place; but Ephraim shall bring forth his children to the slayer.
22223	28	9	14	 Give them, O LORD, whatsoever Thou wilt give; give them a miscarrying womb and dry breasts.
22224	28	9	15	 All their wickedness is in Gilgal, for there I hated them; because of the wickedness of their doings I will drive them out of My house; I will love them no more, all their princes are rebellious.
22225	28	9	16	 Ephraim is smitten, their root is dried up, they shall bear no fruit; yea, though they bring forth, yet will I slay the beloved fruit of their womb.
22226	28	9	17	 My God will cast them away, because they did not hearken unto Him; and they shall be wanderers among the nations.
22227	28	10	1	 Israel was a luxuriant vine, which put forth fruit freely: as his fruit increased, he increased his altars; the more goodly his land was, the more goodly were his pillars.
22228	28	10	2	 Their heart is divided; now shall they bear their guilt; He will break down their altars, He will spoil their pillars.
22229	28	10	3	 Surely now shall they say: 'We have no king; for we feared not the LORD; and the king, what can he do for us?'
22230	28	10	4	 They speak words, they swear falsely, they make covenants; thus judgment springeth up as hemlock in the furrows of the field.
22231	28	10	5	 The inhabitants of Samaria shall be in dread for the calves of Beth-aven; for the people thereof shall mourn over it, and the priests thereof shall tremble for it, for its glory, because it is departed from it.
22232	28	10	6	 It also shall be carried unto Assyria, for a present to King Contentious; Ephraim shall receive shame, and Israel shall be ashamed of his own counsel.
22233	28	10	7	 As for Samaria, her king is cut off, as foam upon the water.
22234	28	10	8	 The high places also of Aven shall be destroyed, even the sin of Israel. The thorn and the thistle shall come up on their altars; and they shall say to the mountains: 'Cover us', and to the hills: 'Fall on us.'
22235	28	10	9	 From the days of Gibeah thou hast sinned, O Israel; there they stood; no battle was to overtake them in Gibeah, nor the children of arrogancy.
22236	28	10	10	 When it is My desire, I will chastise them; and the peoples shall be gathered against them, when they are yoked to their two rings.
22237	28	10	11	 And Ephraim is a heifer well broken, that loveth to thresh, and I have passed over upon her fair neck; I will make Ephraim to ride, Judah shall plow, Jacob shall break his clods.
22238	28	10	12	 Sow to yourselves according to righteousness, reap according to mercy, break up your fallow ground; for it is time to seek the LORD, till He come and cause righteousness to rain upon you.
22239	28	10	13	 Ye have plowed wickedness, ye have reaped iniquity, ye have eaten the fruit of lies; for thou didst trust in thy way, in the multitude of thy mighty men.
22240	28	10	14	 Therefore shall a tumult arise among thy hosts, and all thy fortresses shall be spoiled, as Shalman spoiled Beth-arbel in the day of battle; the mother was dashed in pieces with her children.
22241	28	10	15	 So hath Beth-el done unto you because of your great wickedness; at daybreak is the king of Israel utterly cut off.
22242	28	11	1	 When Israel was a child, then I loved him, and out of Egypt I called My son.
22243	28	11	2	 The more they called them, the more they went from them; they sacrificed unto the Baalim, and offered to graven images.
22244	28	11	3	 And I, I taught Ephraim to walk, taking them by their arms; but they knew not that I healed them.
22245	28	11	4	 I drew them with cords of a man, with bands of love; and I was to them as they that take off the yoke on their jaws, and I fed them gently.
22246	28	11	5	 He shall not return into the land of Egypt, but the Assyrian shall be his king, because they refused to return.
22247	28	11	6	 And the sword shall fall upon his cities, and shall consume his bars, and devour them, because of their own counsels.
22248	28	11	7	 And My people are in suspense about returning to Me; and though they call them upwards, none at all will lift himself up.
22249	28	11	8	 How shall I give thee up, Ephraim? How shall I surrender thee, Israel? How shall I make thee as Admah? How shall I set thee as Zeboim? My heart is turned within Me, My compassions are kindled together.
22250	28	11	9	 I will not execute the fierceness of Mine anger, I will not return to destroy Ephraim; for I am God, and not man, the Holy One in the midst of thee; and I will not come in fury.
22251	28	11	10	 They shall walk after the LORD, who shall roar like a lion; for He shall roar, and the children shall come trembling from the west.
22252	28	11	11	 They shall come trembling as a bird out of Egypt, and as a dove out of the land of Assyria; and I will make them to dwell in their houses, saith the LORD.
22253	28	11	12	 (12:1) Ephraim compasseth Me about with lies, and the house of Israel with deceit; and Judah is yet wayward towards God, and towards the Holy One who is faithful.
22254	28	12	1	 (12:2) Ephraim striveth after wind, and followeth after the east wind; all the day he multiplieth lies and desolation; and they make a covenant with Assyria, and oil is carried into Egypt.
22255	28	12	2	 (12:3) The LORD hath also a controversy with Judah, and will punish Jacob according to his ways, according to his doings will He recompense him.
22256	28	12	3	 (12:4) In the womb he took his brother by the heel, and by his strength he strove with a godlike being;
22257	28	12	4	 (12:5) So he strove with an angel, and prevailed; he wept, and made supplication unto him; at Beth-el he would find him, and there he would speak with us;
22258	28	12	5	 (12:6) But the LORD, the God of hosts, the LORD is His name.
22259	28	12	6	 (12:7) Therefore turn thou to thy God; keep mercy and justice, and wait for thy God continually.
22260	28	12	7	 (12:8) As for the trafficker, the balances of deceit are in his hand. He loveth to oppress.
22261	28	12	8	 (12:9) And Ephraim said: 'Surely I am become rich, I have found me wealth; in all my labours they shall find in me no iniquity that were sin.'
22262	28	12	9	 (12:10) But I am the LORD thy God from the land of Egypt; I will yet again make thee to dwell in tents, as in the days of the appointed season.
22263	28	12	10	 (12:11) I have also spoken unto the prophets, and I have multiplied visions; and by the ministry of the prophets have I used similitudes.
22264	28	12	11	 (12:12) If Gilead be given to iniquity becoming altogether vanity, in Gilgal they sacrifice unto bullocks; yea, their altars shall be as heaps in the furrows of the field.
22265	28	12	12	 (12:13) And Jacob fled into the field of Aram, and Israel served for a wife, and for a wife he kept sheep.
22266	28	12	13	 (12:14) And by a prophet the LORD brought Israel up out of Egypt, and by a prophet was he kept.
22267	28	12	14	 (12:15) Ephraim hath provoked most bitterly; therefore shall his blood be cast upon him, and his reproach shall his Lord return unto him.
22268	28	13	1	 When Ephraim spoke, there was trembling, he exalted himself in Israel; but when he became guilty through Baal, he died.
22269	28	13	2	 And now they sin more and more, and have made them molten images of their silver, according to their own understanding, even idols, all of them the work of the craftsmen; of them they say: 'They that sacrifice men kiss calves.'
22270	28	13	3	 Therefore they shall be as the morning cloud, and as the dew that early passeth away, as the chaff that is driven with the wind out of the threshing-floor, and as the smoke out of the window.
22271	28	13	4	 Yet I am the LORD thy God from the land of Egypt; and thou knowest no God but Me, and beside Me there is no saviour.
22272	28	13	5	 I did know thee in the wilderness, in the land of great drought.
22273	28	13	6	 When they were fed, they became full, they were filled, and their heart was exalted; therefore have they forgotten Me.
22274	28	13	7	 Therefore am I become unto them as a lion; as a leopard will I watch by the way;
22275	28	13	8	 I will meet them as a bear that is bereaved of her whelps, and will rend the enclosure of their heart; and there will I devour them like a lioness; the wild beast shall tear them.
22276	28	13	9	 It is thy destruction, O Israel, that thou art against Me, against thy help.
22277	28	13	10	 Ho, now, thy king, that he may save thee in all thy cities! and thy judges, of whom thou saidst: 'Give me a king and princes!'
22278	28	13	11	 I give thee a king in Mine anger, and take him away in My wrath.
22279	28	13	12	 The iniquity of Ephraim is bound up; his sin is laid up in store.
22280	28	13	13	 The throes of a travailing woman shall come upon him; he is an unwise son; for it is time he should not tarry in the place of the breaking forth of children.
22281	28	13	14	 Shall I ransom them from the power of the nether-world? Shall I redeem them from death? Ho, thy plagues, O death! Ho, thy destruction, O netherworld! Repentance be hid from Mine eyes!
22282	28	13	15	 For though he be fruitful among the reed-plants, an east wind shall come, the wind of the LORD coming up from the wilderness, and his spring shall become dry, and his fountain shall be dried up; he shall spoil the treasure of all precious vessels.
22283	28	13	16	 (14:1) Samaria shall bear her guilt, for she hath rebelled against her God; they shall fall by the sword; their infants shall be dashed in pieces, and their women with child shall be ripped up.
22284	28	14	1	 (14:2) Return, O Israel, unto the LORD thy God; for thou hast stumbled in thine iniquity.
22285	28	14	2	 (14:3) Take with you words, and return unto the LORD; say unto Him: 'Forgive all iniquity, and accept that which is good; so will we render for bullocks the offering of our lips.
22286	28	14	3	 (14:4) Asshur shall not save us; we will not ride upon horses; neither will we call any more the work of our hands our gods; for in Thee the fatherless findeth mercy.'
22287	28	14	4	 (14:5) I will heal their backsliding, I will love them freely; for Mine anger is turned away from him.
22288	28	14	5	 (14:6) I will be as the dew unto Israel; he shall blossom as the lily, and cast forth his roots as Lebanon.
22289	28	14	6	 (14:7) His branches shall spread, and his beauty shall be as the olive-tree, and his fragrance as Lebanon.
22290	28	14	7	 (14:8) They that dwell under his shadow shall again make corn to grow, and shall blossom as the vine; the scent thereof shall be as the wine of Lebanon.
22291	28	14	8	 (14:9) Ephraim shall say: 'What have I to do any more with idols?' As for Me, I respond and look on him; I am like a leafy cypress-tree; from Me is thy fruit found.
22292	28	14	9	 (14:10) Whoso is wise, let him understand these things, whoso is prudent, let him know them. For the ways of the LORD are right, and the just do walk in them; but transgressors do stumble therein.
22293	29	1	1	 THE WORD of the LORD that came to Joel the son of Pethuel.
22294	29	1	2	 Hear this, ye old men, and give ear, all ye inhabitants of the land. Hath this been in your days, or in the days of your fathers?
22295	29	1	3	 Tell ye your children of it, and let your children tell their children, and their children another generation.
22296	29	1	4	 That which the palmer-worm hath left hath the locust eaten; and that which the locust hath left hath the canker-worm eaten; and that which the canker-worm hath left hath the caterpiller eaten.
22297	29	1	5	 Awake, ye drunkards, and weep, and wail, all ye drinkers of wine, because of the sweet wine, for it is cut off from your mouth.
22298	29	1	6	 For a people is come up upon my land, mighty, and without number; his teeth are the teeth of a lion, and he hath the jaw-teeth of a lioness.
22299	29	1	7	 He hath laid my vine waste, and blasted my fig-tree; he hath made it clean bare, and cast it down, the branches thereof are made white.
22300	29	1	8	 Lament like a virgin girded with sackcloth for the husband of her youth.
22301	29	1	9	 The meal-offering and the drink-offering is cut off from the house of the LORD; the priests mourn, even the LORD'S ministers.
22302	29	1	10	 The field is wasted, the land mourneth; for the corn is wasted, the new wine is dried up, the oil languisheth.
22303	29	1	11	 Be ashamed, O ye husbandmen, wail, O ye vinedressers, for the wheat and for the barley; because the harvest of the field is perished.
22304	29	1	12	 The vine is withered, and the fig-tree languisheth; the pomegranate-tree, the palm-tree also, and the apple-tree, even all the trees of the field, are withered; for joy is withered away from the sons of men.
22305	29	1	13	 Gird yourselves, and lament, ye priests, wail, ye ministers of the altar; come, lie all night in sackcloth, ye ministers of my God; for the meal-offering and the drink-offering is withholden from the house of your God.
22306	29	1	14	 Sanctify ye a fast, call a solemn assembly, gather the elders and all the inhabitants of the land unto the house of the LORD your God, and cry unto the LORD.
22307	29	1	15	 Alas for the day! for the day of the LORD is at hand, and as a destruction from the Almighty shall it come.
22308	29	1	16	 Is not the food cut off before our eyes, yea, joy and gladness from the house of our God?
22309	29	1	17	 The grains shrivel under their hoes; the garners are laid desolate, the barns are broken down; for the corn is withered.
22310	29	1	18	 How do the beasts groan! the herds of cattle are perplexed, because they have no pasture; yea, the flocks of sheep are made desolate.
22311	29	1	19	 Unto Thee, O LORD, do I cry; for the fire hath devoured the pastures of the wilderness, and the flame hath set ablaze all the trees of the field.
22312	29	1	20	 Yea, the beasts of the field pant unto Thee; for the water brooks are dried up, and the fire hath devoured the pastures of the wilderness.
22313	29	2	1	 Blow ye the horn in Zion, and sound an alarm in My holy mountain; let all the inhabitants of the land tremble; for the day of the LORD cometh, for it is at hand;
22314	29	2	2	 A day of darkness and gloominess, a day of clouds and thick darkness, as blackness spread upon the mountains; a great people and a mighty, there hath not been ever the like, neither shall be any more after them, even to the years of many generations.
22315	29	2	3	 A fire devoureth before them, and behind them a flame blazeth; the land is as the garden of Eden before them, and behind them a desolate wilderness; yea, and nothing escapeth them.
22316	29	2	4	 The appearance of them is as the appearance of horses; and as horsemen, so do they run.
22317	29	2	5	 Like the noise of chariots, on the tops of the mountains do they leap, like the noise of a flame of fire that devoureth the stubble, as a mighty people set in battle array.
22318	29	2	6	 At their presence the peoples are in anguish; all faces have gathered blackness.
22319	29	2	7	 They run like mighty men, they climb the wall like men of war; and they move on every one in his ways, and they entangle not their paths.
22320	29	2	8	 Neither doth one thrust another, they march every one in his highway; and they break through the weapons, and suffer no harm.
22321	29	2	9	 They leap upon the city, they run upon the wall, they climb up into the houses; they enter in at the windows like a thief.
22322	29	2	10	 Before them the earth quaketh, the heavens tremble; the sun and the moon are become black, and the stars withdraw their shining.
22323	29	2	11	 And the LORD uttereth His voice before His army; for His camp is very great, for he is mighty that executeth His word; for great is the day of the LORD and very terrible; and who can abide it?
22324	29	2	12	 Yet even now, saith the LORD, turn ye unto Me with all your heart, and with fasting, and with weeping, and with lamentation;
22325	29	2	13	 And rend your heart, and not your garments, and turn unto the LORD your God; for He is gracious and compassionate, long-suffering, and abundant in mercy, and repenteth Him of the evil.
22326	29	2	14	 Who knoweth whether He will not turn and repent, and leave a blessing behind Him, even a meal-offering and a drink-offering unto the LORD your God?
22327	29	2	15	 Blow the horn in Zion, sanctify a fast, call a solemn assembly;
22328	29	2	16	 Gather the people, sanctify the congregation, assemble the elders, gather the children, and those that suck the breasts; let the bridegroom go forth from his chamber, and the bride out of her pavilion.
22329	29	2	17	 Let the priests, the ministers of the LORD, weep between the porch and the altar, and let them say: 'Spare thy people, O LORD, and give not Thy heritage to reproach, that the nations should make them a byword: wherefore should they say among the peoples: Where is their God?'
22330	29	2	18	 Then was the LORD jealous for His land, and had pity on His people.
22331	29	2	19	 And the LORD answered and said unto His people: 'Behold, I will send you corn, and wine, and oil, and ye shall be satisfied therewith; and I will no more make you a reproach among the nations;
22332	29	2	20	 But I will remove far off from you the northern one, and will drive him into a land barren and desolate, with his face toward the eastern sea, and his hinder part toward the western sea; that his foulness may come up, and his ill savour may come up, because he hath done great things.'
22333	29	2	21	 Fear not, O land, be glad and rejoice; for the LORD hath done great things.
22334	29	2	22	 Be not afraid, ye beasts of the field; for the pastures of the wilderness do spring, for the tree beareth its fruit, the fig-tree and the vine do yield their strength.
22335	29	2	23	 Be glad then, ye children of Zion, and rejoice in the LORD your God; for He giveth you the former rain in just measure, and He causeth to come down for you the rain, the former rain and the latter rain, at the first.
22336	29	2	24	 And the floors shall be full of corn, and the vats shall overflow with wine and oil.
22337	29	2	25	 And I will restore to you the years that the locust hath eaten, the canker-worm, and the caterpiller, and the palmer-worm, My great army which I sent among you.
22338	29	2	26	 And ye shall eat in plenty and be satisfied, and shall praise the name of the LORD your God, that hath dealt wondrously with you; and My people shall never be ashamed.
22339	29	2	27	 And ye shall know that I am in the midst of Israel, and that I am the LORD your God, and there is none else; and My people shall never be ashamed.
22340	29	2	28	 (3:1) And it shall come to pass afterward, that I will pour out My spirit upon all flesh; and your sons and your daughters shall prophesy, your old men shall dream dreams, your young men shall see visions;
22341	29	2	29	 (3:2) And also upon the servants and upon the handmaids in those days will I pour out My spirit.
22342	29	2	30	 (3:3) And I will shew wonders in the heavens and in the earth, blood, and fire, and pillars of smoke.
22343	29	2	31	 (3:4) The sun shall be turned into darkness, and the moon into blood, before the great and terrible day of the LORD come.
22344	29	2	32	 (3:5) And it shall come to pass, that whosoever shall call on the name of the LORD shall be delivered; for in mount Zion and in Jerusalem there shall be those that escape, as the LORD hath said, and among the remnant those whom the LORD shall call.
22345	29	3	1	 (4:1) For, behold, in those days, and in that time, when I shall bring back the captivity of Judah and Jerusalem,
22346	29	3	2	 (4:2) I will gather all nations, and will bring them down into the valley of Jehoshaphat; and I will enter into judgment with them there for My people and for My heritage Israel, whom they have scattered among the nations, and divided My land.
22347	29	3	3	 (4:3) And they have cast lots for My people; and have given a boy for an harlot, and sold a girl for wine, and have drunk.
22348	29	3	4	 (4:4) And also what are ye to Me, O Tyre, and Zidon, and all the regions of Philistia? will ye render retribution on My behalf? and if ye render retribution on My behalf, swiftly, speedily will I return your retribution upon your own head.
22349	29	3	5	 (4:5) Forasmuch as ye have taken My silver and My gold, and have carried into your temples My goodly treasures;
22350	29	3	6	 (4:6) the children also of Judah and the children of Jerusalem have ye sold unto the sons of Jevanim, that ye might remove them far from their border;
22351	29	3	7	 (4:7) behold, I will stir them up out of the place whither ye have sold them, and will return your retribution upon your own head;
22352	29	3	8	 (4:8) and I will sell your sons and your daughters into the hand of the children of Judah, and they shall sell them to the men of Sheba, to a nation far off; for the LORD hath spoken.
22353	29	3	9	 (4:9) Proclaim ye this among the nations, prepare war; stir up the mighty men; let all the men of war draw near, let them come up.
22354	29	3	10	 (4:10) Beat your plowshares into swords, and your pruning-hooks into spears; let the weak say: 'I am strong.'
22355	29	3	11	 (4:11) Haste ye, and come, all ye nations round about, and gather yourselves together; thither cause Thy mighty ones to come down, O LORD!
22356	29	3	12	 (4:12) Let the nations be stirred up, and come up to the valley of Jehoshaphat; for there will I sit to judge all the nations round about.
22357	29	3	13	 (4:13) Put ye in the sickle, for the harvest is ripe; come, tread ye, for the winepress is full, the vats overflow; for their wickedness is great.
22358	29	3	14	 (4:14) Multitudes, multitudes in the valley of decision! For the day of the LORD is near in the valley of decision.
22359	29	3	15	 (4:15) The sun and the moon are become black, and the stars withdraw their shining.
22360	29	3	16	 (4:16) And the LORD shall roar from Zion, and utter His voice from Jerusalem, and the heavens and the earth shall shake; but the LORD will be a refuge unto His people, and a stronghold to the children of Israel.
22361	29	3	17	 (4:17) So shall ye know that I am the LORD your God, dwelling in Zion My holy mountain; then shall Jerusalem be holy, and there shall no strangers pass through her any more.
22362	29	3	18	 (4:18) And it shall come to pass in that day, that the mountains shall drop down sweet wine, and the hills shall flow with milk, and all the brooks of Judah shall flow with waters; and a fountain shall come forth of the house of the LORD, and shall water the valley of Shittim.
22363	29	3	19	 (4:19) Egypt shall be a desolation, and Edom shall be a desolate wilderness, for the violence against the children of Judah, because they have shed innocent blood in their land.
22364	29	3	20	 (4:20) But Judah shall be inhabited for ever, and Jerusalem from generation to generation.
22365	29	3	21	 (4:21) And I will hold as innocent their blood that I have not held as innocent; and the LORD dwelleth in Zion.
22366	30	1	1	 THE WORDS of Amos, who was among the herdmen of Tekoa, which he saw concerning Israel in the days of Uzziah king of Judah, and in the days of Jeroboam the son of Joash king of Israel, two years before the earthquake.
22367	30	1	2	 And he said: the LORD roareth from Zion, and uttereth His voice from Jerusalem; and the pastures of the shepherds shall mourn, and the top of Carmel shall wither.
22368	30	1	3	 For thus saith the LORD: For three transgressions of Damascus, yea, for four, I will not reverse it: because they have threshed Gilead with sledges of iron.
22369	30	1	4	 So will I send a fire into the house of Hazael, and it shall devour the palaces of Ben-hadad;
22370	30	1	5	 And I will break the bar of Damascus, and cut off the inhabitant from Bikath-Aven, and him that holdeth the sceptre from Beth-eden; and the people of Aram shall go into captivity unto Kir, saith the LORD.
22371	30	1	6	 Thus saith the LORD: For three transgressions of Gaza, yea, for four, I will not reverse it: because they carried away captive a whole captivity, to deliver them up to Edom.
22372	30	1	7	 So will I send a fire on the wall of Gaza, and it shall devour the palaces thereof;
22373	30	1	8	 And I will cut off the inhabitant from Ashdod, and him that holdeth the sceptre from Ashkelon; and I will turn My hand against Ekron, and the remnant of the Philistines shall perish, saith the Lord GOD.
22374	30	1	9	 Thus saith the LORD: For three transgressions of Tyre, yea, for four, I will not reverse it: because they delivered up a whole captivity to Edom, and remembered not the brotherly covenant.
22375	30	1	10	 So will I send a fire on the wall of Tyre, and it shall devour the palaces thereof.
22376	30	1	11	 Thus saith the LORD: For three transgressions of Edom, yea, for four, I will not reverse it: because he did pursue his brother with the sword, and did cast off all pity, and his anger did tear perpetually, and he kept his wrath for ever.
22377	30	1	12	 So will I send a fire upon Teman, and it shall devour the palaces of Bozrah.
22378	30	1	13	 Thus saith the LORD: For three transgressions of the children of Ammon, yea, for four, I will not reverse it: because they have ripped up the women with child of Gilead, that they might enlarge their border.
22379	30	1	14	 So will I kindle a fire in the wall of Rabbah, and it shall devour the palaces thereof, with shouting in the day of battle, with a tempest in the day of the whirlwind;
22380	30	1	15	 And their king shall go into captivity, he and his princes together, saith the LORD.
22381	30	2	1	 Thus saith the LORD: For three transgressions of Moab, yea, for four, I will not reverse it: because he burned the bones of the king of Edom into lime.
22382	30	2	2	 So will I send a fire upon Moab, and it shall devour the palaces of Kerioth; and Moab shall die with tumult, with shouting, and with the sound of the horn;
22383	30	2	3	 And I will cut off the judge from the midst thereof, and will slay all the princes thereof with him, saith the LORD.
22384	30	2	4	 Thus saith the LORD: For three transgressions of Judah, yea, for four, I will not reverse it: because they have rejected the law of the LORD, and have not kept His statutes, and their lies have caused them to err, after which their fathers did walk.
22385	30	2	5	 So will I send a fire upon Judah, and it shall devour the palaces of Jerusalem.
22386	30	2	6	 Thus saith the LORD: For three transgressions of Israel, yea, for four, I will not reverse it: because they sell the righteous for silver, and the needy for a pair of shoes;
22387	30	2	7	 That pant after the dust of the earth on the head of the poor, and turn aside the way of the humble; and a man and his father go unto the same maid, to profane My holy name;
22388	30	2	8	 And they lay themselves down beside every altar upon clothes taken in pledge, and in the house of their God they drink the wine of them that have been fined.
22389	30	2	9	 Yet destroyed I the Amorite before them, whose height was like the height of the cedars, and he was strong as the oaks; yet I destroyed his fruit from above, and his roots from beneath.
22390	30	2	10	 Also I brought you up out of the land of Egypt, and led you forty years in the wilderness, to possess the land of the Amorites.
22391	30	2	11	 And I raised up of your sons for prophets, and of your young men for Nazirites. Is it not even thus, O ye children of Israel? saith the LORD.
22392	30	2	12	 But ye gave the Nazirites wine to drink; and commanded the prophets, saying: 'Prophesy not.'
22393	30	2	13	 Behold, I will make it creak under you, as a cart creaketh that is full of sheaves.
22394	30	2	14	 And flight shall fail the swift, and the strong shall not exert his strength, neither shall the mighty deliver himself;
22395	30	2	15	 Neither shall he stand that handleth the bow; and he that is swift of foot shall not deliver himself; neither shall he that rideth the horse deliver himself;
22396	30	2	16	 And he that is courageous among the mighty shall flee away naked in that day, saith the LORD.
22397	30	3	1	 Hear this word that the LORD hath spoken against you, O children of Israel, against the whole family which I brought up out of the land of Egypt, saying:
22398	30	3	2	 You only have I known of all the families of the earth; therefore I will visit upon you all your iniquities.
22399	30	3	3	 Will two walk together, except they have agreed?
22400	30	3	4	 Will a lion roar in the forest, when he hath no prey? Will a young lion give forth his voice out of his den, if he have taken nothing?
22401	30	3	5	 Will a bird fall in a snare upon the earth, where there is no lure for it? Will a snare spring up from the ground, and have taken nothing at all?
22402	30	3	6	 Shall the horn be blown in a city, and the people not tremble? Shall evil befall a city, and the LORD hath not done it?
22403	30	3	7	 For the Lord GOD will do nothing, but He revealeth His counsel unto His servants the prophets.
22404	30	3	8	 The lion hath roared, who will not fear? The Lord GOD hath spoken, who can but prophesy?
22405	30	3	9	 Proclaim it upon the palaces at Ashdod, and upon the palaces in the land of Egypt, and say: 'Assemble yourselves upon the mountains of Samaria, and behold the great confusions therein, and the oppressions in the midst thereof.'
22406	30	3	10	 For they know not to do right, saith the LORD, who store up violence and robbery in their palaces.
22407	30	3	11	 Therefore thus saith the Lord GOD: An adversary, even round about the land! And he shall bring down thy strength from thee, and thy palaces shall be spoiled.
22408	30	3	12	 Thus saith the LORD: As the shepherd rescueth out of the mouth of the lion two legs, or a piece of an ear, so shall the children of Israel that dwell in Samaria escape with the corner of a couch, and the leg of a bed.
22409	30	3	13	 Hear ye, and testify against the house of Jacob, saith the Lord GOD, the God of hosts.
22410	30	3	14	 For in the day that I shall visit the transgressions of Israel upon him, I will also punish the altars of Beth-el, and the horns of the altar shall be cut off, and fall to the ground.
22411	30	3	15	 And I will smite the winter-house with the summer-house; and the houses of ivory shall perish, and the great houses shall have an end, saith the LORD.
22412	30	4	1	 Hear this word, ye kine of Bashan, that are in the mountain of Samaria, that oppress the poor, that crush the needy, that say unto their lords: 'Bring, that we may feast.'
22413	30	4	2	 The Lord GOD hath sworn by His holiness: Lo, surely the days shall come upon you, that ye shall be taken away with hooks, and your residue with fish-hooks.
22414	30	4	3	 And ye shall go out at the breaches, every one straight before her; and ye shall be cast into Harmon, saith the LORD.
22415	30	4	4	 Come to Beth-el, and transgress, to Gilgal, and multiply transgression; and bring your sacrifices in the morning, and your tithes after three days;
22416	30	4	5	 And offer a sacrifice of thanksgiving of that which is leavened, and proclaim freewill-offerings and publish them; for so ye love to do, O ye children of Israel, saith the Lord GOD.
22417	30	4	6	 And I also have given you cleanness of teeth in all your cities, and want of bread in all your places; yet have ye not returned unto Me, saith the LORD.
22418	30	4	7	 And I also have withholden the rain from you, when there were yet three months to the harvest; and I caused it to rain upon one city, and caused it not to rain upon another city; one piece was rained upon, and the piece whereupon it rained not withered.
22419	30	4	8	 So two or three cities wandered unto one city to drink water, and were not satisfied; yet have ye not returned unto Me, saith the LORD.
22420	30	4	9	 I have smitten you with blasting and mildew; the multitude of your gardens and your vineyards and your fig-trees and your olive-trees hath the palmer-worm devoured; yet have ye not returned unto Me, saith the LORD.
22421	30	4	10	 I have sent among you the pestilence in the way of Egypt; your young men have I slain with the sword, and have carried away your horses; and I have made the stench of your camp to come up even into your nostrils; yet have ye not returned unto Me, saith the LORD.
22422	30	4	11	 I have overthrown some of you, as God overthrew Sodom and Gomorrah, and ye were as a brand plucked out of the burning; yet have ye not returned unto Me, saith the LORD.
22423	30	4	12	 Therefore thus will I do unto thee, O Israel; because I will do this unto thee, prepare to meet thy God, O Israel.
22424	30	4	13	 For, lo, He that formeth the mountains, and createth the wind, and declareth unto man what is his thought, that maketh the morning darkness, and treadeth upon the high places of the earth; the LORD, the God of hosts, is His name.
22425	30	5	1	 Hear ye this word which I take up for a lamentation over you, O house of Israel:
22426	30	5	2	 The virgin of Israel is fallen, she shall no more rise; she is cast down upon her land, there is none to raise her up.
22427	30	5	3	 For thus saith the Lord GOD: The city that went forth a thousand shall have a hundred left, and that which went forth a hundred shall have ten left, of the house of Israel.
22428	30	5	4	 For thus saith the LORD unto the house of Israel: Seek ye Me, and live;
22429	30	5	5	 But seek not Beth-el, nor enter into Gilgal, and pass not to Beer-sheba; for Gilgal shall surely go into captivity, and Beth-el shall come to nought.
22430	30	5	6	 Seek the LORD, and live--lest He break out like fire in the house of Joseph, and it devour, and there be none to quench it in Bethel--
22431	30	5	7	 Ye who turn judgment to wormwood, and cast righteousness to the ground;
22432	30	5	8	 Him that maketh the Pleiades and Orion, and bringeth on the shadow of death in the morning, and darkeneth the day into night; that calleth for the waters of the sea, and poureth them out upon the face of the earth; the LORD is His name;
22433	30	5	9	 That causeth destruction to flash upon the strong, so that destruction cometh upon the fortress.
22434	30	5	10	 They hate him that reproveth in the gate, and they abhor him that speaketh uprightly.
22435	30	5	11	 Therefore, because ye trample upon the poor, and take from him exactions of wheat; ye have built houses of hewn stone, but ye shall not dwell in them, ye have planted pleasant vineyards, but ye shall not drink wine thereof.
22436	30	5	12	 For I know how manifold are your transgressions, and how mighty are your sins; ye that afflict the just, that take a ransom, and that turn aside the needy in the gate.
22437	30	5	13	 Therefore the prudent doth keep silence in such a time; for it is an evil time.
22438	30	5	14	 Seek good, and not evil, that ye may live; and so the LORD, the God of hosts, will be with you, as ye say.
22439	30	5	15	 Hate the evil, and love the good, and establish justice in the gate; it may be that the LORD, the God of hosts, will be gracious unto the remnant of Joseph.
22440	30	5	16	 Therefore thus saith the LORD, the God of hosts, the Lord: Lamentation shall be in all the broad places, and they shall say in all the streets: 'Alas! alas!' and they shall call the husbandman to mourning, and proclaim lamentation to such as are skilful of wailing.
22441	30	5	17	 And in all vineyards shall be lamentation; for I will pass through the midst of thee, saith the LORD.
22442	30	5	18	 Woe unto you that desire the day of the LORD! Wherefore would ye have the day of the LORD? It is darkness, and not light.
22443	30	5	19	 As if a man did flee from a lion, and a bear met him; and went into the house and leaned his hand on the wall, and a serpent bit him.
22444	30	5	20	 Shall not the day of the LORD be darkness, and not light? Even very dark, and no brightness in it?
22445	30	5	21	 I hate, I despise your feasts, and I will take no delight in your solemn assemblies.
22446	30	5	22	 Yea, though ye offer me burnt-offerings and your meal-offerings, I will not accept them; neither will I regard the peace-offerings of your fat beasts.
22447	30	5	23	 Take thou away from Me the noise of thy songs; and let Me not hear the melody of thy psalteries.
22448	30	5	24	 But let justice well up as waters, and righteousness as a mighty stream.
22449	30	5	25	 Did ye bring unto Me sacrifices and offerings in the wilderness forty years, O house of Israel?
22450	30	5	26	 So shall ye take up Siccuth your king and Chiun your images, the star of your god, which ye made to yourselves.
22451	30	5	27	 Therefore will I cause you to go into captivity beyond Damascus, saith He, whose name is the LORD God of hosts.
22452	30	6	1	 Woe to them that are at ease in Zion, and to them that are secure in the mountain of Samaria, the notable men of the first of the nations, to whom the house of Israel come!
22453	30	6	2	 Pass ye unto Calneh, and see, and from thence go ye to Hamath the great; then go down to Gath of the Philistines; are they better than these kingdoms? or is their border greater than your border?
22454	30	6	3	 Ye that put far away the evil day, and cause the seat of violence to come near;
22455	30	6	4	 That lie upon beds of ivory, and stretch themselves upon their couches, and eat the lambs out of the flock, and the calves out of the midst of the stall;
22456	30	6	5	 That thrum on the psaltery, that devise for themselves instruments of music, like David;
22457	30	6	6	 That drink wine in bowls, and anoint themselves with the chief ointments; but they are not grieved for the hurt of Joseph.
22458	30	6	7	 Therefore now shall they go captive at the head of them that go captive, and the revelry of them that stretched themselves shall pass away.
22459	30	6	8	 The Lord GOD hath sworn by Himself, saith the LORD, the God of hosts: I abhor the pride of Jacob, and hate his palaces; and I will deliver up the city with all that is therein.
22460	30	6	9	 And it shall come to pass, if there remain ten men in one house, that they shall die.
22461	30	6	10	 And when a man's uncle shall take him up, even he that burneth him, to bring out the bones out of the house, and shall say unto him that is in the innermost parts of the house: 'Is there yet any with thee?' and he shall say: 'No'; then shall he say: 'Hold thy peace; for we must not make mention of the name of the LORD.'
22462	30	6	11	 For, behold, the LORD commandeth, and the great house shall be smitten into splinters, and the little house into chips.
22463	30	6	12	 Do horses run upon the rocks? Doth one plow there with oxen? that ye have turned justice into gall, and the fruit of righteousness into wormwood;
22464	30	6	13	 Ye that rejoice in a thing of nought, that say: 'Have we not taken to us horns by our own strength?'
22465	30	6	14	 For, behold, I will raise up against you a nation, O house of Israel, saith the LORD, the God of hosts; and they shall afflict you from the entrance of Hamath unto the Brook of the Arabah.
22466	30	7	1	 Thus the Lord GOD showed me; and, behold, He formed locusts in the beginning of the shooting up of the latter growth; and, lo, it was the latter growth after the king's mowings.
22467	30	7	2	 And if it had come to pass, that when they had made an end of eating the grass of the land--so I said: O Lord GOD, forgive, I beseech Thee; how shall Jacob stand? for he is small.
22468	30	7	3	 The LORD repented concerning this; 'It shall not be', saith the LORD.
22469	30	7	4	 Thus the Lord GOD showed me; and, behold, the Lord GOD called to contend by fire; and it devoured the great deep, and would have eaten up the land.
22470	30	7	5	 Then said I: O Lord GOD, cease, I beseech Thee; how shall Jacob stand? for he is small.
22471	30	7	6	 The LORD repented concerning this; 'This also shall not be', saith the Lord GOD.
22472	30	7	7	 Thus He showed me; and, behold, the Lord stood beside a wall made by a plumbline, with a plumbline in His hand.

22474	30	7	9	 And the high places of Isaac shall be desolate, and the sanctuaries of Israel shall be laid waste; and I will rise against the house of Jeroboam with the sword.

22478	30	7	13	 but prophesy not again any more at Beth-el, for it is the king's sanctuary, and it is a royal house.'

22480	30	7	15	 and the LORD took me from following the flock, and the LORD said unto me: Go, prophesy unto My people Israel.
22481	30	7	16	 Now therefore hear thou the word of the LORD: Thou sayest: Prophesy not against Israel, and preach not against the house of Isaac;
22482	30	7	17	 Therefore thus saith the LORD: Thy wife shall be a harlot in the city, and thy sons and thy daughters shall fall by the sword, and thy land shall be divided by line; and thou thyself shalt die in an unclean land, and Israel shall surely be led away captive out of his land.'
22483	30	8	1	 Thus the Lord GOD showed me; and behold a basket of summer fruit.
22484	30	8	2	 And He said: 'Amos, what seest thou?' And I said: 'A basket of summer fruit.' Then said the LORD unto me: The end is come upon My people Israel; I will not again pardon them any more.
22485	30	8	3	 And the songs of the palace shall be wailings in that day, saith the Lord GOD; the dead bodies shall be many; in every place silence shall be cast.
22486	30	8	4	 Hear this, O ye that would swallow the needy, and destroy the poor of the land,
